item.title: Data Analytics Engineer at Sharethrough (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sharethrough is looking for engineers interested in building data products and infrastructure to power our business and provide insight to our customers.  You'll be taking the lead on the design and implementation of a data warehousing infrastructure used by our product, engineering and operational teams.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • Greenfield architecture and construction of a modern data warehouse

  • Working with new technologies such as Apache Spark and Amazon Redshift

  • Deriving insight from large quantities of data, starting with our 500GB/day performance pipeline

  • Collaborating with data science and business intelligence teams on visualization and data wrangling platforms such as Looker


Let’s talk if...



  • You’ve got experience with SQL, ETL, python/shell scripting, and MPP Data Warehousing

  • You’ve worked on or are interested in data integrity governance and semantic layer design

  • You possess an intense curiosity about data and a strong commitment to practical problem solving

a10:author.a10:name: The University of Chicago, Center for Data Intensive Science

item.title: Lead Software Engineer for the NIH/NCI Genomic Data Commons Project at The University of Chicago, Center for Data Intensive Science (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Center for Data Intensive Science (CDIS) is looking for a Lead Software Engineer for the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Genomic Data Commons (GDC) project. Alongside our team of experts, the Lead Software Engineer will develop the scalable and interoperable software stack for the GDC, supporting upwards of 5 petabytes of centralized and harmonized cancer genomic data.


The GDC will provide a open source, scalable, modern informatics framework that uses community standards to make raw and processed genomic data broadly accessible. The GDC will harmonize and centralize existing petabyte-scale cancer genomics datasets through cutting edge approaches to data storage and analysis similar to what is used by successful companies. The GDC will eliminate a major chokepoint, streamlining access to data for researchers regardless of their institution's size or budget, effectively democratizing access to the material. It will also enable previously infeasible collaborative efforts between scientists.
The GDC serves as a key step toward the development of precision medicine, targeted treatments that are tailored to individual patients. Once fully developed, it will provide an interactive system for researchers and clinicians to upload genomics data and use it to identify the molecular subtype of cancer and potential therapeutic targets. Genetic data will be linked to extensive clinical information from patients and their response to treatment.


The Lead Software Engineer in the Center for Data Intensive Science manages all aspects of programming projects, including requirements, design, implementation, deployment/delivery, and support. Leads team efforts and oversees the work of other software engineers. Provides technical oversight and develops standards, guidelines, and processes for applications. Reviews the design and code development of key architectural components. Contributes to decisions on project and infrastructure needs, including the evaluation of server technologies, languages, platforms, and frameworks. Develops timelines, technical diagrams, project plans, and resources allocation in an agile methodology. Works with cloud computing infrastructures including OpenStack, Amazon AWS and Google Cloud to design, develop, maintain, and evaluate software applications to meet business and technical requirements. Works in Linux-based systems primarily with Python and C/C++, with the ability to work with other programming languages as the need arises. Oversees code testing and ensures appropriate standards are met. Works with users, collaborators, and technical staff to resolve problems and respond to feedback regarding potential improvements and enhancements. Ensures appropriate documentation. Serves as a liaison with internal and external collaborators on multiple research projects.


Research includes the full stack from systems to algorithms to user interfaces. Research projects span management, sharing, and provenance of large data sets; resource allocation and scheduling for cloud computing, large scale pipelining of next-generation sequence analysis, transfer programs/protocols for high-speed networks and resource visualization.
Perform other duties as assigned.

This position is grant supported and longevity of the position is dependent upon future funding.

item.title: (Big) Data Engineer at KPN (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
(Big) Data Engineer

Are you triggered by the idea of working in a dream team with other data engineers, scientists and architects delivering gamechanging (big) data & analytical solutions in a company which will ask and support you to perform and deliver impact beyond your expectations? Then we encourage you to read further.

Your job as a Data Engineer?
We are looking for an enthusiastic and creative data engineer who will help create a new chapter of Data Engineering within KPN. Together with your team, consisting of complementary skill sets across data science and engineering, you will have the opportunity to work on diverse and high impact business cases across KPN.

KPN is a data driven Telco organisation and has the ambition to lead in analytics. It is one of the most important subjects structurally discussed at Board level. KPN won this year's award for best Big Data vision at the global Information Technology conference in Las Vegas. The foundations have been laid to actively apply big data solutions to the enormous amount of rich data utilizing the tools and applications available today and exploring those of tomorrow. KPN has very highstandards with regards to privacy and security for our data and our customers. You will leverage these policies to safeguards the privacy.

As an experienced Data Engineer you will be responsible for:



  • Establishing a chapter of Data Engineering within KPN

  • ETL for analytics on Hadoop and Teradata Data Warehouse

  • Data handling and discovery for (big) data

  • Creation of analytical records to improve impact of our data scientist

  • Leverage and implement privacy and security policies

  • Create and maintain complex models

  • Give direction to the roadmap data based on value

item.title: Big Data Solutions Engineer at Prudential (Newark, NJ)
item.description:
Join a sophisticated Data Services Prudential team implementing high value, Information Management solutions. Looking for highly experienced Java Hadoop Big Data Engineer with experience of working with large-scale, distributed data pipelines Responsibilities span the full data engineering lifecycle from architecture and design, data analysis, software development,

QA, capacity planning and managing the analytics environment as a whole.

 

Desired Skills and Experience

Job Responsibilities:
* Build distributed, scalable, and reliable data pipelines that ingest and process data at scale and in real-time.
* Collaborate with other teams to design and develop and deploy data tools that support both operations and product use cases.
* Perform offline analysis of large data sets using components from the Hadoop ecosystem.
* Evaluate and advise on technical aspects of open work requests in the product backlog with the project lead.
* Own product features from the development phase through to production deployment.
* Evaluate big data technologies and prototype solutions to improve our data processing architecture.

 

Candidate Profile:
* BS in Computer Science or related area
* 10-12 years software development experience
* Minimum 2 Year Experience on Big Data Platform
* Proficiency with Java, Python, Scala, HBase, Hive, MapReduce, ETL, Kafka, Mongo, Postgres, Visualization technologies etc.
* Flair for data, schema, data model, how to bring efficiency in big data related life cycle
* Understanding of automated QA needs related to Big data
* Understanding of various Visualization platform (Tableau, D3JS, others)
* Proficiency with agile or lean development practices
* Strong object-oriented design and analysis skills
* Excellent technical and organizational skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

item.title: Big Data Software Engineer 80-100% at Swisscom AG (Liebefeld, Schweiz)
item.description:
Your responsibility
You will build Big Data software solutions that properly handle Big Data's 3V: volume, velocity and variety. As a programming polyglot, you will work on our Big Data back-end as well as front-end, connecting various parts via dedicated APIs. Through proper maintenance, you will ensure reusability and extensibility of your code as well as make sure your code is documented and meticulously tested before being put into production. You will team up with DevOps and Data Scientists to continuously innovate and enhance our build, deployments and automation infrastructure.

item.title: Software Developers for Back- & Frontend at Maritime Data Systems GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for young, highly motivated, smart developers from different parts of the world to join our team in Hamburg / Germany. You can join us,even if you have just finished university or if you want to do an internship or your master thesis in our company.



At the moment we offering several positions for Backoffice and Frontend developers.


  • Java Backend Developer


  • JS-Angular or Bootstrap Frontend Developer


  • Internship (Software Developer)


  • Master Thesis (Algorithms & Big Data)

item.title: Software Engineer (Full-stack) at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for an engineer to build out front-end-heavy applications. You’ll be developing and rolling out reactive front ends, big data backends to support them, and everything in between. We’re doing Rails, Node.js, Angular, Bootstrap, Solr, Postgres on AWS.   This role is specifically for someone who wants to build interactive web apps (vs data science or backend infrastructure) but because of the scale of the data and query volume, absolutely requires serious CS chops. This position is in Factual’s Los Angeles headquarters.
 
Responsibilities



  • Work with product and back end engineering teams to develop tools for exploring and visualizing data for our data, ad tech, and mobile personalization products

  • Develop website demos to help illustrate how our products work

  • Develop internal reporting tools and other API support tools

  • Develop high stakes, high volume API features

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer at Looker Data Sciences (Santa Cruz, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LOOKER ENGINEERING


The engineering team at Looker is a tight-knit group of high-performers. We value simplicity in both our code and our user interfaces. We don’t believe in large teams; we opt for small groups that move fast, communicate clearly and achieve more.  We try to choose the right tool for the job, not one tool to solve all problems. We make a huge impact on product direction, we experiment, and we iterate rapidly. 


SENIOR FRONT END ENGINEER 


Looker is seeking experienced Front End Engineers to build out our data discovery platform. Looker is still a small team, so you’ll have the opportunity to work on many aspects of the product and shape the Front End architecture.  You should have extensive experience and a proven track record solving complex web engineering problems.

item.title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer at Mitra Capital LLC (Boston, MA)
item.description:
In the Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer role, you will be challenged to create innovative technology solutions at the intersection of language analysis, data-driven insights and logic-based workflow.  The Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer’s core responsibilities will involve building tools that drive the systems underlying the firm’s research process, including advancing the firm’s text mining and machine learning platform.  The position reports to our experienced Chief Data Scientist and offers a high rate of learning on a diverse range of projects and the opportunity to quickly have direct impact upon the organization.  


The ideal candidate is a clever and versatile coder with a hacker mentality who is eager to tackle complex problems.  The Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer must be comfortable working in an agile development environment with high expectations for rapid delivery of prototypes, changing requirements, and direct feedback from the internal business customer.

item.title: Senior Engineer at HERE-Chicago (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
HERE, a Nokia company, is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com



The Team:



The RCP group designs and builds hardware and software for capturing, processing, and extracting information from street-level imagery, 3D Lidar data, aerial and satellite imagery, as well as dense GPS probe data from smartphones and vehicles. These rich datasets are used to power next-gen 3D consumer maps, navigation and assisted driving systems, and more. HERE Maps, a division of Nokia, provides detailed road and navigation data for nearly 100 countries, and can be found in four out of five vehicle in-dash navigation systems. Licensees of HERE’s platform include Microsoft, Yahoo, Amazon, and Baidu. 



The Position:



Within RCP, the Data Operations Team manages the software processing pipeline for transforming petabytes of raw data into useable information.  The team is also responsible for data quality control, measuring and analyzing pipeline performance and addressing data issues that may be identified.  We are seeking a Senior Engineer to help us build tools to enable, expedite and enhance Data Operations Team’s QA and analytical efforts.  Example work for this team will be building and maintaining tools to improve the efficiency and efficacy of terrestrial and satellite data QA review.

item.title: Senior Salesforce Administrator at BuildSavings (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
• Daily administration and end-user support of Salesforce applications including but not limited to managing multiple user setups, profiles and roles, customization of objects, fields, record types, page layouts, formulas, validations, data backups, writing requirements, design solutions/configurations and communicate Salesforce functional updates to users; could involve

  • Create and manage custom reports, complex workflow rules, approval processes, data validation to support business processes

  • Experience evaluating 3rd party solutions and AppExchange products based on project needs

  • Experience maintaining data quality through ongoing data analysis, record de-duplication, and other related tasks

  • Experience with data migration tools like Apex Data Loader, Excel Connector to Import and Export the data to the Salesforce.com platform

  • Direct involvement in developing business requirements, best practices, process flows, configuration and testing

  • Manage and maintain sandbox usage planning, data migration, environment comparisons and version update control

  • Follow predefined team development to produce clean, efficient and maintainable platform configurations

  • Resolve platform and technical issues

  • Assist with production support issues

  • Provide Salesforce training to internal team members

  • Remain current with Salesforce updates and new technologies and best practices with the industry

item.title: Lead Salesforce Developer at BuildSavings (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
• Experience on Salesforce customizations, security controls, creating profiles, roles, users, record types, page layouts and email services

  • Professional experience in creating Salesforce.com Apex triggers on custom and standard objects, writing Apex Classes, Apex Controllers, test classes, SOAP API, REST API, Batch API, Streaming API, Bulk API , Web Services and developing VisualForce Pages

  • Proficient in creating custom objects, custom tabs, custom fields, picklist values, role based page layouts, workflow alerts and actions, workflow rules and approvals, validation rules, custom reports and report extractions to various formats

  • Experience with developing user friendly interfaces in Salesforce using Bootstrap, VisualForce and JavaScript remoting

  • Experience with data migration tools like Apex Data Loader, Excel Connector to Import and Export the data to the Salesforce.com platform

  • Experience with relationships between objects like master-detail, lookup, entity relationship, Data model etc.

  • Worked on SOQL and SOSL queries in data extraction from Salesforce

  • Experience in Integrating AppExchange applications with Salesforce

item.title: Data Engineer (m/f) at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
• You will be reponsible for continuing the development of data driven applications for one of our ventures. This includes a data warehouse (developed in-house, based on open-source technologies), a CRM system and integrations with other 3rd party systems

  • You will integrate, transform and index data from various data sources and develop meaningful data representations and visualisations

  • You will deal with the challenges of growing data amounts (performance, scaling, data quality)

  • You will work in an agile software development process in close collaboration with a product management team

item.title: Data Analyst at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
We are looking for an individual who has the skills and drive to help our data scientists go faster by handling the responsibilities of profiling complex datasets, by identifying inefficiencies and rectifying them, by reconciling and mapping datasets, and by interacting with clients around data related subjects when the need presents itself. You will exist at the intersection of databases, software and modeling – you’re a generalist. You will have the unique opportunity to grow with the company from the ground up in a fun and challenging work environment. This role may also potentially serve as a bridge for candidates seeking training in data science and ultimately desiring a transition to a data science role. The analyst position will be a crash course in anything and everything related to the field.


Candidate profile:



  • This is an entry level role – we are looking for recent BS grads (CS, Math and Stats majors preferred)

  • Prior work with SQL, MATLAB or modeling not necessary but experience is a plus

  • You need to be a good detective, eager and willing to learn about a range of topics -- whatever is thrown your way.

  • ABOVE ALL: You need to be independent, resourceful and creative.

a10:author.a10:name: New York University - Division of Libraries

item.title: Data Services Specialist at New York University - Division of Libraries (NY, NY)
item.description:
The QDA & Survey Research Specialist will be working in a vibrant and collaborative environment on a team that supports all phases of the data lifecycle for quantitative, qualitative, and geospatial research. Data Services offers access to specialty software packages, software training and support, and consulting expertise for many aspects of numeric, qualitative, and spatial data for research, including data access, analysis, collection, data management, and preservation. The successful candidate will work closely with Division of Libraries professionals and faculty as well as with colleagues in NYU Information Technology Services (ITS) with respect to referrals, service development, technology, standards, resources and projects.


*Please note that this is a two year fixed term position with potential to renew.

item.title: Data scientist at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Data scientist


Ministerie van Veiligheid en Justitie, Nederlands Forensisch Instituut


Functieomschrijving


Je beantwoordt met behulp van data-analyse vragen rond opsporing en bewijswaardering. Dit doe je bij het kennis- en expertisecentrum voor intelligente data-analyse (Kecida), onderdeel van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI).


Kecida zet intelligente data-analyse in voor het oplossen van forensische vraagstukken. Ook richten we ons op onderzoek en ontwikkeling in kunstmatige intelligentie en helpen we de openbare orde en veiligheidsector met het inzichtelijk maken van grote hoeveelheden data.


Als big data engineer pas je data-analyse toe, zoals machine learning, tekstanalyse en netwerkanalyse. Je weet data in het juiste formaat te krijgen, zodat je ze snel in kunt zetten. Vervolgens gebruik je statistiek om inzicht in data te krijgen en machine learning voor het benutten van deze inzichten. Daarnaast houd je je bezig met onderzoek en ontwikkeling op het gebied van data-analyse en data science. Tot slot werk je aan consultancyprojecten voor een diverse groep opdrachtgevers binnen de openbare orde en veiligheidsector, zoals projecten over fraudeopsporing.

item.title: Data Services Engineer at Discovery Digital Networks (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Discovery Digital Networks, the premier publisher of digital-native programming for the Internet age, is looking for a Data Services Engineer with an affinity for working with data to support, evolve and expand our web and data infrastructure.


The candidate must be willing and able to function on a small team working with designers, front-end engineers and data scientists. This position will require knowledge of Python and PHP, and some familiarity with Javascript and MySQL. Experience with Amazon Web Services, Linux server administration and packages/frameworks like Flask, SQLAlchemy, React and Lumen is a plus. Successful candidates will typically have at least 3 years of experience. Ping pong skills also a plus!


We offer a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and a 401k matching plan, in addition to other perks.  Join our collaborative, fun, and creative work environment!


 This position is located in San Francisco, CA.


Some representative daily tasks include:



  • Maintaining and enhancing the ETL that feeds our data warehouse;

  • Building and supporting new and existing data tools and products;

  • Maintaining and developing both customer facing and internal web services;

  • Helping to improve the performance and reliability of the entire Discovery Digital Networks technology stack.


 Some possibilities for initial projects:



  • Updating data warehouse to include detailed geographic and demographic data;

  • Using machine learning algorithms to create tools to help producers create better content;

  • Creating dashboards to surface warehouse data to users.

item.title: Software Engineer In Data at Dataminr (NY, NY)
item.description: At Dataminr, we are looking for dedicated software engineers to help us sort, analyze and deliver relevant information from terabytes of unstructured data in the social media space. We strive for strong abstractions that allow for fast iteration, easy integration and short development cycles, allowing us to constantly learn from our data and empowering our clients to apply these insights toward product enhancements.

item.title: Data Analytics Specialist at Marist College (Poughkeepsie, NY)
item.description:
Data Analytics Specialist



The Information Technology Department of Marist College is seeking a candidate to assist in development and deployment of data analytics technologies and services for both internal and external groups and organizations.  When engaged internally, the Data Analytics Specialist will work with other College offices and academic departments to assess how data analytics can be used to improve institutional effectiveness by addressing issues such as advancing student performance, increasing retention, and assisting with admissions, advancement and enrollment management.  Working with external clients, the Data Analytics Specialist will support revenue generating activities providing similar services including the development of predictive models that are customized to meet specific client needs.



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, or Statistics and three years of proven working experience as a data analyst.  Position requires significant knowledge of databases, analytic tools, data warehousing, business intelligence techniques, strong data mining skills and developing predictive models.   Candidate should have previous experience using report generation and analytic tools such as Argos, Cognos, SPSS and Pentaho.  Familiarity with Ellucian Banner is a plus.  Ability to multi-task in rapidly changing technological and team-oriented environment and excellent oral and written communication skills are required. 



Marist College is an independent and comprehensive liberal arts institution located in New York's historic Hudson River Valley. Situated on 210 acres overlooking the Hudson River, it enrolls 4,787 traditional undergraduate, 799 full and part-time graduate and 543 continuing education students. Marist also has a branch campus in Florence, Italy, and extension sites throughout New York. Marist has been recognized for excellence by U.S. News & World Report, TIME Magazine, The Princeton Review's The Best 376 Colleges, and Barron's Best Buys in College Education and is noted for being a pioneer in the area of online degree programs.



To learn more or to apply, please visit http://jobs.marist.edu. Only online applications are accepted.



Marist College is strongly committed to the principle of diversity and is especially interested in receiving applications from members of ethnic and racial minority groups, women, persons with disabilities, veterans, and persons from other under-represented groups.



AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER



Apply Here



PI91563090

item.title: Data DevOps Engineer at Rally Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve and advance health and health care using modern data technologies and end-user engagement.  Rally Health is a private company of 270 employees with a major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group (with the market cap of $112B and the net income of $10B).  We have partnered with several insurance companies including UHG and other large corporations for user acquisition, clinical data feeds, and monetization.   


In this role you will be enabling analytics, data science, and business intelligence by deploying and maintaining infrastructure and data services around health risks, clinical and lifestyle recommendations, and population health management and reporting.


Our technologies:  AWS, Scala, Play, Hadoop (CDH), Kafka, Spark and Spark Streaming, MongoDB, Vagrant, Jenkins, Chef

item.title: Engineering Systems Data Engineer at ARM Ltd (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
The Engineering Systems Analytics group is responsible for ensuring that we have a solid understanding of both our engineering infrastructure, which we refer to as the engineering systems stack, and the engineering processes that run on top of it.


It strives to achieve this goal through a number of parallel activities:



  • By helping to refine our spark-based infrastructure that allows relevant data to be centrally collected, aggregated, and processed

  • By developing dashboards, reports and complex analysis and/or visualisations of the data that satisfy the business needs, both in terms of project reporting to help measure progress of the work, and in terms of infrastructure reporting to help understand the impact of this work on the estate

  • By working with engineering and IT functions to ensure sufficient relevant data is being captured to provide the best information in the above two categories


We are looking to augment the team with broad additional skills across the areas listed above.


You will be a software engineer with experience of Spark and R, or equivalents.


You will be equally at home working on the data processing pipeline, or performing an in depth analysis of the data it contains.


You will consider yourself a data scientist, keen to tackle the problems of extracting knowledge from data, and driven to understand the core ‘stories’ that data can tell, and to help drive efficiency and effectiveness improvements by providing the means to make data driven decisions.


This role be based from ARM's HQ in Cambridge, UK.

item.title: Data Scientist at Swisscom AG (Liebefeld, Schweiz)
item.description:
Your job When it comes to solving complex problems and finding patterns, you're the one to ask, because abstract thinking, parsimonious models and neat implementations are part of your everyday thinking.


Workplace:



Bern-Liebefeld


Level of employment:



80-100%


OE:



INI-BIX-BDM

That's why we need you
You feel at home in the world of Big Data. This makes you ideal for supporting our BI and Big Data Competency Centre in designing, developing and deploying analytical systems. Come and work with us on the Switzerland of the future.

Your responsibility
You will apply your theoretical knowledge to solve real-life complex problems. In doing so, you will develop analytical systems and services, new theoretical models as well as technological solutions and present the results in front of various stakeholders. Technology scouting and consulting and supporting other teams with regard to the optimal and secure use of these models and solutions also belong to your responsibilities. Through all this, you define and drive the further development of the Big Data cluster and to continuously innovate and enhance the software we build.

item.title: Database Programmer and Developer at University of Oxford (UK)
item.description:
NUFFIELD DEPARTMENT OF ORTHOPAEDICS, RHEUMATOLOGY AND MUSCULOSKELETAL SCIENCES


Database Programmer and Developer (119821)


Grade 7: Salary in the range of £30,434 to £31,342 per annum


We are seeking a Database Programmer and Developer within the Nuffield Department of Orthopaedics, Rheumatology and Musculoskeletal Sciences (NDORMS) located at the Botnar Research Centre, Oxford.


You will be responsible for maintaining, expanding and developing complex software used to support several research projects run by the Epidemiology Unit as well as assessing and improving the quality of the software through appropriate testing during the development process. Duties will also include writing readable code with good documentation and developing and maintaining the Epidemiology Unit website. You will also advise other members of the group on IT methodologies and procedures.


You will have a degree in computer science or equivalent technical qualification and will be proficient in developing and maintaining web applications for data capture written in PHP using HTML5/CSS/Javascript. You will also have expertise in developing and maintaining console and web applications as well as skills in testing both console and web applications. Sound knowledge of the relational database model, SQL, data management and MySQL is essential. Knowledge of working in a mixed computing environment involving Windows and Linux servers and experience of working with confidential data and related software (e.g. TrueCrypt) would be desirable.


This is a full-time fixed term appointment for one year.


The closing date for this position is 12 noon on Friday 2 October 2015. You will be required to upload a supporting statement and CV as part of your online application.


To apply for this role and for further details, including the job description and selection criteria, please click on the link below: 


https://www.recruit.ox.ac.uk/pls/hrisliverecruit/erq_jobspec_version_4.jobspec?p_id=119821

item.title: Principal Software Engineer - Data Products at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
About the job:


This is a senior role focused on transforming large user-driven datasets in our distributed environment into public APIs for developers.

Successful candidates will be strong developers with deep experience in micro-transactions, data mining, complex SQL, and a passion for API design & REST.


 Responsibilities:



  • Focus on extreme availability and quality, providing a 99.999% defect free and low latency experience across Twilio's data products.

  • Design, build and deploy globally distributed data pipelines that can be accessed securely in real time around the world.

  • Automate everything, from testing to deploys to operations.

  • Lead the cloud communications data revolution by leveraging business intelligence, customer feedback and metrics to create an unparalleled customer experience.

  • Provide scalable, high-quality, resilient backend services in any region for all Twilio data at rest.

  • Own and operate data services at massive scale. Support 200,000,000+ daily transactions and process the pipeline through which all data generated within Twilio flows.

  • Work directly with product management to define, architect, and build new internal and external facing APIs.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Metrigo Gmbh (Zalando SE) (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
• Development of scalable, high performance webservices reacting in real-time.

  • Code optimization and garbage collection tuning.

  • Development of Big-Data, high-volume applications that support multi-millions of users as well as billions of requests on a daily basis.

  • Management of multi-layered webservice products, as well as invention and development of new ones.

  • Communication with different stakeholders from Zalando SE and your team to understand product requirements to carry them out to successul release!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description:
Quantcast is an organization that lives and breathes data. Data is used in every aspect of our business, driving everything from our audience measurement service, to our real time bidding and ad personalization, and even corporate operations. We are looking for top-tier talent to design, implement, and operate large scale ML systems in a production environment. You’ll work within a machine learning group that is obsessed with improving the state of the art in performance advertising. You’ll take full ownership of the development and operation of ML systems that span dynamic ad personalization, predictive modeling, recommendations, bid optimization and pacing - all operating on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with our real-time systems that process over 2 million events per second, a distributed compute cluster that processes 30 petabytes of data per day, and a training pipeline that builds tens of thousands of models daily.


Opportunities



  • Make an impact. Quantcast performs world-class data modeling and engineering of realtime systems with a relatively small engineering team. Data science is the backbone of Quantcast; your impact will be much greater here than at a large company.

  • Thrive in a full Big Data ecosystem. Quantcast has invested heavily in its compute infrastructure and has vast amounts of data to aid in decisioning. Almost the entire platform has been built or extended in-house, to achieve our rigorous computational needs, with many systems returned to the open source community.

  • Make a name for yourself. We publicize our work through open-source projects, blog posts and papers, and we work with amazing advisors, like Trevor Hastie and Jerome Friedman.

  • Great timing. We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build and operate large scale machine learning algorithms, systems, and supporting infrastructure

  • Develop techniques to efficiently extract meaning from petabytes of data

  • Improve existing advertising products and introduce new end-to-end products to delight our customers

  • Interface with other teams and leaders in Engineering, Product Management, and Business Operations

item.title: Big Data Processing Expert at Swarm64 AS Zweigstelle Hive (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
About Swarm64


Swarm64 is developing the Scalable-Data-Accelerator (SDA) that accelerates any data-heavy application by orders of magnitude because of its unique highly parallel architecture. Swarm64’s SDA will revolutionize database software, business intelligence, simulations, genomics, geological data processing, financial analytics and many other areas of business. 


We are an international team located in Berlin, Germany. What makes us special is our invincible ‘can do spirit’ and our persistence in making things happen, our dedication to achieve true mastery in our fields of expertise, and a joyful way of going about our business. Join us to have tremendous fun while creating truly amazing technology. You will gain vast new knowledge and competences in our team of outstanding engineers and highly experienced business people.


We are looking for a passionate Expert in Big Data Processing Technologies, covering traditional SQL databases (especially MySQL, PostgreSQL or Oracle 11g/12c) as well as No-SQL solutions (MongoDB, Hadoop Pig/Hive/Impala, Cassandra and the like). Key requirement is a deep knowledge and experience of database and data processing principles as well as the implementation of SQL and No-SQL databases in C++.


You will take responsibility for and provide leadership to Swarm64’s software development efforts to seamlessly integrate our SDA into existing SQL and No-SQL database systems and into other solutions for processing large amounts of data.

item.title: Data Scientist @ Cloud-Based Behavioral Analytics Software Company at RedOwl (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
RedOwl’s Senior Data Scientists work on a diverse array of statistical challenges, supported by a top-notch engineering team, at a company that places an incredibly high value on analytics. Our current Senior Data Scientists are experts in a wide range of complementary statistical disciplines, including computational biology, natural language processing, machine learning, computational neuroscience, and economics.


RedOwl Senior Data Scientists play a variety of roles within the company. You will develop and implement new analytics within Reveal, assist in shaping the product roadmap, supervise teams of software engineers, and help clients use Reveal to mitigate their most pressing security threats. Senior Data Scientists are given a wide range of autonomy to passionately pursue their approach to problem solving through improving the software product.


Senior Data Scientists are expected to design and implement cutting-edge statistical methods for solving client problems. You will work with clients in order to understand their needs, workflows, and data sources. With this knowledge, Senior Data Scientists are involved in product and team leadership, helping oversee the development of Reveal to better meet both current and anticipated client needs.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer- Security Platform Owner at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
The Security Intelligence team, part of Information Security at Amazon, owns the monitoring of and response to malicious activity on the Amazon network. We collect data from all parts of Amazon's massive, worldwide service-oriented architecture.



We are seeking Software Engineers to join a team in Information Security dedicated to enabling our organization to perform its most critical functions at Amazon’s scale. Our challenges are broad and deep -- we need to build flexible, secure, scalable, high-performance and robust software and services. We have all of the challenges you’d expect such as high scale, big data, and a need to never go down. In addition to these challenges we also have the security aspect. We protect customer data from adversaries that want it.



At Amazon, we obsess over our customers, and ensuring our customers’ trust is our first priority. To earn that trust in an environment as vast and varied as Amazon’s and an online world where threats grow ever more sophisticated requires building a world-class security team to tackle never-before-seen challenges at dizzying scales. You will not just be using cutting-edge technologies here in Amazon; you will be inventing them.

You have strong verbal and written communication skills, are self-driven and deliver high quality results in a fast-paced environment. You have strong computer science credentials, are passionate about Internet technology, are customer-obsessed and have a track record of building quality services. You know how to build and you dive deep into back-end services. You excel when working on complex and diverse systems. You can succinctly and accurately report your findings. Most importantly, you have a passion for learning and continuous improvement.


  • MINIMUM 8 years' Software Development experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala

  • Experienced in big data technologies and/or distributed computing systems

  • Self-directed, ability to multi-task, sharp analytical abilities, excellent communication skills, capable of working effectively in a dynamic environment

  • Proven design skills and able to find creative scalable solutions to difficult problems

  • Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, internet security fundamentals and designing for performance, scalability and availability




  • Masters in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices

  • Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills

  • Demonstration of project ownership including requirements, design, implementation, testing, and operational support

  • Experience with stream, batch and/or graph processing platform (e.g. Spark)

  • Experience with security technologies or products

  • Experience working in an agile environment

item.title: Help Desk/Junior Systems Engineer at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for a Junior-level Help Desk/Systems Engineer to help handle the management and growth of our cloud and internal computing and network infrastructure.  We're a technical group of people working in a relaxed environment with various demanding infrastructure needs.  There's almost no 24/7 component to this job but there are a lot of machines and systems to keep configured and happy and we have a very high standard of careful, detail-oriented, responsive professionalism.


Responsibilities:



  • Maintain computing and networking infrastructure.

  • Share support burden for mostly technical internal staff

  • Repair and recover from hardware or software failures

  • Devops and automation of internal and production infrastructure

  • System/network monitoring & troubleshooting

  • Participate in on-call rotation duties

item.title: Big Data Engineers at Betsson Group (Ta' Xbiex, Malta)
item.description:
Are you interested in working for the market leader in a fast-growing industry? Betsson Group is now looking for talented Big Data Engineers to join us in our Malta offices to build the next generation in data services.


Who are we?


Betsson Group offers online gaming products to customers and partners all over the world and we aim to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. We are a dynamic and creative company with over 1000 passionate employees and consultants of almost 40 different nationalities. Most of us work in the operational Head Office in Malta but we also have other offices around the world, for example in Stockholm, Kiev, Tallinn and Gibraltar. Betsson Group has its roots in Sweden and Betsson AB (Betsson Group’s holding company) is quoted on the Swedish Stock Exchange. The Mediterranean island of Malta offers a relaxed life-style, with more than 300 sunny days a year and the best diving experience in Europe.


Who are you?



  • You are an exceptional developer with an aptitude for new technologies who loves to push the boundaries to solve real business problems

  • You will have previous Big Data experience using the Hadoop ecosystem to solve large-scale problems.

  • You will have a good understanding of distributed systems and experience in using open source frameworks

  • You have agility to learn new technologies quickly.

  • You have the ability to develop and leverage key partnerships and communicate very effectively.

  • You display initiative, self-motivation, and effective time-management skills.


Description


Our Big Data development team is growing fast and we are looking for software engineers to help us use a variety of Big Data technologies to create exceptional personalised customer experiences and solve difficult business problems based on a robust, low latent platform of structured and semi-structured.

item.title: Software Architect at RBM Technologies (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Responsibilities:



  • Define business and technical requirements for future engineering efforts

  • Architect solutions, data models and technical approaches to future engineering efforts

  • Explore new technologies, create prototypes and determine applicability to the company’s product strategy

  • Ability to understand software at a code level when required

  • Be familiar with new technologies, processes and techniques and be prepared to guide their introduction into the engineering team.

  • Be a leader in defining the architectural direction of the company's products.

  • Become a subject matter expert on RBM’s application software

item.title: Senior Front End Developer Pioneering Business Forecasts at Intensity (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Intensity applies expertise in economics, data science, and machine learning to solve the most complex and challenging issues that organizations face in the competitive marketplace. We are seeking a senior level front-end developer to implement the technical design and development of web-based applications that deliver pioneering business forecasts and data visualizations. This position requires a can-do/will-do attitude, a love of coding, and a passion for solving challenging problems. The position is located in San Diego, California.



RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:


Specific responsibilities and duties for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Implement the user interface technical design and development of enterprise-class, cloud-hosted, web applications

  • Write robust front-end code with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks and libraries

  • Develop rich, interactive data visualizations, including graphs, charts, and other dynamic features

  • Design and implement user authentication and security features

  • Collaborate with product managers, UI designers, and back-end developers to define functional requirements and translate them into technical requirements

  • Rapidly solve problems and fix bugs

  • Work with technology partners and vendors as required



QUALIFICATIONS


Qualifications for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Extensive experience building highly interactive web application interfaces

  • Deep expertise in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript MVC frameworks and libraries

  • Expertise designing and developing rich, interactive data visualizations

  • Strong understanding of web standards, cross-browser compatibility, responsive design, Bootstrap, CSS frameworks (LESS, Sass), and AJAX

  • Excellent understanding of database development, including basic data structures and algorithms

  • Experience with Agile processes, test-driven development, continuous build, and integration tools

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively

  • Problem solver and technology enthusiast

  • Creativity, innovation, and resourcefulness

  • Bachelors and/or Masters degree from a top university



PREFERRED


Preferred experiences and capabilities for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks (AngularJS, ReactJS, KnockoutJS, Backbone, etc.)

  • Experience with data visualization toolsets (D3)

  • Working knowledge of Java or Python, Ruby on Rails and/or PHP

  • Strong object oriented design and programming skills

  • Experience with database development (SQL, MySQL, NoSQL)

  • Familiar with modern Internet/information/data security issues and technologies

  • Familiar with source code management tools (Git, Subversion)

  • Experience with graphic design software (Photoshop, Illustrator)



APPLICATION


To apply for this position, please send a cover letter and resume to Intensity via email at careers.IT@intensity.com.


Additional information is available at www.intensity.com.

item.title: Senior Engineering Manager - Machine Learning at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description:
Quantcast is an organization that lives and breathes data. Data is used in every aspect of our business, driving everything from our audience measurement service, to our real time bidding and ad personalization, and even corporate operations. We are looking for a seasoned hands-on data science manager to join a growing team of scientists and engineers in London, focused on performance targeting and optimization. 

This team is responsible for building the online advertising prediction and control systems that power Quantcast. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge statistical models and machine learning techniques, as well as serving as mentor, manager, and joint architect for the systems and processes built by the team.  Not a purely theoretical position, this team is responsible for shipping production code to meet the demands of the business and a solid background in software engineering is desired. You’ll have the opportunity to work with our real-time systems that process over 2 million events per second, a distributed compute cluster that processes 30 petabytes of data per day, and a training pipeline that builds tens of thousands of models daily.

Opportunities



  • Make an impact. Quantcast performs world-class data modelling and engineering of realtime systems with a relatively small engineering team. Data science is the backbone of Quantcast; your impact will be much greater here than at a large company.

  • Thrive in a full Big Data ecosystem. Quantcast has invested heavily in its compute infrastructure and has vast amounts of data to aid in decisioning. Almost the entire platform has been built or extended in-house, to achieve our rigorous computational needs, with many systems returned to the open source community.

  • Make a name for yourself. We publicize our work through open-source projects, blog posts and papers and we work with amazing advisors, like Trevor Hastie, Jerome Friedman, and Michael Jordan.

  • Great timing. We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.


Responsibilities



  • Manage several projects, including prediction and control systems that are designed to efficiently drive sales and engagements for our clients

  • Lead, don’t follow. Drive innovation and contribute to intellectual property. Identify and propose new systems and techniques that bring business value. Everybody codes and participates.

  • Hire and manage a growing team of 5 - 10+ engineers of all seniority levels

  • Advise other data science teams and projects in London and globally

  • Ensure that the team is focused on commercially relevant projects, that the pace of innovation is rigorous, and that we meet stringent design, performance and robustness quality standards

  • Interface with other teams and leaders in Engineering, Product Management, and Business Operations

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer at Sense Labs (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
Sense is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join its team. At Sense, we are developing a consumer product consisting of hardware and software for analyzing home energy consumption at a detailed level. The insights and data provided by Sense help consumers see what is going on in their homes to save energy and make things work better.  Sense is conveniently located in the heart of Cambridge in Harvard Square.


The ideal Engineer/Scientist will mine wattage/energy data, design algorithms, and develop models which improve Sense's automated disaggregation platform. The right person for this role will enjoy diving into messy time-series, designing high-performance models, and developing robust code that scales on live data.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Services at HelloFresh (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
As a data services software engineer at HelloFresh, you will be collaborating to build one of the most advanced big data platforms in Europe. You will develop distributed services that processes data in near-time and real-time, with focus on scalability, data quality and integration of machine learning models. 



  • Plan, Implement and maintain distributed, service-oriented and message-oriented data platform components 

  • Create or implement metadata processes and frameworks, message queues, and RESTful services

  • Create plans, test files, and scripts for testing the services platform, ranging from unit to continuous integration testing

  • Review designs, codes, test plans, and documentation to ensure quality

item.title: Big Data Developer - Contract at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
What we're looking for in you:



  •  Passion, creativity, deep expertise, openness, flexibility and drive. Practicality and common sense are important to us.

  •  Focus on moving the business forward. We don't just build software for its own sake (notwithstanding deep appreciation for the craft). We build it to help our customers find the right hotel, every time.

  •  A keen interest in the business, not just a given technical problem. We want you to understand the big picture and how your work fits into it.

  •  Get excited about big, hairy technical problems like we do.

  •  Participate in the Hotels.com technology community, the wider Hotels.com team, and the wider technology community around the world.


We live, eat, and breathe travel powered by technology. We work hard and play hard. We're never satisfied. We celebrate success and learn when we sometimes fall short.


Your job


Helping our business succeed through the power of data is a key priority across our business. In this role you'd be responsible for helping us achieve that by developing software to help us harness the power of the data available to us.



  •  Create and enhance RESTful web services

  •  Implement Hadoop jobs with Cascading, Hive, and raw Map Reduce as appropriate

  •  Read and write streams of messages from/to Kafka

  •  Read and write data from/to Cassandra

  •  Configure Oozie and Falcon jobs

  •  Contribute to open source projects

  •  Write automated tests

  •  Review your team member’s code

  •  Regularly refactor code to adapt to fast moving business requirements and evolving technical landscapes

item.title: Big Data Architect at HelloFresh (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
HelloFresh is among the Top 3 largest companies to come out of Europe over the past 4 years (market cap). Our growth trajectory and expansion has been phenomenal – only 3 years after inception we are active in 7 markets on 3 continents, all of which are managed and maintained from our global headquarters in Berlin.


We aim to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch at home. We have received almost US$ 200mn in venture capital and have won multiple prizes for our work. Our team is diverse, high-performing and international, helping us to create a truly inspiring work environment in which you will thrive! Join us and help building up a fresh food global champion!


About the job


As a Big Data Architect at HelloFresh, you will be in charge of building, scaling and architecting one of the most advanced big data platforms in Europe. You will develop a distributed BI system that processes data in near-time and real-time, with focus on scalability, data quality and integration of machine learning models. 



  • Plan, Implement and maintain a distributed data warehouse using the Hadoop ecosystem, real-time event processing engine and message brokers

  • Develop data warehouse process models, real-time, near-time and batch ETL processes, perform data enrichment, record linkage and integration of distributed statistical models

  • Create or implement metadata processes and frameworks

  • Create plans, test files, and scripts for testing the BI framework, ranging from unit to continuous integration testing

  • Review designs, codes, test plans, and documentation to ensure quality

item.title: Senior Software Engineer Test at Quid (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
POSITION OVERVIEW


As a Software Engineer in Test at Quid, you will own testing and play a critical role in defining the quality of Quid's products. You will be responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining test automation software. You will work hand in hand with the different teams at Quid (Front-end, Back-end, Data Science, Infrastructure) to help drive quality software. You will be focussed on solving some of the most challenging problems in delivering high quality software all while being exposed to a host of technologies including Selenium, Elasticsearch, Storm, Spark and WebGL. 


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and develop test automation tools and infrastructure

  • Implement and maintain test frameworks and automated test suites

  • Work closely with developers to define test strategy and software quality expectations

  • Collaborate with infrastructure team to create "hands free" deployments and smoke tests

  • Empower development team with test tools and software metrics that help drive software quality

  • User interface automation using Selenium

  • Make the call on when software is ready to ship

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Big Data at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
Are you an engineer who wants to work for a strong and innovative online travel technology company? Do you have a passion for turning data into meaningful information? Does working on a world-class analytics platform backed by a cutting edge Big Data implementation scaling to hundreds of terabytes any interest? Do you want to work with (and learn how to use) the latest Big Data technologies in the Hadoop ecosystem? 

Expedia Inc. the largest Online Travel Agency is looking for an experienced, highly motivated, self-directed Software Development Engineer to join the Hotels.com technology team.  In this role you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the Hadoop big data platform and will play a key role in a huge technology pivot. This entails working with the delivery team and business partners to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.  Our team has experience using a wide range of technologies and many years of Hadoop experience so we guarantee that you won't be bored and will learn a lot. We are also constantly looking for ways to improve our development methodologies and welcome fresh ideas and approaches


Responsibilities



  • Develop various facets of the Hadoop EDW Java/Hadoop ecosystem

  • Write clear, efficient, tested code

  • Develop code as part of a wider team through pair programming and code reviews

  • Contribute to both program and system architecture

  • Evolve development standards and design patterns

  • Work with business stakeholders to flesh out and deliver on requirements in an agile manner

  • Deploy and maintain applications in production environments

  • Communicate and document solutions and design decisions.

item.title: Digital Team Leader at SCL Group (London, UK)
item.description:
An international data strategy and communications agency is looking for a full stack web developer to lead its Digital Development team and manage ongoing team growth.


Working in a small, fast-paced team environment the successful candidate will take ownership of a large bespoke CRM system that delivers the insights generated from our novel big data machine learning algorithms and delivers them to clients in a seamless and efficient manner. They will also be responsible for overseeing a growing number of web assets of the company and its clients.


The company has doubled in size in 18 months and is set for a similar expansion in the next year, this role presents an excellent opportunity for a motivated candidate to join a highly nimble team and build a sub-team around them as SCL continues to expand.


You will be working hand-in-hand with a world-leading Data Science team and the role presents excellent opportunities to develop skills in the fast-growing interface between the two areas.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Premier, Inc. (Charlotte, NC)
item.description:
We are looking for an accomplished and technology driven Senior Software Engineer to join our Quality and Regulatory team in our informatics and technology services department.


The Senior Software Engineer is responsible for writing computer software. Software Engineers design, code, repairs, enhance, integrate, upgrade, convert, provide level-3 support, and administer application software, and middleware.  Work is performed within guidelines set by management regarding the development life cycle, version control, source code control, documentation, unit testing, code verification, code deployment, and team collaboration.  


Major Accountabilities: 


Software Development



  • Develop deliverable for QA (Code and unit test)

  • Develop approach for coding – review, analyze and collaborate with business analyst and development teams to fully understand requirement

  • Collaborate with development team on data approach for coding – Understand data guidelines, and understand data sources available, what is new based on requirements, and how the project will impact common data stores

  • Provide direction to Associate Dev/Developer, and collaborate with core team, Project Management, QA, Security, and other cross functional teams to provide the appropriate solution

  • Team Mentoring, Directing, and Priority setting

  • Provide SME on application and data to other teams; also provide ad-hoc reporting

item.title: Software Engineer - ElasticSearch / Data Processing at Tenable Network Security (NY, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Tenable now has over 400 employees globally and 20,000 customers in 150 countries. Tenable Network Security is recognized as one of the fastest growing security product companies by SC Magazine, Red Herring, Info Securities, Deloitte, E&Y and as a Best Places to Work by the Washington Post, Baltimore Sun, Baltimore Business Journal and Expert Marketplace.

Description


Do you get amped learning new technology? Does brainstorming new product ideas and ways to implement them keep you energized?  Then Tenable’s Engineering team is the place for you.  We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help create new product features built around ElasticSearch. You’ll also assist in the architecture of features and functionality of a robust platform that can handle powerful data processing and analytics. 


Responsibilities



  • Leverage the latest technology in search, data model design, optimization and devs ops tasks.

  • Participate in planning and architecture meetings with senior management and Product Management to define the product roadmap.

  • Build key platform features with a focus on data processing

  • Build high volume and scalable services.

  • Define and set coding standards for the team.

item.title: Front-End JavaScript Engineer @ high-growth DC startup FiscalNote at FiscalNote, Inc. (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Engineering at FiscalNote
Our team has a wealth of diverse life and career experiences that allow us to think outside of the box and ahead of the curve. And we laugh – all the time. You'll get the opportunity to work at an institution pushing the boundaries of open data transparency, while collaborating with some of the industry’s brightest engineers and data scientists to devise, nurture, and implement cutting-edge solutions to continuously evolving engineering obstacles.


About the Position
Willy Wonka said “We are the dreamers of dreams.” Well, FiscalNote front-end engineers are the architects that make our open data dreams come true. Wild ambition isn’t lacking at FiscalNote, and only the most talented can visualize open-data products that have never been built before. Our front-end engineers love what they do, and they are on a mission to continuously improve upon and build the most beautiful and useful user interfaces the open data world has ever seen.


About You
Creative. Ambitious. Communicative. Driven.  You yearn to exercise your abilities in a greater capacity than on a tiny feature of a much larger product. Lending your talents across our entire stack, you not only love sharing your savvy with the team, but also crave the opportunity to absorb any and all knowledge from our hyper-collaborative environment. Your appreciation (bordering on obsession) for clean code and attention to detail have helped you shine brightly at previous positions. You’re tickled by the idea of implementing inventive uses of older technologies, but even more revved at the idea of leveraging the most modern front-end tools, frameworks, and languages. Most of all, though, you live to engineer creative interfaces that take the user experience to a whole new level.


You Have
- 2+ years of industry experience programming in JavaScript
- Expertise with HTML5 and CSS3
- Expertise with jQuery
- Knowledge of algorithms, data structures and Object Oriented programming
- Knowledge of and experience with JavaScript MV* frameworks. Ember.js is highly recommended.
- Undergraduate and/or graduate degree in engineering, computer science, or related technical field (<i>Preferred</i>)
- Proficient with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or related design software (<i>Preferred</i>)
- UI/UX design experience (<i>Ideal</i>)


In becoming a FiscalNoter, you’ll enjoy a plethora of benefits that you would expect at both an established company and at a startup. More importantly, though, is the opportunity to develop software that impacts real decisions -- decisions that substantially affect governing in the US and abroad. You will hone your engineering skills among peers just as motivated and skilled as you are, and in the process, develop a tight-knit camaraderie that will transcend simple software development.

item.title: Computer Science Trainer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg R&D is responsible for creating and maintaining all functions within the Bloomberg Professional Service. Our team works with the latest technologies and provides training for a technical staff of more than 2,000.

Bloomberg R&D's training team is looking for an experienced, hands-on software professional to prepare and deliver technical training to R&D developers and other internal customers. Our team works closely with other parts of R&D to analyze technical training needs and to provide training for job skills, professional development programs and graduate training. It is essential that candidates have technical expertise gained through practical programming experience, as well as advanced training experience, including the ability to apply that practical experience to communicate technical concepts effectively in a training environment.

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking to recruit an experienced Software Engineer to work on the OpenMinTeD H2020 project, to create an e-infrastructure that fosters and facilitates the use of text and data mining technologies in scientific publications. You will join the Cheminformatics and Metabolism team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will work with the OpenMinTeD consortium on the BioMedical use case for this consortium. You will also develop the curation tool for the ChEBI database at EBI and integrate the solutions produced by the OpenMinTeD consortium. Towards this end, you need to have excellent software engineering capabilities and be able to understand and implement software according to user requirements.

The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

item.title: Data Warehouse and Database Architects at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description: We are currently looking for Database Architects and Data Warehouse All Stars. You will be responsible for helping us build from the ground up and a unique opportunity that will allow end to end development and autonomy. The Predictive Analytics Practice at Milliman is an aggressive startup operation within the larger Milliman business and is using the latest tools and technologies in big data, cloud operations, predictive analytics, BI, and scientific visualization. We are looking for highly motivated, startup loving people who want to be involved in building for the future with a bunch of like minded team members. If you enjoy a fast paced and fun environment with the occasional beer thrown in we can help you out!

item.title: System Adminstrator (Linux) at EMBL-EBI (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking an experienced Systems Administrator to join the Systems Infrastructure Team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Trust Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.This position is in the Compute team which is responsible for EBI's central computing services.


You will be responsible for EBI's central computing services including HPC clusters, job scheduling and monitoring. These responsibilities include user support, troubleshooting, and both hardware and service maintenance and update, in order to keep the infrastructure at the highest levels of use and performance.


The EBI maintains clusters totalling 1,500 nodes which are used for production services and by several hundred developers and researchers. Additionally, EBI manages more than 60 PB of scientific data, which are mounted from different storage systems using multiple technologies such as NFS, GPFS and PANFS.

There will also be the opportunity to get involved in projects that offer opportunities to learn new skills.


The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

item.description:
• Develop our e-commerce and marketing platforms

  • Develop our customer support, CRM and data platforms

item.title: Chief Technology Officer at First Help Financial (Newton, MA)
item.description:
In order to continue rapid growth, First Help Financial ("FHF") is looking for a highly motivated Chief Technology Officer with leadership and hands-on experience in programming, database, and team management. As FHF is scaling its software system to meet growth, the CTO will be given great autonomy in the architecture and design of the stack.



Interested parties can send a cover letter, CV, & a link to an open source profile to parker@firsthelp.com

• Work with customers to understand business requirements and translate needs into user friendly reports
