Also with RoR, Javascript, SQL, API’s, JSON/XML? Do you want to learn web scale technologies like Mapreduce, MongoDB and big data? Do you like to use innovative technologies and methods to develop a functional, flexible and scalable big data platform? Please, don't hesitate and contact us!

item.title: Principal Engineer at First. (Durham, NC) (allows remote)
item.description:
About First.


First is a venture-funded startup at the intersection of predictive analytics and real estate tech. We identify when and why people will move, and build products to change the game for real estate professionals and consumers.


Our team is focused on shipping great products and driving innovation in a massive industry (2014 realtor commissions were >$69B). We believe in continuous improvement and sharing knowledge - whether through pair programming, speaking at meetups, and eventually open-sourcing parts of our system.


We’re moving fast and ready for a technical leader to join our CTO in building initial product offerings and automating our data platform.


Engineering


As one of our first engineers, you'll be a senior leader helping guide key architecture and technology decisions. You will reliably scale our data platform to support products and the needs of our data science team. This includes choosing and deploying our server and compute infrastructure (e.g., Ansible, Hadoop, Spark, etc) and building frameworks to support the development of our predictive models.

item.title: Web Software Engineer - Equities Technology at BATS Chi-X Europe (London, UK)
item.description:
You will be a highly motivated developer who will build and maintain a broad range of web applications that perform a critical role in allowing our team to control, monitor and analyse our cutting-edge trading platform. Some of our web applications process millions of requests a day and are used by our members and the investing public for presenting high quality market data.


You will be responsible for designing, developing and testing these high-performance, scalable, data-driven web applications with professional browser-based interfaces using Javascript, CSS, SQL and Python.


You will be involved in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and thrive in an environment where you deliver quality code into production on a frequent basis. We are aggressive and agile. We care about code quality. We care about testing. We care about automation. We care about the user experience.

item.title: Awesome Senior Devops Engineer needed at Taxibeat Ltd (Athens, Greece) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for an awesome DevOps Engineer to join our highly skilled development team, to help manage and drive operational systems, requirements and tool sets.  Taxibeat has numerous custom, complex systems running in our data centers to provide traffic and routing information. We are looking for someone who can take full control of our existing systems and infrastructure while helping us make decisions about new infrastructure and technologies to make it better.


The successful candidate will be a team player, capable of collaborating in a fast paced, devops oriented environment as well capable of working very independently with a high level of self-motivation.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Palo Alto OR Seattle) at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Coupang - Sr. Software Engineer - Palo Alto or Seattle


What if you could set the standard of how e-commerce can and should be done around the world?


Now you can at Coupang!



We are Korea’s largest online retailer and our goal is to create the next-generation e-commerce model. According to Nikesh Arora, we are “one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive Internet companies in the world.” In just 4 years, we already have over 25M devoted users and over $2.5B in annual revenue. And we are just getting started!



We just closed a whopping $1 BILLION round of funding, and we are about to undergo hypergrowth! We have offices in Seoul, Shanghai, Palo Alto, Seattle, and Ontario, CA. We are looking to double our amazing team in the U.S.!



If you want to work in a fun, challenging environment while changing how the world thinks about e-commerce, then we want to hear from you!



About the role:



You’ll get to work with the best in the industry, with many of our team members coming from Amazon, eBay, PayPal, Facebookand more! You’ll work in a collaborative and open environment where we consider ourselves a family (Check out our Family Day!). And our agile environment will enable you to rapidly innovate with the most cutting edge technologies.



What you’ll do:


You’ll be faced with unique challenges to scale we aim to grow to more than 55M+ users in Korea alone. You’ll also get to push the envelope of what’s possible with mobile commerce (currently over 75% of our sales are done on mobile)!



Some specific things you’ll work on:



  • Highly Scalable and Reliable services oriented architecture

  • Big Data Analytics supporting data collection, modeling, and optimization

  • Strategic domains such as mobile payments, pricing, search, personalization, and supply chain management.

  • Consumer driven web and native mobile interfaces and APIs.



(We are only able to consider candidates local to the U.S. at this time. Thank you for your interest!)

item.title: Java Backend Developer (m/f) at Visual Meta GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are Visual Meta - an innovative, Berlin based internet company which has grown to over 200 employees since its foundation in 2009, and we're still growing at a relentless pace. We run shopping sites in 19 countries across three continents LadenZeile.de, ShopAlike.com.br, Shoppala.com, and ShopAlike.in. Despite our great success we have managed to retain a very friendly and open working environment. Since 2011 we have belonged to the Axel Springer Group and have benefited from its great network of online businesses. 


We are looking for “Java Backend Developer (m/f)” on a full-time basis to help us inventing, extending and scaling our backend services for leading shopping comparison platforms worldwide like LadenZeile and ShopAlike.


We deal a lot with data mining and analysis, large databases, images, search technologies, machine learning and web technologies. We code stuff that matters and reaches millions of people. Our technology stack is plain Java, MySQL, Hadoop, Spring, Eclipse and Tomcat.


Your responsibilities:



  • Managing the data warehousing, reporting and visualization

  • Improving our online marketing applications and our data processing / bidding systems

  • Developing back office applications / content management systems

  • Scaling databases for MySQL and Hadoop

  • Controlling the service integration and operating with administration tools


What we offer:



  • A committed, successful and international engineering team in one of the best tech companies in Berlin

  • Continuous training possibilities and room for further personal development

  • Large impact due to small, excellent development teams and professional data center environments

  • Leading-edge technology to solve challenging problems and to build great software

  • Healthy snacks (fruits, cereals), water and hot drinks

  • Flexible working hours, team events, corporate events and leisure activities to support your work-life balance


If you are interested in an exciting position within a friendly team, please submit your application in English to the attention of Johannes Schaback, including cover letter, CV, your earliest starting date, salary expectations as well as relevant references, by using the following Link: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=orjlZfwO&s=stackoverflow


We are looking forward to receiving your application!


Visual Meta GmbH | Schützenstraße 25 | 10117 Berlin


www.ladenzeile.de | www.visual-meta.com

item.title: Information Security Engineer at Gap Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Information Security Engineer works as a member of the Threat & Incident Management team (TIM team). The TIM team is part of Gap’s Information Security organization (InfoSec), working closely with infrastructure, application, and managed service provider teams to ensure the security posture of Gap’s global enterprise is maintained, including endpoint, network, server and border security.



The IT Security engineers serve as Subject Matter Experts (SME) for InfoSec’s portfolio of monitoring and logging tools, providing research, expert advice, and direction on configuration and management of the tools.



The Security Engineer has direct responsibility for working with all GapTech teams in delivering subject matter expertise for cybersecurity incident response and computer forensics services for suspected or confirmed cybersecurity breaches, emerging threats assessment, and supporting legal e-Discovery requests.


Responsibilities



  • Identify security issues and risks associated with security events reported by L1 or L2 InfoSec teams, or via alerts from various security tools, and develop remediation and/or risk mitigation plans

  • Leverage a wide range of security technologies including, but not limited to: SIEM/syslog, IDS/IPS, malware analysis and protection, content filtering, logical access controls, identity and access management, data loss prevention, content filtering technologies, application firewalls, vulnerability scanners, LDAP, security incident response and Identity Management software

  • Participate in incident response and investigations of suspected information technology security misuse or compliance reviews as requested by Gap’s Security Council, InfoSec management, or as required when alerts are received from InfoSec threat monitoring tools and threat intelligence sources

  • Work with InfoSec product vendors and service providers, to evaluate potential security offerings, including product evaluations, pilots and proof of concept installations

  • Assist in responses to internal and external compliance audits, e-Discovery data collection, penetration tests and vulnerability assessments

  • Coordinate maintenance of security-related systems (Anti-Virus, Patching, Intrusion Detection, Logging, Anti-spam, etc.)

  • Monitor current and proposed laws, regulations, industry standards, and ethical requirements related to information security and privacy

  • Conduct research on emerging products, services, protocols, and standards relative to the information security arena

  • Other duties as assigned

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Machine Learning Team at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Lead Software Engineer to join our machine learning team to help define our next-generation, optimization platform working closely with Data Scientists. 

We’re looking for highly-motivated individuals with the right skills to help us in developing systems that will have a direct influence on the success of the company. Candidates must have solid experience working on large-scale, distributed systems. This will be an opportunity to take a lead on several core projects with considerations on key architectural and design decisions. 

Join us as we pursue the goal of facilitating the merger of television and on-line media into a consistent experience accessible across any connected device including desktop, tablets, mobile devices and more.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead software development projects enhancing our distributed optimization service and data lake, the core of TubeMogul’s technology platform

  • Work with Data Scientists to implement optimizations to increase campaign effectiveness

  • Collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations

  • Monitor and plan out core infrastructure enhancements (a.k.a. stay ahead of possible scalability bottlenecks)

  • Troubleshoot and resolve system problems and customer issues under very tight service level agreement.

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and helping them architect code smartly)

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

item.title: Machine Learning Scientist at insydo (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
The Role


insydo is looking for a talented and passionate Machine Learning Scientist with strong exposure to join our multi-national team and build a highly robust and scalable service.


Providing personalized and intuitive content to our users is a key mission for insydo.  Therefore continuously improving the quality of our recommendation system will play a significant part of your role. Do you like to solve non-trivial problems? Are you excited to overcome a real challenge and think outside the box? If yes- we want to hear from you! 


What you will do:



  • Define and evaluate models for real-time prediction and classification

  • Apply machine learning, collaborative filtering, NLP, and deep learning methods to massive data sets

  • Prototype and evaluate new algorithms

  • Iterate on recommendation quality through continuous A/B testing

  • Exploring data sources to understand properties and quality of real world datasets


We are looking for:



  • Individual with passion for building systems that apply advanced methods of computer science to real-world problems. 

  • Candidate with proven record of applying machine learning technics in commercial projects (e.g. artificial intelligence, recommender systems, user modelling, personalisation, data mining, data modelling, information retrieval or natural language processing).

  • Person with strong mathematical background in statistics, algorithms and machine learning.

item.title: Android Developer at PicMonkey (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We got our eyes peeled for an Android engineer who wants to work here in the Emerald City on our app. Creating a flawless next-generation Android experience will make us happy, make you happy, and most importantly make our users happy.



We can’t wait to hear from you. You gotta be:



Hella experienced with Android distributions on consumer electronics products


Excited about innovating new products


Skilled at proactive outward communication and technical leadership


Fearless of new challenges


Out of this world at data analysis and debugging

item.title: Java Software Engineer at EMBL-EBI (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking to recruit an enthusiastic, highly motivated Java Software Engineer to work at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will be working in the Technology Science Integration group led by Steven Newhouse, the Head of Technical Services, across a number of activities aimed at improving access to our OpenStack based cloud systems for our internal and external user communities. This may include:


  1. deploying, developing and integrating technologies to provide web portals


  2. establishing high-performance IO solutions that EMBL-EBI’s data sets to both local and remote clouds


  3. evaluating new tools and technologies for integration into our service offering coming from the open-source communities


  4. assisting development teams in troubleshooting production issues


  5. assisting in migrating existing applications to new technology


  6. developing and extending internal tools to streamline and automate workflows


You will be working with members of EMBL-EBI’s Technical Services Cluster (to integrate your software with the other services being operated at EMBL-EBI and from other service providers) and with internal and external users (to gather their initial requirements and support their use of your software) supported through recently funded projects from (Cancer Research UK and the European Commission).

The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

item.title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Must have strong Salesforce.com experience) at CDK Global (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
CDK Global is seeking at Business Operations Analyst


POSITION SUMMARY


The Business Systems Analyst III provides advanced level of expertise in identifying, driving, developing and/or deploying technical systems and/or reporting solutions within the Services group. Associate is responsible for independently conducting the analysis of business issues and requests that require the creation, updating and/or enhancements to Services business systems and/or reporting solutions.


This person will apply their strong knowledge of established Services business processes to recommend appropriate solutions that help solve the identified business need(s). The BSA utilizes advanced knowledge of Salesforce, SQL, Tableau, and/or other applicable tools, technology, and business systems to perform gap analysis, document business requirements, recommend solutions, identify level of effort and deliver on complex business-critical projects. You will work directly with business and technology stakeholders, Services program management and supporting resources to identify and recommend appropriate technical solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst performs configuration and testing of agreed upon solutions as assigned. You will provide expert level of technical and business expertise to other team members including solution analysis, quality review and testing of developed solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst actively participates in business strategy discussions relating to new functionality, system solutions or other broadly scoped initiatives as assigned.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Business Analysis: Plans, conducts, and documents analysis efforts associated with assigned business processes and issues or initiatives that require creation of new and/or updating of existing business systems, tools and/or critical business processes. This includes managing business process review (BPR) sessions with stakeholders, documenting business requirements, providing relevant solution options and creation of functional specifications and use-cases to support any associated business system configuration or development efforts.

  • Systems/Application Support and Administration: Provides expert level of systems support, maintenance and administration for assigned systems.This includesadministration and configuration associated with assigned database, CRM, telephony or related applications and tools to ensure alignment with the requirements of the business. Provide subject matter expert to team members and stakeholders on assigned systems and other business-critical applications.

  • Reporting Development and Data Analysis. Develops, executes, and maintains assigned datasets, reports and data mining efforts specific to all core business systems supported by the Services Operations team. This includes performing expert level data and impact analysis on assigned metrics, business processes and systems to ensure accuracy and relevance to Services initiatives and business priorities.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES



  • Proven track record of researching and analyzing complex technical issues and then summarizing them via table, graphs, and written analysis

  • Strong verbal and interpersonal skills; exceptional writing skills demonstrated by delivering clear, correct and timely communications and effectively working with others.

  • Ability to analyze complex data or systems issues and to provide actionable recommendations to impacted teams based on the analysis

  • Ability to analyze complex business processes and identify efficiency opportunities and/or solutions to resolve process gaps or related business challenges

  • Identify, develop and document requirements that clearly support and communicate needs to Services stakeholders, IT and supporting teams

  • Ability to effectively present analysis and data findings to wide range of technical and non-technical audiences

  • Detail oriented with excellent time management and organizational skills to meet critical deadline

  • Ability to interface effectively with multiple functions/organizations and all levels of management.

  • Ability to design solutions that anticipate areas of contention and are adaptable to future changes

  • Strong data and problem solving ability

  • Ability to analyze, test and document solutions to ensure business requirements have been satisfied

  • Ability to administer data warehouse systems and other assigned systems/tools

  • Ability to effectively troubleshoot data inaccuracies, identify root causes, and take corrective action

  • Ability to effectively mentor and train associates within job family


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORK ENVIRONMENT


Duties are performed in an office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the manual ability to utilize a computer keyboard and the ability to read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane. Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside of normal working hours (holidays, evenings and weekends).

item.title: Amazon Echo - Software Development Manager at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Interested in Machine Learning? How about Amazon Echo? We’re building the machine learning platform behind Amazon Echo and other Amazon products and services. We’re working hard, having fun, making history; come join us!



As the Manager of Software Development, you will be responsible for leading a team of engineers in design, development, test, and deployment of distributed workflow systems and machine learning infrastructure systems. A successful candidate will have an established background in developing distributed systems, a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment. You will be helping to hire and build your team and systems, and will own defining the road map for your group.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the over-all systems development life cycle

  • Management and execution against project plans and delivery commitments; Manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team within an Agile/Scrum environment

  • Management of departmental resources, staffing, mentoring, and enhancing and maintaining a best-of-class engineering team

  • Work closely with the engineers to architect and develop the best technical design and approach

  • Report on status of development, quality, operations, and system performance to management

  • Customer engagement and product road map definition.




  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (MS, Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc.)

  • The key requirement for this position is established skill designing and developing solutions to complex problems in a distributed systems environment.

  • Strong technical credentials, with at least 8 years experience managing software development teams, ideally with some hands-on architectural or distributed systems experience

  • Mastery of the tools of the trade, including familiarity with modern programming languages (Java, JavaScript, C/C++, Objective C) and open-source technologies (Apache, Hadoop)

  • A strong track record of project delivery for large, cross-functional, projects

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences

  • A track record of communicating well with executives and non-technical leaders




  • MS, Ph.D. in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, etc.

  • Experience with big data solutions

  • Knowledge of ML fundamentals


Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disability/Vet

item.title: C / C++ Software Engineer at Tenable Network Security (Columbia, MD) (allows remote)
item.description:
Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and governments --- -- we call this a start!


Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and government.  

Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars who are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Our market-defining technology provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk, and ensure compliance.


Tenable is looking for a highly motivated C/C++ Software Engineer to join the Development team for the Log Correlation Engine (LCE) product. The Log Correlation Engine processes, classifies, stores, and correlates log data for customers to identify and eliminate network threats. 


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Plan, design, implement, and test features and improvements to the core of the Log Correlation Engine.

  • Collaborate with the technical lead, Research, and QA teams to produce coherent and comprehensive software solutions.

  • Work with log data, vulnerability data, and security logs to improve and expand existing capabilities.

  • Develop innovative object-oriented, reusable, and stable code, and deliver solutions on schedule in an Agile environment.

item.title: Security Architect at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for an experience security architect that has designed scaleable and secure web application, and is also comfortable performing penetration testing and security analysis of systems. 

Some of the challenges of designing the Exaptive platform is that its goal is to be extended by third-party components, and those components will be bought and sold in a component store much like the Apple app store. This opens up opportunities for malicious code as well as introducing the complexity of financial transaction processing. On top of that, Exaptive frequently gets used for data science in fields that have confidential and proprietary data. So we're looking for someone with experience designing architectures that can deal with these things - someone with experience designing sandbox systems for large-scale multi-user environments, with financial transaction processsing applications, and with designing systems with secure data handling. 

This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 


If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation costs.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer - Budapest at Prezi.com (Budapest, Magyarország)
item.description:
We're looking for an engineer interested in writing and running the mission-critical backend services of Prezi and building forward thinking web experiences and interactions for our users.  


As a Full Stack Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a growing start-up, building things millions of people will see everyday. You will experience and experiment with new technologies and work with a group of people whom you can learn and keep pushing things forward. This position is located in our Budapest office.



You should be excited about:




  • Joining a team that focuses on the growth of the whole product




  • Working in a small, cross functional team with other engineers, designers, data analysts, marketing, product managers.




  • Creating customer facing applications




  • New technology and design




  • Working in a challenging, fast paced and always changing environment.




  • Working with big data





Challenges you will be working on:




  • Participate in building a microservice architecture which scales, routes around failure and lets us build complex systems out of small components as well as maintain existing web applications.




  • Run everything into the cloud (AWS), rethinking the assumptions that no longer hold in our current architecture.




  • Help us build our emerging JVM based stack (built on the Netflix open-source stack, mostly in Scala), which will power our next generation of services.




  • Open source some of the awesome things we’re working on.




  • Develop and maintain existing backend services (mostly written in Python) to ensure they are efficient, reliable and secure enough for our many million users.




  • Exploring exciting relationships, patterns, answers in our enormous data sets




  • Developing high fidelity functional prototypes to validate growth initiatives




  • Pro-actively enhancing our web platform

item.title: Software Engineer at Panduit (Folsom, CA)
item.description: Panduit’s software team in Folsom, CA, develops next-generation technologies that view data centers as a system to be optimized to save energy and run reliably. We're looking for a range of junior to senior level engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including UI design, data storage and retrieval, third-party device communication and control, distributed computing, large-scale system design, security, enterprise scalability, functional programming; the list goes on and is always growing. As a software engineer, you will be a member of a dynamic development team where you will apply your software engineering skills on commercially released products critical to Panduit’s corporate vision with opportunities to switch focus to other components of the system as you and our products grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, self-motivating, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full stack as we continue to push technology forward.

item.title: Senior Automation And Monitoring Middleware Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The UI Infrastructure team provides the building blocks used by the firm's 3000+ R&D employees to deliver high-quality, high-performance functionality to our customers in a timely manner. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work across a number of development scrum teams to support an agile continuous development and deployment environment. Strong technical and programming skills, excellent problem solving skills required. Day to day tasks involve development and integration of the Bloomberg Terminal's back-end infrastructure and the CI and monitoring framework needed for deployment and troubleshooting. The candidate will be responsible for ensuring the reliability, scalability and performance of the applications that are running on this infrastructure, as well as the long term evolution of the deployment monitoring infrastructure. The candidate will have experience with automation and monitoring using tools and technologies such as Jenkins, JIRA, Chef, Python, web and cloud services across a range of platforms including Windows, Linux, Solaris, and AIX.

item.title: Application Developer (m/f) at Definiens AG (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
•  Develop and maintain Definiens applications for tissue-based image analysis as part of an agile software development team


  •  Develop image analysis algorithms and user workflows for biomedical image analysis problems based on the Definiens proprietary image analysis platform and proprietary viewing and slide management system




  •  Acquire a profound understanding of the market requirements for accuracy and robustness to optimize the development process




  •  Implement application specific graphical user interfaces and workflows based on user experience requirements




  •  Choose implementation options with a focus on maintainability, reliability, efficiency and high usability




  •  Develop suggestions for software and process improvements and contribute to implementing them




  •  Contribute to user documentation, training material and product life cycle documentation according to the quality management system

item.title: Front End Web Developer at 3D Repo Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
As a Front End Web Developer, you'll have a unique opportunity to redesign and implement a scalable, touch friendly web-based interface for our customers to interact with. You will be responsible for graphical design, jQuery and Bootstrap implementation and integration with the back-end API to load information and progressive 3D models depending on user actions. All of the technology is already in place and proven so we are looking for someone who can take it to the next level! 


At 3D Repo, we develop cutting edge open source version control Software as a Service for large-scale 3D architectural models in the cloud. Our customers include the largest construction companies such as Balfour Beatty with £10bn turnover. 


3D Repo HQ is in the London node of the European Institute of Innovation and Technology (White City, London).


To get a better idea of what we do, have a look at this paper: http://3drepo.org/publications/3drepo-io-building-the-next-generation-web3d-repository-with-angularjs-and-x3dom/

item.title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer at 3D Repo Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
As a Full-Stack JavaScript Engineer, your responsibility will be our 3drepo.io Web Server and API development in NodeJS and MEAN stack. You will be predominantly dealing with a JSON-based communication with the existing C++ Bouncer Service in the back-end, Express framework, API, testing, etc.


At 3D Repo, we develop cutting edge open source version control Software as a Service for large-scale 3D architectural models in the cloud. Our customers include the largest construction companies such as Balfour Beatty with £10bn turnover. 


3D Repo HQ is in the London node of the European Institute of Innovation and Technology (White City, London).


To get a better idea of what we do, have a look at this paper: http://3drepo.org/publications/3drepo-io-building-the-next-generation-web3d-repository-with-angularjs-and-x3dom

item.title: (Senior) Datenbankentwickler (m/w) MS SQL, MySQL at infoteam Software AG (Bubenreuth, Deutschland)
item.description:
(Senior) Datenbank-Entwickler (m/w)
MS SQL, MySQL


Bei der infoteam Software AG werden Sie Teil eines genialen Teams. Sie arbeiten für inter­nationale Kunden aus den Bereichen Industrie, Life Science und Medizin­technik für unsere Nieder­lassung an unserem Standort in Bubenreuth bei Erlangen.


Ihre Aufgaben:


Als Teil unseres dynamischen Datenbank-Entwickler­teams sind Sie zuständig für die fachliche und physikalische Daten­modellierung. Sie sind mit­ver­antwortlich, in welchen Strukturen und Formaten die Daten abgelegt und mit­einander verknüpft werden. Sie erstellen Daten­importe und -exporte, Reports und treiben unser modernes OLAP-System voran. Außerdem über­nehmen Sie die Administration und das Monitoring laufender Systeme. Auf Basis von funktionalen Kunden­anforderungen entwerfen Sie das technische Design und übernehmen anschließend selbst die Programmierung. Sie stehen in enger Abstimmung mit den Bereichen Analyse und Architektur und bieten Support bei der Lösung von System­störungen.

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f) - Rendering & Cloud Computing at Dassault Systemes 3DExcite GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
In Research and Development we provide expert solutions for 3D realtime visualization, asset management and immersive use cases. You will be part of the Quality Assurance department which ensures the quality of our products with a focus on 3D high-end visualization and virtual reality.


Show all in: Munich - Germany, Research & Software Development, Permanent


 Job Responsibilities


Verify & validate next generation 3D rendering & distributed rendering technology on API level



  • Work on next generation 3D rendering & distributed rendering technology for usage in workstation, HPC and cloud environments

  • Verify and validate software libraries on API level

  • Create automated functional, stress and performance tests

  • Create test specifications and plans

  • Enhance test infrastructure

  • Work as part of a Scrum team and collaborate closely with relevant stakeholders

item.title: DevOps / Configuration Management Engineer at ABB (Kraków, Poland)
item.description:
Build the software product (compile and link).
• Lead the integration of source code between branches in the CM system.
• Perform entry-level debugging of source code to facilitate resolution of integration problems.
• Release the software product for customer use at the end of a development project.
• Automate repetitive tasks by scripting and development of software tools.
• Deploy the software product on internal test systems, some of which are virtual and some physical.
• Set up test systems from scratch, i.e. install OS, configure networking, install software, configure security.
• Create customized OS installation images of Windows and Linux to be used on both internal and customer systems.
• Provide performance data within the CM area, such as build times, lines of code, compiler warnings, etc, and make this visible to the rest of the team.
• Participate or lead improvement projects within the CM area, e.g. automating builds, creating interfaces between different tools.
• Be prepared to work odd hours at times – usually planned well in advance.

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.


Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Android Applications at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Explore and leverage your career with one of the world’s foremost leaders in diverse robotics – from consumer, telepresence, and international defense and security, we are constantly creating robotic products that improve, impact, and change lives.


As a Senior Software Engineer – Android Applications at iRobot, you will be developing mobile applications that control iRobot’s Defense & Security Products.


In this role, you will collaborate with other mobile and robot developers, designers, testers, and business managers.  You will have the opportunity to contribute to all aspects of the product development lifecycle.  The ideal candidate must be able to pick up new technologies quickly, be a strong team player, and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands. The ideal candidate will also have experience building mobile applications (Java/Android) that control real time systems.


What you will do


In this role, you operate as a member of an elite and growing team of robot developers delivering the next generation of iRobot products.


 As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you will develop new products that are used by the military, state & local, and industrial markets; these are the robots that save lifes and keep people out of harms way.



  • Design, implement, and test a new, Android based, robot control application.

  • Collaborate with technical architects, test engineers, and user interface designers.

  • Write high quality code that is well documented and unit tested.

  • Participate in and drive code reviews.

  • Proactively write software documentation.

  • Maintain and identify areas for improvement in established software.

item.title: (Senior) PHP / Symfony2 Developer (m/w) at Exozet Berlin GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Symfony2 is your most favourite framework and you have already used it in several projects. You know the bundles and how to apply them. For example Sonata (Admin, User, Media…) or Elastica. You know how to manage test suites with Jenkins – just because Continuous Integration should be part of every project. You love to design and develop complex web portals. Troubleshooter is your second name. For you large quantities of data are easy to handle and a bugfix triggers a dance of joy in you. You don’t hesitate to try out new tools and you are always open for new ideas. You love to share your knowledge with your colleagues and also project managers whom you advise in terms of best solutions, priorities and planning.



This is what you can expect


You develop individual solutions for our clients based on Symfony2 and PHP as part of our teams. You design databases with Doctrine and improve data base accesses. You fix bugs, write documentation and discuss possible solutions – with your team, the project managers, designers and QA. And sometimes even with our clients. You can expect exciting projects, nice colleagues, a family-friendly atmosphere and a wonderful view over the Tempelhof Airport Field.

item.title: LAMP Developer at Zeta Interactive (New York, NY)
item.description:
The LAMP Developer will play a fundamental role in supporting Zeta Interactive’s rapid growth and market expansion world-class code, client-facing web properties in the digital media space.


You’ll be working closely with our product team to extend our platform, build new features, and solve problems / opportunities. You'll be tackling problems big and small from HTML formatting to application design to database optimization.


The ideal candidate will have exceptional verbal and written communication skills, will be self­-motivated, detail­-oriented and highly organized. You will possess a passion for well­-structured, well­-commented code and be a creative thinker. Your ability to multitask and prioritize work in our fast paced environment will be key to your success.

Responsibilities:



  • Extension, modification, and maintenance of our web application infrastructure

  • Port existing data center­based infrastructure to AWS

  • Build new / enhance existing tools and integrations critical to the enterprise

item.title: Software Developer Java at Tracsis plc (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
An experienced and talented Java software developer is sought to join our fast growing, successful software company which specialises in business and data management applications for the public transport industry.



The role will see the successful candidate taking responsibility for the development of new features across our suite of products. The candidate will be expected to analyse requirements, provide suitable designs and take part in the development, testing and future maintenance of the systems. Successful candidates will join a small software team working across our suite of products using a wide variety of technologies. We strongly encourage proactive learning, and personal development. We emphasise good technical practices and value long-term quality and continuous improvement.


Candidates must hold a 2.1 or higher degree in Computing, Science, Engineering or Mathematics or a related discipline.

item.title: Software Engineer, Generalist at Connectifier, Inc. (Costa Mesa, CA)
item.description:
Build the next generation employment platforms, and help great companies find great people.


Connectifier is changing the way recruiting is done today. Our engineering team from Google, Microsoft Research, Berkeley National Lab, Carnegie Mellon, and Stanford is building large scale data analysis software that processes professional profiles from all around the web. By analyzing code repos, blogs, and social profiles we're helping recruiters and hiring managers connect more efficiently with the candidates best for their openings.


We are deployed at 25% of the Fortune-100, and our revenue is growing extremely fast. At Connectifier you'll get to work with top growing companies and fantastic brand names and deliver a best in class product.


Example projects


Build a predictive AI model of employee success based on a dataset of millions of people


Build infrastructure for running distributed, restartable tasks on a cluster of machines


Requirements


Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or commensurate work experience


Software engineering work or internship experience


Preferred experience


Application of algorithmic knowledge and intuition to solve complex problems


Experience building software with a statically-typed backend language (Java preferred. C, C++, Scala, etc. are all sufficient)


Knowledge of machine learning, aritifcial intelligence, big data and web technologies are a plus


How to apply and what to expect


Click the apply button below.


Be prepared to answer technical questions and write code to solve very challenging problems during the initial phone interview, a 5 hour on-site (or video chat) interview and on-site coding project.

item.title: Software QA Engineer - Zurich, Switzerland at PlusQuote.net AG (Zürich, Switzerland)
item.description:
We are a young and growing startup company based in Zürich, Switzerland. We already hit the market with one product, Quiz4Deal, and we are now developing the second one. The new cloud-based enterprise-grade product is developed by our Zürich-based development team, for which we are currently hiring.


Your challenges



  • Be a valuable part of our great team: participate in the creative process of product development, bring new ideas on the table, challenge and improve the existing ones

  • Be ready to find creative solutions to client requirements (we don’t speak “impossible”)

  • Develop comprehensive unit tests, stress tests, integration tests, and code quality tests

  • Encourage and motivate the team to follow the test-driven development process

  • Fine-tune servers and services; benchmark these to find the sweet spot in the parameter space so that our products are fast and reliable

  • Never stop learning, be up to date with current technologies and future trends


You are a young, dynamic, fast and avid learner who wants to join our offices in Zürich as a Software QA Engineer. You understand that in a Web 2.0 startup, the agility and the quick response to the consumer needs are critical. You have some years of experience as software developer, and at least 1 year of Java development. You understand the concepts of distributed systems, you have experience with large scale data processing (Big Data), machine learning and process optimisation. Additionally, you worked with Cassandra, Hadoop, JUnit, Mockito and/or Spark. You have a solid understanding of OOP and classical relational databases. You are familiar with the Scrum methodology, you are fluent in English (written and spoken) and you have at least a BA/BS in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent. You must be eligible to work in Switzerland.


We offer a full time position in a friendly, flexible and fun working environment in a small team. An open, fluid environment where we not only share ideas but also contribute towards the development of our peers in the team. This is a growth opportunity that can lead to a nice progression within the company.

item.title: MySQL DBA at MLB Advanced Media (NY, NY)
item.description:
MLB Advanced Media (MLBAM), the interactive and mobile company of Major League Baseball, is the developer of several award-winning products, apps and services. Some of these include: MLB Gameday, MLB.TV, Fantasy Baseball, Beat the Streak, and the #1 sports app and a Hall of Fame inductee for iPhone, iPad and Macworld – MLB At Bat! We are also an industry leader in the development and distribution of live streaming video events over multiple platforms.


We are seeking a MySQL DBA (Mid-Senior Level) in our New York City office.


At MLBAM, you will get to have your hands on the pulse of a platform that is providing the best live streaming experience in the world. You will be able to work with a large environment where ideas are always welcome and will have the opportunity to work where the future of media delivery is being forged.


Responsibilities:



  • Perform on-site, day-to-day production MySQL database administration tasks in a Linux environment, including maintenance, troubleshooting, tuning, optimization, installation, upgrades, backup/recovery, and data migration across multiple data centers and multiple database server architectures/systems.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve production database issues

  • Maintain database design/release documentation

  • Work closely with Engineering and DBA Team to design and implement optimal solutions.

  • Consistently meet deadlines and schedules by working closely with Engineering/Infrastructure team

item.title: Full-Stack Software Developers at Groupon International (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Groupon has opening for experienced full stack developers to help design and build high-scale, web and mobile e-commerce applications that run non-stop around the globe.  We work in small, independent and collaborative teams to architect massively scalable and reliable systems.  As part of our Dublin technology team, you'll use a variety of technologies and development practices to build pioneering local commerce applications used by hundreds of millions of people.

You'd be a great fit for this position if you're comfortable working with a small team, rapidly iterating a multi-component software stack and taking the initiative to add great new features that we haven't even dreamed up yet. Come help us build and power our rapidly growing international e-commerce platform!

Core Responsibilities 



  • Design high-performance RESTful web services serving billions of requests a week

  • Personalize content and promotions based on user interests

  • Deliver billions of e-mail messages efficiently

  • Unravel the myriad of payment technologies available globally

  • Optimize placement of inventory across fulfilment centers

  • Build large-scale infrastructural data systems using open-source technologies

item.title: Java Scala Developer (M/F) at Transpaygo GmbH (Wien, Österreich)
item.description:
Fonmoney is a young and dynamic Start-Up based in Vienna, Austria. Created in late 2011 we are providing a service for our clients to send money around the world as a top-up or a bank-transfer. Our goal is to change “The act of sending money home”.


Fonmoney is developing a cutting edge Anti-Fraud and Anti Money Laundering Engine. We are working on the distributed machine-learning platform based on Apache Spark. In order to achieve this, we are currently looking for a passionate a Java engineer (M/F) for our office in Vienna. If you have a good knowledge and experience with Unix/Linux and you are also a little bit familiar with Windows environment, then feel free and apply for this position.

item.title: Scala Developer - Innovative company in Rotterdam at Pointlogic (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
SCALA DEVELOPER


Innovate, stimulate, participate


About the job


Client requirements and increasing data size have prompted our international development team to look for Apache Spark as platform for lightning fast distributed computing. The first version of our product that uses Spark will be released in September and clients are already asking us to extend the platform. Time for you to join our Scala team to design and implement a flexible architecture and efficient algorithms to support better marketing decisions!


Our development has high standards with respect of the code and its maintainability. We expect that you are used to writing unit tests and are comfortable with a culture of peer reviewing. You are a self-motivated, creative thinker, you are flexible and enjoy working in teams.


Pointlogic accommodates employees that wish to develop their capabilities in relevant areas by means of supporting studies and facilitating R&D projects.   


Our offer


We offer a competitive compensation package and ample opportunity for self-development, both in the specialist and personal field. An atmosphere of openness, mutual respect, time for social contact ánd fun are important aspects to us. In addition, working for Pointlogic means flexibility, both in terms of working hours and work location.


If this vacancy appeals to you we look forward to receive you application withmotivation letterandCV by email: careers@pointlogic.com

item.title: Electrical Engineer at Sensoria Inc. (Redmond, WA)
item.description:
As an Electrical Engineer, you are a key participant in the design of Sensoria’s groundbreaking product offering, successfully engaging with an experienced multi-disciplinary team and global partners. You are responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment. 


In this role, your responsibilities include:



  • Contribute in hardware development of consumer products from concept through prototyping, short run and manufacturing.

  • Perform hands-on system bring-up and validation.

  • Create detailed test plans.

  • Implement automated testing infrastructure.

item.title: Technical Product Manager - Tools and Infrastructure at Workday (Pleasanton, CA)
item.description:
Please Note: 
- This position requires existing work-authorization in the United States.
- If you don't already have U.S. work authorization, please don't submit your resume.


About the Team:
The Technology Product Management team at Workday drives the product and strategy for Workday’s secret sauce - our technology platform that was designed from scratch for the cloud. We are growing at a fast pace, and we're looking for folks with a strategic vision and a proven track record for successfully getting sought-after products to market.


About the Role
Design the infrastructure required for scaling and storing massive amounts of data in the era for millions of users.


In this role, you would:



  • Collaborate with Workday's customers, development, services, and sales teams to understand their requirements

  • Work with the 3rd party vendors, technical architects, development, operations, and infrastructure organizations through design, testing, product release, and maintenance

  • Write detailed feature specifications based on requirements

  • Manage uptake of new enhancements by coordinating with internal development

  • Define a product roadmap and determine requirements for each release

  • Participate in customer facing situations and user conferences as a product expert

  • Demonstrate flexibility and the ability to adapt to change

item.title: PHP Developer at Jon-Don Inc. (Roselle, IL)
item.description: Jon-Don has an immediate need for a PHP Developer to join their team full-time. The ideal candidate will have work experience in development and implementation of a wide variety of Web-based products primarily using PHP, JavaScript, SQL and AJAX.  Developers work as part of a team and independently on enhancements and new development of the company's software. In addition to developing in-house applications, developers code and implement integrations with various cloud applications.

item.title: C++ Software Engineer at B-Line Medical (Washington, DC)
item.description:
B-Line Medical, a leader in healthcare simulation, is on the lookout for a brilliant C++ software engineer. You will be working alongside a small team of very capable software engineers, QA engineers and product managers to help develop and advance our video products and web-platform. Our platform is used by 7 out of the top 10 medical schools, and helps train more than 50% of all medical students in the country. If you know C++ inside and out, and enjoy low level programming, we’d love to have you on our team.


Our team culture can be described as creative, problem solving, and fun. We're engineering-driven from the top down, and we really believe in delivering the best product in our industry.


Our video products are a key part of our web platform. They allow customers to capture, encode, and stream high-resolution video from multiple video angles, synchronized with real-time data from medical devices. We support video using our own encoders, along with custom-built applications for devices such as Google Glass.  These devices in real time transmit to our centralization server to be accessed through an elegant web interface. You’ll be working on these products along with the web platform.

item.title: Sr. Engineer (Dev Tools) at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Senior Software Development Engineer with experience creating and deploying software tools to enhance the productivity of our entire Development team. As the Sr. SDE on our Dev Tools team, you’ll be responsible for leading the group in the delivery of tools and added features/functionality to help make life easier for your fellow Developers and DevOps teammates. You will already have proven ability to write code and automation scripts working with large scale internet technologies. Experience in a continuous deployment environment is a definite plus.



  • Work with development leadership to evaluate, propose and design new tools

  • Design, develop, and deploy development tool features from front-end to back-end

  • Collaborate with other project teams to incorporate their innovations and vice versa

  • Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of development tools and systems to help scale the product

  • Create and adapt automated processes that improve the efficiency of our software development, delivery, and deployment

  • Provide mentorship to other Dev Tools engineers

  • Stay current on state of the art technologies.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Advidi (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
If you would like to be involved in shaping the future of internet advertising (innovation), develop features which will be exposed to hundreds of millions of users every day (big data), go off the beaten path to design and develop high performance and high availability web applications (challenges), then you will be pleased with what Advidi has to offer. The Advidi SOA is composed of multiple critical components which are handling large amounts of live traffic and is the backbone of our business workflow. Thus, high availability, zero-downtime and minimum response times are critical.


As a DevOps engineer you will be taking part in the development of exciting new features for the company’s core software products. We are looking for people who get things done and would like to work on projects that add value to business and would enjoy working within an inspirational environment.


Responsibilities


You will support, develop and enhance highly scalable and highly available infrastructure for all our projects in Google Cloud. You will find a balance between creating awesome things that create an immediate impact and making sure that they're secure and maintainable in the long run. You will have an opportunity to be involved with product development as a software engineer and be able to develop your programming skills to the next level.

item.title: Software Engineer - Core Engine at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Core Developer, you will be involved in the development of these various fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design and technical specifications of the system and responsible for developing high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until the 18th of September, 2015.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Chatham Financial (Kennett Square, PA)
item.description:
This position is part of our models team, which is responsible for developing robust and scalable services to enable cutting-edge financial applications. Our models are implemented in a micro service architecture designed to support a variety of internal and external user applications. We are looking for developers who are interested in both software engineering and computation, with skills and experience including:



  • Object-oriented design patterns; languages including C#, C++ or Java; web frameworks like Microsoft MVC and angular.js; and relational and NoSQL databases.

  • Quantitative and modeling skills with an ability to learn techniques in numerical optimization, data mining, simulation, or model calibration.

  • Comfort with full stack software development, including computationally intense back-end development and service design, data storage and access models, enterprise level messaging patterns, and modern web development frameworks.

  • Proclivity towards refactoring and continuously improving OO code through agile development methods.

  • Testing skills including use of inversion of control, mocks, and stubs in unit testing and BDD testing frameworks like specflow and cucumber.


Additionally engineers on the models team work directly with operational teams, other software engineering and design teams, and our quant team comprised of Mathematics and Physics Ph.D.’s. Members of this team gain knowledge of our business and the mathematical models used in modern finance, and have the ability to deliver robust and scalable software meeting the needs of a variety of business users. The team has a strong core of existing developers who can help new members gain this knowledge.


Although not required, a typical successful candidate may have been involved in



  • Mathematical/quantitative competitions.

  • Open source development projects.

  • Advanced degrees in mathematics, computer science, engineering, or sciences.

  • R&D experience at the collegiate or professional level.


Our technology stack is constantly evolving but currently includes .Net, ServiceStack, RabbitMQ, SQL-Server, ASP .Net MVC, angular.js, Memcached, Redis, various Amazon web services, unmanaged C code, Nvidia Cuda, and Python. We also use developer tools like Team City, Subversion, Specflow, Graylog, and Visual Studio. We have specialized design, database administration, devops, and IT infrastructure teams to allow software engineers to focus on software engineering.


Finally, we work in a rapidly-changing, high-performance environment that relies on excellent communication and collaboration, so we look for people that are energized by being part of great teams, and looking to challenge themselves to learn new technologies and apply them to our technology stack. Most new employees say that Chatham is both the most challenging and most rewarding place at which they have ever worked. If this applies to you, we’d be interested to hear from you.

item.title: Business Product Owner at MediaRadar (NY, NY)
item.description:
DESCRIPTION


You are a hands-on top performer who will augment our product team and focus on the future of our offerings. Your flexibility and desire to learn is essential. You have the passion and innate ability to become the “CEO” of every assigned initiative.



What you’ll be doing:



Our Business Product Owner will be an individual contributor, focusing on the business aspects of our strategic offerings. Your job will be spent on the following key objectives:



  • identifying and assessing business opportunities

  • building and managing product road maps

  • constructing the revenue model, understanding and managing revenue and costs levers

  • managing relationships with stakeholders in finance, marketing, sales and operations

  • establishing and maintaining key external partner relationships

  • working closely with the product and engineering teams in an agile environment to deliver amazing products to market

  • tracking success and failure via business analysis of metrics and analytics

item.title: Application Engineer at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 


We are looking for a talented individual to be a key technical evangelist about Exaptive, educating the user community and customers in writing, presentations, and short videos.  He or she will support the sales process through demos, technical training sessions, proposals, and proofs of concept to identify customer needs, design solutions, and communicate Exaptive’s unique value.  This role is the bridge between us and our community, communicating our story to our community and representing that community in shaping our company’s direction.


We will provide intensive training during which you will create top notch documentation and video tutorials for our users – written and video.  The role will evolve according to the dynamic needs of a startup and to your talents and professional desires.           


This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to other Exaptive and customer locations. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as an opportunity to excel. The startup environment is not for everyone, but offers the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 



Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). We were also recently named a Gartner Cool Vendor (http://blogs.gartner.com/michael-shanler/cool-vendors-in-life-science/).  Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation expenses.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Java at Chewy.com (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
item.description:
The Overview:


As an engineer on our Ecommerce Systems team, you will deliver solutions and features for the leading online pet retailer in the United States. You will lead a team that is responsible for the vision, strategy, product roadmap, and development of Chewy’s core Ecommerce Platform which consists of customer management, order and shipment management, returns management, catalog management, competitive pricing tools, search and personalization services, and operational analytics.  You will have significant influence over the vision, features, and design of this critical platform. Working with other technology teams, you and your team will design and build interfaces that integrate with vendor & supply chain systems, fulfillment systems, and financial systems. This is a high-profile position that will have exposure across the entire business.


You will write simple and sustainable code that reflects a constant understanding of the business impacts. This is a terrific opportunity to join a thriving startup and have a significant role in its success. There is a tremendous opportunity to grow professionally and to be a part of a dynamic and successful team.

item.title: Senior software engineer - equity + market salary at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Retail Growth Fund acquired the Ice.com domain in 2014 to launch the best place for women to discover and purchase jewelry. We don't take any inventory because we're a marketplace - which means our capital goes towards building IP and acquiring/retaining users. 

A few things that make us interesting:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including equity in a high growth VC backed start-up (Crosslink, Maveron, Quest, Polaris). Salary/equity is determined based on a sliding scale: if you would like a higher salary, we can issue you less equity, and vice versa. 
  • Small (12 person), growing, and agile team. 
  • $1k gift card to dog food our own marketplace sellers! 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with extensive experience in Python/Django or Java. (Django is a key part of our stack but we use some Java). 
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform (Django, Java, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • MS or PhD
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: Senior Software Developer at ThoughtWorks (Melbourne, Australia)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is hunting for talented developers who know how to create great code to join us in Melbourne. 

Being a consultancy, our teams work on a huge variety of projects. You could be helping shape the digital strategy of a retail giant, building a new mobile platform for a bank, creating an app to support an awareness campaign for Indigenous Australians or helping the science community locate meteorites that have fallen to earth.  All of this whilst building quadcopters or robotic arms in your spare time.


Examples of some of our current projects:




  • Mobile applications including native Android and iOS for telco, retailers, banking clients as well as less traditional science and indigenous communities 

  • HTML5 rich web applications using AngularJS and NodeJS

  • Large scale distributed systems with big data using technologies like Storm, Hadoop, Elastic and Cassandra

  • Functional programming languages like Scala and Clojure for heavy data processing projects



We're a big believer in diversity.  We build software for a wide variety of people so we think that a wide variety of people should build our software.  We abhor and reject discrimination and inequality, and promote diversity in all its forms. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve.  As long as you're an opinionated, disruptive thinker, we'd like to hear from you.


We don't do bureaucracy, or hierarchy but you do get lots of autonomy and we actively encourage you to experiment with new technologies without limitation. 


In addition to all this, we have some great extra benefits including a generous training budget and one of the best parental leave packages in Australia.


As a general rule of thumb our languages and technical environments range across Java, Ruby, Scala, Clojure, C#, Python, iOS, Android and Javascript. Do you have 5+ years' commercial experience in any of these languages?  Are you a proud code geek looking for a home? Do you get a buzz out of helping others get their geek on? We'd love to talk to you!


To apply or find out more, use the links and we will be in touch soon.

item.title: Graduate Developer - Reboot the classroom at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
As a Graduate Developer at Sparx, you’ll be an integral part of the team from day one, forming the heart of our technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be joining our team of games and software developers, supporting the development of the technical framework of the Sparx system. If software is your thing, you’ll be writing tablet native code (we currently work on iPads) to run the Sparx resource. You’ll get to see software you’ve helped program go live in a classroom the next day. Then you’ll be diving straight back in to making it better, getting into the detail, zooming out to look at the bigger picture, solving each problem and trying out the next idea. If gaming is more your thing, you’ll be supporting the designing, programming and testing of high quality games for a variety of subjects.
