  • Mentor more junior developers

  • Develop, deploy and maintain the consumer-facing features of the TripAdvisor native iOS App

  • Responsible for all aspects of software engineering, from design to implementation, QA and maintenance.

item.title: Looking for New Talent! C++ (Associate) Developer for the SAP HANA database team at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.The SAP HANA in-memory database is the basis for new, ground-breaking SAP applications and is widely agreed to be a highly valuable asset in the SAP software portfolio. In-memory computing is made possible through recent technology advances in main memory, multi-core processing, and data management. It leverages technology innovation to establish real-time analysis of business data and combines both transactions and analytics to improve existing business processes with a dramatic increase in performance. The SAP HANA in-memory database as basis for the in-memory computing shows enormous promise as a key driver for SAP market of the future. The development of the SAP HANA in-memory database is distributed over all continents. You will be part of the development team in Walldorf with more than 100 exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. We live code development in a flexible and agile way. You will be part of small and self-organized groups of developer.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

We seek for developers with strong focus in C++ system or application programming. The main task of the job is to drive and implement development topic as part of a development team inside the core of the SAP HANA in-memory database. You can expect to work on some of the following tasks:
- Write meticulous software implementations in classical main memory database areas such as compression algorithms, distribution algorithms or query processing as well as in domain specific extensions like processing of geo spatial information, graph processing, hierarchical information processing or database programming languages
- Write basic regression tests for your own code using different programming languages (e.g. C++, Python, SQL) and testing frameworks (e.g. Google C++ Testing Framework)
- Do code reviews and code audits to spot opportunities for improvements with respect to usability, testability, supportability, or potential performance penalties

WORK EXPERIENCE

- 0 - 2 years
- We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path. Your set of application documents should contain a cover letter and CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

Required skills:
- Strong C++ programming skills
- University degree in computer science or related technical discipline
- Basic knowledge on relational database management systems
- Excellent German and English both spoken and written
- Willingness to analyze and debug complex problems
- Good communication skills Preferred skills:
- Experience in Administration, Programming or Profiling on Linux
- Knowledge of code-analysis tools e.g. Valgrind, Intel Amplifier, Cppchecker
- Experience with continuous integration concepts and tools e.g. Git, Gerrit
- Python or Shell-Scripting programming skills
- Working experience in the area of system or application programming with C++ (eg. internship or working student experience)
- Knowledge in architecture of relational database management systems101014132

item.title: Software Engineer - Quality Assurance Developer at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Quality Assurance Developer, you will be developing automated test suites for the development in these various fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design of automated test systems, creating test cases, and responsible for developing high quality test code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until 18th September, 2015.

item.title: Back- End Web Developer at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
item.description:
Back-End Web Developer



Michigan State University (MSU) is seeking an innovative and creative Back-End Web Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the application and the browser. This role focuses on the server side of programming for the web, yet also requires understanding the programming languages that control the display of content in the browser.



Responsibilities


The Back-End Web Developer:



  • Integrates user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server-side logic

  • Develops and modifies object-oriented frameworks both inside and outside of a CMS

  • Builds reusable code and libraries

  • Develops front-end code that meets or exceeds WCAG 2.0 AA and W3C web standards

  • Develops applications that interface with web services

  • Implements security and data protection

  • Provides detailed estimates of time and resources required to meet project objectives

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at mParticle (Boca Raton, FL) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a skilled Cloud Systems Engineer who will be responsible for supporting our growing application infrastructure. The candidate will be responsible for maintaining strict production SLAs of a custom distributed application running on AWS cloud infrastructure, monitoring, alerting, incident management, SOP, capacity planning, change management, security, and overall platform stability and improvement.
 
The ideal candidate will have a deep technical understanding of Linux operating systems and at least an intermediate understanding of Windows operating systems, strong experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), advanced scripting skills, experience with variety of monitoring solutions, deep understanding of network communications and excellent troubleshooting skills.


Finally, we are seeking someone who wants to be a major contributor in a small, dynamic work environment, loves a challenge, and has a strong balance of technical and people skills.
 
The Cloud Systems Engineer will be responsible for:



  • Maintain, monitor, and improve the performance and availability of the 24x7 production environment including networks, servers, databases, etc.

  • Participate in on-call rotation and provide hands-on support during emergencies, outages, and service transitions.

  • Define and monitor compliance to production environment SLAs.

  • Participate in creating long-term and short term strategies for scaling the production environment.

  • Adhere to a comprehensive incident management program including problem management.

  • Generate KPIs for service availability, uptime, and adherence to SOPs, and SLAs.

item.title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer at HBC Digital (NY, NY)
item.description:
As a Senior QA Engineer, your day to day activities include: developing test scripts, executing tests and analyzing results, solving complex problems, providing/evaluating solution options, collaborating with IT teams, researching new products and/or working on internal projects. Your job requires ability to: manage multiple tasks with competing priorities, adapt to changes in scope or schedule, work under tight timelines, be creative in working through obstacles, effectively communicate, collaborate with business and technical teams, and deliver on time. You are expected to know how to effectively manage a project from planning to delivery. You can be assigned individual project or participate in group project, in a lead or contributor capacity. Additionally, you are responsible for administrating of QA systems and tools. Last but not least, you will be conducting performance/load testing, and/or assigned functional projects.

Requirement:


  • Proficient with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.

  • Fluent in Object Oriented Design and Object Oriented Programming.

  • Proficient in a high level programming language (Java/C# - prefer Java).

  • Ability to maintain/enhance existing (complex) Java code.

  • Familiar with Windows Server and Linux Operating System.

  • Proficient with SQL and able to create DB table schema, stored procedure, and trigger.

  • Good knowledge of system networking (understand switch, router, load balancer, network monitoring, etc.

  • Background in performance/load testing ecommerce architecture.

  • Knowledgeable of the various data exchange formats like XML, JSON, etc.

  • Ability to analyze complex data sets (log analysis, network package analysis, etc.

  • Familiarity with Continuous Deployment and Continuous Integration.

  • Ability to lead a technical team.

  • Ability to solve complex problems and recommend solution options.

  • Project management and time management skills.

  • Ability to effectively communicate with business and technical audiences.

  • Capable of multi-tasking and working through multiple priorities.

  • Self-starter, go-getter, and team player.

  • Flexible to work extended hours or off-hours when needed.

item.title: Engineering Manager - Technical leader for a Music Software Company at BMAT Music Innovation (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
BMAT is an innovative and fast growing software company with a team of young and international tech/music lovers located in the sunny Barcelona.


We are looking for an Engineering Manager who has the mission of leading outstanding technical teams like R&D, IT, Software Development, among others, to guarantee the quality in our product development and services for the music industry. You will report to the Board and works closely with other functional leaders in the company, being responsible for the translation of the company strategy to the technical team, managing them with a hands-on behavior to achieve the objectives in the expected timing and quality. You will be the responsible for all of the company’s product development activities and the satisfaction of the team members.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities



  • Develop strategic planning, direction and control of product development activities.

  • Provide technical direction and guidance, as well as hands-on project management, for all product development.

  • Ensure the optimal application of technology and engineering resources to meet product development and/or customer requirements

  • Detects conflicts and risks, find solutions and report them.

  • Ensure that the product is fully and correctly defined and documented.

  • Hire, coach and direct team members to acquire necessary resources to meet scheduled commitments.

  • Represent the company managing the customers during the process of product development and maintenance.

item.title: SQL Developer-Dive in, Develop and Disect Databases! at Radio Systems Corporation (PetSafe) (Knoxville, TN)
item.description:
Often times, we get so caught up in the day to day execution of our jobs that we forget that we should be learning and growing instead of simply doing the same tasks over and over.  THIS is your opportunity to grow. To stretch those muscles and learn new skills.  Our ERP team, is filled with dynamic people with such a varation of skill sets that you will essentially be learning something new every day.  Our question to you is: What can YOU bring to the table? What can YOU teach us?! We are eager to find out and to learn from you!  If the below job description looks like you and what you are passionate about, we want to hear from you! 


SUMMARY OF POSITION: Responsible for the technical development, maintenance of custom packages, interfaces, extensions for Oracle e-Business Suite and Cognos BI reports and cubes.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Analyze user requirements and, based on findings, build SQL queries, procedures, packages, reports and cubes for Oracle ERP and Cognos BI applications;

  • Monitor performance of existing database objects and tune objects with worsening performance;

  • Diagnose and resolve database access and performance issues

  • Monitor and resolve issues for SQL based interfaces with external trading partners;

  • Provides expertise in software development lifecycle management (analysis, design, development, testing training, etc.) of new ERP&BI development, including reports, interfaces, business forms, data migration, user exits, and workflow;

  • Assists with understanding configuration dependencies and interrelationships between data warehouse/business intelligence tools and designs, and troubleshoots in the area with this knowledge

  • Facilitate DBA with activities in non-production instances

item.title: Software Developer (1 - 5 years experience) - Multiple Openings at Power Advocate, Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Looking for an opportunity to work alongside the Senior Technology team of a leading-edge Big Data SaaS technology and consulting company that provides market intelligence to the energy industry? Interface with our Executives, Product Owners and Senior Software Developers? Work on a team in a culture that fosters individual responsibility and team success? Interested in emerging Big Data technologies?


If you like to work independently and be a player on a dynamic team in a SCRUM environment, if you want to expand your software development skill sets and have opportunities for career advancement, we have the job for you!


SUMMARY: PowerAdvocate is seeking a dynamic individual to join a high performing software development team. Work with code to develop functionality as requested by product owner and our customers as well as work as a key member in a self-organizing SCRUM team, which focuses on continuous improvement and short, iterative development cycles and produces 98%+ bug-free releases.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: In addition to the following, other duties may be assigned to meet business needs.



  • Analyze and design applications

  • Write software to solve problems for customers

  • Working on front-end web development using Java, jQuery, ExtJS, Css, and HTML

  • Working on back-end website service using Java development, an Oracle database, Spring, EJB, MVC, Hibernate, Solr and Single-Sign-On.

  • Have fun!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at 33Across (Sunnyvale, CA)
item.description:
The role:
We’re looking for a Lead Software Engineer to join our 12-person engineering team. We’ve had 10x growth in our new product line over the past year and we’re looking for a Ruby on Rails expert to drive this growth and service 100’s of millions of users in an impactful way.

What will you do? You’ll build consumer-facing web applications (link to this ) and lead a small team of Rails engineers in building new dashboards and extending tools for our network of publishers. Our products offer over a million websites worldwide unique insights into how their content is being consumed and shared online, drive incremental traffic to these sites, and help some of the largest publishers in the world monetize their content.

Your mission, should you choose to accept it:
* Provide technical leadership, software design, and architectural guidance to a team of full-stack engineers, instilling best practices in the software development process, “the Rails way”, and mentoring other engineers.
* Design, build, enhance, and maintain our Publisher dashboards and workflows, providing new insights and control to our customers as we extend our products to mobile & tablet.
* Partner with User Experience and Visual Designers to implement intuitive and aesthetic web UIs.
* Integrate with our Big Data/NoSQL back-end infrastructure to pull data that feeds insights and reports.

item.title: Full Stack Development Engineer at Groupon International (Athens, Greece)
item.description:
Groupon are seeking experienced full stack developers to work in our Dublin office to design and build high-scale, web and mobile e-commerce applications that run non-stop around the globe. We work in small, independent and collaborative teams to architect massively scalable and reliable systems.  As part of our Dublin technology team, you'll use a variety of technologies and development practices to build pioneering local commerce applications used by hundreds of millions of people.

You'd be a great fit for this position if you're comfortable working with a small team, rapidly iterating a multi-component software stack and taking the initiative to add great new features that we haven't even dreamed up yet. Come help us build and power our rapidly growing international e-commerce platform!


Awesome things you will be doing!


You will work on our Ruby on Rail and Node.js e-commerce platform (similar architecture to Groupon I-tier) while delivering superior mobile and desktop user experiences.


We are producing high quality cross-browser and cross-platform code as we maintain high quality and test coverage while adding new functionality. 


We certainly work in an agile environment so we would like you to research and champion new innovative open-source technologies and frameworks and because you will be an awesome candidate we know you will embrace mentoring junior developers on technical issues and modern web development best practices.


No country is the same and we, the local extensions team, know this better than most.  Most of our time we spend touching multiple code bases to provide that one feature a country can't live without.  If you're interested in touching many code bases or get bored from spending forever on the same project, this position is made for you.

We traverse the links from frontend to backend, sometimes multiple backends.  We're exposed to lots of different code bases, encountering most languages under the sun, usually in code, but sometimes in speech too.  Would you like to be a part of us?

item.title: Software Engineer - NLP Developer at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As an NLP Developer, you will be involved in the development of our Natural Language Processing system component. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design and technical specifications of the system and responsible for developing high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until 18th of September, 2015.

item.title: Systems Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
About the Job
Become a member of an elite technical team advancing the infrastructure of ROBLOX, the largest indie game development platform in the world with more than 17 million unique active users. We are ranked #1 among kids entertainment sites in the U.S. for the number of daily visitors, total minutes, total page views, total visits, and average length of visits by ComScore. Each month we have more than 4.4 million active users and more than 70 million hours of engagement. Our users have created more than 15 million games and have played 2 billion hours since 2008.

As a Data Center Ops Engineer, your duties will include, but are not limited to:



  • Maintain a 99.9% SLA for a 24/7/365 production environment

  • Triage, troubleshoot, and solve production issues caused by failures in hardware, configuration, networking, vendor outages, and continuous software upgrades

  • Quickly resolve complex problems encountered during the installation and operation of our applications, to ensure negligible impact on players and internal operations

  • Prioritize and multitask daily responsibilities, while being flexible enough to respond to emergent high-priority issues

  • Design, deploy and configure servers and complex firewall environments

  • Assist in implementing disaster recovery procedures and system failover efforts

  • Collaborate with highly skilled and driven colleagues in a dynamic, agile environment

  • Collect, document and help manage vendor-related services

  • Manage systems and develop contingency plans

  • Participate in on-call rotations


Our infrastructure management system is highly automated, enabling engineers to interact with thousands of servers across multiple environments in parallel via the command line. Our application space includes database scalability, caching, message queuing, wide-table search, recommendations, user ratings, services for mobile devices, gaming cloud management, and virtualization. We live in both the cloud and traditional data center environments.


Perks & Benefits:



  • Robust medical, dental and vision insurance

  • 401k

  • Flexible time-off

  • Wellness reimbursement

  • Free onsite parking & other commuter benefits

  • Free catered lunches & a fully stocked kitchen with unlimited snacks!

  • Chance to work with a top-notch team on cool and unique projects!


ROBLOX does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruiters.

item.title: Java Developer at Gap Inc. (Erlanger, KY)
item.description:
Position Statement:  Provides the technical delivery role in the Application Delivery lifecycle from inception and solution delivery to production to production support, maintenance, and enhancement. The Software Engineer analyzes project requirements and solution design to assure that Material Handling systems are functionally appropriate, technically sound and well integrated in accordance with business user requirements, methods and standards throughout the project life cycle.



Responsibilities: 



  • Ability to design and review software for large complexity business problems or      interconnected medium complexity business problems within a project framework.

  • Ability to develop software for large complexity business problems within and across projects or within one or more systems. Lead external MHE providers in defining technical specifications and development efforts as  appropriate. Able to advise others on development of features or components.

  • Conducts development & design reviews.

  • Works with project teams, Operations, and Support teams to assure timely resolution to defects identified during the software development lifecycle.

  • Collaborates and partners with architects in recommending emerging technologies and      application solutions.

  • Able to apply best practices in the Material Handling Engineering field and have the ability to train others on these practices and standards.

  • Serves as application expert (SME) for Material Handling systems, and when defining options/alternative for proposals to meet new IT enabling opportunities.

  • Integrating Material Handling solutions in multi-channel fulfillment environments.

item.title: wanted: Senior Front End Engineer / bandmate at The Hackerati (NY, NY)
item.description:
What We Do


Technology Consultancy


The Hackerati is a high-end, boutique consulting firm delivering Engineering as a Service to diverse clients, from Fortune 250s to startups.


Why You Should Join Us


We're not afraid to be our wild selves.


We’re different. With mottos like be fearless and weird is good, our unique perspectives on life and technology make us great people to learn from and work/party with. We sponsor lunches and happy hours, band practice, electronics like Glass/Oculus/Myo, and we’ve presented at the UN—twice. We rock that familial vibe, and you should join us if you enjoy a blurred line between work and play.


What To Expect


Deliver the industry's most challenging projects.


Hackerati consultants are like The Wolf from Pulp Fiction: we solve problems. Hard ones. To do so, we deploy teams of Hackerati to work onsite with clients around NYC, and also build products in-house, both for ourselves and clients. A typical project lasts between 6 and 9 months—Thus there is constant diversity of work.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at Planet Labs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Role:


As a member of the either the Product of Mission Operations team, you will collaborate with Engineering to ensure we are continually optimizing and maximizing our ability to access large amounts of data.  Help to design and implement our next generation pipeline to support lightning fast processing and serving at web scale.  With new data coming from our satellites all the time,  our system must be rock solid to process and deliver insight to our customers as quickly as possible, with no hiccups. You will write production quality code, perform analysis and tuning, and be available to help maintain our 24x7 environment.

item.title: Infrastructure Architect at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for an infrastructure architect that has experience designing complex web-application architectures, is familiar with a wide variety of technologies, and knows how to pick the right technology for the job. Exaptive is more than just a data analytics platform. It's a complete ecosystem for data science - that means it is comprised of a bunch of different pieces that all have to work together. There is the web-based development environment, the Xap Store, and the Cognitive Network. Each component introduces its own set of infrastructure requirements. In addition, we have a consulting branch of the business which sometimes needs infrastructure design decisions in response to unique custom client requirements. 

This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation costs.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at CreativeLive, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Make real things. Stay curious. Have fun.



CreativeLive is looking for talented engineers to join our growing technical team in our San Francisco office. You will be forging a new frontier in online learning applications, leveraging and contributing to open source technology.


Our platform is built on Node and Angular, so you will ideally have solid experience coding in Javascript, and be excited by being empowered to contribute and learn at any level of the stack, from defining clean server APIs to creating beautiful front-end experiences.



Along with your fellow engineers, you'll be working with design and product to continuously improve the CreativeLive site and internal tools by



  • iterating on prototypes

  • architecting modules and applications

  • refactoring existing parts of the site

  • extending our content management system

  • implementing data visualization dashboards

  • interfacing with (and creating) web services 

  • improving the scalability and fault tolerance of our distributed systems

  • actively contributing to refining our Agile development processes

item.title: Information Systems Application Specialist Full Time at Stony Brook University (Stony Brook, NY)
item.description:
Information Systems Application Specialist – Full Time



Stony Brook University’s Faculty Student Association has an immediate need for an Information Systems Application Specialist. This position plays an integral role in various FSA software/hardware applications including analysis, design, integration, testing and automation. This position is a valuable member of the team that will provide technical guidance and professional administrative support to program managers, department heads, administrative officers, faculty, support staff and various other members of the University. The IS Application Specialist continuously seeks to enhance operations by exploring and executing other ways to improve data analysis, integration capabilities and reporting and demonstrates superior technical knowledge, resourcefulness and possesses outstanding communication skills while adhering to high standard of excellence.



Required: Bachelor’s Degree; in lieu of degree, 4 years of directly related f/t computer support experience or a combination of higher education and computer support experience totaling, 4 f/ years may be considered; 3 years of f/t experience in MS Windows server troubleshooting and software maintenance; knowledge of Microsoft Windows servers and networking; proficient with major relational database management systems (RDBMS) including Oracle, Microsoft SQL or Sybase; proficient with SQL, stored procedures, triggers and report writing using Crystal Reports or other similar report writing tools; experience in creating clear, concise and accurate training manuals and systems documentation; experience with programming languages such as .Net and JavaScript, of coding processes, web services and security measures; prior experience performing analysis work; ability to work independently and as a member of a team; excellent written and oral communication skills. Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field; experience in project management; experience with point-of-sales systems such as Micros, Business Intelligence platforms such as Pyramid Analytics or Tableau, document management systems, and campus card systems; experience working with MS SQL Server BIDS, ETL, SSAS, SSRS.



Excellent benefits package and salary commensurate with experience.



Send a resume and cover letter with salary requirement by 9/24/15 to Human Resources Manager, Faculty Student Association, 250 Stony Brook Union, Stony Brook, NY 11794-3209, or Fax to (631) 632-6573 or email responsehiringmanager@gmail.com



Equal Opportunity Employer, females, minorities, disabled, veterans.



PI91659940

item.title: ERP Applications Developer at Marist College (NY, NY)
item.description:
ERP Applications Developer




The Department of Information Technology invites applications for an ERP Applications Developer to work as a team member in support of Marist’s Ellucian Banner ERP software implementation and development of various software products in support of the College mission, as well as day to day operations. Responsibilities include programming, software development, report development, and data integrity.          




The Applications Developer will work with customers to streamline business processes and realize efficiencies and will act as a liaison to departments/offices to provide user support and excellent customer service. The individual in this role will develop processes, programs and ad hoc report and business intelligence dashboards, along with collaborating with a team to develop large scale enterprise; Write, test, document and deliver new software and processes; Maintain and enhance the ERP’s self-service applications and portal.        




A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Systems and /or six years of experience in the information technology field. Ideal candidate should have experience in using SQL, JAVA, PHP or other programming languages with demonstrated success in software development. UNIX skills and shell scripting experience preferred. Knowledge of Oracle database, PL/SQL programming a plus. Experience with Ellucian Banner ERP or in higher education strongly preferred. Ability to work in rapidly changing technological and team-oriented environment is essential. Excellent customer service and communication skills a must.




Marist College is an independent and comprehensive liberal arts institution located in New York's historic Hudson River Valley. Situated on 210 acres overlooking the Hudson River, it enrolls 4,787 traditional undergraduate, 799 full and part-time graduate and 543 continuing education students. Marist also has a branch campus in Florence, Italy, and extension sites throughout New York. Marist has been recognized for excellence by U.S. News & World Report, TIME Magazine, The Princeton Review's The Best 376 Colleges, and Barron's Best Buys in College Education and is noted for being a pioneer in the area of online degree programs.


To learn more or to apply, please visit http://jobs.marist.edu. Only online applications are accepted. The review of applications will begin immediately and will continue until the position is filled.



Marist College is strongly committed to the principle of diversity and is especially interested in receiving applications from members of ethnic and racial minority groups, women, persons with disabilities, veterans, and persons from other under-represented groups.




AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER




Apply Here

item.title: Senior Back End Engineer - Node.js / NoSQL at Unscene (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
About Us:


Print-based Unscene City Guides* have been produced in 18 different cities with multiple local editions since 2003.


Here’s the deal…


We are in the early stages of building a modern web-based city guide with social media integration in one seamless platform. This new product will celebrate the diverse neighborhoods and shape the way locals and visitors discover, share, and explore their urban surroundings.


Agile, small and bleeding edge -- Our roles overlap frequently and we learn a lot from each other. Communication is key and we have a lot of exciting plans for the future.


We are looking for an engineer who is capable of working on different aspects of the server side of our game. The ideal candidate has extensive experience in NoSQL databases, server code, and a proven track record solving web and database engineering problems.


Enter, you.


You want to own and drive the product that you are working on like it's your own (because it is). As a leader of our engineering team, you will be responsible for developing well-thought-out back end logic and services for our new platform to communicate with at our startup office in Lincoln Park.


Along the way, you’ll:



  • Lead by example -- Support and develop other engineers by offering advice and guidance

  • Write code -- Implement and manage the interchange of data between the server and users

  • Contribute to the continual improvement of our development process

  • Develop NoSQL database structures

  • Partner with business leads to make key engineering and business decisions

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) at Featurespace (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Want to work for a cutting-edge technology company in Cambridge?


Featurespace - the world-leader in Adaptive Behavioural Analytics - is looking to hire a Software Engineer (Java).


At Featurespace you will be developing new features for the pioneering real-time machine learning platform which underpins our cutting-edge ARIC engine, integrating ARIC into customer deployments, and building new modules to plug in to our platform.


If you can build scalable distributed solutions which can process hundreds of millions of events per day, Featurespace wants to hear from you.


Your responsibilities would include:



  • Working within a small team to design large-scale, real-time distributed architectures

  • Delivering new features: from specification, through development, QA and into final deploy

  • Providing input into future technology development

  • Working with Data Science teams to ensure APIs are relevant and usable

  • Supporting your code throughout its lifetime

  • Building custom modules for client integration


Please note: we are unable to offer remote working or visa sponsorship. We require applicants to have the right to work in the EU.

item.title: iOS Software Developer at Gecko Health Innovations (CareTRx) (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
We are looking for an iOS Developer with a passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits, and who will work with our team of talented engineers to design and build the next generation of our mobile applications.


Responsibilities



  • Design and build advanced applications for the iOS platform.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

  • Test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.

  • Work on bug fixing and improving application performance.

  • Continuously discover, evaluate, document, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Rewards Network (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
This role will be part of a team that makes the Rewards Network production application stack as well as configuration manager a priority. In coordination with your team, you will be supporting Web Sites, back-end processes, integrations to partner systems as well as provide the business with on-demand ad-hoc data requests and analysis.



  • You will triage, communicate status, and drive resolution for issues with the iDine.com website, our partner websites, APIs, as well as the tools and backend systems that support our entire Dining Rewards Program

  • You will help automate both deployments and configuration management using tools like Chef and Team City

  • You will carry out root cause analysis of incidents and provide developers with the necessary analysis to fix production defects

  • Supporting the business and the Agile Development teams, you will assist with their functional understanding of the production system as it works

  • Working regularly with the Development Team, you will learn how to debug existing software and help offload developer support responsibilities

  • You will participate in an on-call rotation

item.title: Quality Software Tester at Panduit (Folsom, CA)
item.description:
Panduit’s software team in Folsom, CA, develops next-generation technologies that view data centers as a system to be optimized to save energy and run robustly. We're looking for a range of test engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including general software testing, test automation and scripting, wired and wireless device communication technologies and protocols, distributed system testing; the list goes on and is always growing.


As a quality software tester, you will be a member of a dynamic development team where you will apply your system testing skills on commercially released products critical to Panduit’s corporate vision.  You will have opportunities to switch focus between test planning and execution, test automation infrastructure, UI testing, service and device testing, and other areas of expertise on the team as you and our products grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, self-motivating, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Backend Web Developer) at U.S. House of Representatives (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Vacancy Announcement Number: CLK-007-15


Closing Date: August 14, 2015


Proposed Starting Date: Immediate


The Office of the Clerk for U.S. House of Representatives is seeking a dynamic and innovative Senior Software Engineer (Backend Web Developer) to join a development team that is dedicated to building and enhancing systems critical to legislative operations, used by Members of Congress, Committees, other internal agencies and the public. This position will focus on designing and developing intuitive and reliable services, as well as assist with system planning, analysis and data modeling efforts.


Works in a small work station in an office environment without an expectation of privacy where noise levels are usually moderate. As an experienced Senior Software Engineer, the applicant must have the temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant and professional manner. The applicant must also be able to exercise discretion and independent judgment in fulfillment of responsibilities.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Crytek GmbH (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
Crytek is looking for an experience Senior Software Engineer to support our Web / Publishing team.


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for working on the design, development and ongoing support for game, application and tools technologies used by Cytek’s games-as-a-service (GaaS).


The successful candidate will be an experienced engineer in developing game technologies and have an interest in distributed systems, multiplayer games, databases, tools development and game client technologies.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop, support and iterate on the integration of company products.

  • Creating a reliable and high performance online service which stands for quality.

  • Work directly with Crytek studios to resolve technical issues.

  • Participate in the scoping and sizing of tasks.

  • Work towards the goal of shared common technologies where applicable.

  • Ensure appropriate, accurate and up-to-date technical documentation.

  • Debug, reproduce and triage bugs to create solutions.

  • Take ownership for building and maintaining platform tools.

  • Contribute to making self-publishing a success.

item.title: (Senior) Software Developer (w/m) at etracker GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Lust auf die Entwicklung innovativer Software im Data Science-Umfeld?

Dann freuen wir uns, dich als

(Senior) Software Developer (w/m) mit Leidenschaft


in unserem Team zu begrüßen!

Du hast maßgeblichen Anteil an der Weiterentwicklung unserer komplexen und im Markt ausgezeichnet positionierten Software und entwickelst diese in einer Open Source Web-Architektur weiter. Die eigenverantwortliche Implementierung von vielschichtigen Erweiterungen in einer High Traffic Software-Architektur, die im Wesentlichen auf NoSQL- und In-Memory Datenbanken aufsetzt, steht dabei im Fokus deiner Aufgabe.

Bei uns findest du



  • agile Entwicklungsmethoden in Verbindung mit hoch automatisierten Release-Prozessen

  • gelebtes Software Craftsmanship

  • neueste Technologien und visionäre Lösungen

  • Continuous Delivery-Prozesse und Light Weight Container

  • Testautomatisierung vom Unit- bis zum Integrationstest

  • Entwicklung nahe am Betrieb

  • ein hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und Selbstorganisation innerhalb der Teams

  • Freiraum, um eigene Ideen voranzutreiben und umzusetzen

  • die Mitarbeit in einem hoch professionellen Team, das Spaß an seiner Arbeit hat

  • Raum für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung

  • eine attraktive Bürolage im Herzen Hamburgs mit Blick auf Rathaus und Michel



Wir wünschen uns



  • ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit Informatikschwerpunkt oder eine entsprechende Ausbildung mit Abschluss und Berufserfahrung

  • sehr gute Praxis in Java oder einer anderen OO-Programmiersprache und im OO-Design

  • idealerweise sichere Beherrschung moderner Internettechnologien oder aber eine hohe Web-Affinität

  • vorzugsweise UNIX Know-how

  • eine systematisch-analytische sowie nachhaltige Arbeitsweise

  • eine hohe Bereitschaft, neue Methoden und Technologien kennen- und beherrschen zu lernen



Lust auf etracker?

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung ausschließlich per E-Mail unter Angabe deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie deines möglichen Eintrittstermins an jobs@etracker.com.

Lust auf etracker aber noch Fragen?


Dann kann Elke Hollensteiner bestimmt weiter helfen: 040 55 56 59 52.

item.title: QA Engineer at Spoon.net (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Spoon makes groundbreaking virtualization software that allows businesses, developers, and consumers to stream applications over the web, distribute server workloads and create automated test environments. Imagine simply installing a small plugin and being able to instantly run Firefox, Skype, Chrome, Spotify, or any other application without downloading it.


Founded in 2006, Spoon.net is a profitable, rapidly growing company with a multi-million dollar revenue base. We are seeking quality assurance engineers to join our virtual machine engine, server infrastructure, developer products, and web development teams.


QA engineers design and execute test plans, develop automated test and monitoring systems, assist analysis of customer technical issues, and work closely with product designers and developers to maximize product quality, performance, and reliability.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Create, execute, and maintain comprehensive test plans. Product areas include: virtualization engine, data storage and analysis, desktop client, web site (client and server), server infrastructure, and development tools

  • Design and create automated test suites to verify the performance and functionality of software products and services

  • Build and test virtualized applications and analyze virtual machine errors

  • Quickly learn new languages and technologies appropriate to a range of problem domains

  • Work closely with developers to maximize product quality and maintain accurate defect tracking records

  • Work effectively with development team members, product management, contract staff, and customer engineers to solve extremely challenging technical and design problems

item.title: Software Engineer at Premier, Inc. (Salt Lake City, UT)
item.description:
We are looking to bring on a Software Engineer to work in a highly talented Java software development team creating greenfield software products most of which are developed in a cutting edge open source product development environment. These products are sold in Software as a Service (SaaS) model to hospitals and other healthcare sites to assist in improving clinical outcomes, reducing waste and preparing for new methods of delivering care as required by health reform. 


The Software Engineer will work on our TheraDoc Safety team and can sit in our Salt Lake City, UT office or our Headquarters in Charlotte, NC.


Key Accountabilities:



  • Writes Java code and assists in development of new products and enhances and maintains existing products

  • Commitment to proof of concept of new OpenSource technologies

  • Analyzes and addresses requirements in product design

  • Estimates work effort

  • Creates and executes unit test cases (both automated and manual)

  • Provides support to resolve customer issues, perform debugging, and create patches

  • Constant collaboration with the software release team

item.title: Software Engineer -- Personalization at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for dynamic, passionate and effective Software Engineers to join our team. Our product is the wildly successful travel website www.tripadvisor.com. Our website and mobile apps provide our users with a rich user experience to research, collaborate, and contribute. We have big data with over 150 million reviews, opinions, photos, and videos reaching over 260 million unique visitors each month.


We are seeking developers for our Personalization team, which is responsible for understanding, analyzing and delivering knowledge based on the activities of the millions of users of our site.


Can you operate in a highly-iterative agile development environment, delivering significant new functionality every week?Can you interact with a wide variety of peers across the organization to get to a single result? Are you, above all else, passionate about what you do and who you do it for?

item.title: Software Developer - Planning and Scheduling Systems at Tracsis plc (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
A talented software developer is sought to join our fast growing, successful software company which specialises in resource planning and scheduling software applications for the public transport industry.


The role will see the successful candidate interpret business requirements to develop and deliver high quality, customer focused applications and technical solutions. Working as part of an agile team, the role includes all aspects of the software lifecycle, from assessing business requirements and design through to testing, deployment and maintenance. We strongly encourage proactive learning, and personal development. We emphasise good technical practices and value long-term quality and continuous improvement.


Both recent graduates and experienced developers will be considered for this role. Candidates must hold a 2.1 or higher degree in Computing, Science, Engineering or Mathematics or a related discipline.

item.title: Internship Technology (m/f) at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your tasks will be:



  • In the Product Management team you will support the development of our IT systems from both a business and an IT perspective

  • In the Quality Assurance team you will manually test new feature implementations and work out ideas to improve the software testing process

  • In the Operations team you will coordinate specific international IT projects and provide technical support in resolving IT problems

  • In the Office Tech team you will provide 1st and 2nd Level Support in our Help Desk and make sure that our IT processes run smooth enough to make our daily work more efficient

item.title: Java Frontend Developer (m/f) at Visual Meta GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for Java Frontend developers (m/f) on a full-time basis to help us invent, extend and scale our frontend services for leading shopping comparison platforms worldwide like LadenZeile and ShopAlike.


We, the IT team, believe in lean & agile software engineering and create websites for desktop, phone & tablet devices, native apps & inhouse applications for Visual Meta.


We code stuff that matters and in three different areas - Frontend, Mobile & Backend.


On the Frontend and Mobile side we deal a lot with modern web technologies such as Java, CSS, SASS, Javascript & jQuery.The Backend technology stack consists mainly of MySQL, Spring, Tomcat, GWT, HBase, Hadoop and ElasticSearch.


Your responsibilities:



  • Implementing new frontend features in cooperation with our Product Management and Graphic team

  • Setting up A/B-Tests to assure effectiveness and user acceptance of new/already existing functionality

  • Monitoring and improving the page load time on desktop, mobile and tablet pages

  • Good knowledge and awareness on-page search engine optimization


What we offer:



  • A committed, successful and international team

  • Large impact due to small, excellent development teams and professional data center environments

  • Leading-edge technology to solve challenging problems and to build great software

  • Continuous training possibilities and room for further personal development

  • Flexible working hours and a great office in the heart of Berlin

  • Healthy snacks (fruits, cereals), water and hot drinks

  • Team events, movie nights, table football, ping-pong, company bikes, etc.


If you are interested in an exciting position within a friendly team, please submit your application in English to the attention of Marcel Pierry including cover letter, CV, your earliest starting date, salary expectations as well as relevant references.


We are looking forward to receiving your application!

item.title: Junior Test Automation QA Engineer with Java at aspect (Galway, Ireland)
item.description:
The Associate Engineer, QA is a team member for the development of tests for a specific product component. In this position, the Associate Engineer, QA works with more Principal and Higher level QA Engineers for direction and task assignments. Reviews test cases and plans with other QA members. May execute existing automated test scripts.



PRIMARY ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Tests software products through the use of systematic procedures to develop, apply, and maintain quality standards for company products.

  • Modifies, and executes software test plans. 

  • Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software.

  • Analyzes test results to ensure existing functionality and recommends corrective action.

  • Consults with development engineers in resolution of problems.  

  • Responsible for participating in the evolution and execution of procedures for ensuring the quality of new features and releases of software.

  • Isolates, reproduces and tracks bugs and verifies fixes.

  • Executes test plans for manual and/or automated tests.

item.title: Software Engineer - Cleantech Startup at EnergySavvy (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
EnergySavvy is looking to grow our flagship product team, Optix Engage. As one of Washington’s Best Workplaces two years in a row, we know that politics and bureaucracy never make great products. We focus on results and creating high-quality, user-centric software. Ideas and innovation thrive in our open, meritocratic culture.


Software engineering is the heart of our company. We rely on our developers to collaborate and shape the product direction. This means a leaner specification process and an excellent end product that's been built with the type of feedback you can only get by trying out aspects of each feature as they're developed. You’ll iterate quickly with an emphasis on clean and reusable code.


We’re building a new product that’s transforming the way businesses save money on energy. If you’re excited about the opportunity of working on a new product, making decisions around architecture and design, this would be a great fit for you. We don't care if you've never tried Python, Django or React. EnergySavvy embraces smart software engineers who are eager to learn, and if you've created great projects in Rails or other MVC frameworks, you'll pick it up fast.

item.title: Senior Full-Stack Ruby on Rails Developer at Aureso (Singapore) (allows remote)
item.description:
Keeping sight of the big picture while developing well-architected enterprise SaaS solutions excites you? You have strong experiences in working with Ruby and building cloud services/software solutions? Ideally (not obligatory) you also have acquired deep developer knowledge (min. 2 years experience) in at least one of the following fields: Digital Marketing, CRM, Capacity Planning, Business Intelligence or Big Data management? Then you are the one we are looking for to strengthen our engineering team!


This is an exciting opportunity (temporary/project-based or full-time) for mid-/senior-level RoR developers who are interested in defining and revising the architecture direction, building key elements of it and providing thought leadership. You will design, develop and ship innovative new user experiences for the automotive retail industry (and beyond) and assist in monitoring the production service to ensure reliability and performance.


You'll be on a team with a lot of freedom, and as a result, own a lot of responsibility. Take features from conception to completion and become a core member of the development team at every level of the platforms stack!

item.title: C++ Experienced Software Developer at think-cell Software GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.


At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.


We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.


think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.


We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.

item.title: Data Engineer at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description: Are you obsessed with data, tools and metrics? Have you used and can you build tools to perform data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL)? Are you interested in tools that gather, store, and analyze User Metrics and Product usage? Do you love Python? We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to contribute ideas, innovation, solutions and code to our product.

item.title: Hadoop Developer, Senior at Booz Allen Hamilton (Chantilly, VA)
item.description: Ingest data from various structured and unstructured data sources into Hadoop and other distributed Big Data systems. Support the sustainment and delivery of an automated ETL pipeline, using a suite of COTS, GOTS, Java, Perl, and other tools. Validate data that is extracted from structured and unstructured data inputs, databases, and other repositories, using scripts and other automated capabilities, logs, and queries. Enrich and otherwise transform the extracted data as required. Produce monitoring and reporting of data flow through the ETL process and perform data extractions, data purges, or data fixes in accordance with current internal procedures and policies. Complete problem tickets containing bug fixes, design modifications, and changes based on customer requirements. Track development and operational support via user stories and decomposed technical tasks in a provided issue tracking software, including GIT, Maven, or JIRA.

item.title: Senior Data/Database Software Engineer at TripAdvisor (Boston, MA)
item.description:
The “TripAdvisor for Business” (T4B) team is responsible for areas of the business where we allow travel-related business like: hotels, resorts, travel agencies, vacation rentals, and restaurants to connect with their customers and travelers around the world. We help these businesses promote themselves by generating unique and new opportunities to build their brand and grow their businesses.


T4B’s Partnerships team is responsible for projects supporting display and integration of TripAdvisor content on third party websites around the world as well as integrating third party presence on TripAdvisor. This team designs and maintains the major portals into the TripAdvisor ecosystem for our business customers.


Now that you’ve got an idea about what the T4B team does, here’s some detail about the role!


This is a fast-moving and growing team and looking for someone who is just as comfortable whipping up a web page as developing the platform that will deliver that dynamic page to millions of visitors per hour (yes, millions per hour!).


So, until Chuck Norris applies for this job…


We’re looking for an experienced full-stack engineer with in-depth and hands-on knowledge of PostgreSQL, Hive/Hadoop and Microsoft SQL Server which is used to deliver our content. In this role you will design API’s, build global e-commerce systems, and create analytic platforms for customers and everything else facing our business clients.

item.title: Senior Ruby / Python / Java Developers - Awarded Best Company to Work for 2015 ! at Simply Business (London, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
If you’re smart, passionate about technology and enjoy solving complex technical challenges then you should apply to join our best-in-class tech team. We believe that people are our most important asset and one worth protecting. As such, we’re known for creating an enviable working culture to keep our employees smiling on a day to day basis. 


We offer things such as flexible hours, remote working, fortnightly hackathons and freedom to work on projects of individual interest to name just a few. In fact, our impressive working culture has recently earned us 1st place in the Sunday Times 100 Best Companies to Work for 2015. 


We have two different positions.


1. Senior or Lead Developers who would like to lead a team / projects (fulltime in London) - We envisage the split here being about 70% hands-on coding and 30% leading the team, liaising with product owners on prioritization work, attending iteration planning meetings with stakeholders, delegating tasks to dev team, and making sure we are following Lean / Agile processes correctly.


2. Senior Developers who want to be 100% hands-on coders with no lead responsibilities (this can be fulltime in London OR remote) - This role will be 100% hands on working with our other Devs to code beautiful products for our customers! 


Please be aware the salary will vary dependent on experience and whether you are working remotely or onsite in London)



Some of our Current Projects: 

Seedy - Our custom built CMS. A hybrid, markdown based, sinatra driven CMS but with a TDD undercurrent. Content changes are no different to backend refactoring. Templates are written in a custom DSL that enforces our style guide while still supporting iterative changes and automatic deployment. Across the company people (including business teams) are now being tagged in pull requests and even writing code!

Aerie - We’re overhauling our data and analytics architecture. Using the latest approaches in event streaming, we are building a brand new data pipeline based on Kinesis and Redshift that will support the analysis of both structured and semi-structured data in near real-time. This will provide rapid and intuitive customer insight to our decision makers, while also providing exciting machine learning capabilities back to our core product offering.

AAA - We are enhancing our new world platform. Our current focus is on security with a view to building out ‘infrastructure as code’ using tools such as AWS CloudFormation, AWS OpsWorks, Chef/Puppet and many others. Essentially, we believe a well architected system allows us to avoid unnecessary complexity and can enable individuals to generate great output.

Our Tech Stack



  • Ruby

  • Rails                                                                                                                            

  • Scala  

  • MongoDB

  • RabbitMQ

  • Puppet/Boxen

  • AWS                                                                                                                        

  • Hadoop / RedShift / Looker /Tableau

  • Cucumber / RSpec / Jasmine                              

  • SASS / HAML / HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / CoffeeScript / jQuery



This list changes all the time, as being on the lookout for new technology trials and opportunities is part of our code. We don’t believe in limiting ourselves, or the company. If there are other tools that could get the job done better, we’re committed to exploring them.

Things we believe in:



  • TDD / BDD

  • Continuous Delivery

  • Pair Programming

  • Build – Measure - Learn

  • Active participation to open source

  • Our business people writing code (we've not seen this anywhere else!)                                

  • Cross functional teams (Dev / QA/ Data / UX / Product owners all sitting together)            

  • Release early and learn quickly - we release our software to production around 15 times a day on average!        

  • Continuous learning - we look to pay for courses and conferences and actively encourage our Devs to get out and about in the community. We have even sent some of our Devs to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for conferences recently.                                                              

  • Have fun! We do ruby coding challenges during lunchtimes over pizza, we have desk beers on a friday, we have several social events throughout the year, we do fortnightly hackathons, we have afterwork clubs like: UX, Data science and Robotics club, we have flexible working hours, weekly 'show n tell' sessions, and lot's more!

item.title: PHP Developer/Drupal 7 Developer at Society for Science & the Public (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description:
Society for Science & the Public (SSP) is looking for an energetic and innovative full-time Drupal Developer who is well experienced with selection and use of a wide range of Drupal modules, able to extend existing modules or write new modules from scratch, able to theme using best-practice techniques, and is experienced with tools in LAMP environments.


You will be working with new and emerging technologies for online engagement and support integration with the Drupal CMS. The ideal candidate will have the ability to self-manage and work quickly, effectively, and efficiently in a team environment with a close attention to detail. The ideal candidate will have 3+ years full-time Drupal development experience, including module selection, module development and theming using Drupal 7.


Primary Responsibilities


•Construct conceptual and technical designs that include the use of Object-Oriented (OO) techniques
•Write PHP code based on requirements defined
•Develop Object-Oriented (OO) code and/or provide maintenance and enhancements to existing code based upon a solid understanding of OO design
•Work with business users to gather requirements, write functional and technical specifications
•Conduct multiple levels of testing including unit, system, integration and performance
•Estimate and plan iterative/agile releases
•Configure Drupal and create custom modules to meet requirements
•Design, develop, and test an overall solution that includes a content management system (CMS), including capabilities such as social collaboration, analytics, CMS content entry, CMS content migration, explicit/implicit personalization, developing content types or content objects, site architecture, and page templates
•Estimate and plan releases for a CMS implementation
•Anticipate issues and risks at the module level and escalate appropriately


To learn more about Society for Science & the Public, please visit www.societyforscience.org


This is a full-time position.


SSP is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer


SSP is committed to equal employment opportunity. In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, SSP does not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis, including but not limited to: veteran status, race, color, religion, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, national origin, disability, personal appearance, family responsibilities, matriculation, political affiliation, age and/or any other categories protected by the laws of the United States or the District of Columbia.

item.title: System Administrator III at Institute for Defense Analyses (Alexandria, VA)
item.description:
Overview


With minimal supervision, this position designs, administers, maintains and provides technical support for IDA’s network and server systems and services. Responsibilities include the coverage and scheduling of Help Desk tickets and Change Requests, taking lead roles on projects for corporate-wide IT initiatives, mentoring members of Enterprise IT Operations on systems integration and operations, ensuring systems compatibility and standards of configuration are maintained on all new and existing systems, promoting IT best practices, and general server maintenance. Due to the nature of this position, and the requirement for extended coverage, this position may be required to work hours outside of a regular schedule.


Responsibilities


1.Takes the primary role as project leader and designer of new IT technology initiatives. Provides formal project management documentation and partners with junior administrators and systems analysts to ensure the successful transition and operation of these new technologies as the junior administrators and systems analysts assume a maintenance role following the implementation. Designs effective processes for the roll-out and continued services of all IT initiatives to include support functions.
2.Develops testing and integration plans for new systems and software in order to ensure compatibility with IDA’s current network IT infrastructure. Builds new physical and virtual systems to design specifications and follows proper disposal procedures for retired systems. Ensures all systems meet or exceed the intended business and security requirements and comply with IDA’s minimum configuration standard and configuration management guidelines. Ensures all systems are properly configured to communicate with the corporate asset management system.
3.Designs, builds and delivers reliable disaster recovery and backup capabilities with local and offsite restoration capabilities.
4.Mentors junior staff and ensures all project and daily task schedules are maintained.
5.Oversees and coordinates the work assignments of junior system administrators.
6.Maintains technical documentation, to include the development and publication of standard operating procedures for systems and processes under their control.
7.Coordinates resources necessary to help resolve network problems or issues that involve other EITO or IT directorate groups.
8.Administers and maintains the systems and services, internal and external, physical and virtual, on IDA’s classified and unclassified networks, to include standalone systems and services, to ensure optimum performance and availability.
9.Conducts regular system maintenance to include monitoring, tuning, capacity planning, and adjusting configurations as necessary to resolve problems, minimize downtime, and to enhance capabilities. Systems can be identified as, but are not limited to, servers, workstations, networks, appliances, remote access systems, NOCs, and SOC systems.
10.Provides system support to minimize downtime, this may include error detection, systems analysis, and timely intervention to prevent or correct system problems.
11.Assists Information Security Analysts collect system security audits and perform Computer Emergency Response Team actions.
12.Ensures the success of patch management, software deployment, and network operations for the systems and services within their area of responsibility.
13.Provides technical support and responds to all assigned Help Desk tickets and Change Requests.Works with fellow senior analysts when necessary to quickly resolve critical system or service outages.
14.Maintains technical proficiency as new IT technologies are implemented at IDA. Keeps abreast of new and developing IT technologies and makes recommendations, as appropriate, to improve or correct IDA’s services and system performance.
15.Responds to critical after hours support issues.
16.Communicates all computer network, system and service problems and outages immediately to the Server Operations Supervisor and/or EITO Manager.
17.Performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


1.Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience in related field.
2.Seven years minimum experience in system administration and trouble-shooting networked systems. Requires a working knowledge of Ethernet, TCP/IP, UDP, DNS, media converters, network cabling, e-mail and web services, and remote access methodologies.
3.Seven or more years experience with Windows operating systems; experience with Mac, UNIX, Linux and network system administration desired.
4.Experience with data backup systems, asset management tools, SANs, VoIP, and virtual machines desired.
5.Must be self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision.
6.Ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal form and with all levels of employees; possess good interpersonal skills.
7.Project management experience a plus
8.Must be willing to work hours outside of a regular schedule.
9.Ability to obtain and maintain appropriate security clearances.


IDA is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that is free from discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, marital status, genetic characteristic or any other legally protected condition or characteristic.

item.title: Software Development Manager at Amazon (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
Quidsi Inc., is a subsidiary of Amazon and entrepreneurial parent company to Diapers.com, Soap.com, BeautyBar.com, Wag.com, Yoyo.com, Look.com, Afterschool.com, Casa.com and Vinemarket.com. We are a mom-centric retail technology company. We deliver delightful experiences, products, and expertise by offering a curated selection of products, lightning-fast delivery, incredible customer service, and an easy-to-navigate shopping experience.



Quidsi’s sites are host to millions of daily visitors and our warehouses are run by hundreds of autonomous Kiva robots. Our entire operation from our websites/apps, to our fulfillment centers and customer care center is focused on creating an enjoyable end-to-end customer experience. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people who are energized by what if (the meaning of Quidsi in Latin). If you'd like to help us build the place where people can find and buy anything online, come and innovate with us!



We are seeking a technical lead to manage various projects related to Quidsi's 9 retail ecommerce sites and customer experience. You'll have technical ownership of a functional area and manage a small team of talented engineers. This includes a curated site experience as our products and sites become increasingly diverse, expedited shipping and a team who is empowered. Projects will leverage Amazon’s technological capabilities and platform to make Quidsi’s solutions compelling, unique, and sustainable.



This is truly unique career opportunity for a technology leader who likes to invent as well as dive deep. You'll be the hands-on leader of a team, overseeing a broad range of platform integrations, improvements and customer-facing features. You'll partner with business leadership to initiate and prioritize key projects and work beyond our organization to tap into Operations capabilities. You'll operate at all levels of the technology stack, supporting a broad set of clients and collaborating with a wide range of service providers (internal and external).



Responsibilities:

·Guide web development teams and be responsible for overall systems development life cycle

· Translate of complex functional and technical requirements into detailed project plans and schedules; manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team by defining, implementing and maintaining a coherent, progressive development strategy for our product line

· Manage process and quality of service improvements, planning, project management of software deliverables within the team, and management of resources across teams

· Work closely with the architects to develop the best technical design and approach for product development

· Maintain current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology

· Possess architectural depth to steer teams toward highly performing systems

Communicate with effectively with your team and and with stakeholders at all levels of the company

· Apply analytical and program management skills to make decisions that result in significant business impact

· Create and execute appropriate quality plans, project plans, test strategies and processes for development activities in concert with business and project management effort

· Build an effective development organization by driving the recruiting and hiring of senior level engineers, developing and managing the group, and conducting performance reviews of team members

· Delivery of quality applications on-time and on-budget

· BS in Computer Science or related discipline
