· Minimum 5-8 years of software development experience in Java or C++ and object oriented design

· Minimum 3-5 years leading, mentoring, and developing a team of technical talent



Proven results oriented person with a delivery focus and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment

· Demonstrated ability to make data-driven decisions and manage complex initiatives from conception to launch

· Experience building and operating highly available, highly scalable, high-volume systems

· Working experience with UNIX/Linux and service oriented architectures

· Experience leading remote development teams

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Ability to work well with people and be both highly motivated and motivating

· Strong analytical skills with excellent problem solving abilities

· Strong technical vision



Quidsi Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer-Affirmative Action Employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet

.tch1.qds.crp.

item.title: Lead / Sr. C# Full Stack Engineer (C# / MVC / SQL Server) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) has an immediate opportunity for highly skilled Lead Software Engineers to work on our flagship product Rave. Rave is used everyday by pharma companies, biotech and clinical research organizations the world over. Medidata's Rave is part of a platform that provides our customers with the most advanced tools for planning, executing and managing their clinical trials. Result? 7 of the top 10 grossing drugs in 2013 were developed on our Medidata platform. 


We are continually building and improving our SOA cloud-based clinical trial solutions to put innovative technology and insightful data into the hands of researchers allowing new treatments to reach markets safely, efficiently and effectively. Working at Medidata will allow you to impact society in a positive way.


The engineers who best fit at Medidata are those that make good decisions, communicate well, and are eager to make an impact. We are curious, flexible, passionate, honest and selfless. We enjoy freedom and responsibility and can get things done. We are not afraid to fail and have the confidence to remain calm in stressful situations. We can survive on our own but prefer working as part of the team of equally talented peers. We are self-improving and disciplined and enjoy learning and sharing what we've learned. We are missionaries, not mercenaries.


What's in it for you?
We offer our engineers a highly competitive compensation that includes base, bonus and a strong benefits package that includes medical and dental insurance, vision care, short- and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts FSA), commuter FSA, 401K, tuition reimbursement program, paid company holidays and unlimited paid time off.

We provide top of the line computers (PC or MacBook Pro), adjustable standing desks and the most comfortable work spaces. We have plenty of space for collaboration, game room and a private rooftop terrace.


We help our developers be more efficient by providing them with a license for Visual Studio Premium with MSDN, a ReSharper license, and a PluralSight subscription.


Every engineer gets an opportunity to work on a personal-interest project for two weeks every six months. We send people to conferences to learn, get exposed to new ideas and bring back the knowledge and the contacts that they acquired.

item.title: Technologist with C++ focus for high frequency trading firm at Xanadu Trading (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Xanadu Trading is a young knowledge and technology based proprietary trading start-up. We are active in one of the most intense industries in the world. We trade our own capital, for our own risk and benefit, and have no customers. Xanadu is focused on high frequency algorithmic black box futures trading as well grey box options market making on Eurex, LIFFE and CME. We have offices in both London and Barcelona.


Options market making software needs to be at the same time very fast and responsive as well as reliable and bug-free. This is what has made developing in this area one of the most challenging, difficult and interesting propositions around. Xanadu's young technology department not only aims to compete in this area, but to disrupt it - from (almost) scratch, and with less man power than most competitors. And in order to do so, we are looking for great technologists.


As one of the first technologists in our young startup you will work directly with Xanadu's founder and head trader and will have varied and often changing responsibilities. In general, you will be responsible for working on parts of our automated trading tools in C++. Depending on your preferences and business requirements you might also do some front end development in Java - or work on statistics, data analysis and data visualization in R. Whatever it is going to be, it will be at the very heart of what Xanadu does and crucial to its success.


In summary, we offer:
  - Highly intellectual and competitive atmosphere
  - No sales pitches (we don't have customers - we code for ourselves, to our specs, to solve our problems, on our timeline)
  - Ability to use advanced mathematical modelling skills
  - Ability to write robust and highly efficient code, where both make a tremendous difference
  - English speaking work environment
  - Free food
  - Social activities
  - Nice office space
  - Very competitive salaries (salaries are negotiable and depend on experience - for fresh graduates total remuneration starts at 36k€ excluding benefits)

item.title: Lead Security Engineer at Merck & Company Inc. (Branchburg, NJ)
item.description:
Merck is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and consumer health products, as well as animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company - one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.

Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of people like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.

As a key member of the Information Technology, Risk Management and Security organization, the Associate Director of Data and System Protection will develop security requirements and standards, select, test and deploy security products such as (but not limited) to web security solutions (web gateway, web application firewall), application security solutions (SharePoint, Exchange, NAS protection), endpoint security solutions (antivirus, desktop firewall, web content filtering, intrusion prevention), encryption solutions (full disk, file/folder), data leakage protection (DLP), SEIM and enterprise log management systems, specifically Splunk Enterprise.


These solutions support our current and future state capabilities for achieving desired levels of information protection, confidentiality, integrity and availability of services. The incumbent will ensure that the security solutions designed, engineered and deployed are in alignment with security architecture and strategy, and support Merck's policies and standards, best practices, as well as meeting performance, scalability and availability requirements. The incumbent will create a standard set of requirements, technical designs, recommended configurations and drawings necessary to design, implement and deploy our current and future state security capabilities. The incumbent will develop and execute various tests and procedures on a variety of security equipment to ensure that security systems are operating as designed. The incumbent will work with a variety of suppliers and partners specifically focusing on the technical and architectural details, perform research, monitor and report on security technology trends and requirements, such as emerging standards for new security technologies and opportunities. The role also requires active participation in security incident response and investigations when called upon, as well as requiring 3rd level operational support for production security solutions. The role requires active and ongoing collaboration with many groups and organizations both within ITRMS and external to ITRMS (Global Technology Operations, Research, Manufacturing, Sales, etc.). 



The candidate will be expected to perform leadership of junior staff members, and mentoring/guidance as needed, and possibly manage a team of contractors. The selected candidate must be able to think and act independently, and be able to work with other colleagues around the world. The candidate must be able to keep up-to-date with current and emerging security solutions, threats and trends and be able to develop and present recommendations for the adoption of this information into an overall security solution strategy and roadmap.

*Open to any location in the United States

item.title: Senior .NET Developer at Cie Digital Labs, LLC (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
Cie Digital Labs is looking for a Senior .NET Web Developer to play a pivotal role in the architecture and programming of interactive applications and backend systems to support web-based applications. This is a great position for the self-motivated, organized candidate with exceptional level of attention-to-detail.  We’re looking for people who are creative problem solvers and “out-of-the-box thinkers.”

You must be creative, focused, results-oriented, self-motivated, and a resourceful problem-solver.  Our ideal candidate is one that can thrive in a fast-moving, creative company.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work with other developers to develop and build systems on the .NET platform using cutting-edge techniques, tools, and utilities

  • Assist in the back-end architecture and modeling of data-driven applications

  • Research, test, and implement new technologies, frameworks, and utilities

  • Be a mentor to more junior developers working on your projects. Set development schedules, delegate tasks, and review code

  • Help enforce development standards and best practices for other developers

  • Work with non-developers to execute the full software development lifecycle on projects

  • Participate and provide feedback in brainstorming sessions and scoping meetings

item.title: Senior Systems Developer at Time Warner Cable (Herndon, VA)
item.description:
The Time Warner Cable Corporate Herndon office currently seeks a Senior Engineer for our Systems Engineering department. Below please find a brief description of the essential duties and responsibilities required to function successfully in this position.


Essential Job Functions:


Custom application development in Perl, Ruby, and some C/C++ from the ground up. Candidate must have experience working as part of a team to develop high quality software solutions. Ideal candidate would be capable of developing scalable, distributed, highly available software solutions without significant external guidance.


Operate as a member of a specialized development-oriented engineering team. Share responsibility for project development with other engineers. Act independently when developing small scope projects. Work as part of a small team when requirements dictate more complex solutions. Candidate must be comfortable sharing ideas, discussing solutions, and receiving feedback throughout the entire product development process.


Develop software to integrate COTS applications within the existing Time Warner Cable infrastructure. Support other teams within Systems Engineering when specific development oriented assistance is requested.


Analyze ISP and VoIP product requirements and engineer solutions to meet them. Determine most appropriate solution for addressing requirements be it in-house development or integration of COTS software. Solutions must meet both time and cost constraints and stand up to peer review. Majority of projects revolve around Wireless (3/4G), High Speed Data (ISP), and Digital Phone (VoIP) product offerings.


Contribute to project planning, architecture specification, and implementation planning for application development tasks. Determine accurate level of effort and timeframe for project completion.


Thoroughly document solutions including authoring of functional specifications, design documentation, installation, and operations guides. Provide guidance to QA to ensure sufficient testing occurs during the product test cycle. Support Operations when issues arise in production to provide troubleshooting assistance and solutions. Maintain documentation for software development projects and implementation/deployment planning.

item.title: Automation Quality Assurance Engineer at VMware Bulgaria (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and policy-driven automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.

With 2014 revenues of $6.04 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, 75,000 partners, and 18,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on architecting what's next in IT?

Responsibilities:

• Work in SDDC [Software-Defined Data Center] Solution Quality Engineering team to Design and qualify SDDC Solutions for various customers including the non-functional attributes like performance, security, interoperability, etc., in Cloud environment
• Support in design and validation of Federation Enterprise Hybrid Cloud and VVRD [VMware Validated Reference Design] document, as part of Agile groups
• Identify the potential integration/interOp challenges from reading PRD and functional spec. of involved products, talking with customers, field engineers and internal customer to understand the interoperability requirement for products in suite, towards SDDC Deployments. Write SDDC level integration/interOp test plans, test specifications, and certify integration/interOp requirements
• Ensure test environment reflects the operating environment of our customers Design and implement the customer test beds and End to End applications/various workloads simulated from a customer environment, documented in Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design and execution of automation scripts to support Automation of E2E workflows/use cases derived out of Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design Interoperability/compatibility Test Matrix and Requirements-based use cases, Test execution, reporting and tracking the overall progress, analyze risks and come up with the mitigation proposals
• Work with the required stake holders to escalate/resolve open issues
• Have an excellent Customer Focus related testing and develop Customer use cases in order to have our products work in customer like environments
• Deep understanding of customers through use cases, Alpha, Beta, IT use and the validation of those use cases
• Need to build very tight relationships with the field in collecting feedback and by sharing engineering expertise
• Co-ordinate with development and test teams for SDDC Solution testing across various VMware products and 3rd party products
• Support the BU vision of multiple SDDC Deployments
• Drive implementation of End to End Automation of customer workflows/use cases
• Act as a customer advocate, looking for innovative ways to improve current quality processes and procedures
• Mentor junior engineers

Requirements:

• BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Master is preferred
• Experience in testing in an enterprise or system level environment
• Positive mindset, excellent attitude, energetic, motivated, sharp learner, dedicated and hard working
• Experience and knowledge in automation frameworks is a must
• Strong experience in gathering test/use case requirement from customers, PMs and reading spec., familiar with risk based test design, test cases (automation/manual) implementation and execution, test resource/planning knowledge and experienced in Solution level, Integration and InterOp testing
• Passionate about quality
• Good understanding about the best practices, SDLC/SQLC processes, methodologies of QE, detail oriented and good follow through skill
• Manage activities to meet their delivery dates and publish the testing status report to different functional teams, management, project, engineering etc. clearly on regular basis
• Experience in testing Cloud solutions
• Possess the in-depth knowledge of Operating Systems (Windows/Linux/Unix) and one or more of the following areas: System administration, Networking and transport protocols, Storage (SAN) and file systems technology
• Strong analytical skill, critical thinking and debugging/trouble shooting skills with initial triaging of software/hardware failures
• Strong collaboration skills, good leadership and initiative to work with teams which might cross different business units, departments and partners to finish the end to end product integration/interOp testing independently
• Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
• VMware product experience is a plus

VMware offers:

• Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long term incentives
• Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular performance assessment, teams of world-wide IT professionals
• Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, sport activities, open communication
• Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, regular team buildings and celebrations

Before you join, VMware will require you to go through a pre-employment screening process.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.


No visa or work permit requirements for EU citizens or EU work permit holders

item.title: Market Data C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Market Data department develops high quality software that handles inbound and outbound data for various Bloomberg products. We manage massive volumes of data from major exchanges and contributors around the globe including the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), the London Stock Exchange (LSE) and the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSX). We deliver billions of data points a day to customers through our market-leading enterprise reference data product. Our data enables global market makers to make financial decisions and is held to the highest standards. Our developers are involved in all aspects of the software development life cycle including requirements gathering, project management, design, development, testing and release.

There are two main groups in Market Data (Feeds and Data License). More information on individual teams within these groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred team.

>> Feeds

The Feeds group builds low latency systems in a Linux environment. We gather data from financial sources across the globe to deliver quality market data sets. We strive to provide the highest quality of data while maintaining minimal latencies on high throughput real-time market data.

Exchanges

The Feeds Exchanges team develops feed handlers from North and South American exchanges. We provide critical data to our clients for high profile exchanges such as NYSE, NASDAQ, CME, BM&F/Bovespa and TSX. Our initiatives include improving the resiliency of our feed handlers through enhanced data recovery mechanisms while upgrading to our latest infrastructure to improve upon our data model.

Contributions

The Contributions team processes data from central banks, global banks and inter-dealer brokers for non-exchange traded OTC markets using industry standard protocols. We strive to make our system simple, efficient and fault resilient. We build scalable and massive infrastructure used by our business and operations teams to increase data accuracy, deployment and troubleshooting of real-time feeds, reducing time-to-market for our clients. Ongoing projects include the next generation of cloud infrastructure to increase fault tolerance, load distribution and on-demand resource management.

News

The News team provides reports on earnings, interest rates and major economic indicators like unemployment numbers, housing reports and consumer indices. Our systems connect the Bloomberg terminal with information from social media such as Twitter and Weibo. Our automated systems also cater to algorithmic trading.

Tactical

The Tactical team excels at investigating, debugging and fixing mission critical problems as they occur in real time. Our main goal is to provide a timely response to all client-facing issues. We build tools to better debug and enhance the development experience. Tactical developers work closely with feed handler developers to identify gaps in the product and enforce operational and functional standards, upholding quality in the market data product.

>> Data License

Data License is Bloomberg's market leading enterprise reference data product. Our customers are key financial players who use our products to power their trading applications, risk management and corporate action processing, which requires our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces for a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, credit default swap, currencies, equities and futures and options. We work closely with our business and sales teams to develop solutions to satisfy customer demands.

Core

The Financial Data Delivery Core team builds and maintains high performance systems that feed billions of data points per day to Bloomberg's customers through its market leading enterprise reference data product. Our system delivers information on nearly all types of financial instruments to key players in the industry who rely on its accuracy.

Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL)

The BVAL team builds a product that calculates pricing for over two million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. This evaluated pricing data is delivered with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as net asset valuation calculations. Our product calculates, validates and delivers millions of data points. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable and fault-tolerant architecture. We are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop to address scalability needs and new offerings that will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements.

Content

The Content Generation and Distribution team builds systems that deliver a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including equities, options, derivatives, indices, bonds, commodities and currencies. We work with hundreds of databases and a distributed system that utilizes multiple processes across dozens of machines to generate the needed data. Our data is delivered to clients via various mechanisms such as web services, MQ and SFTP.

Workflows/Analytics

The Workflows and Analytics team designs and implements flexible, usable, and performant systems for ensuring data quality and consistency across our feeds and workflows. Developers in our team use a variety of technologies, including C++, Python, Perl, Java, JavaScript, Comdb2 and Hadoop.

Metering

The Metering team is responsible for building high performance distributed systems for managing large volumes of client data. We work with multiple groups within Bloomberg and develop tools to transform and efficiently store the data for trend analysis, billing and business intelligence. We are leveraging Hadoop to meet the demands of the massive amount of data we collect and analyze, and the complexity of algorithms that operate on the data. Our technology stack for the next generation system will include Webservices, Apache Kafka and Hortonworks Hadoop distribution.

item.title: Data Platform Architect (Java) at OnePlus (Shenzhen Shi, China)
item.description:
• Design and develop data platform infrastructure

  • Design and develop systems for big data collection and analytics

  • Implement both online and offline solutions and multidimensional query support

  • Design and develop real-time data analytics and streaming cloud services

item.title: Global Head of Business Intelligence (m/f) - Munich, Germany at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Westwing is one of the world’s fastest growing eCommerce companies: Backed by well-known investors with over EUR 179 mn. in funding, we are the leading Home & Living eCommerce company in the 15 countries we serve. Every day, we inspire more than 19 mn. members with stylish furniture and accessories from well-known brands they love. In 2014, we surpassed EUR 183 mn. in annual sales and continue to grow rapidly.


Our international team is the secret to our success. Westwing balances style expertise and creativity with a deeply data-driven business and tech mindset. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious and looking for the challenge to transform an industry.


To pursue our ambitious growth strategy, we are looking for a Global Head of Business Intelligence (m/f). In this position, you and your team are collecting, transforming, and analyzing data to drive business decisions across the company.


Your responsibilities will be:



  • Enabling Westwing to become the globally leading Home & Living eCommerce player by delivering the key business insights and driving strategic decisions

  • Building, integrating, and harvesting ‘Big Data’ for our company, thus enabling data-driven decisions across all aspects of our business

  • Working with leading-edge technologies and methodologies to unlock the power of our data on topics like personalization, recommendation engines, and many more

  • Being part of our global executive team, working together with leaders and teams across countries and functions

  • Leading (and growing) a world-class team reporting directly to the CMO

item.title: Senior 3D Software Engineer at E4D Technologies (Richardson, TX)
item.description:
Are you resourceful, innovative, forward thinking, committed and have a passion for software development? If you are, please read on!


We have an excellent opportunity for a 3D Graphics Software Engineer to join our R&D team and contribute to developing our next generation 3D design software using innovative UI and intelligent algorithms to make the CAD/CAM process more intuitive.


E4D Technologies is a high-tech medical device company focused on 3D imaging, successful entrepreneurship, and commercialization of new technologies. The company has taken the dental profession to a higher level of productivity, patient comfort and convenience with its E4D CAD/CAM restorative systems and software solutions for dental offices, laboratories and teaching institutions.


We use the latest tools and standards to develop high-performance, cross-platform 3D design applications that keep us extremely competitive in our market. Our team is lean and mean, using scrum to develop high-quality code quickly and efficiently. E4D is an R&D-driven company, with an executive leadership team led by 3D coders.  Like technology itself, E4D Technologies is moving the future of digital dentistry forward with ongoing investment in imaging and CAD/CAM technology. With research and development led by the top electrical, mechanical, optical, firmware, and software engineers in the industry, E4D Technologies is committed to staying on the leading edge of precision, quality and digital applications


You will participate as high-level technical expert in design, coding, testing, and debugging.  Please visit our website at e4d.com.

item.title: Software Engineer -Voice Guidance,Text-to-Speech(TTS) at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
HERE Berlin is an innovative branch where an international team of 50+ nationalities create Location Based Services at the highest level.


Join our fast growing, highly motivated Navigation team as an experienced Software Engineer specializing in voice package development. The Navigation team offers a unique chance of developing voice guidance features for cutting edge turn-by-turn navigation products used on automotive, smartphones, mobile devices and web services.


You will be responsible for creating high quality voice directions for navigation systems used in over 40 different countries/languages.


 The responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
 


  • Design, development and maintenance of voice directions software for turn-by-turn navigation products

  • Development of tests and test automation tools for the voice directions software and related content.

  • Being accountable for the quality assessment of the software both functionally and non-functionally.

  • Ensure proper deployment of the software to test and public servers

  • Integration of delivered technologies in the voice software

  • Coordination of  activities with project and product management

  • Documentation of developed code, tools and test environments

  • Coordination of new feature implementation with other teams

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Autodata Solutions (London, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Autodata Solutions is looking for multiple Senior Java Developers for their London, Ontario office.


Position Overview:


As the Senior Developer, your primary role is to design, code, test, debug and analyze software programs and applications. You will be expected to drive and contribute to researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production life cycle in areas with broad scope. This position contributes heavily to the guidance and mentoring of other developers.  This role is being offered as a permanent full-time opportunity without the option of working remotely. 


Key Responsibilities:



  • Write software components and applications according to specifications and industry standards with thorough code reviews and mentor others in this effort

  • Occasionally acting as the project Technical Lead, you will work with Business Analysts, Architects & other Programmers in conceptualizing and developing new software programs & applications

  • Guide & assist in the preparation and documentation of program requirements 

  • Run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement and general debugging

  • Generate statistics and prepare reports for management and/or team members on the status of the project

  • Liaise with Network Administrators, Systems Analysts, Database Administrators and Software Engineers to assist in resolving problems with client software products or software systems


Apply for this role directly using the following link: Click Here!.  We look forward to hearing from you!  For more information about Autodata Solutions, we invite you to check out our website at www.autodata.net.


We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified.  Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer.  We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at RootMetrics (Bellevue, WA)
item.description: RootMetrics is seeking a bright, self-motivated DevOps Engineer to join our Engineering team. The DevOps Engineer will be a jack of all trades with experience in system administration, network operations, software development, build and release engineering, performance engineering an site operations. A small organization mentality is critical for success in this position: a passionate can-do attitude, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to collaborate while acting as a thought leader in your area of expertise will serve you well at RootMetrics. Sound good? Once hired, here’s what we’ll need you to do.

item.title: Software Engineer - UI/Front End at FireEye (Reston, VA)
item.description:
The Role:


As a UI/Front End Software Engineer, you will make data beautiful and easy to navigate so we can solve real world problems.  You will develop fully functional web applications that align with business objectives.  You will grow your skills, work with cutting edge technologies and introduce new tools and techniques to the team.  You’ll work in an environment that encourages creative thinking and limits red tape.  You’ll collaborate with fellow engineers, UX designers, product management and end users.  You’ll come up with ways to do things more quickly and more effectively while maintaining a laser focus on quality.  In a nutshell, you’ll create software that makes our team smarter, faster, and better at what we do – protect the world from evil.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and develop dynamic web applications in an agile development environment

  • Engage in architecture sessions, challenge existing solutions and inspire ideas for future enhancements

  • Evaluate and utilize cutting edge JavaScript frameworks

  • Rapidly prototype and refine applications based on user experience feedback

  • Promote strict code testing and validation to ensure high-quality coding standards

item.title: Frontend Engineer for Onefootball at Onefootball GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
While being the latest platform launched by Onefootball, our web app is now at the centre of our sharing infrastructure and we are working hard to make it an important source of information for football fans on both mobile and desktop. This is why we are looking for a Frontend Engineer to join our team.


Your Role


You’ll join our web team and work directly on the existing code base of the web application and the related administration tools. The product is fresh enough so that we don’t have a lot of cumbersome legacy code and we follow the industry’s best practices to keep the job pleasant. We're always open to suggestions and expect you to use your own experience in improving our processes. You should be fun to work with and like to learn and teach everyday. Also we value pragmatism and intellectual curiosity. Since you'd be working closely with other teams from different departments, your job is to make sure your voice is heard both inside and outside your field of expertise.


The position is located in our awesome football office in Berlin. We offer free drinks and food and great team events such as tech talks, football public viewings, sport events, lunch roulette and of course support with relocation and Visa application processes.


Who we’re looking for


You are passionate about programming and have already successfully developed products for a large and diversified user base. You ideally have more than 4 years of experience in coding for the web, a solid background in computer science concepts and a good understanding of the entire lifecycle from design, engineering to release and maintenance.


You master unit testing and respective frontend developer tools (we use bower + grunt + less but any similar variation is fine). You have a good comprehension of browser performances, UX across multiple screen sizes and you are attentive to details. Ideally, you have gained a significant experience with AngularJS 1.x and have experience in developing for other mobile platforms as well.


If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. And if you’re a football fan, all the better.

item.title: IOT Software Engineer Embedded Linux Development at Intel (Leixlip, Ireland)
item.description:
Creating and extending computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth--that's our vision, is it yours? We are changing the world at Intel. 


Step inside our world and you'll find one brilliant mind after another working together in a spirit of collaboration that is simply contagious. And through this shared dedication-this culture of innovation and exploration-we do more than deliver the latest technologies. We deliver the future. See for yourself. Look Inside. 


That's where you come in. We need innovators and proven communicators like you to push our thinking. We need your strong collaboration and organizational skills, as well as your ability to effectively work with and manage teams. You will help push us to the next level. Joining us means joining a dynamic team at a company that has established a reputation for innovation. 


As an IoT Software Engineer – Embedded Linux Development in Quark Design team you will play an integral role in designing and developing software for new Quark silicon devices, ensuring that we develop outstanding products. Your responsibilities will include but are not be limited to: 


- Conducting or participating in multidisciplinary research and collaborating with design, layout and/or hardware engineers in the design, development, and utilizing of productivity enhancement layout tools and design rule checkers, electronic data processing systems software.


- Determining computer user needs, advising hardware designers on machine characteristics that affect software systems such as storage capacity, processing speed, and input/output requirements, designing and developing compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. 


- Responding to customer/client requests or events as they occur. Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal education, judgment and formal software process.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Schrödinger (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our mission: Dramatically improve human health and quality of life by developing and applying advanced computational methods that transform the way compounds and materials are designed.


What we do:We develop a software platform for drug researchers, replacing labor-intensive procedures in favor of automation. Our platform gives access to an unparalleled combination of collaboration, data access, and computational modeling tools that speed up the drug discovery process. This technology allows scientists to run virtual experiments on massive compute grids and to analyze the resulting large dataset efficiently as a team.


Who we are: We are a community of passionate, friendly, and skilled team players. We are a diverse set of developers, entrepreneurs, and scientists who have made the decision to collaborate together on something with significant human impact. We take pride in our relationships with many satisfied clients, including numerous large pharmaceutical companies. Our investors are fellow technology visionaries, including Bill Gates.


The position: As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Schrödinger, you will design and develop scalable methods of building, deploying, and supporting our enterprise application services and systems across various machine infrastructures (primarily Amazon AWS). These are industry-transforming systems that our users (drug researchers) depend on daily to move their projects forward.


The position is one that draws on technical skills stemming from development operations, systems engineering, as well as systems administration. You will leverage these existing technical strengths to understand our existing infrastructure while being given the freedom to innovate major improvements to meet changing needs. This role is primarily an engineering one that does not require experience in the physical sciences (chemistry, biology, or physics).


Responsibilities:


Architect and implement the infrastructure for building, testing, deploying, tuning, and troubleshooting our engineering team’s production and development systems


Advise the development team on best practices throughout the design process of their applications, to ensure that they can be delivered to manageable and highly available production environments


Communicate frequently with stakeholders to prioritize infrastructure enhancements by DevOps team


Design and manage our monitoring/alerting systems


Organize and participate in the on-call schedule process for our operations team


Requirements3+ years of relevant work experience: DevOps/Infrastructure, Test Automation, Systems Administration, and/or Development


Experience working with modern infrastructure operations and automation tools:


server virtualization (e.g. Amazon AWS, Xen, Rackspace, VMWare)


cluster configuration (e.g. Chef, Puppet, Salt)


continuous integration and testing (e.g. Jenkins, Hudson, BuildBot)


Proficient knowledge of and passion for the UNIX operating system:process limits, devices


networking / http


system administration and bash


we primarily use Ubuntu/Debian, Centos/Red Hat


Experience solving security problems:


certificate management, network/firewall configuration, encryption


Experience working with Monitoring and Alerting Tools:e.g. Datadog, Nagios, Zenoss


Experience with a modern scripting language:


e.g. Python, Ruby


Experience with the deployment and maintenance of databases:e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB


Experience with source control


e.g. GIT, SVN


Proficient interpersonal skills (oral/verbal communication), complemented by an ability to collaborate in a team environment


Enthusiasm for solving interesting problems and a willingness to learn


Ability to ask smart questions, think outside the box, and be creative


Pluses:


Bachelors in CS/Engineering/related field


Experience deploying distributed web applications:


e.g. Apache, Nginx, NFS, LDAP


Experience working with containerization (e.g. Docker, Vagrant, LXC)


Advanced DBA skills


Experience with maintaining databases and database replicationScience minor or independent interest (chemistry, physics, biology, or related)


Check out the website for our platform here: https://www.schrodinger.com/livedesign/



We are prepared to offer a highly competitive compensation package for an exceptionally well-qualified candidate. Benefits include medical, dental, 401(k), flexible spending account, 3+ weeks vacation, and tuition reimbursement.

item.title: Backend Software Engineer at Planet Labs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Software touches every corner of our company, enabling us to continually improve every process by controlling the tools that run them. In addition to our internal tools that control the manufacturing, testing, operating and optimizing the satellites we also run a massive data processing pipeline that crunches terabytes of imagery (and will soon do that every single day). We run a cloud-first, API-driven architecture. Our goal is to enable everyone in the world to access our imagery, so huge web-scalability is a requirement. Our ‘full stack’ runs from the spacecraft to our web tools, and there are enough hard and interesting problems to keep many teams busy for a long time to come.


Our Backend Software engineers currently code primarily in C and Python. We run tens of thousands of jobs per day on an AWS infrastructure with PostgreSQL, Flask and ElasticSearch.  Our applications are built on a foundation of open source projects. We work to be active contributors of those projects and dedicated stewards of new open source image processing and infrastructure projects.

item.title: Lead Engineer - Ruby, JavaScript, AWS at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The Product Office - Internationalization team is hiring a Senior Engineer / Development Manager for our Tools development team.


The role is focuses on extending our world-class, cloud-based Translation Management System (TMS) to support the internationalization of all HERE products.


The tools development encompasses a range of technology and includes improving existing and implementing new internationalization management capabilities, in order to serve a wide range of customers, e.g. design, development, localization, freelance translators and testers.


We are looking for an experienced engineer with equally strong backend and frontend skills to join our team.

item.title: Software Engineer - Frontend Web Developer - Brussels, Belgium at Take Eat Easy (Zaventem, Belgium)
item.description:
Take Eat Easy is at the center of a very sophisticated logistics machine designed to dispatch couriers to restaurants in order to deliver food to customers. To make this all work, we develop a lot of frontend applications both public (customer website) and internal (live support, data input, customer support, operations management, etc.), in which real time and ergonomics are really important.

In order to keep building those web interfaces and help us make them state-of-the-art, we are looking for passionate web developers whose responsibilities will include:


  • Requirement analysis and solution design in strong relation with the designer/product manager

  • Fast & Robust developments of new functionalities (lean approach)

  • Testing & releasing your applications

  • Improving development processes

  • Proposing technological evolution to make our architecture even more scalable and modern


Benefits



  • The possibility to bring technological evolutions to our environment to bring real value to our business

  • Very competitive Salary Package

  • Take part in the european expansion adventure of Take Eat Easy!

  • Geek & Startup atmosphere

  • Free food every day (the awesome kind!)

  • Cool Apple gear

  • If you love food like us, then plenty of opportunities to talk about it, and a unique chance to help bring the best food to our customers

And if you need to know more about what it's like to work for a startup company, check this out: http://sebastien-arbogast.com/2015/07/02/top-7-rea...

item.title: J2EE Senior Developer at Prudential (Newark, NJ)
item.description:
Prudential is looking for multiple service integration Developers, who have passion for new technologies, understand responsive web development, and Service oriented architecture(SOA) and turn concepts to life. As a developer, you care about quality of code, understand how to integrate disjointed systems, love to learn new technologies, and are ready to adapt on changing design frameworks and design principles. Needless to say, you will have knowledge on how back-end systems work. Details are critical as you iterate on complex interactions and have pride in your work output. We are looking for someone who loves a good challenge and can work collaboratively

We are building a startup culture in a company that is touching 20 Million+ lives, yet thinks agile. A company where talent drives success and your work touches everyone from a 25 year old to folks over 90 years old living in retirement. We care about web accessibility. We care how we treat our customers. Our employees are passionate about what they do and make it happen.

Responsibilities:
* Collaborate with product management, marketing, designers, technology and architecture teams.
* Design and develop high quality application components to meet our Business needs - Pojo components, database components, services, web services, and Junit test modules.
* Work in an iterative/Agile environment and a good team player who can work with a strong Technical team.
* Manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
* Driven, self-motivated, able to work under pressure using sound judgment & professionalism
* Ability to review functional requirements and determine the type of integration work that is needed based on the requirements
* Analyze and tune application performance, with a focus on service/message throughput and latency.

item.title: Infrastructure Engineer at KCG (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
KCG is a leading market maker working in three continents, across four asset classes, on over 50 markets around the world. Our team is strong and growing, always going after new ways to create better and more efficient markets. Working at the intersection of financial markets and technology, our tight-knit, interdisciplinary teams create the innovations that are improving the markets of tomorrow. We put our newest talent side-by-side with some of the leading thinkers in the industry, creating a vibrant work experience that promotes mutual learning and respect.


We cultivate an environment that is challenging and rewarding for each and every employee. Over the years, we’ve come to attract a unique kind of person—confident but humble, competitive but collaborative, focused but flexible. It’s a combination of traits that tie back to the values that have shaped our success to date, and will be critical to our success in the future.


The KCG Market Making Business seeks a  talented engineer to work in our team to manage the infrastructure of the ETG group.


The Infrastructure team is responsible for providing daily support to the Trading Operations Team, including support for our Quantitative Research computing environment (GRID based computing).


This position will be managing for capacity planning of our server, network, and storage environments.  As well as providing support for our Market Data Recording System which is a key component for quant research. This position will be working closely with Quants/Traders to address any issues they may have with our production and research environments.


The engineer will  provide system administration for our multiple trading systems (>1500 servers) and will be responsible for design and implementation of new server hardware and networking technologies.   This includes performance testing and validation of new hardware and Operating Systems to ensure they meet our requirements. 


Role Requirements


·          4 - 6 years’ experience implementing and administering Linux Servers in an enterprise environment.  RH/CentOS experience preferred but not required. Experience working in a Linux environment.


.           Strong scripting skills a must (e.g. Shell, Python, Perl, etc.) 


·           Solid understanding of core networking concepts such as IP Routing and various IP related protocols (e.g. TCP, UDP, Multicast UDP).


·          Good understanding of storage solutions and storage related technologies


·           Understanding of how Financial Trading Systems work at a high level and knowledge of Exchange Protocols is ideal but not required.  General understanding of ULL/HFT concepts a bonus.


·           Knowledge of grid computing, and/or HDFS/HBASE a plus.


.           Bachelors, Masters or PHD in computer science or closely related field  


.           Team player, good communication


·          Self-motivated and able to take ownership of projects.

item.title: Python Software Developer to Help Build Our Betting Platform! at BetBright (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced Python Software Developer to join our ever-growing development team. As a Python Software Developer, you will be delivering quality user-friendly software for BetBright using your seriously awesome programming skills (for real).


As an experienced developer, you get the requirements of a start-up environment with its fast-paced, changing nature and are keen to continue adapt and develop your skill set- keeping up to date with existing and emerging technologies.


You will be:



  • Developing high quality, efficient code to meet business needs

  • Updating our betting system to work with new market types

  • Adding new pre-play or in-play sports to our sportsbook product
