item.title: Software Engineer at Thales Communications, Inc (Billerica, MA)
item.description:
Thales Visionix, Inc. in Billerica MA is seeking an Embedded Software Engineer.



Thales Visionix designs head-mounted augmented-reality displays used in fighter jets and other military and civilian applications.  We are seeking a multi-talented software engineer experienced in both low-level and high-level software development.  You will join a small group of experienced engineers working with cutting edge motion-tracking and display technologies.  We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, passionate about their work, and versatile enough to solve a wide variety of engineering problems.



The primary function of this position is to conceive, design, develop, evaluate and document embedded software for sensor-based subsystems. The incumbent will also provide engineering support on interdisciplinary teams involved with production transition and process control activities.


Job Requirements



  • Develop, plan and estimate program activities related to embedded firmware design for MEMS-based motion sensors. 

  • Establish electrical engineering design requirements for electrical components to ensure high standards of economy, safety and reliability.

  • Design and development of appropriate test methods to characterize system performance and reliability.

  • Recording, analyzing and interpreting test data, including the application of appropriate statistical techniques.

  • Prepare and present technical reports, recommendations and presentations related to development and design studies, product and process investigations. The audience may range from peers to executives, professionals at symposiums to Customers at design reviews.

  • Integrate product design efforts with QA, manufacturing, product assurance and logistic support functions to ensure product designs that are producible and maintainable.

  • Assist the logistic support function in the development of user training and operational manuals to ensure equipment fit, function and comfort.

  • Schedule flexibility to support critical deadlines may be required. 



EDUCATION AND/OR PROFESSIONAL LICENSE(s):



  • B.S. or M.S. in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science required



EXPERIENCE:


Required Experience



  • 5+ years in a firmware design role for embedded systems

  • Experience with embedded systems architecture and design.

  • Experience using modern software development methods, processes, and tools.

  • Design disciplines encompass microcontrollers (Microchip dsPIC preferred, ARM), DSPs, MEMS sensor technologies, analog to digital converters



Preferred Experience



  • Experience with a variety of interfaces including SPI, IIC, and serial UARTS

  • Experience with inertial measurement devices including accelerometers, gyros, and magnetometers

  • Statistical analysis, as well as strong general mathematical background.

  • Knowledge of commercial and military standards and specifications in EMI and environmental.



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES



  • C/C++, MatLab, source control tools.

  • Excellent debug skills including the ability to use oscilloscopes and logic analyzers.

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills are necessary.



Thales Defense & Security, Inc. participates in the United States Department of Homeland Security's E-Verify program.



Thales Defense & Security, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity /Minorities/ Females/ Vet/ Disabled affirmative action employer.



We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce.



Apply Here: http://www.Click2apply.net/rs5dybt9f4




PI91534133

item.title: Principal Engineer (Matching Engineering) at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
eHarmony is looking for a highly talented individual to join our Matching Engineering team! Every day, eHarmony matches millions of people based on deep compatibility, built on decades of psychological research and Machine Learning. Matching is the core of eHarmony, and you have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be right in the middle of it. 

Your challenge as a Principal Engineer on our team will be to implement and scale these matching systems, to support ever more complex modeling processes, across a rapidly growing community of users. 


In this position, you will be responsible for:



  • Getting to work with innovative new technologies (e.g. Hadoop/Map-Reduce, NoSQL stores like MongoDB and Voldemort, AWS based cloud computing, SOA via REST services)

  • Working on a matching system that creates trillions of potential pairings in our candidate pool (over 51 million registered users)

  • Designing core back-end Matching components

  • Coding day-to-day in Java, and other languages such as Scala, Ruby, Groovy, C++.

  • Analyzing and improve the efficiency, reliability and scalability of components across the Matching infrastructure

item.title: DevOps Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
DevOps Engineer


About the Job


Become a critical member of an elite technical team advancing the infrastructure of ROBLOX, the largest platform in the world for emerging and independent game developers. We aren’t just building a publisher tool, but rather a technology platform providing developers with the tools they need to create their own world class games, bringing User Generated Content to the gaming space. With our user base consistently growing, we remain the #1 ranked kids entertainment site in the U.S. by ComScore. Each month we have more than 5 million active users and over 80 million total hours of engagement with peak concurrent users approaching over 200K.


You, being a talented engineer with the ability to take a big problem and break it down into smaller pieces to find the best possible solution, will work closely and collaboratively with our 5-person Ops Team on our internal development tools and automation pipelines. You will build out and significantly automate several parts of our continuous integration and test automation systems, design and build tools used internally by the engineering team, and help implement best in class configuration management and provisioning systems. You are a jack of all trades who loves having an impact on your team and product by:



  • Maintaining a 99.9% SLA for a 24/7/365 production environment

  • Developing automation to automatically detect and recover production issues in all layers from hardware, configuration, networking, and vendor outages, and continuous software upgrades

  • Quickly resolving complex problems encountered during the installation and operation of our applications, to ensure negligible impact on players and internal operations

  • Prioritizing and multitasking daily responsibilities, while being flexible enough to respond to emergent high-priority issues

  • Designing, deploying and configuring extremely complex computing environments characteristic of large-scale gaming systems

  • Leading in the execution of disaster recovery procedures and system failover efforts

  • Collaborating with highly skilled and driven colleagues in a dynamic, agile environment

  • Managing systems and developing contingency plans

  • Participating in on-call rotations


Our infrastructure management system is highly automated, enabling engineers to interact with thousands of servers across multiple environments in parallel via the command line. Our application space includes database scalability, caching, message queuing, wide-table search, recommendations, user ratings, services for mobile devices, gaming cloud management, and virtualization. We live in both the cloud and traditional data center environments.


Perks & Benefits: 



  • Robust medical, dental and vision insurance

  • 401k

  • Flexible time-off

  • Wellness reimbursement

  • Free onsite parking & other commuter benefits

  • Free catered lunches & a fully stocked kitchen with unlimited snacks!

  • Chance to work with a top-notch team on cool and unique projects!

item.title: Windows Systems Administrator at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
The role of the Microsoft Systems Administrator is to help architect, monitor, and maintain V12 Group’s Microsoft (MS) and Unix server infrastructure Candidates need to be self-motivated, articulate, and intimately familiar with the Microsoft server operating systems, and be willing to provide some support to our current UNIX production environment.

Responsibilities



  • System administration, performance tuning, monitoring, maintaining fault tolerance, account management for Production SaaS environments

  • OS installation, support, performance tuning, monitoring, applying service packs, etc.

  • Active Directory/LDAP support and maintenance (e.g. integration with MS AD, utilizing AD for other IT/business functions)

  • End user support for system infrastructure (server and network)

  • Proactive monitoring of server systems (e.g. uptime, failover, antivirus, anti-spamming, etc.)

  • Maintain and support backups for servers

  • Participate in long-term strategies for IT

  • Writing of tools, scripts, etc., as necessary

  • Support miscellaneous systems as necessary

  • Make recommendations, and collaborate with software developers, system and network administrators, and other support staff

  • Monitor important technology innovations and work to incorporate technology that improves overall services delivered

  • Advise and recommend purchases of computers and computer related goods whenever appropriate

  • Provide technical support as needed on a wide range of issues concerning networking, hardware installation and support, and software installation and support

  • Strong experience with teamwork in Internet-related server operation groups; expert technical-level verbal and written communication skills in English

  • Ability to participate in process definition for change management and problem resolution to support large-scale 7x24 systems operations

  • Should have SaaS background sufficient to understand operations, security, and network planning

  • All other duties as assigned

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Sheridan College (Oakville, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Reporting to the Digital Marketing Production Manager, the Senior Web Developer leads and communicates the technical and functional development of Sheridan’s primary web properties including supported marketing systems, software and web applications. The Developer leverages their expertise and knowledge of web application architecture and development to achieve the strategic goals and objectives of Sheridan College through digital marketing initiatives.  The supported marketing systems, software and web applications are: Sheridancollege.ca (Sitecore CMS, WordPress), Emarketing (Emma EMS, Sitecore EXM, Subscription Centre), Print Experience Manager (PXM), Digital Marketing System (DMS, xDB) and the Continuing Education Online Store (E-Store/Active Commerce), in addition to numerous related smaller software, systems and applications. 


  Specific responsibilities include:
• Leading evaluation and development efforts of technical enhancements and modifications to the existing corporate websites and applications, which includes: reviewing requests to determine feasibility of implementation; defining site objectives by analyzing user requirements; envisioning features and functionality; developing recommendations by comparing advantages and disadvantages of custom development and purchased alternatives;  designing and developing user interfaces to internet applications by setting expectations and features priorities throughout development life cycle; determining design methodologies and tool sets; completing programming using languages and software products; designing and conducting tests; integrating applications by designing database architecture and server scripting; studying and establishing connectivity with network systems, search engines, and information servers;
• Assessing and analyzing requirements for new website features, functionality and application modules for design and implementation purposes which includes: meeting with end-users to determine needs and define scope of new projects; analyzing requirements and specifications, in the context of existing functionality and application modules, business processes and available technologies, to identify and document the impact and advise the user community of the implications;
• Providing senior technical support to maintain the existing corporate websites and applications which includes: troubleshooting complex web application issues; tracking and monitoring the resolution of reported issues; documenting solutions for resolved issues and following up with end users to ensure complete closure of reported issues;
• Providing high-level technical evaluation and analysis for web application enhancements and upgrades which includes: Reviewing existing customizations, enhancements and interfaces and determining how they are impacted by upgrades; reviewing and testing technical changes and documenting modifications;
• Maintaining, developing and sharing technical currency in a rapidly changing environment which includes:  researching new internet technologies and software products; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations;
• Performing other related duties as assigned;


Appointment Details:
Department: Marketing & Brand Strategy
Campus: Trafalgar (may be assigned activity at any campus)
Employee Group: Support Staff
Reference #: 15/S/68
Payband: J
Hourly Range: $35.52 - $41.18
Hours of Work: 40
Hours/Week: 800am - 5:00pm


Application Deadline: Open until filled

item.title: Software Engineers at Apex Learning (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Apex Learning is headquartered in Seattle and is looking for talented Software Engineers to join our creative, dynamic, and supportive Technology team based out of our Seattle office. Our Software Engineers collaborate with senior-level staff to develop, test, and deploy critical business applications using current and past .NET Framework versions and SQL server technologies.


We are a shop with mature Agile implementation and wide company support that strives to explore new technologies to solve our challenges. This is a great opportunity to have your contributions count at a company that is truly passionate about making a difference for students by contributing to their future.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Coordinate with the Client Support team to address platform defects and issues reported by customers.

  • Assist senior-level technical staff and Product Management to build, test, and deploy new features or enhancements to existing features.

  • Utilize both Agile and traditional software lifecycle methodologies.

  • Analyze performance of software interfaces and identify alternatives for optimizing the usage of computer resources.

  • Apply generally accepted programming standards and techniques to assure efficient program logic and data manipulation.

  • Participate in designing, coding, testing, debugging, configuring, and documenting and software.

  • Provide assistance and routine consultation to users in the development of operating systems and software.

  • Plan and execute software version upgrade releases and custom interfaces.

  • Collaborate with others to develop alternative system and software designs.

  • Other duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Bachelor’s Degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.

  • 2+ years of development experience with the Microsoft .NET platform, including C#, VB.NET, ADO.NET, and ASP.NET.

  • 2+ years of direct development experience in Microsoft SQL Server technologies, including SQL 2005 and more recent versions.

  • Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft SQL programming and best practices.

  • A great attitude and a team focused mind set.

  • Ability to pass a pre-employment background check.

  • Ability to pass a Social Security Administration E-Verify check for U.S. work authorization.


HOW TO APPLY


We’d love to hear from you! Please submit your resume via our careers portal, found at: https://jobs-apexlearning.icims.com/jobs

item.title: Web Application Developer at Dito, LLC (Huntsville, AL) (allows remote)
item.description:
As Web Application Developer at Dito, you should possess strong web application development skills, creativity, and an affinity for solving complex problems.  You will be working closely with clients and Ditomites (Dito team members) to create custom solutions that utilize some of the newest technologies available in Google’s ecosystem; Apps Script, App Engine, Google Apps REST API’s, Compute Engine, DataStore, Cloud SQL, Cloud Storage, Big Query, Google Maps Engine, Maps API for Business, Google Search Appliance and even Google Glass.  Many times, clients will have legacy apps that need to be rebuilt with the Cloud in mind.  That’s where you come in!  We need an individual who takes a specific interest in hacking and building upon Google Apps APIs and its various Cloud Platform products, and other 3rd-party systems to create robust and complete solutions for our customers.



Ideal candidate: You spent hours learning JavaScript and Python, you’re asking questions in online communities and getting answers, you’ve built some apps that integrate with APIs and/or some server-side processes with JSON, you consider yourself highly skilled in JavaScript with confidence to take on the world, have a few go-to frameworks (Angular JS, jQuery), and now you’re ready to get hired full-time with a successful company that can ignite your career!  Conceptual understanding of different JavaScript methodologies, libraries and frameworks is key. JavaScript projects will range from Google App Scripts to full, single-page applications. Understanding and potentially being able to use different tools in the appropriate situation, such as Angular JS, Backbone, Mustache and jQuery, will be important - as is the ability to solve problems without using those tools at all. You have built applications on Google App Engine, and are comfortable modeling data with App Engine’s Datastore, specifically NDB.  If this site excites you, that's a big step in the right direction: http://javascript.crockford.com/



Responsibilities:




  • Develop professional, highly scalable and interactive web applications as custom solutions for clients

  • Full lifecycle application development

  • Designing, coding and debugging applications in various software languages.

  • Software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software review, identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, software reliability analysis

  • Performance unit-based software testing and quality assurance while building out the application

  • Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, automation

  • Support, maintain and document software functionality

  • Integrate software with existing systems

  • Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation

  • Work closely with Project Manager on client discovery, project estimating and project progression, testing, deployment, and iterations

  • Maintain standards compliance

item.title: Build and Tools Tech Lead - DevOps, Jenkins, C++, Python at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a technical lead to join the newly founded Connected Driving DevOps team. If you are passionate about complex, distributed development environments, continuous integration/delivery and quality and efficiency in the embedded space, then this could be the position for you. This is an opportunity to lead a team that can be the backbone for delivering the next generation of navigation systems to the Automotive industry. 




Your task will be



  • Responsible for driving the enhancement and automation of our continuous integration and delivery processes.

  • Facilitate the continuous integration process across multiple code repositories and environments.


    • Evangelising DevOps best practice and facilitating adoption of DevOps methodologies across teams.



  • Creation and maintenance of a DevOps dashboard and alert system.

  • Technical GoTo regarding all things CI/Build and Test Automation (Design, implementation, execution, evaluation)

  • Integration tests, Integration trouble shooting and error debugging

item.title: Release Engineer at Ipreo (NY, NY)
item.description:
Why Ipreo:


Imagine a job where you…



  • Work directly with senior managers on a regular basis

  • Have a meaningful impact on the mission-critical products and services that clients rely on every single day

  • Collaborate with colleagues across business lines and regions


At Ipreo, this is true for EVERY MEMBER of our global organization! Our technology solutions and analytical insights are relied upon by every major investment bank and thousands of corporations around the world.


What’s in it for you:


As a Release Engineer you will apply existing and emerging technologies to build mission critical solutions. Release Engineers provide an essential function to our software development life-cycle by providing hands on support during the release phase of our financial services software.  They are responsible for pulling together many software updates to build software release packages into our QA, Demo, and finally Production environments.


In addition to the design and development work, you will also gain exposure to the financial services industry. You will have the opportunity to work in a fast paced environment where priorities can change on a daily basis. You will also have the opportunity to learn from other senior engineers and work in an Agile environment, gaining experience with Agile and DevOps constructs.



What you’ll work on:



  • Liaise with developers during live support issues by applying knowledge from installations and configurations. 

  • Perform all code deployments for managed environments, including Production, QA, and Demo.

  • Responsible for finding and escalating software issues that impede successful release. 

  • Create procedures and implement utilities to automate Software Configuration Management processes.

  • Design and develop installation utilities for Windows and Web-based applications.

  • Create quality documentation and artifacts surrounding the entire development lifecycle.

  • Manage the software release schedule for both the product and development teams to follow, including prioritizing and scheduling code deployments.

  • Work with the Operations team to ensure the system stability of all environments.

  • Automation of routine daily tasks using PowerShell scripts for repeated actions.

  • Provide administrative and technical support, including installation of software patches, and trouble-shooting of installation and configuration problems.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer, Realtime Bidding at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Principal Software Engineer to help define our next-generation, real-time bidding platform. With over 250,000+ decisions per second, we are building out infrastructure enhancements to focus on availability, performance and availability.

Candidates must have solid experience working on large-scale, distributed systems. This will be an opportunity to take a lead on several core projects with considerations on key architectural and design decisions.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead software development projects enhancing our distributed real-time bidding system, the core of TubeMogul’s technology platform

  • Collaborate on key architectural decisions and design considerations

  • Monitor and plan out core infrastructure enhancements (a.k.a. stay ahead of possible scalability bottlenecks)

  • Troubleshoot and resolve system problems and customer issues under very tight service level agreement.

  • Work with machine learning team to implement optimizations to increase campaign effectiveness

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and helping them architect code smartly)

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team

item.title: Android Developer at Actual Experience plc (Bath, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for an experienced Android Software Developer who can take the lead on the development of our Android software offerings in two significant areas.


A component of our service is a measurement software client that takes network and application level measurements. This is proven on Mac, Windows and Linux platforms and we now want to develop it to run on mobile devices. We are also developing an engaging mobile app for the business leaders of our customers to access the results of the analysis we perform with the measurements.


You will be leading the development of both the measurement software on Android and the mobile app.

item.title: Senior iOS Developer (m/f) at Dassault Systemes 3DExcite GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:
Senior iOS Developer (m/f)


We offer you an exciting environment and plenty of opportunities to grow and develop your talents. You will be part of our "App Solution Implementation" team, which is responsible for all kinds of web and mobile technlogies. We are looking for an iOS developer to create innovative and outstanding native and cross platform apps which customers will love to use.


Job Responsibilities


Initiating, designing and managing innovative and highly interactive projects for our customers worldwide



  • Initiating, designing and managing innovative and highly interactive  projects for our customers worldwide

  • Collaborating with creative teams, external service providers and customers to identify, evaluate and translate business needs into detailed requirement and design specifications

  • Taking over the entire mobile applications life cicle (e.g. for iPhone, iPad and AppleWatch) - from concept and design to development to testing and release to app stores

  • Researching the latest technology and trends, while creating new and innovative ways to improve mobile applications that can ensure excellent customer experience

  • Reviewing project progress and ensuring, that the project is completed within committed objectives, schedule and costs

  • Identifying, analyzing and reporting problems in a timely manner

item.title: Product Architect at Ipreo (NY, NY)
item.description:
Why Ipreo:


Imagine a job where you…



  • Work directly with senior managers on a regular basis

  • Have a meaningful impact on the mission-critical products and services that clients rely on every single day

  • Collaborate with colleagues across business lines and regions


At Ipreo, this is true for EVERY MEMBER of our global organization!  Our technology solutions and analytical insights are relied upon by every major investment bank and thousands of corporations around the world.


What’s in it for you:


As a Product Architect and a member of a highly-skilled, forward thinking Software Product Architecture & design team, this role will help drive the architecture and design of our portfolio of software applications and products based on the strategy and priorities determined in collaboration with Product Strategy & Marketing. This role also collaborates with our Product Build group to promote good practices in software development/operations to deliver high-quality products in a predictable timeframe.


In this role, you will work on various initiatives and collaborate extensively with stakeholders and development teams to achieve ambitious goals. The ideal candidate will be able to work efficiently within a fast paced environment where priorities can change on a daily basis. This is an exciting opportunity to become a critical part of a fast growing, global organization, backed by two of the world’s leading financial sponsors, Blackstone & Goldman Sachs, at what is arguably the most exciting time in the rapid evolution of our company.


What you’ll work on:



  • Maintain a holistic view of Ipreo’s Software Product Portfolio and identify opportunities for high-value, strategic, cross-product initiatives.

  • Deliver high-level architecture recommendations for cross-product initiatives.

  • Perform detailed architectural reviews of product design proposals.

  • Identify opportunities for improvement and re-use in existing product designs.

  • Create and curate a set of Ipreo Architecture Principles to guide product development.

  • Identify the best tools to support the application of Ipreo Architecture Principles to product development.

  • Foster the creation of reusable patterns, components and services.

  • Guide product development in the best use of portfolio-wide patterns, components and services.

  • Provide technology and thought-leadership in Ipreo technical communities.

  • Identify opportunities for product architectural improvements designed to increase quality, performance, security, maintainability, resilience and manageability.

  • Use industry knowledge to ensure architectural recommendations are in line with industry best-practices.

  • Evaluate opportunities presented by advancements in technology and the threats posed by technology obsolescence.

item.title: Intermediate QA Analyst at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About the Role


We’re looking for a passionate Intermediate Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst with a strong technical background who thrives in a fast-paced, client-centric, entrepreneurial environment. In this role at Vena you will be responsible for the development, execution and maintenance of manual and automated tests to support functional and regression test cycles. In addition, the QA Analyst will work with Product Development, Professional Services and Customer Support/Success to create and maintain test environments and frameworks for standardized test processes based on software testing methodologies and industry best practices.


Responsibilities



  • Analyze existing projects and requirements to identify test requirements 

  • Build QA design and create test strategy, test plans and test cases

  • Execute manual and automated tests

  • Contribute to the building and implementing of best fit testing methodologies

  • Identify and execute test strategies for functional, integration and regression testing

  • Lead document reviews of test plans and test cases

  • Lead bug triage meetings and prioritize issues based on the client and project needs

  • Participate in release management meetings, provide testing stats on the test coverage and number of bugs found to assist in determining the release readiness of a project

  • Manage & support outsourced testing/QA resources  as required to efficiently manage workload

  • Own the lifecycle of issues/bugs being recorded, tracked, resolved and closed

  • Effectively communicate regarding QA issues based on acquired knowledge and be persuasive in addressing findings

item.title: Software Developer at Nanometrics (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for a software developer to join our team of smart, creative engineers to help build our next generation of products.


How we work


We work in an informal, fun, fast-moving, collaborative environment with minimal hierarchy. While we have the freedom to set our own hours and the flexibility to maintain an excellent work/life balance, we work hard to ensure that our products are delivered on time.


We develop a full range of software -- from customized Linux kernels and advanced signal processing applications, to web services and APIs.  We believe in using the best development tools and practices, and use an Agile approach.


What we do


Nanometrics creates innovative software and systems for detecting and monitoring seismic activity. Our products make a difference in people’s lives by helping to understand the significant human impact earthquakes have around the world. Our customers are leading researchers and companies who use our products for earthquake scientific research as well as natural disaster warning systems, nuclear non-proliferation monitoring, and induced seismic activity detection. Our systems are deployed on every continent and in some of the most remote and harsh environments on Earth, from deserts and mountains, to the Arctic and the bottom of the ocean.


This position is available in our Ottawa office, located on the edge of the Greenbelt. Close to biking paths and bus routes, and a short commute to many nearby residential areas.

item.title: Release Engineer at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Are you excited to work on large scale Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery Pipeline for various products on Mobile, Web & Cloud systems?


 Pushing new features to customers in a high traffic web scale environment, powering customers like Yahoo, Bing, Amazon, Facebook, Microsoft and others, without users noting a glitch in the service motivates you?


 Then you are looking at the right page!!


 HERE, Berlin is looking for a Release Engineer for our Core Platform release team.


 As our new Release Engineer, you will be working hands on with developers, QA, product owners and other teams. You will be working with highly motivated and agile team to ensure features are released on our SaaS platform. Using your release understanding, automation and technical expertise, you will work closely with product and development teams to ensure smooth execution of complex application releases throughout our release pipeline.


 Main responsibilities



  • Maintain and administer software configuration management and build management pipelines for multiple development projects and products throughout the entire development lifecycle.

  • Automation and supporting of software releases (planning, preparing and controlling software releases)

  • Verifying, documenting, automation of software build content (build management)

  • Executing, verifying, and troubleshooting full software system builds

  • Defining, implementing, and documenting software deployment strategies and installation procedures

  • Archiving software versions and transferring them to other departments for release and distribution

  • Develop build scripts and tools for builds, using most appropriate languages and technologies

  • Planning, Implementing, Documenting, and Administering configuration control procedures across multiple projects

  • Administering, maintaining, and troubleshooting source and change control mechanisms

  • Implementing, maintaining, and troubleshooting software build environments for specific projects

  • Responsible for continuing process improvement of all software configuration management activities and procedures

  • Introduce new techniques and technologies for new build systems and evolve existing systems

  • Evangelize continuous integration & delivery concepts and ideas within our product teams

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at Cloudreach (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Cloudreach’s Systems Engineers work with challenging technical solutions for industry leading clients. We love all things cloud related and believe passionately in the innovation it can drive.


How will you spend your time at Cloudreach


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):




  • Green field development of Amazon Web Services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc), e.g. looking at an existing service or data centre and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, or building a scalable mobile backend




  • DevOps: Systems engineering work with frameworks such as Chef or Puppet - as well as helping to break down barriers between silo’d teams. We automate everything




  • Technical deployment and consultancy related to Google Apps for Business - for example designing a complex Single Sign On solution




  • Not doing any out of hours shift work - yay!




What do we look for?




  • You’ve studied Engineering, Computer Science or a similar subject




  • You’re super motivated and have at least a year’s working experience. We can find a great role for you with 1 year or with 10+ years experience




  • Scripting skills - ideally Python or Ruby, but talk to us if you love to hack in any language. We look for people who automate everything where sensible. If you had 10 servers, you wouldn’t update each one manually right?




  • You’ll probably prefer a command line to a GUI




  • Solid knowledge of Linux (or perhaps Windows) Systems Administration/Engineering




What are our cloudy perks?




  • A top spec laptop. You want a Macbook, not a ThinkPad right?




  • Unique ‘cloudy’ culture where we keep our feet on the ground and our heads in the Clouds - this year’s project is building a Quadcopter on our 3D printer




  • Plenty of holidays - increasing with every year of happy cloudy service. You’ll also get your birthday off to open your presents/eat lots of cake




  • Great career development opportunities with an assigned mentor




  • Centrally-located offices - where the cool kids hang out




  • Good food and team ‘cloudy’ lunches, taking over a restaurant every Friday




  • If you do something amazing, we’ll give you a spot bonus




  • The chance to work on side tech projects to build something cool, unrelated to your day to day work




  • Overseas work opportunities - if you want them




  • Working with a collaborative, social team and levelling-up your skills faster than you will anywhere else

item.title: Web-Based Application Developer - Help Eliminate Bad Debt for our Clients at ONLINE Information Services, Inc. (Winterville, NC)
item.description:
ONLINE is seeking an experienced software development professional for the position of Developer who will work with other developers in maintaining database backed websites for our customers and partners.


As a .NET Web Developer , you will be creating both internal and customer-facing web-based applications. Examples of applications that we have developed and are supporting are; reporting interfaces for the collection and viewing of real-time data from our app.
