item.title: React Front End Developer at KoBoToolbox at the Harvard Humanitarian Initiative (Cambridge, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Work on a cutting edge product used in all of the world's toughest environments by the UN, Doctors without Borders, and many other humanitarian organizations.  This is a hands-on development role, and requires the implementation of a web application using React, HTML5, Python/Django (among other technologies) and using best practice continuous integration tools. A successful candidate will possess a broad knowledge of web application development technology. This individual will thrive in a collaborative and team-oriented environment, have an interest in the work conducted by HHI, and have a desire to acquire and apply new skills.


Location



  • Applicants based in the greater Boston area are preferred

  • Others must be willing to work during core EST working hours

item.title: Front End Developer / Designer > Global Platform for Local Culture at The Culture Trip (London, UK)
item.description: This is a great opportunity to take up a key Development and Design role in an exciting, very-fast growing global platform for local culture. You will work closely with CEO, CTO and a top-notch multi-disciplinary team (editorial, social, product, R&D) to ensure delivery of world class UI/UX across multiple platforms (web, mobile web, Android and iOS) and refine product definition. You will code the front-end and integration with the backend and be involved in the design for the site revamp and mobile app. We will transition and migrate from a proprietary CMS to an open-source CMS over the next few months. The company just secured Series A funding and is executing a substantial recruitment drive over the next few weeks. We would like this position filled asap.

item.title: Backend Engineer, Data Scientist at Yousician (Finland)
item.description:
Yousician is the fastest growing music education company in the world with over 20 million users. Our mission is to make music education accessible for everyone by changing the way people learn to play musical instruments.


Every day we use data intensively to improve the experience for our 20+ million users.


We’re looking for a backend engineer with a passion for data, who will be building a scalable data pipeline and providing the tools for the team that facilitate data-driven decision making.


You will take a lead role in all aspects of data analysis, designing and implementing our data architecture and the algorithms that drive our product.


Responsibilities



  • Lead the design and development of our data pipeline.

  • Support all the teams (UX, product, music education, marketing) in data-driven decision making.

  • Take a lead role in all aspects of data analysis

  • Develop tools to provide fast access insights for different teams.

  • Support the backend team with implementation of important/critical features.


How to apply



  • Please send your application and CV to careers@yousician.com

  • Only applications in English will be considered.

  • This position is a full-time position in Helsinki, Finland.


Important: FOR PEOPLE CURRENTLY NOT CURRENTLY LIVING IN FINLAND, please state your intentions of relocating to Finland. If we don't find any reference to this in your application, we will not consider your application and concentrate on applications from other candidates

item.title: Developer at Squla (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Your role?


In this role you will get the opportunity to work within a team of great developers who work hard every day on the Squla platform, the games and great features for the Squla platform web applications. You will be




  • building end-to-end features for the Squla platform web application;

  • testing your features and being fully responsible for them when they go live;

  • perform maintenance and bug-fixing as required.

item.title: Application Developer Sr at University of Pennsylvania Libraries (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
The University of Pennsylvania Libraries seeks a progressive programmer to join its growing Digital Library Developer team. Working with an innovative blend of open-source and best-in-breed development tools, the Senior Application Developer creates software for multiple, complex digital library projects in the areas that include discovery, repository systems, researcher profile services, and business intelligence. Project work is designed and executed in teams comprised of software engineers, subject matter experts, and operations staff that emphasize collaboration and creative problem solving across a range of disciplines. The position reports to the Director for Digital Library Development and Systems, and supports a wide range of computing services which enhance and facilitate teaching, learning and research efforts of the University. Digital library development makes use of a full range of skills, including coding, technical architectures, application specifications, database design, and workflow analysis. The Senior Developer is responsible, along with other programmers, for testing, quality assurance and the life cycle management of library applications. The Senior Developer is a participant in and at times leads project teams to implement IT services, technical solutions and designs, and often has the support of a small crew of junior developers. The position also provides expertise on metadata that are relevant to digital library implementation and the development of local, reusable methodologies for metadata interactions.

The Senior Developer operates with a high degree of independence and professionalism in managing job responsibilities, work priorities, methodologies, and routines. The position requires a readiness to research IT developments and tools, to apply the findings of research to design and programming, and in general, to bring best practices and the latest concepts in the field to application development. The position is responsible for researching, recommending, managing and maintaining technical metadata standards for structured data repositories such as Oracle & MySQL databases, Apache Jackrabbit, Solr, and XML documents. The senior developer participates in IT planning as well as the execution of planning priorities.

The work requires close collaboration with a variety of audiences, including Library staff at all levels, project managers and developers across campus, Penn faculty and researchers, and IT professionals from other institutions and commercial firms. The Senior Developer must be highly effective working in groups and with subject matter experts who may not be IT professionals. The successful candidate will join a team of energetic and creative contributors. Responsibilities include timely and responsive communication, fulfillment of deadlines, and a readiness to engage in the bidirectional sharing of knowledge and expertise with colleagues.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Sophos (Burlington, MA)
item.description:
SENIOR FULL STACK DEVELOPER



At Sophos, we operate at the cutting edge of technology, protecting businesses worldwide against complex threats, viruses and spam. We build high quality software security products in a fast-paced, nimble environment and we've been doing it for over 20 years.


Join us to help our customers protect their business and meet compliance needs.


Role


Senior Software Engineers possess the ability to function as a technical lead, providing technical direction to other developers. Frequently have direct responsibility for product features or key technology choices and implementation. Collaborates as part of a team for the development of complex systems; including requirements analysis, concept development and design, implementation and testing, demonstrating flexibility of role as required.



  • Candidates located in other areas of MA & NH are also welcome to apply


Main Duties



  • Drive design and implementation leveraging modern design patterns

  • Ability to partner effectively with UX, PM, DevOps, QE and other developers to design and implement meeting the spirit of requirements

  • Pride in authorship of code

  • Experience in modern front end frameworks

  • Technically curious to keep present on advances in technology

  • Experience with segregation of model, presentation, and business logic.

  • TDD experience and strong desire to build in test from the start.

  • Write code (Test or Product) to deliver against project timescales, quality and requirements in various languages including Java or other selected languages for Sophos Cloud products.

  • Conduct Unit, System and Integration testing and fixing errors, with guidance if required.

  • Work with best of breed Cloud technologies (NoSQL, high throughput event processing, cloud-scale data analytics, etc)

  • Design small software components (Functionality, defect fixes or automation) that form part of a larger solution, in line with team objectives

  • Define Test scenarios and Test cases to ensure quality of the teams deliverables

  • Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers in daily Scrum meetings.


Experience and Skills



  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent

  • 7+ years of JAVA, API, JavaScript, Angular JS, Java Web Services, UI Skills, Json.

  • Experience using and creating RESTful APIs.

  • Experience with the following technologies (recommended);

    - MongoDB
    - Redis

  • Experience/knowledge with CI/CD

  • Experience with Agile Software Development methodologies

  • Excellent attention to detail

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Essential



  • Design and write high quality code

  • Evaluation of code and design quality

  • Understands how products and technologies interface with each other and fit with the strategy and business needs

  • Evaluation of technical and functional specifications and their cohesion

  • Negotiation

  • Technical problem solving

  • Effective communication with different types of audience

  • Risks Assessment and Mitigation

  • Coaching and training

  • Team Working


Benefits


In most cases, the compensation package includes:



  • Medical insurance

  • Dental insurance

  • Vision insurance

  • Life insurance

  • Long-term disability insurance

  • 401k plan

  • Vacation time

  • Gym membership compensation

item.title: Senior PL/SQL Database Developer at FUJIFILM Medical Systems, Inc. (Morrisville, NC)
item.description:
FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. is a leading provider of diagnostic imaging products and medical informatics solutions to meet the needs of healthcare facilities today and well into the future. From an unrivaled selection of digital x-ray systems, to the Synapse® brand of PACS, RIS and cardiovascular products, to advanced women’s health imaging systems, Fujifilm has products that are ideal for any size imaging environment. The Endoscopy Division of FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. supplies high quality, technologically advanced FUJINON brand endoscopes to the medical market. FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. is headquartered in Stamford, CT with offices in the Raleigh, NC region. For more information please visit www.fujimed.comand www.fujifilmendoscopy.com.


Senior Database Developer


 Our team is looking for the person who was labeled “the over achiever”.  The one who let the cookies burn in the oven because you were busy thinking about database schemas instead of watching the timer.   Are we getting close?


 Being the first to figure things out and wants to work with complex data schemas because a challenge is why you get up and come into work every day.  And it’s why we want to talk to you.


 We’re hiring a database developer for our team and we want someone who gets a rush out of taking the lead and starting something new.


 Bigger is better!


 This position will let you work not oly on improving our current product with the latest web technologies but also being part of a team that is building an entirely new platform for our Synapse product for not just radiology but to include cardiology and other imaging modalities and suite of products.


 For starters, you’ll be working on our Synapse Cardiovascular product where you will be a hands-on database developer writing stored procedures, schemas, changing schema objects, normalizing, debugging issues on the front end and down to the database level. 


 And just when you think you’d like a little something more to do you will be doing a little performance tuning and optimization for peak performance because you love a challenge and want to figure out what locks up and how that can be fixed.


 Just in case that isn’t enough to challenge you, did we mention that we’d love for you to have some experience with C++ or C# and some .Net so you can do some middle level development on the database.


 And this is only the starting point. Whether you want to know more about the specific details of your systems or the leadership opportunities we offer, you’ll have the chance to build your skills and knowledge base from day one.

item.title: Social Commerce Developer at SHOP.CA (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
SHOP.CA is Canada’s leader in online shopping, providing a premium Canadian experience that combines an authoritative selection of products, unparalleled service and a social commerce. Launched in July 2012, SHOP.CA has become the fastest growing retail site in Canada and top 10 most visited Canadian owned ecommerce site.  As a SHOP.CA Social Commerce development team member, your role will be to work on Social Commerce, ensuring that integrations with social networks continue to work through upgrades as well be in charge of integrating the SHOP.CA platform with new social networks.  You are innovative and will work to create solutions that leverage the capabilities to create stunning ecommerce solutions for our customers.  You have drive, energy, and passion to contribute to a hyper-growth startup in the fastest growing segment in Canada.


Responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the SHOP.CA development organization helping to make SHOP.CA’s Social Commerce world-class for customers a terrific user experience including Member Registration, Connection Social Profiles to SHOP.CA Member Profiles, Social Sharing Out from SHOP.CA and Social Sharing In to SHOP.CA, and Invite-a-Friend

  • Quickly resolve outstanding defects and issues

  • Work collaboratively with team members to clarify business requirements, create comprehensive and viable designs with effort estimations

  • Participate in development planning sessions and meet agreed deliverable dates for new features and enhancements

  • Safeguard consumer data in accordance with SHOP.CA’s data security policies

  • Adhere to SHOP.CA’s software development lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Work effectively with a tight team of world-class designers, web developers and back-end developers

  • Create documentation for new features and application changes

  • Supporting our QA team in testing your features formally (test scenarios) as well as informally

  • Work with our infrastructure team to debug issues as they arise in production

  • Innovate new solutions and research new social networks and their technologies that will complement SHOP.CA’s eCommerce site – help make SHOP.CA’s Commerce platform experience world class including working with Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and many more.

  • Actively participate as a direct resource to projects as required in the following areas:


    • XHTML, DHTML, HTML, CSS, AJAX, JavaScript files, and other solutions employed by SHOP.CA

    • Architect, design, develop, maintain and support all software components of the SHOP.CA Social Loyalty Network platform

    • Implementation of business logic server-side in Java for low level social network integrations



We work in an aggressive, energetic and sometimes frantic environment where exceptional coders thrive. You must be willing to join an early stage, hyper growth company that will require significant time commitments to be successful. It’s not for the meek here, but if you have what it takes, we will push you hard and you’ll gain incredible experience and knowledge solving challenging software engineering projects.

item.title: Software Engineer (.net/Ruby) at Careerbuilder (Norcross, GA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Software Engineer (.net/Ruby)


The strength of our solutions and brand combined with your expertise empower us to literally change peoples’ lives!


Who We Are:
This is an exciting time at CareerBuilder as we continue the rapid growth of our global HR Software as a Service operation. Fueled by technology that is years ahead of the competition, we’re doing something the industry has never seen before: unifying the recruiter experience in one pre-hire platform that is always on, is data-driven and is easy to use. You’ll see us expand into more markets with innovative products and services that are changing the way companies recruit new talent around the world. As a Software Engineer at CareerBuilder, you’ll have the opportunity to do something extraordinary. Our employees are what drive our success and are at the very core of our identity.


Who You Are:
Software Engineers at CareerBuilder solve interesting business problems that span the range of deriving intelligence from big data, engaging job seekers on mobile devices, to building applications in the cloud.


Helping developers integrate their code with others through release management, automated testing and deployment one minute, and then showing no mercy in a vigorous game of table tennis the next –the life of a CareerBuilder Software Engineer is never dull! Bring your ideas, your skills, your object-oriented background and your quick-draw and come join our team. Pursue next-generation technologies and tools to help support the platform that is matching job opportunities with employment seekers around the globe. You’ll be given plenty of independence and autonomy with which to work, and you’ll be able to spend 10% of your time just learning new tools and languages. If you have a passion for solving complex problems, thrive in a fast-paced environment, CareerBuilder has a place for you. If you have the passion for developing cutting-edge solutions to business problems and you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!


As a Software Engineer, you will come up with new and innovative platform development ideas for ALM. Best of all, we participate in the open source community, which allows for plenty of flexibility and room for innovation as you experiment and tinker alongside some of the best Software Engineers in the business.


Here are some of the toys you’ll get to play with:
* REST
* Visual Studio
* Distributed Computing
* TFS and Github
* .NET 4.5
* Saucelabs
* Automated Testing
* SOA
* MVC
* Linux
* Chef
* RubyRails


Software Engineer (.net/Ruby) Job Requirements:
As a Software Engineer, you must be an excellent and self-driven problem solver, with at least 2 years of experience under your belt. You should also be a team player with a good sense of humor, good work ethic, who likes to work and brainstorm with others. You will need to be able to interact with developers as customers. And of course, you’ll also need to be able to comfortably switch between various programming languages, projects, platforms and tools.


Additional requirements for the position include:
* Bachelor’s degree, computer science or related major preferred
* Experience with high level programming languages such as C#, Java and VB.net
* Familiarity with SQL
* Possessing excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to convey complex ideas clearly, concisely and diplomatically
* Solid understanding of object-oriented design and development (OOA/OOD)


Model candidates will also have:
* Distributed Computing
* Knowledge of testing and testing principles
* Exposure to Scrum and Agile processes
* Knowledge of ALM
* Experience writing code using the .net framework
* Experience writing chef Cookbooks
* Experience with RubyRuby on Rails
* An excellent shot with a Nerf gun


One great way that we encourage innovation and the development of new ideas is through events such as our annual HackDay contest. This provides you with the opportunity to explore your own business improvement ideas and to present them to CareerBuilder executive leadership. (Oh, and just to make it interesting, there is a $10,000 prize if you come up with a winning idea that provides actual business value!)


Benefits: We’re All About You!
We encourage our employees to make the most of the generous benefits we offer. Take advantage of great perks such as paid time-off for volunteering, diverse education opportunities, flexible hours, and wellness reimbursement, just to name a few. CareerBuilder.com is committed to helping employees strike a balance.


Here are just some of the amazing benefits we offer:
* Training that positions you to hit the ground running with ongoing learning and development courses; we never stop investing in our people.
* Summer Hours! Enjoy 1/2 day paid Fridays during Summer Hours
* Casual Dress Code-don’t worry about buying new suits and dry cleaning bills!
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental & Vision Programs
* Education Reimbursement Program allowing up to $5k per year towards completion of a Bachelor’s and non-MBA graduate degree, and up to $10K per year towards completion of an MBA! No strings attached!
* $400 Annual Reimbursement for Wellness Activities, including your gym membership!
* 401(k) Program with Strong Employer Match and 2 year vesting schedule!
* Five Star Company Paid Trips-if you hit your numbers, pack your bags and get ready to experience luxury!


CareerBuilder, LLC is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, ancestry, marital or veteran status.

item.title: Front End Architect - $100K at Crossover (, ) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ready to make $100,000 USD and eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Work for DevFactory, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. Sound too good to be true? Take a closer look...


What to Expect as a Front End Architect at DevFactory


Join DevFactory and you’ll be given the responsibility of leading the development of new custom written, high performance web interfaces.  You will partner closely with back-end engineers, designers, and product management to ensure features are developed holistically.  You should have an unrelenting drive for quality, with a passion for responsive UIs and tight clean animations.  Importantly, you will be expected to apply your already deep understanding of data backed JS frameworks, to not only define and implement the key architecture components of the front end web app, but also give recommendations for backend services that can support the user experience desires of product management.



Compensation


At DevFactory, you’ll earn extremely competitive wages while enjoying the flexibility of working from virtually anywhere on the face of the earth:




  • Salary: 50 USD/hr




  • Position type: Full time (40 hours per week)




  • Location: Global




The Type of Front End Architect We’re Looking For


DevFactory values a culture of excellence. We need web architects/developers who are not only technically proficient, but also demonstrate the following qualities:




  • Perfectionism when it comes to code quality (Even JS can be beautiful!)




  • Commitment to following dev “best practices”, with code-reviews, unit tests, etc.




  • Passion for developing a simple, clean, and attractive UI/front-end




  • Confidence that your talent is significantly above your peers and competitors




  • A willingness to embrace the concept of iterative development as the means for building excellent products




  • And obsessive commitment to quality and an eye for detail.




Next Steps


Ready to join? Start the process now by applying through our application link. If you meet the qualifications, we will proceed with a series of tests and interviews. DevFactory is eager to see what you have to offer our cutting edge global workforce.

item.title: Front End Developer / Integration Specialist at Digital Animal (Birmingham, UK)
item.description:
As a Front end Developer you will work as part of our Birmingham-based Development team to:



  • Create - create new advocacy solutions for our clients.

  • Build - create tools to support the creation and management of advocacy campaigns.

  • Integrate - help clients’ developers implement Digital Animal's technology on their websites

  • Support - help support clients in dealing with integration issues.



Who are we looking for?


We are looking for a web developer with strong front end development skills. You have both the ability to write good code and an eye for layout, design and UX.  You will have spent time integrating third party technology in your own web sites and applications, and as a result have an appreciation for the nuances of creating web-based technologies.


You will be a crucial part of our development team. You will be involved in projects from concept to completion. You will work closely with members of our consulting team and with our development team. You will communicate directly with client developers throughout the design and implementation of their marketing campaigns.


You will be involved in designing and building new solutions in our Labs projects.



Characteristics required:


We are interested in your characteristics and not just your skills and experience.


These are the key characteristics we apply to everything we do. You will possess these characteristics too:



  • Thoughtfulness at start

  • Communication, helpfulness & openness during

  • Quality & precision throughout

  • Organisation & structure throughout

  • Learning & sharing knowledge at the end



For this specific role, we are looking for someone who:



  • Is digitally savvy.

  • Is able to communicate clearly in writing and in speaking

  • Has an organised and systematic approach, complemented by creative flair

  • Pays close attention to detail

  • Believes in excellent customer service

  • Wants to learn about digital advertising and data

  • Has a passion for technology, social media, advertising and marketing

  • Wants to be part of a fast-growing startup with big ambitions



Ideally you will also have experience with Web technologies used by our clients; and with design technology, including:



  • Creative design, layout and UX

  • A basic knowledge of automated testing

  • Coding in cross browser compatible HTML, Javascript and CSS

  • Responsive design and coding

  • Vanilla Javascript as well as the popular Javascript frameworks

  • A basic knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator, Fireworks, InDesign or similar

  • Exposure to the MEAN stack

  • Working closely (and patiently!) with client developers.

  • Strong use of source code repositories, like Git and understanding of Git workflow

  • Willingness to learn new technologies

  • Familiarity with Cloud based SAS applications

  • Experience in contributing to open source projects is a plus

  • Literacy and numeracy.

  • Experience with SQL databases is a plus

  • Teamwork is a must, but you should also be confident working independently, and be a self starter



Education/Certification:



  • A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or a related field is a plus - but attitude and experience come first

  • Note: A demonstrable portfolio will hold more weight than any academic accreditation



A Day In The Life:



  • We start the day with standups to make sure the code you write is building the software that you want to use, and address anything that is blocking your progress. This is a great place to pick up on the latest and greatest practices and patterns in tech, and get support from more seasoned members of the team.

  • We pause often, holding fortnightly retrospective meetings where we ask ourselves: “How could we do better?”.  It’s an opportunity to consider ideas (big and small) that can have a big impact on how we deliver as a team.

  • We try to foster a working environment that’s fun and friendly, and where all ideas are considered properly. We are not very hierarchical, and our people tend to have a broad range of skills, rather than being narrowly focused.

  • We also love to experiment with bleeding edge technologies and are encouraged to develop innovative applications in Digital Animal Labs. Recent projects include hooking our core architecture to the Internet of Things and ibeacons.



Salary


Your initial salary will be between £25k and £40k, depending on experience, plus stock options.



How to apply


Send an email with a covering letter and CV to: zaid.crowe@digitalanimal.com


In your letter, answer the following questions:




  • What’s wrong with our website?



  • Which software product from the last two years would you be most proud of building and why?



If successful, you will be invited for an interview at our Birmingham office.


If we like the look of each other after interviews, we will invite you to work with us for a week or two (paid, of course) so that we can see how you fit in, and you can get a real feel for what your job would be like.  We appreciate you may already be in full, or part time employment/education, if that is the case - we’ll work with you to find the best way forward.



Please phone 0121 6982144 or email zaid.crowe@digitalanimal.com for any further information.

item.title: Platform Mobile Engineer at SHOP.CA (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Mobile is a key channel for SHOP.CA and we want to provide our customers with the best mobile (App and HTML) shopping experience.  As Head of Mobile Engineering, you will be responsible for creating, maintaining and executing SHOP.CA’s mobile strategy for phone, tablet across HTML and app solutions.  You are passionate about mobile and user experiences and will create mobile solutions that our customers love to use.  You will create daily KPIs and measure and report on the success of our mobile channels focusing on results first.  You are innovative and will work to create solutions that leverage the latest mobile capabilities in localization, notification, bar-code scanning, voice, etc to create stunning ecommerce solutions for our customers.  You have drive, energy and passion to contribute to a hyper-growth startup in the fastest growing segment in Canada.


Responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the SHOP.CA development organization helping to make SHOP.CA a world-class mobile destination with a terrific consumer experience

  • Develop daily KPIs on mobile site and app utilization, conversion rates, etc

  • Make proactive recommendations to improve customer experience based on analytics

  • Lead the strategy and recommend solutions to meet SHOP.CA’s mobile strategies including

  • support for mobile HTML on phone and tablet devices as well as apps.

  • Participate in development planning sessions and meet agreed deliverable dates for new

  • features and enhancements

  • Safeguard consumer data in accordance with SHOP.CA’s data security policies

  • Adhere to SHOP.CA’s software development lifecycle (SDLC)

  • Work effectively with a tight team of world-class designers, web developers and back-end developers

  • Define, and implement front-end standards for performance, analysis and personalization

  • Quickly resolve outstanding defects and issues

  • Use all available and emerging creative development tools in your work

  • Work collaboratively with team members to clarify business requirements, create comprehensive and viable designs with effort estimations.

  • Actively participate as a direct resource to projects as required in the following areas:


    • Wireframe development (PhotoShop or other similar programs), site (XHTML, DHTML, HTML,

    • CSS, AJAX, JSP, PHP, Flash and JavaScript files) and other solutions employed by SHOP.CA

    • Architect, design, develop, maintain and support all software components of SHOP.CA mobile solutions (iOS, Blackberry & Android)

    • Implementation of business logic server-side in Java/JSP to support the mobile eCommerce platforms.


  • Creating documentation for new features and application changes

  • Supporting our QA team in testing your features formally (test scenarios) as well as informally.

  • Build out QA test ‘lab’ for devices and handsets necessary for the QA team to adequately test SHOP.CA’s mobile strategies

  • Working with our infrastructure team to debug issues as they arise in production.

  • Innovating new solutions and researching new technologies that may complement SHOP.CA’s eCommerce site – help make SHOP.CA’s mobile commerce experience world class


We work in an aggressive, energetic and sometimes frantic environment where exceptional coders thrive. You must be willing to join an early stage, hyper growth company that will require significant time commitments to be successful. It’s not for the meek here, but if you have what it takes, we will push you hard and you’ll gain incredible experience and knowledge solving challenging software engineering projects.

item.title: Operations Engineer at Cloudreach Europe Limited (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Cloudreach are Europe’s only top tier partner of choice for both Amazon Web Services & Google - the giants of the cloud computing industry. We’re the best at what we do. We provide a range of valued services to the Enterprise, and we see the need to recruit a number of highly technical and dynamic individuals to help us maintain our reputation and continuous customer satisfaction as we continue to grow in the cloud !!



Why do you want to work with us?



  • You want to be one step ahead: The future of IT is in the cloud, and we work with the leaders in this space. You will get exposure to new technology and new data analytics tools.

  • You want interesting work: This role is complex and analytical, with the chance to become an excellent data modeller and to work both with internal teams and directly with clients. You will endeavour to automate any repetitive tasks.

  • You want a progressive culture: The established culture is friendly, with a lot of banter and we firmly believe that work should be fun. At the same time we value personal growth and understand that a great organisation is one made up of diverse individuals.

  • You want to broaden your knowledge of food or drink: We’re in the heart of Edinburgh, next to some of the oldest and best restaurants and pubs in the UK. We regularly go out for lunch and after work as a team. And if you’re not up for a wee jaunt to the pub, there’s always beer and juice in the fridge.



What we are looking for?

Cloudreach is looking for a number of capable sysadmin engineers or developers who have a passion for operations with 3-5 years relevant experience who are keen to grow their technical and business skills in a fast growing company. We’d like to see someone who has had exposure to infrastructure with automation. If you are curious about the Cloud and have possibly dabbled with AWS and Google Apps we want to speak to you. We subscribe to the concept of "DevOps", where we use development skills in the operational environment in order to increase service quality. Typically our customers use an extensive array of technology running on either Linux (with Open Source) or the Microsoft stack.
The beauty of this role is that as the hardware layer is abstracted, you focus on honing your technical skills, and the interesting stuff, rather the heavy lifting. The intent is to fix or work around the root cause of operational issues, so that they do not reoccur.

You will be working with the following new technologies (and more):



  • Linux / Open Source

  • Microsoft technologies

  • Management of and automation of management of these systems

  • Amazon Elastic Computing cloud

  • Google Apps



Responsibilities



  • Action incident / problem cases related to the support of customer systems in line with Service Level Agreements

  • Liaise with customer directly in the case of major incidents

  • Carry out pro-active maintenance

  • Action service requests

  • Ensure knowledge of the platforms is accurately maintained

  • Produce statistical information as required to support ITIL reports

  • Assist in customer migrations by Service Delivery teams (to Google Apps / Amazon Web Services)

item.title: Data Scientist (The Walking Dead) at Next Games (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
If you’re a startup-minded pro with a passion for games and a brain that can tackle any given problem in a unique way, then keep on reading as we’re on the look for our new team member for The Walking Dead game team:


DATA SCIENTIST


As our Data Scientist, you’re responsible for generating insights from large data sets produced by our games and players. Working closely with our EP’s and game teams you’ll get to service and manage our day-to-day data requests and analyses hands-on.


This is what you’ll get to work on:



  • Work with product teams to define data to be collected from our products for analysis

  • Analysis of key performance indicators, such as customer acquisition, retention, lifetime value and virtual economy balance

  • Defining the data acquisition of AB tests and analysis of the gathered AB test data to estimate the effect on key metrics and choose the best features

  • Develop models for predicting player behavior

  • Answer in-depth analytics questions from the team and create reports of the results

  • Identify and report actionable insights to internal stakeholders, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results


Your experience and skills include:



  • 2+ years experience in a data scientist or analyst role, involving some of the following: data analytics, CRM data analysis, data mining, business intelligence, machine learning, predictive modeling

  • Expert knowledge in SQL-related languages

  • Knowledge in statistical programming languages (R, etc.) and in Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, NoSQL, etc.)

  • Experience in interpreting data and analytics results to provide actionable insight into user/product behavior and deriving conclusions from those insights

  • Comfortable working in an international, fast-paced, challenging and stimulating organization

  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills in English


Here at Next Games we aim high, and will ask you to do the same. In exchange, you’ll be part of a team that is great to work with, who is dedicated and passionate about what we do – we believe passion is contagious. Giving each Nextgamer the tools and means to succeed in their job is our priority. We believe the fruits of our labor should be shared with everyone at Next Games. We offer the opportunity to work with a great bunch of passionate and dedicated people, a competitive salary and benefits package, and first and foremost a big challenge.



If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now!



When you apply, please email your CV, a cover letter along with your salary request to data.scientist@nextgames.com. Please apply soon, as we’ll proceed once we’ve found the right person to join our team!



For further information about the position please contact our CPO, Joakim Achrén at +358-500 625 398 during the following time:



Friday 21.8. between 13.00 – 14.00 (EEST)

item.title: Data Architect at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Twilio Architecture team is responsible for the architecture of Twilio’s platform. The Data Architect will be a core member of the team focusing on designing data topologies and pipelines for handling and storing the immense amount of data we capture every day.


About the job:


As an experienced software engineer, you will be developing the architecture that will be instrumental in operating globally available, resilient and highly performant services used by hundreds of thousands of developers and apps.

Successful candidates will be strong developers with deep experience in data modeling, data storage and Business Intelligence systems.


Responsibilities:



  • Drive the technologies and policies needed to store, manage and interact with Twilio's data.

  • Work with the engineering teams to help choose technologies, design system architecture and model data in a scalable and efficient way.

  • Develop proof of concepts, shared libraries and services that will be used across the product engineering organization.

  • Coordinate with Sales Operations, Marketing and Finance to help understand their data needs and how disparate systems will integrate.

  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems in distributed computing, data persistence, and more.

item.title: Data Scientist (Palo Alto OR Seattle) at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Coupang - Data Scientist - Palo Alto or Seattle



What if you could set the standard of how e-commerce can and should be done around the world?



Now you can at Coupang!



We are Korea’s largest online retailer and our goal is to create the next-generation e-commerce model. According to Nikesh Arora, we are “one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive Internet companies in the world.” In just 4 years, we already have over 25M devoted users and over $2.5B in annual revenue. And we are just getting started!



We just closed a whopping $1 BILLION round of funding, and we are about to undergo hypergrowth! We have offices in Seoul, Shanghai, Palo Alto, Seattle, and Ontario, CA. We are looking to double our amazing team in the U.S.!



If you want to work in a fun, challenging environment while changing how the world thinks about e-commerce, then we want to hear from you!



About the role:



You’ll get to work with the best in the industry, with many of our team members coming from Amazon, eBay, PayPal, Facebookand more! You’ll work in a collaborative and open environment where we consider ourselves a family (Check out our Family Day!). And our agile environment will enable you to rapidly innovate with the most cutting edge technologies.



What you’ll do:


You’ll be faced with unique challenges to scale we aim to grow to more than 55M+ users in Korea alone. You’ll also get to push the envelope of what’s possible with mobile commerce (currently over 75% of our sales are done on mobile)!



Some specific things you’ll work on:



  • Build cutting-edge machine learning models to proactively provide strategic recommendations to business partners that can drive effective impact

  • Conduct in-depth data analyses to drive and deliver insights to help business partners make strategic decision

  • Partner with different functional teams, leveraging various tools to automate models and reports

  • Cares deeply about data quality and demonstrates this commitment by attention to quality of data and code generated

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at Premier, Inc. (Charlotte, NC)
item.description:
Are you a Lead Software Engineer interested in working at a Health IT startup?   Premier has invested in a new emerging business incubator to try and solve the biggest problems facing healthcare by utilizing Big Data and Predictive Analytics.


This Lead Software Engineer will be helping health systems create data warehousing capabilities on top of an enterprise platform in order to share real time data across a collaborative.  This cutting edge startup will be helping Premier’s member health systems solve issues within population health through accelerators and dash boards created off this new platform.  


Premier’s new product is truly a Platform as a Service (PaaS).  We are currently seeking a Lead Software Engineer with Platform as a service (PaaS) experience for an immediate fulltime need.  This Lead Software Engineer will be on a team of experienced Health IT Professionals working with raw data from all of our healthcare clients to extract, transform and load data into data marts ready for new application development.  If you are looking for an opportunity to work with a leading edge Health IT start-up without the risk of one, this is definitely the opportunity for you.


Key Accountabilities:


Software Development



  • Planning, analyzing, and directing the coding and testing

  • Provide guidance and direction on development approach for coding – review, analyze and meet with business analyst to fully understand requirement

  • Provide guidance and direction on the development of the data approach for coding – Understand data guidelines, and understand data sources available, what is new based on requirements, and how the project will impact common data stores

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer at Thinair (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description: We're looking for a senior front-end developer to help design our product and to eventually lead our front-end team.

item.title: Senior Backend developer at Thinair (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description: We're looking for a senior backend developer to help design our product and to eventually lead our backend team.

item.title: Quant Developer at Marriott Sinclair (Little Chesterford, UK)
item.description:
The role of Quant Developer is open to a capable and motivated mathematician with software development expertise.  We're looking at a broad range of experience levels here, from new graduates to gurus, and we want anyone coming on board to be prepared to learn and improve their skills.  We're a young company with an open, relaxed atmosphere, and we're looking for people that are in turn open to new ideas and ways of doing things.


The role involves a broad range of activities:



  • Development of the Tyche software product.  All development proceeds according to modern software development practices such as continuous integration testing, and code produced needs to be mathematically correct and highly efficient.



  • Determining mathematical solutions to problems, and determining how best to express those solutions in terms of computer code.  The problems to be solved may be concrete practical problems such as how to find an optimal investment strategy, or how best to calibrate a mathematical model to data, or more abstract problems such as how best to efficiently execute a sequence of mathematical operations.



  • Testing and quality control.  This is hugely important to us.  Any work needs to be thoroughly tested, and a comprehensive set of tests should be submitted for the work alongside the code, to add to our regression testing suite.



  • Maintenance and support of Tyche.  For this, read bugfixing ;)!  We have a low bug-rate at present, and have very rigorous systems for bug recording and monitoring, but fixing bugs generally takes priority over new project work.


The term "Quant Developer" can be used to mean a broad spectrum of things in the industry.  At one end, there are essentially pure quants who hack programs together, and at the other end there are dedicated software developers with little mathematics.  We don't really fit in to that.  At Marriott Sinclair we take the software development equally as seriously as the mathematics.  The team here are professional software developers at the same time as being serious mathematicians; we don't compromise on either area.


Please submit a CV and covering letter to Mark at Marriott Sinclair.

item.title: Web Developer Arc GIS & JavaScript at Proceed Solutions (Calgary, AB, Canada)
item.description:
Job Overview


Proceed Solutions is looking for an experienced, driven and independent person who can assist in supporting and continuing the development of an existing suite of software applications which serve as the backbone of our business.


Reporting to Development Services Manager, the candidate is responsible to ensure the continued support and development for an environmental management framework.


The primary responsibilities of this position are to:



  • Support project based work in an environmental management framework

  • Implement spatial models and services platforms

  • Work with Geospatial Data Management team to develop processes and tools

  • Develop and deploy spatial visualizations and data management processes and procedures

  • Provide data management leadership and support to project participants

  • Write software using the Arc GIS JavaScript framework.


Key Accountabilities



  • Creation and management of GIS based data sets, data-stores and processes to manage spatial data;

  • Database and GIS system technical support, development and programming;

  • Support & develop new GIS functions for the application;

  • Support corporate business development activities;

  • Assist in proposal preparation and identification of project opportunities;

  • Assist with project research activities

item.title: Senior PHP Developer at Datto EMEA (Reading, UK)
item.description:
Datto, Inc., is one of the fastest growing companies in Connecticut, specializing in backup and disaster recovery solutions, and we are a leader in our space. We are seeking a Senior PHP Developer for our top-flight development team based in our Green Park, Reading office. The development team at Datto is a highly collaborative organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skill, and a passion for quality. Come write cutting edge Windows Backup solutions, and collaborate with program management and quality assurance staff on innovative projects.


Responsibilities



  • Design and develop web products using PHP/Javascript/Bash.

  • Implement new features and maintain existing code base.

  • Give valuable input regarding the core architecture.

  • Follow coding standards and best practices.

item.title: Stream (Techstars) - Senior Python developer at Stream INC (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
About Stream

Stream (GetStream.io) is building a new kind of data store. A data store to build, scale and personalize feeds. Our users access Stream via a blazing fast, highly available and simple to use API service. We run on a very complex tech stack, highly optimized for performance and availability.


Stream is a well funded startup with offices in Amsterdam and Boulder. We are looking for an experienced Python developer to join our development team in Amsterdam. Your responsibilities include build features for Stream's API service and storage layer as well as contribute to our open-source library (Stream-Framework)


Here are a few of the reasons we think this work is fun and challenging:



  • High performance demands. You will get to choose efficient data structures and algorithms for high performance. This often requires understanding the details of stdlib and how other libraries such as django, gevent, celery work.

  • We run a collection of services, each with different requirements and patterns optimized for efficiency. To name a few: single threaded, multi-threaded, multi-process and event-driven.

  • Complex testing scenarios.

  • Designing a simple, clean, and easily-understandable API is hard.

item.title: (Senior) Data Engineer f/m at Smaato Inc. (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Smaato is expanding its product portfolio due to growth and demand within our industry. This is an opportunity to work for a world-class company providing an innovative platform product that could change the way the next generation understands advertising!

For our new SaaS platform, we are looking for an experienced Senior Data Engineer, who is passionate about processing large amounts of data. Currently, our cutting edge platform is processing an average of 3 billion inbound advertising queries per day. Each incoming request generates multiple outbound requests to our partners.

The Data Engineer is a technologist and innovator who brings passionate inquisitiveness, primary research, and forward thinking to every assignment. Daily activities will include developing solutions to User Story based requirements, mentoring more junior developers, engaging positively with the Scrum Team, building software to pass automated acceptance tests, and delivery of Sprint commitments. The Data Engineer will share responsibility for all team deliverables, and will favor informal communications with Product Owners and with other stakeholders within our company.


Key responsibilities




  • Design, develop and deliver scalable, high-performance, real-time data processing and analysis software.

  • You will be also responsible for evaluating and selecting the right technologies as well as working on the system architecture.

  • Support the business and product stakeholders by developing new and innovative algorithms for analyzing the stored data

  • Interact with our UI engineers to develop innovative ways of visualizing huge amounts of data.

  • Work in an agile environment

  • Work together with the product management team to incorporate the needs of our customers and help them manage their mobile advertising campaigns.

item.title: Data Engineer - Python, PostgreSQL and Redis at Lyst (London, UK)
item.description:
Lyst are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Analytics team and work on the huge data projects that are integral to Lyst’s day to day operations.


Data lies at the heart of everything we do here at Lyst, from understanding our users better to making mission critical decisions, we always look at the data first.


We record nearly 100 million rows of data a day just from user interactions. To support this volume, we have built our own analytics architecture, predominantly in Python and leveraging the convenience of many cloud services like AWS Redshift, Lambda, CloudFront, S3, etc.


With this sea of data growing everyday, you will work hand in hand with our analysts and data product managers to ensure that our analytics data pipeline is clean, efficient and scalable as the business and traffic increases. From building bespoke BI tools, ensuring analytics engineering requests are responded to in a quick manner to architecting new solutions. You will work on things such as:



  • Improving our analytics data architecture, ensuring scalability and resiliency

  • Streamline the anomaly detection process across all our data, and build tools and processes around it to speed up the required actions to solve any anomaly

  • Improving our internal BI tool, Looker, and tools surrounding it to ensure Analysts are able to provide amazing insight to the business.

  • Understanding the query requirements from our data analysts and optimising our database (table) design to make them faster and more efficient.

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.



WHAT WE USE


Python, JavaScript, Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, AWS, Objective-C, Elasticsearch, Docker, Ember.js, RedShift, Pandas, IPython Notebook



As you can see we are really excited about the data we have here hopefully you will be too. We expect you to have already had some exposure to working in a commercial environment as an data Engineer. You will have the ability to not only work as a hands on member of the team but also the


We like to build things that solve problems, you will not be constrained by process - we work in small product teams that take a lean approach to building things. We believe that there is no silver bullet to fix the problems and challenges we face: instead we encourage consistent iteration to ensure we are always solving problems. We care deeply about collaboration, feedback and trust; all of our engineers take ownership of committing their own code and ensuring that everything is bug free and reliable.


If the above resonates and you would like to strongly influence the direction of our products and our culture, work with amazing people and hang out with Albert and Bruce, the office dogs. Artisan beers. Good Coffee. Great people.


If you would like to apply please do so right away, if you would like a bit more info feel free to get in touch with Tris on jobs@lyst.com.

item.title: Systems Security Engineer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
1010data has created the fastest database in the world via an easy-to-use, spreadsheet-like interface to make big data discovery easy across retail, consumer packaged goods, financial services, healthcare and telecom.


We are seeking a Security Systems Engineer to establish, lead and implement measures to protect the privacy of our customer data and intellectual property.


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance.


The right person appreciates the end-end ownership of building tools and is confident in embracing new technologies that come with cutting edge security.


If you are a security authority and hands on engineer excited to employ cutting edge techniques to manage and secure massive amounts of data in dynamic web environments we would like to speak with you!


Responsibilities:



  • Designing and implementing advanced security techniques in parallel and distributed systems environments

  • Mining security data, performing deep analysis to discover unrealized threats, in order to provide better transparency and more accurate metrics.

  • Developing new and innovative methods for automating security log analysis and event processing.

  • Implementing identity and key management infrastructure.

  • Implement HIPAA, SSAE16 compliance initiatives

  • Understand and review technical documents such as operating system and application system logs, code snippets, and information security best practice/regulatory guidelines.

  • Work collaboratively with developers as well as non-technical business units.

item.title: Foundational Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Foundational Applications department builds some of the most innovative and heavily used applications and infrastructure in the financial industry. We work on communication systems, compliance and archiving solutions, charts and visualizations, news, search and recommendation systems and big data infrastructure.

Our developers operate at the intersection of in-depth technical research and an aggressive time-to-market. We not only own the full life cycle for the products we build, but also work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to strategize on next generation features and functionality. We are dedicated to using and contributing to open source, have an active presence at industry conferences and collaborate with top universities.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Instant Messaging

Bloomberg Instant Messaging (Instant Bloomberg, or IB) is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. IB handles close to 250 million post events per day. Our usage has grown considerably over the past few years, requiring that we maintain a sophisticated UI and a state-of-the-art distributed architecture which can scale to the most extreme load without compromising performance. We also build a unified multimedia communications product called BConnect. We work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meetups and conferences.

Bloomberg Vault

Bloomberg Vault (BVault) is a startup within Bloomberg developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. The explosive growth of social media and web collaboration require businesses to remain compliant with an increasingly regulatory environment. Our software, hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, archives over 60 billion messages and has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises. Our infrastructure processes over 200 million messages a day, checking content and interaction patterns, and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.

Mail

The Bloomberg Mail (Message) group builds a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and other communication on the Bloomberg terminal. Our network of users, connected through the platform, relies on our real-time performance, ironclad security and tight integration with financial data and Bloomberg applications. Message is built on top of open source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available distributed system includes comprehensive storage, search infrastructures, real-time email transport and delivery pipelines. We build APIs for integration with other applications and systems, and a feature-rich user interface optimized for our customers.

News

The News group develops one of the most heavily used applications on the Bloomberg terminal that provides search, real-time alerts and analysis. We build systems that process over one million news stories a day from over 80,000 sources. We provide scalable products that meet strict indexing latency requirements and synthesize and present an overwhelming amount of unstructured information to our clients. Bloomberg News uses our systems and workflows making them the fastest, most influential news agency in the world.

Government Intelligence

The Government Intelligence group helps investors quantify the impact of government activities such as legislation, regulation and contracting. Our work includes ingesting large unstructured public data sets and discovering actionable data points to alert clients in real-time. We design scalable search and database solutions to aid discoverability and analysis.

Charts and Custom Indices

The Charts and Custom Indices group builds visuals that make it easier to absorb information and identify data trends. In addition to visualizations, we develop analytical platforms that retrieve, aggregate and process large data sets. Our services run on dedicated Linux servers and require stability, scalability and speed.

Search and Discoverability

The Search and Discoverability group builds a federated search and question-answering engine to ensure Bloomberg clients can find the right information as quickly as possible. We use open source search technologies and natural language query understanding to build an intuitive search functionality. Our platform searches millions of data points from dozens of structured and unstructured data stores and natural language question-answering engines.

Financial Data Infrastructure

The Financial Data Infrastructure group builds the next generation of infrastructure to take in large amounts of financial data. We use big data and cluster management technologies to achieve high performance, reliability and transparency. Current initiatives include: price history infrastructure to store and manage billions of historical time series data points; data pipeline to ensure transparent and accurate delivery and governance of data; data snapshot for real time access to thousands of data points about millions of securities; and, Bloomberg Query Language to provide a rich access and calculation layer on top of all Bloomberg data.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer / Software Engineer at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

Due to trivago’s rapid growth our site traffic is now reaching around 3 billion requests per month. For this reason we are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to join our dynamic Software Engineering department and ensure a reliable, fault-tolerant production environment. We want all our users to experience trivago at its best, and you are the person who will make this happen. If you are a master of PHP, eager for a new challenge and looking for the freedom to experiment with new technologies then we look forward to hearing from you!


Your responsibilities:



  • Monitor applications in production (Price Search, Community, Hotel Manager etc.) and solve any issues or complications that arise, especially during peak traffic hours.

  • Build a fault-tolerant and scalable environment to support our rapidly growing business.

  • Research solutions for new projects, pitch pioneering concepts and build prototypes to drive trivago's technological infrastructure forward.

  • Design and build customized cutting edge tools by experimenting with new technologies.

  • Collaborate with stakeholders and ensure maximum productivity by guaranteeing a reliable production environment.

  • Share your technical know-how with the team and document your tests, solutions, concepts and approaches for future reference.

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Fetch Rewards (Madison, WI)
item.description:
About Us


Our vision is to leverage technology to transform shopping into an engaging, rewarding, and


delightful experience. We're a vibrant team of innovators who have embarked on a journey


to reinvent how people shop. Our first stop: Grocery. Our technology platform, based


around a free smartphone app, ensures that users have the best shopping experience


possible. Over the last 18 months, Fetch Rewards has become one of the fastest growing


tech startups in Wisconsin.


Our offices are located in downtown Madison overlooking the iconic Capitol Square and


adjacent to dozens of restaurants and shops. We like to celebrate our victories, big and


small, and we’ve never been accused of taking ourselves too seriously.


As a small and agile team, we pride ourselves on the caliber of our work and the scope of


our ambition. We have two sayings that sum up the ethos of Fetch Rewards: Defeat the


Odds! and What’s next?


We're committed to working with innovative and passionate people. As a young company,


we need team players who can go above and beyond their individual responsibilities to help


the company build towards its vision. If the challenge of disrupting a stagnant industry


alongside a hard working and funseeking team, then read on!


Why this role is important to us


A senior services developer at Fetch Rewards is someone who can be handed a


challenging problem and design and develop an appropriate solution with little to no


assistance. This role will focus on building back-end services to integrate seamlessly


with our data warehouse, mobile platforms, and other systems. This will be a key


leadership position on the team providing guidance and technical direction with our


back-end services and systems.

item.title: Systems Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Want to work on the cutting edge of cloud computing services at massive scale?



Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for Systems Engineers for the AWS Database Services team in Dublin, Ireland. This team is working in the heart of AWS managing rapid growth services such as Redshift Amazon is building some of the largest distributed systems in the world and we need smart people to help plan and put together the pieces.



The Systems Engineers within our team are instrumental in creating, automating, deploying, operating and scaling a massive always-on distributed system. We are seeking passionate engineers with strong Linux systems engineering skills who pro-actively automate away problems and constantly look to improve quality of service.



The ideal candidate will have thrived in operating complex systems, diagnosing and resolving the hardest corner case problems. You are fast on your feet and excited by the challenge of working in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift quickly. In addition to your linux systems skills you will be very comfortable with networking & database technologies. You must be able to triage situations quickly and work equally well with internal engineers and external customers to bring about swift problem resolution in ways that persist and are reusable for multiple services.



You will be expected to deliver on these kinds of things in the first six to twelve months on the job:



Automate away recurring problems:

· Develop or further existing application and system management tools and processes that reduce manual efforts

· Design and participate in the development and delivery of operability-related features such as system health monitoring, diagnostics, repair, and other self-healing automation.

· Monitor the health of the fleet, automating system health, maintenance tasks, and reporting systems as needed.



Manage capacity in the face of massive growth:

· Maintain fleet inventory management, including producing, maintaining, and evolving capacity plans for various components.

· Adapt and improve operations management systems and processes to accommodate rapid and increasing growth in systems and traffic.

· Define and/or refine hardware requirements and selected designs.

· Participate in the design and execution of production acceptance tests and new hardware evaluations.

· BS Computer Science or other technical degree and/or related experience

· 5+ years of solid *NIX system administration experience

· Scripting skills in one or more of Perl, Python, Ruby, Bash or Java.



· Experience running and maintaining a 24x7 Internet-oriented production environment, preferably across multiple data centers, involving (preferably) at least hundreds of machines.

· Automation or monitoring framework experience, deployment or development

· Demonstrable expertise around specifying, designing, and/or implementing system health, performance monitoring tools, and software management tools for 24x7 environments.

· Experience with very large distributed systems such as large scale distributed database systems, storage farms, and/or horizontally scaled request processing fleets

· Experience with hardware load balancer administration, network optimization, or other related and demonstrable TCP-level experience

· A solid grasp of networking fundamentals, preferably including hands-on experience with load balancers, switches, routers, etc.



*LI-JF1

item.title: Senior PHP Developer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a PHP Developer at Coolblue you will make sure our web shops are ridiculously fast and meticulously kept.


What you tell your friends you do
"I build web shops. And no - I will not fix your computer."


What you will really be doing



  • Coming up with new functionalities and building them.

  • Improving the technology that runs over 300 web shops.

  • Improving the user-friendliness of all of those web shops.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You will have your own specialization, but you will also be able to perform all other tasks within the team.

  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.

  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.

  • Big data is your guru, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Faceted search. Search and filter real-time product information, hundreds of times per second, for 90.000 products in 280 shops.

  • Responsive design. One codebase, lots of devices, but always the optimal user experience.

  • Reviews. A completely new infrastructure for better performance and scalability. Improved usability for both customers and moderators. More reviews, more interaction, less spam, better conversion rates.


What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...


Team
You will be working in a team with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be complemented by a Scrum Master and a Product Owner.

We are looking for a Senior Billing / Subscription Management Engineer with Ruby experience who gets as excited as us about web security, machine learning, big data, and cloud scalability to join our nimble engineering team – we are looking for someone with Ruby experience but is also  open to learn other languages, as long as you're excited about learning new stuff.



  • Develop web-related event based applications including the architecture, design, coding, integration, and maintenance of web and database applications; implement and automate back end systems.

  • Maintain and develop solutions on a social platform, scaling high traffic sites for Ruby on Rails, on platforms similar Amazon Web Services

  • Build with Responsive Web Design.

  • Coordinate the needs of all business owners, create and execute project work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.
