item.title: DevOps/Ruby Engineer at Stitch Fix (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
About the Team


Stitch Fix has an extensive internal platform for managing our business, from inventory management to warehouse logistics to our own Personal Styling platform, each serving thousands of internal users who run the business every day.  Our public-facing infrastructure is growing as well, helping millions of our customers be their best selves.  It’s all tied together with an array of user-facing applications and back-end services.


We’re ops savvy, but not ops-focused. While we are currently hosting our Rails apps on Heroku and leveraging their add-on ecosystem, we are only married to what works, and are constantly re-evaluating our technical infrastructure.  We aren’t afraid of change if that helps us deliver faster, better, and more reliable solutions to our business partners and customers.


This is where you come in. Stitch Fix needs a Ruby and Rails developer with a keen interest in development tools, technical operations and “developer happiness”.  We have a lot of applications, services, and infrastructure, and we need someone who can be dedicated to make sure it’s meeting the needs of the development team.


About the Role


You’d be walking into a welcoming and diverse environment that is built around partnership, integrity, feedback, responsibility, and innovation. We have over 20 Rails apps and services, hosted on Heroku, and deployed with a high degree of consistency. Our mature engineering team is truly partners to those that run Stitch Fix by providing efficiency & effectiveness with the tools we develop.


You’re excited about this opportunity because you will...



  • Make application development and deployment easier for the engineering team

  • Help us solve thorny problems around performance and fault-tolerance

  • Build tools and systems to manage security

  • Make sure we’re up-to-date on the best practices of our service providers (Heroku, AWS, etc.)

  • Investigate new tools & technologies our team can use to solve problems for the business

item.title: Principal Medical Software Architect at Cambridge Consultants (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Main purposes of the job


This position offers the rare opportunity to take a leadership role in the Medical Technology business and help shape the future of intelligent, connected medical devices. If you are excited about solving complex, multivariate technical and systems challenges in the medical domain, are passionate about developing robust, safety-critical software that serves a meaningful purpose, and have excellent interpersonal and leadership skills, then this role could be for you. You will work with our clients and lead the creation of innovative multidisciplinary products and technologies in the medical space.


This role offers continuous exposure to the latest developments in an exciting field poised for growth, as well as the variety of working with many companies, technologies, and people who are passionate about the future of the role of technology in healthcare.


This role is based in our new state-of-the-art innovation center, located in Boston, MA.


Type of work undertaken by the group


The Medical Technology Division undertakes the development of innovative new medical devices and systems from concept, through prototype manufacture, to new product introduction, often surmounting considerable technical challenges.


We undertake development projects across a wide range of categories including surgical tools, drug delivery devices, diagnostic instruments, and critical care.


We combine highly creative lateral thinking with excellent technical skills and broad industry experience to form powerful development teams. Our work ranges from complete product developments to providing consulting services for our clients on their technology, strategy or development processes. Every project is a unique technical challenge, and provides a rich learning experience.



Typical development project examples include:



  • Cloud-connected disease management product with crowd sourced data analytics

  • Point of care diagnostic instrument with sample handling, optics and microfluidics

  • Embedded systems for remote patient monitoring applications

  • Wireless pacemaker implant, including ASIC development

  • Novel surgical tool involving machine vision, automation, and complex UI

item.title: Lead Systems Developer at Tennessee Housing Development Agency (Nashville, TN)
item.description:
LEAD SYSTEMS DEVELOPER



APPLICATION DEADLINE IS SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 27, 2015 AT 11:59 P.M.



Division: Information Technology


Reports to: Director of Information Technology 


Location: Nashville, TN


Full-time/Part-time: Full-time


Salary Grade: 43


Monthly Salary Range Minimum: $5,984


FLSA Classification: Exempt (03)


Note: eligible for telecommuting up to two days a week depending on workload and current projects



Critical features of this job are described under the headings below. They may be subject to change due to changes in our business processes or other business-related reasons.



POSITION SUMMARY:  Performs the role of Lead Developer on all programming projects, including the establishment, communication and enforcement of coding standards, reviewing the work of team members, and performing key, advanced code development where necessary to ensure consistent delivery of high-quality services and products to THDA staff.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.



  • Trains and coaches all developer positions, developing staff skills and encouraging growth and development; makes assignments and monitors work progress.



  • Performs the role of Lead Developer on all programming projects, including the communication and enforcement of coding standards, reviewing the work of team members, and performing key, advanced code development where necessary.

  • Develops and enforces all programming procedures and standards with the oversight of the Director of Information Technology; uses industry best practices surrounding the Agile System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology.

  • Exercises a knowledge of project management and software development techniques and works closely with Project Manager to complete the requirements of software applications; examines project deliverables in a timely manner for adherence to organization standards to ensure that user and system requirements are met.

  • May conduct reviews with users of preliminary system design products and plans; reviews program design to ensure compatibility with needs and business requirements.

  • May investigate the availability of application software packages that will accomplish proposed system or program goals, researching and evaluating similar systems and participating in vendor demos to determine if existing software may meet user requirements.

  • Creates database objects, user interface code, business logic, reports, Structured Query Language (SQL) scripts and stored procedures, and other code required to implement systems; creates, defines, and implements application frameworks.

  • Resolves problems encountered in the use of THDA-developed applications, which can include working with other Information Technology staff; de-bugs computer programs selecting approriate application development languages and troubleshooting tools.

  • Maintains technical knowledge of software development techniques, investigating new tools and utilities for software development as necessary.

item.title: Software Infrastructure Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
We develop the core foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data-processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high-performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code which can react quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users, as well as our managers, are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering through coding to deployment and maintenance.

More information on individual teams, technologies, and their products can be found below. You will have the ability to select the team you are interested in based on your preference or expertise.

Teams in Software Infrastructure:

Application Frameworks

UI Framework - We build and maintain an in-house real-time data-processing framework, which is used by over 3,000 developers to write high-quality, easy-to-use and efficient applications within the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for extending the core libraries to support more varied, complex and scalable solutions, and enhancing the toolkit for application developers, such as adding tools for performance analysis, debugging, introspection and optimization.

Rapid Infrastructure - We produce the next generation of tools for enhancing developer productivity and the infrastructure behind the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for creating software in C++ in both UNIX and Windows development environments. We work closely with other stakeholders to produce both the frameworks and tools used by all application developers to build and deploy their UI and applications.

Developer Experience

We are a team of technologists, engineers, evangelists and trainers charged with helping our developers deliver their best work. We are not afraid to make large investments to build our own tools when it will make us better able to outpace the competition. At the moment we work with Phabricator, Jenkins, DPKG, GitHub Enterprise, Coverity, Jira and anything that fills gaps and joins them together.

Market Data Distribution

API Technology - We are responsible for Bloomberg's data distribution infrastructure, which is the largest in the world, providing low-latency market-data and value added Bloomberg data via our open API (http://www.bloomberglabs.com/api/). We support scalable, distributed, high-performance software that provides mission-critical data delivery to all Bloomberg desktop customers and a large number of enterprise-level applications.

Market Data Systems - We build backend services and distribution infrastructure for Enterprise Solutions products such as, but not limited to, BPOD/B-PIPE (Bloomberg's consolidated real-time and reference data feed) and the rapidly expanding Event Driven Trading Feed (EDTF) business.

Systems Infrastructure

We build low-level UNIX infrastructure that is critical to Bloomberg's systems. Our areas of responsibility include: high volume, low latency realtime data distribution; enterprise wide software deployment systems; FIX connectivity; and PKI security services. As the rest of Bloomberg R&D fundamentally relies on our products, we have high standards for correctness, performance and scalability. We are a highly collaborative team who are passionate about building reliable systems to solve real world problems.

Ticker Plant

We develop real-time software for our high-profile system which sits at the core of the Bloomberg infrastructure. We process market data from around the world, driving the majority of downstream Bloomberg applications. We address the market demand for low-latency solutions by providing innovative software powered by the most comprehensive, timely and accurate financial data in the world. We work closely with multiple businesses and sales groups to design and develop our applications to satisfy ever-growing customer demands.

item.title: Senior Database Developer at XSOLIS Health (Nashville, TN)

item.title: Data Scientist at Feedzai (Lisbon, Portugal)
item.description:
We are looking for data scientists with as much skill as passion and large amounts of both! Come and help us disrupt the hot hot market of digital payments and online fraud prevention!


You will be working in a cross-functional team where you will be able to tackle complex fraud detection problems and where your main responsibilities will be:



  • Work close with our product development team and with other R&D team members in thorny fraud detection problems.

  • Support your answers and findings with appropriate statistical techniques and methods.

  • Contribute to the team knowledge by keeping up with the state-of-the-art in machine learning applied to our domains.

  • Communicate findings within the organization, particularly the management, product and delivery teams.

  • Develop solution prototypes and help integrate them with the product.


What we offer:



  • Career growth and ninja skills over a set of emerging technologies and tools such as Spark, Scala, Hadoop, Cassandra, R, Weka, and more.

  • Independence to choose preferred tools and techniques to solve problems and minimize time-to-completion.

  • Become a member of an award-winning, amazing, driven, focused team which is disrupting the market.

  • Relaxed working environment in Lisbon, Europe’s Leading City Break Destination city.

item.title: Vice President of Engineering at Umbel (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Summary: 


We are a team of agile, boundary-pushing problem-solvers who love to invent and improve. The VP of Engineering will lead a group of passionate, talented engineers (approximately 15 engineers with plans to grow rapidly) that are building a customer data query and analysis SaaS platform. Our core technology—a distributed, decentralized, bitmap index—is unrivaled and capable of performing complex queries over 200x faster than alternative solutions. You will report directly to our CEO and work very closely with our Chief Data Scientist to build an industry leading SaaS platform capable of delivering insights to our clients. 


What You Must Do To Be Successful In This Position:



  • Manage, coach, and mentor a rapidly growing team of 15+ front end, back end, and integrations engineers

  • Successfully scale our team, which is set to more than double over the next 9 months

  • Lead our Engineering recruiting charge by acting as an evangelist and improving the hiring processes

  • Be a cultural leader for our Engineering team

  • Work with our Chief Data Scientist to achieve groundbreaking R&D and architectural improvements

  • Oversee and execute multiple projects across the entire stack while maintaining stability, quality, and scalability

  • Work closely with our Product team to manage and prioritize requirements, balancing short-term and long-term needs effectively

  • Hone our agile development methodologies and team throughput

  • Drive technical performance improvements

  • Be the voice of Engineering and communicate to the entire company

  • Be a leader in the company and a voice for key executive level decisions on behalf of Engineering

  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and even commit code when necessary is a plus

item.title: Scientific Software Developers at D. E. Shaw Research at D. E. Shaw Research (NY, NY)
item.description:
Extraordinarily gifted software developers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed in part at fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.  Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for large-scale data analysis and simulation both on commodity clusters and on massively parallel special-purpose supercomputers of our group’s design.

Particularly relevant areas of expertise might include computational biology, Python and C/C++ programming, molecular dynamics, scientific visualization, computer graphics, full-stack web development, scientific workflow management, high performance data-parallel computing on multicore and GPU architectures, and the development of large-scale data management, cheminformatics, and/or analysis frameworks, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability and a demonstrated track record of achievement.

If you are interested in being part of a team of the world’s leading biologists, chemists, and computer scientists, please use the link below to submit your application material.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below: 
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/JrSP

D. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team. We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming. We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

item.title: Python Developer at Trimble Navigation (Westminster, CO)
item.description:
About Trimble Data


Trimble Data develops scalable, cloud-based geospatial systems. Our goal is to make geospatial processing simpler and faster for consumers by interfacing many varied geospatial applications into a cohesive whole.


Our primary system is the Trimble Data Marketplace, a storefront for geospatial data. The Marketplace enables customers to find, customize, and download data quickly and easily.



Python Developer


We are seeking a self-motivated and enthusiastic software engineer to join the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team. Python developers are responsible for developing and maintaining highly scalable geospatial processing systems that will handle petabytes of data.


As a member of the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team you will use a wide variety of technologies, such as Python, FME, and AWS to solve problems and have the opportunity to explore and use emerging technologies.


We are looking for intelligent, innovative, and driven developers. We will consider applicants with limited experience in the technologies listed below, however you must have strong Python skills.


Key Responsibilities




  • Software engineering with a healthy dose of performance engineering and DevOps.




  • Use Linux and Windows system administration knowledge to set up and maintain working cloud distributed systems.




  • Use BASH, BATCH, Python, C, C++ and other specialty languages to develop and maintain backend systems for Trimble Data.




  • Use AWS to manage and grow our cloud strategy.




  • Work within your team and with other teams to ensure the overall vision of the project is being fulfilled.

item.title: Software Infrastructure C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Software Infrastructure department develops the foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code that reacts quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users and managers are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and coding to deployment and maintenance.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Ticker Plant

The Ticker Plant group is at the core of both the Bloomberg Professional Service and Enterprise Solutions products that process market data from around the world and drive the majority of downstream applications. The Ticker Plant system provides low latency processing of market data from around the world while servicing client queries from our cutting edge time series database. Our systems process billions of ticks a day and are highly fault tolerant and scalable. Our group researches and implements industry leading technologies such as high throughput time series database, low latency tick streams, and various efficient, robust and scalable components for Bloomberg's market data storage and distribution system.

Feeds Infrastructure

The Feeds Infrastructure group provides the platform that supports our feed handlers in processing market data from exchanges and contributors around the world. The platform consists of a high performance, reliable and scalable framework used to build and deploy these feed handlers and the host environment in which they run. The team provides solutions that can be reused across feed handlers to meet the market's quickly evolving demands. Our systems run 24/7 and require resiliency and seamless failover.

Feeds Infrastructure Applications

The Feeds Infrastructure Applications group builds an array of services used by feed handlers, Ticker Plant, the Enterprise product and terminal applications. The services facilitate the global distribution and processing of market data, system scalability and operational management of feeds. We solve some of the most critical feed and Ticker Plant software problems and provide the tools to manage these systems.

Data Distribution (API)

The Data Distribution group builds and maintains the largest global network in the world, spanning five continents. The infrastructure is built using state-of-the-art technologies to deliver low latency market data and news throughout the world via OpenAPI (www.openbloomberg.com/open-api). The group uses commodity software/hardware platforms to develop high performance C++ code and multithreading to achieve peak rates and optimize bandwidth and latency.

Application Framework

The Application Framework group builds the infrastructure and libraries used for developing applications at Bloomberg. This includes the application runtime environment, the UI toolkit exposed to developers, the client-side rendering engine and integration with real-time data. We are responsible for advancing the next generation of UI technology and giving our applications the advantages of the latest paradigms and features. Our group builds the tools for profiling and debugging applications and a custom IDE for developing them.

item.title: Software Engineer - Data Platform at Loggly. (San Francisco, CA)

This is an exciting opportunity to work in a highly innovative environment with new technologies as we continue to evolve our products and extend our leading market position. Our culture is fast-paced, performance-oriented, open and collegial, and lots of fun. This is a full-time position based in San Francisco, CA.

item.title: Data Architect at Idea Couture (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Idea Couture is looking for a senior backend systems architect to join our technology group and build systems and solutions that help shape the future.

item.title: Modeling and Simulation Analyst at Stellar Science (Albuquerque, NM)
item.description:
Stellar Science is a growing Albuquerque-based scientific software development company seeking talented scientists that are interested in helping create and extend exciting scientific and engineering analysis applications. This is a new position at Stellar Science and we are looking for individuals that are interested in helping us define this role and mature our applications. Specifically, we are looking for individuals that are motivated, excited to learn new tools, and willing to help wherever they are needed.

We develop custom software products in domains that include computer vision and image processing, image simulation, high power microwave systems modeling and simulation, laser source generation and effects modeling, computational electromagnetics (CEM), space situational awareness (SSA), high performance computing (HPC), and computer aided design (CAD) tools, among others.

A Stellar Science Modeling and Simulation Analyst will be involved in all aspects of our application software life cycle, from marketing & business development to design, testing, documentation, and the customer interaction along the way. They will be working with management and the development teams to improve our applications and make our customers happy. We are looking for someone that has great verbal and written communication ability and stellar presentation skills. Someone that is eager to learn and excited to explore new domains.

Applicants may range from recent college graduates to experienced software engineers; the main requirements are that candidates be top-notch, responsible, self-motivated, honest, able to work well independently or in small teams, and be able to rapidly learn new tools, and techniques as needed to meet mission requirements.

Minimum Requirements:

B.S. in physics, math, engineering, or a related field
Confident, articulate, and professional speaking abilities
Exceptional computer skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with software testing
Scientific analysis experience in one or more of the following domains:

  • Space Situational Awareness (SSA)
  • Image Simulation and Analysis
  • Computational Electromagnetics (CEM)
  • 3D CAD
  • Image-based Meshing
  • Directed Energy
  • Lasers
  • High Power Microwave (HPM)
  • High Performance Computing (HPC)
  • Modeling & Simulation

U.S. citizen willing to undergo background investigation and perform some work at Kirtland Air Force Base

Desired:

M.S. or Ph.D. in a scientific or engineering field with substantial scientific analysis experience

Stellar Science is a forward-thinking business that allows its employees to work at home on occasion when consistent with job requirements. Standard benefits include ten paid federal holidays (which may be floated as desired), three weeks vacation, a generous fully employer-funded SEP IRA, and fully employer-funded health insurance, as well as dental, disability, and life insurance.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin, in accordance with CFR 60-1.

item.title: Software Developer for Scientific Applications at Stellar Science (Albuquerque, NM)
item.description:
Stellar Science is a growing Albuquerque-based scientific software development company seeking talented software developers to create and extend exciting scientific and engineering analysis applications. We maintain high standards in all our software development efforts, utilizing modern development practices including continuous integration, test-driven development, and code reviews in order to develop high quality, maintainable, and reusable code. By employing a lightweight development process, we remain highly productive and responsive to changing customer needs.

We develop custom software products in domains that include computer vision and image processing, image simulation, high power microwave systems modeling and simulation, laser source generation and effects modeling, computational electromagnetics (CEM), space situational awareness (SSA), high performance computing (HPC), and computer aided design (CAD) tools, among others.

Applicants may range from recent college graduates to experienced software engineers; the main requirements are that candidates be top-notch, responsible, self-motivated, honest, able to work well independently or in small teams, and be able to rapidly learn new languages, tools, and techniques as needed to meet mission requirements.

Minimum Requirements:

  • B.S. in computer science, physics, math, engineering, or a related field
  • Substantial software development experience
  • Object-oriented design and programming in Java or C++
  • Ability to implement, understand, and maintain mathematical and scientific codes
  • U.S. citizen willing to undergo background investigation and perform some work at Kirtland Air Force Base

Desired:

  • M.S. or Ph.D. in computer science or a scientific or engineering field with substantial software development experience

Experience in any of the following is a plus:

  • Cross-platform software development on Linux, Windows, Mac
  • 3D graphics using Open Scene Graph and/or OpenGL
  • User interface development with Qt, Java Swing, Gwt
  • Supercomputing, OpenMP, threads, MPI, GPUs
  • Microsoft Visual Studio, Qt Creator, Eclipse
  • Google closure or similar tools for large-scale javascript development
  • OSGi, orekit, commons.math
  • Image processing, imagery analysis, or computer vision
  • Aerospace vehicles, orbital mechanics, electromagnetics, space situtational awareness
  • Directed energy modeling and simulation
  • Computer aided design (CAD)

A representative sample of your code may be requested early in the evaluation process, e.g. something you've written for work, for a class, or for fun. It need not compile, but should be long enough to help evaluate your programming and software engineering skills.

Stellar Science is a forward-thinking business that allows its developers and scientists to work at home on occasion when consistent with job requirements. Standard benefits include ten paid federal holidays (which may be floated as desired), three weeks vacation, a generous fully employer-funded SEP IRA, and fully employer-funded health insurance, as well as dental, disability, and life insurance.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin, in accordance with CFR 60-1.

item.title: Software Engineer - Core Java at OptionsCity Software (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Join us as a Software Engineer - Core Java


At OptionsCity, we partner with financial institutions to streamline their trading operations by providing services and tools including pricing, risk management, execution, and automated trading systems. Our vision is to change the way trading professionals think about and utilize technology.


The OptionsCity development team follows Agile Software Development principles to produce state-of-the-art software designed for the professional trading community. Using OOP/OOD, OptionsCity provides market data and order routing capabilities that power our state-of-the-art market making, trading, and risk applications. As a member of this team you will be a key contributor to maintaining existing applications, improving core technology, and creating new software to expand OptionsCity’s coverage of global asset classes and solutions required to support them.


Other responsibilities including contributing to the existing automated testing frameworks for new and existing implementations as well as assisting support staff in any escalated production cases.


What you’ll be doing:



  • Work on the business-level services provided by our platform, from market making, opportunity identification, pricing, risk management, order and trade management, to exchange connectivity

  • Work on the core services exposed by our platform, like threading, persistence, messaging

  • Contribute to the entire ecosystem: Metro, Freeway, API’s

  • Push the platform forward from a quality and performance point of view through systematic refactoring

  • Actively participate in discussions around design, architecture, and problem solving

  • Work closely with Dev-Ops for configuration, automation and deployment

  • Participate in application testing to ensure high quality software

  • Provide development support to second level support team

  • Participate in agile related meetings to plan, assess and improve the development process


What we’re offering:



  • The opportunity to change the way trading professionals think about and utilize technology 

  • Technology-­driven company, founded by software developers

  • The opportunity to make an immediate impact in an open, merit­-based environment

  • Small tech team of 20 gives you direct access to CTO

  • Agile methodology (Scrum)

  • Work on all aspects of our trading systems including high ­performance, multi-­threading, real­time kernels, etc.

  • Work within a development organization from which you are expected to learn and which expects to learn from you

  • Open-­ended career path

  • Opportunity to learn about the options trading industry

  • Outstanding benefits: health, dental, vision, 401K, life, long term disability and commuter plans, Monday morning breakfasts, and lunch + beverages provided daily

  • Competitive salary + equity incentive

What you'll get out of it:

  • Competitive compensation including cash and stock options

  • A company that is young, agile and responsive to great ideas

item.title: Software Engineer - Intermediate Level at M3D LLC (Fulton, MD)
item.description:
Job Description





Here at M3D we value the creativity of our employees and promote free-thinking. We provide our programmers with flexible schedules, and have a large diversity of projects. 



Active Projects:



  • Graphics programing (User interface)

  • Data Processing

  • Control Systems

  • Production automation support software

item.title: Web Developer at AlchemyAPI, an IBM Watson Company (Denver, CO)
item.description:
You’re a developer who loves to optimize process flows and leverage data to build automations. You pride yourself on the ability to move up and down the stack and enjoy tasks like setting up the database schema as much as building out the front-end. If this sounds like you, we’d love to sync up.


We are looking for a full stack web developer who can help with our business analytics, customer flows and marketing site. In this role, you will work with different types of data and develop process efficiencies that generate a positive impact on the business. The right candidate sees the value that data represents and has a strong desire to utilize this asset to derive insights that improve decision making and enhance customer relationships.

item.title: Backend Developer at Wakoopa (Barcelona, España)
item.description:
Wakoopa is a fast growing company from Amsterdam. We have developed a research tool that meters online behavior on computers, phones and tablets in a privacy conscious way. Panel members participate voluntarily to help with online research. We are currently active in over ten countries, across 3 continents, and have tens of thousands panelists active with our software on a daily basis.


Our ambition is to create the best technology for passive metering in the world.


We work with a modern technology stack that is adapted to the unique engineering problems we aim to solve. Our applications are written in Ruby and Go. For our infrastructure needs we try to use Amazon Web Services as much as we can, or build it ourselves. The processing of the large amounts of data we receive is handled by Hadoop, Hive and ElasticSearch.


We are looking for an experienced Backend Engineer who can help us scaling up our data processing backend to support even more panelists. Are you up for the challenge?


Responsibilities:


The amount of data we collect will always be growing and there are a lot of interesting technical challenges which you can help solve. Some examples are:



  • Scalable data processing and storage

  • Automated classification and filtering of data

  • On-the-fly calculations of metrics

  • Solid API to serve client-side applications


What we offer:


Our team is a group of passionate, experienced, all-round engineers. We use a pragmatic and efficient development method. For communication we use the latest tools like Slack and Hangout. We are not afraid to try new things.


You will join our Barcelona office where you will work together with the development team there and also interact frequently with the team in Amsterdam. This can even be face-to-face, allowing you to discover this beautiful city and sharpen your cycling skills.


We offer a competitive compensation package.


What we ask for:


We expect you to take on the challenge of diving into our technology and claim a piece to make it the best in the world.


We want you to be passionate about technology and be able to apply the best tools for the task at hand.


We are looking for a senior engineer but we will also consider your application if your motivation or talent can compensate for your experience.

item.title: Development Data Team Lead at Markit (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
• You will be creating and leading a medium sized, focused team, supporting the data needs of our UI Development team across a variety of clients

  • You have proven success in establishing and growing high performance teams focused on delivering high quality software on time and on budget

  • You have a solid understanding of web development and an in-depth understanding of API development and best practices

  • You fully believe in documentation and building exactly to spec

  • You understand how to build reusable components that have the flexibility to meet multiple clients’ needs


Web Development Culture


We pride ourselves in having a large community of developers who actively support each other through open dialogue and brain storming. We love to solve problems quickly and elegantly while keeping the codebase maintainable and lean. We value a collaborative environment where ideas are valued and exchanged not only through our technology, but together in person, using tools like 50-foot whiteboards, and lots of sticky notes to map out and create sites, apps and tools that help people understand complex information.


What you will do and learn



  • Engineer and maintain high traffic, highly visibility APIs for the world’s largest financial firms and media outlets. (We received 5 billion hits last month).

  • Gain exposure to the stock market and other financial data, while developing APIs that deliver dynamic information from a variety of sources.

  • Use proprietary technologies and standard best practices to build and deliver high performance APIs.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Government Intelligence Team at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
How does government influence finance? What government activities can move financial markets? Which companies benefit from government activities and which are negatively impacted?

The R&D News department is currently working on building brand new products to help financial professionals solve these questions.

The government intelligence team is looking for an enthusiastic, experienced software developer who can start contributing immediately to the success of this exciting new suite of products. A successful candidate should enjoy driving product development by collaborating closely with business stakeholders. The candidate will be tasked to solve a variety of technical problems including ingestion of large unstructured public datasets, discovering actionable data points to alert clients in real time, designing scalable, extensible search and database solutions to aid discoverability and analytics, and designing user interfaces to make sense of confusing government data for the busy financial professionals that make up our target client base.

item.title: Senior Software Developer C++ - Equity Products at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Bloomberg Equity product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make decisions and increase alpha. Our next-generation Equity analytics unlock market data and give our clients unprecedented advantages. Today's Equity product spans a wide gamut of functionality, from fundamentals to estimates, company analysis to peer valuation, idea generation to portfolio construction, and exchange-level tools to macro regional/industrial analysis.

Equity R&D in our New York office is seeking driven and dedicated developers to join our fast-paced team. We develop rich user interfaces as well as powerful backend servers in C++. Developers contribute to all phases of software engineering ranging from requirements through release. Candidates should exhibit strategic thinking, an aggressive drive, and an aptitude for engineering quality software.

item.title: Senior Big Data Software Engineer- $60K at Crossover (Bangalore, India) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you a Senior Software Engineer that has spent several years working with Big Data technologies? Have you created streaming analytics algorithms to process terabytes of real-time data and deployed Hadoop or Cassandra clusters over dozens of VMs? Have you been part of an organization driven by a DevOps culture, where the engineer has end to end responsibility for the product, from development to operating it in production? Are you willing to join a team of elite engineers working on a fast growing analytics business? Then this role is for you!


Job Description


The Software and DevOps engineer will help build the analytics platform for Bazaarvoice data that will power our client-facing reporting, product performance reporting, and financial reporting.  You will also help us operationalize our Hadoop clusters, Kafka and Storm services, high volume event collectors, and build out improvements to our custom analytics job portal in support of Map/Reduce and Spark jobs.  The Analytics Platform is used to aggregate data sets to build out known new product offerings related to analytics and media as well as a number of pilot initiatives based on this data. You will need to understand the business cases of the various products and build a common platform and set of services that help all of our products move fast and iterate quickly. You will help us pick and choose the right technologies for this platform.



Key Responsibilities


In your first 90 days you can expect the following:




  • An overview of our Big Data platform code base and development model




  • A tour of the products and technologies leveraging the Big Data Analytics Platform




  • 4 days of Cloudera training to provide a quick ramp up of the technologies involved




  • By the end of the 90 days, you will be able to complete basic enhancements to code supporting large-scale analytics using Map/Reduce as well as contribute to the operational maintenance of a high volume event collection pipeline.





Within the first year you will:




  • Own design, implementation, and support of major components of platform development. This includes working with the various stakeholders for the platform team to understand their requirements and delivery high leverage capabilities.




  • Have a complete grasp of the technology stack, and help guide where we go next.





Bazaarvoice is a network that connects brands and retailers to the authentic voices of people where they shop. Each month, more than 500 million people view and share authentic opinions, questions and experiences about tens of millions of products in the Bazaarvoice network. Our technology platform amplifies these voices into the places that influence purchase decisions. Network analytics help marketers and advertisers provide more engaging experiences that drive brand awareness, consideration, sales and loyalty. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Bazaarvoice has offices in Chicago, London, Munich, New York, Paris, San Francisco, Singapore, and Sydney.


Total Compensation is $30 / hour

item.title: Back-end developer in fast growing Start-up at Energimolnet by Playback Energy AB (Gothenburg, Sweden)
item.description:
Come help us save the environment and disrupt a whole industry while doing it!


Energimolnet is built to boost the energy sector by making it fun, easy and truly scalable to develop energy related services that improve efficiency and save the environment. We manage billions of data points and provide the world’s most comprehensive infrastructure for collecting and distributing energy data. Our users save energy by using services they already love -- while we automatically extract data from energy bills, utility web-sites and smart-meters.


Grow with us


We are now expanding in Europe and looking for a back-end developer to join our growing team in Gothenburg. Your main responsibility will be to improve our data collection capabilities and implement new features that will help us grow globally. Our stack is highly distributed and we focus on what we do best and let Heroku, MongoLab, Iron, Papertrail, Mailgun, AWS, etcetera do the rest.


Your responsibilities



  • Lead the back-end development for data collection and monitoring as we enter new geographical markets

  • Be part of general planning and architecture decisions regarding cloud infrastructure and API-design.

  • Help our customers with support questions about the API and data collection

  • Pet-projects: Play around with the API and IFTTT to demonstrate and inspire how Energimolnet can be connected to smart lights and web services

item.title: Software Engineer, Performance Data Analytics at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description: The primary goal of the Software Engineer of Performance Data Analytics will be to use SolarCity’s extensive data resources to develop methods and techniques to better integrate widespread solar deployments with the grid.  SolarCity believes that better predictability and optimization of distributed energy systems will provide significant value to grid operators and energy market participants.  The Data Engineer will be responsible for engineering tools for that prediction and optimization.

item.title: Forensisch software engineer big data at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software engineer big data


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren Java-ontwikkelaar?



Binnen het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) werkt een team gedreven softwareontwikkelaars aan vooruitstrevende forensische software. Je draagt in hoge mate bij aan de doorontwikkeling van het forensisch big data-platform Hansken.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Het platform draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren. Denk aan e-mails, chatberichten, GPS-coördinaten en dergelijke.



Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Naast het dienen van een belangrijk maatschappelijk belang is Hansken ook een technisch zeer uitdagend project waar je telkens met nieuwe technieken in aanraking komt. Bij dit R&D-project wordt gewerkt volgens een agile ontwikkelproces, met moderne ontwikkeltools die goed op elkaar aansluiten.



Als forensisch software engineer big data ontwikkel je samen met een team van ongeveer 8 collega’s het platform Hansken verder om onder meer de performance, schaalbaarheid en functionaliteit te verbeteren. Aan het systeem worden hoge eisen aan de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid gesteld. Daarom ben je kritisch over het functioneren ervan, durf je vragen te stellen en sta je open voor feedback. Naast je werk aan het systeem denk je mee over het continu verbeteren van het ontwikkelproces, waarbij de forensische kennis zo goed mogelijk geborgd wordt.

item.title: Senior Developer / Manager with Java and SQL for Telco Big Data Pioneer at mCentric (Las Rozas, Spain) (allows remote)
item.description:
Senior Developer / Manager with Java and SQL for Telco Big Data Pioneer


We are looking for a Senior Developer ready to confidently apply a solid technical and managerial skillset to create new or upgrade current solutions, proposing and defending innovations.


You will be using your experience as a Senior Developer to create and upgrade solutions which interact with the mobile telecommunications core network, familiarising yourself with a multitude of mobile telecommunications protocols, standards and infrastructure variations of those standards. mCentric solutions range from Data Plan Management, xDR Navigation, SIM Registration, Voucher Services, and other basic mobile network solutions which in turn are feeding its data into a dynamic and intelligent promotions platform allowing for precise Microsegmentation applied to intelligent and interactive promotions and reporting. Our solutions are responsible for dealing with billions of events processed per day, millions of concurrent user sessions, and are expected to deliver results in real time. To handle the demand, several of the solutions are built over a Big Data structure. In fact, mCentric solutions are running over the first BDA installed in Africa.

item.title: Senior tester forensische big data at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Senior tester forensische big data


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren tester met kennis van big dataoplossingen?



Je bewaakt bij de groep Software Engineering van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) de kwaliteit van het forensisch big data platform Hansken. Hiervoor ontwikkel je testen en voert ze uit.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Het platform draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren. Denk aan e-mails, chatberichten, GPS-coördinaten en dergelijke.



Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Als senior tester forensische big data geef jij invulling aan al het benodigde testwerk, waarbij je de functionaliteit van Hansken en de forensische integriteit van de resultaten waarborgt.



Bij Hansken wordt gewerkt volgens een agile ontwikkelproces, met moderne ontwikkeltools die goed op elkaar aansluiten. Hierbij geef jij op testgebied concrete invulling aan de sprintplanning. Je denkt daarbij fundamenteel na over het testen van deze complexe software en volgt de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op testgebied. Je zoekt de ontwikkelaars op om in een vroeg stadium testplannen te ontwikkelen en verwerkt deze tot uitvoerbare tests. Daarnaast zet jij het proces op voor het uitvoeren van acceptatietests, coördineer je de testactiviteiten en voert deze ook zelf uit. Je rapporteert de testresultaten aan het team en benadrukt pijnpunten.



Om Hansken continu te kunnen blijven verbeteren, zorg jij er met de ontwikkelaars voor dat testplannen worden omgezet in geautomatiseerde tests. Voor het geautomatiseerd testen van onze applicaties gebruiken wij op dit moment het test framework JBehave in combinatie met de Selenium web driver. Deze tests maken onderdeel uit van een continuous delivery proces, waarbij we vanuit onze issue tracker met 1 druk op de knop Hansken kunnen bouwen, testen en uitrollen.

item.title: Business Systems and Data Developer at Healthwise (Boise, ID)
item.description: The Business Systems and Data Developer is a senior level systems developer responsible for designing, developing, and implementing enterprise-level applications, systems, and data models that support core internal business functions. The Business Systems and Data Developer works closely with the Business Systems and Data Architect, the Business Operations Team and others to implement and integrate systems for Healthwise to solve business problems and support scalable operations.

item.title: Sr. DevOps Engineer - User Data at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio operates a cloud communications service that is distributed with points of presence throughout the globe at a scale of thousands of servers. Because we are mission critical infrastructure for our customers, operational excellence is a key objective and that’s where DevOps comes in as a core competency.


About the job:

Twilio engineers own and run their products and services from conception to continuous operation. DevOps engineers play a key role and are embedded within teams to focus on the operational aspects of our services. 

Responsibilities:

Twilio's User Data engineers develop services to implement RESTful data services, MySQL & DynamoDB databases and power ETL through Kinesis-powered data pipelines. Some operational concerns are availability, throughput, latency as well as data consistency guarantees. Our DevOps engineers are focused on 24x7 availability, performance and manageability concerns of these services. 

You will collaborate with Architects and Engineering leaders to define and develop operational features, tools and processes including:



  • Tools and processes for configuration management of large numbers of databases and services. This includes participating in technology selection and architecture review to ensure zero downtime releases and maintenance as well as enable auto-scaling. 

  • Instrumentation for monitoring the health and availability of services including fault detection, alerting, triage and recovery (automated and manual).

  • Performance management, including benchmarking and monitoring of vital metrics, capacity planning, and resolution of performance problems affecting service levels. 

  • Custom diagnostic and troubleshooting tools. 

  • Developer facing support tools made available via our developer portal and to our customer support organization.

item.title: Trading Solutions - Enterprise Messaging Software Developer (C#/Java/C++) at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Enterprise Connectivity and Integration team is looking for skilled developers to work on its message processing workflow engine and delivery platform. The system balances numerous requirements while merging ETL design, real-time processing, systems programming, web delivery and human computer interaction for graph-based message transformation.
The team is building new functionality and features as we extend our capability with a generic messaging framework that includes routing and processing heavy traffic loads across an array of circumstances. Developers can expect to contribute immediately and will be working on:
-High performance distributed system to support asynchronous workflows, faster fault-recovery.
-Parallel data processing, message enrichment, data transformation and delivery mechanisms all within a high throughput, low latency, secure server environment.
-Open source technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Storm and more.
-Streamlined user interface.

item.title: Tradebook Low-Latency And Algorithmic Trading - Senior C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker, a US ECN, and a technology provider ofcross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting Equities/Futures/Options/FX trading.

Tradebook is building the next generation, ultra-low latency trading platform, which supports multi asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets and grab new opportunities.

Our focus is on developing low latency & real-time black box trading systems, algorithmic trading systems, providing connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions.

R&D Tradebook is looking for a motivated and talented C++ developer to join this effort. You will be working a small group of technologists passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and delivering innovative product solutions. The role involves implementing a high performance technology stack from ground up, designing efficient data structures and services for business functionality, and building a highly available system with throughput of millions of messages per second. Candidates should exhibit an aggressive drive, bias towards action, and a proven aptitude for engineering quality software solutions.

This candidate will also work closely with Sales, Products and Trading Desk from idea generation to implementing and delivering cutting-edge technologies and trading solutions to the market.

Tradebook is seeking developers with project experience in creating systems for:
- Algorithmic Trading
- Black Box Trading
- Market Making
- Risk Management
- Quantitative Analysis
- Event Based Trading
- Solutions for Hedge Funds
- Solutions for Proprietary Trading firms (Prop shops)
- High frequency trading applications
- Low latency trading applications

item.title: Java Developers transforming data into elegant solutions at Landmark Information Group (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
Landmark Solutions developers work on a range of projects, typically for government or public body customers.  Our speciality is transforming data into elegant solutions that deliver insight and value.  We do this mainly by implementing authenticated web services that consume, retrieve, query and modify structured data.  We implement syntactic and semantic validation and business logic and persist the data to relational, data-warehouse and object stores.  Many projects also contain web site user-interfaces.  Our core technology is Java 8 and we utilise many web modern frameworks including Spring 4, Hibernate 4, Google Guice, JDBI, Dropwizard, Jersey and JAX/RS.  We apply an agile development process where possible, centred around Jira, using Bitbucket, git, feature-branches and peer-reviews where possible.



You will be part of a vibrant and ambitious team who are making a real difference to our business by designing and delivering first class software in an environment of dynamic and outcome focused delivery. Our objectives are technically challenging and we deliver products which generate a key part of the business’ revenue. Are you looking for a challenge that will push your boundaries in terms of your personal development, and help contribute to business success through developing innovative solutions for our customers? If so, we’d love to hear from you.


Our developers have an important voice in how our solutions are constructed, so an open and collaborative approach to change is essential. Our teams have great opportunities for personal development and therefore the role would benefit a self-motivated learner.

item.title: JS Engineer, London office based at Monetate, Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
We're actively searching for Javascript Engineers to join our growing technical team in London office.This is a full time, permanent position, based in our London office. You will work with Monetate's delivery team side by side to use Javascript to build experiences for on page experiments for our many significant E-commerce clients. Your content will run on high-traffic web pages and test marketers ideas in real time.

We're looking for self-starters with a deep understanding of data structures and algorithms to tackle tough new challenges and to contribute to the growth of our business and our customers' success. Individual contributions are acknowledged during weekly company meetings and recognized throughout the company. If you're a problem-solver who is passionate about rich web applications, scaling Internet applications to billions of page views, and working with big data, then you're a perfect fit for our close-knit and agile team.



We offer full package of benefits, flexible hours, free lunches and monthly socials with the whole team.


Apply today!  


Please note: this is a London, UK office based position- local applicants only.

item.title: Software Engineer - Istanbul at Hazelcast (Üsküdar, Turkey)
item.description: We are looking for software developers to be involved in all phases (design, development, testing, documentation and support) of Hazelcast software modules.   Qualified candidates should have recent and hands-on experience with Java.   Experience with distributed computing and multi-threaded programming desired.

item.title: Core Financial Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role: 

The Core Financial Applications (CFA) department designs and builds business-critical solutions for a diverse set of customers in the financial industry. Our products include analytical and research applications for equities, fixed income, mortgages, commodities, economics, foreign exchange and financial derivatives. The products we build help traders, investment bankers, corporate treasurers, research analysts and portfolio managers solve complex business problems.

As a software engineer in CFA, you will be responsible for the full development life cycle of key projects. You will learn about finance from our subject matter experts and through Bloomberg University courses. Your ingenuity and enterprise will help improve and progress our products in a highly competitive and challenging marketplace.

Our software engineers are quick, resourceful, flexible and collaborative. They combine their technical skills and product knowledge to craft unsurpassed solutions for our customers.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Derivatives & Cross Asset

The Derivatives & Cross Asset group is one of the fastest growing in both CFA and Bloomberg. We deal with analytics required by a variety of trading, risk management and regulatory reporting applications. The front, middle and back offices of major financial institutions involved in the USD 700 trillion derivatives industry use our products to make sense of the complexity, risks, pitfalls and regulations surrounding these financial instruments. Our derivatives teams meet these challenges by offering a one-stop solution that brings transparency, efficiency and excellence to market professionals.

Fixed Income Pricing

The Fixed Income (FI) Pricing group builds a product that is the market standard for pricing and provides up to date and accurate information to the global financial community. We are focused on building low latency, high throughput systems that employ advanced statistical techniques for generating real-time and accurate pricing information. FI Pricing also builds analytics products that revolutionize the fixed income market place. Our application suite includes high precision pricing algorithms, accurate end-of-day price generation systems, liquidity hubs for storing and retrieving pricing information, sophisticated user interfaces and big data analytics platforms. These products are extensively used by various market players such as portfolio managers, risk officers, analysts and traders.

Foreign Exchange

The Foreign Exchange (FX) group provides market leading analytic functionality and award-winning currency pricing and data. Because FX trades are over the counter (bank to bank; not traded in exchanges), it is important for traders to have transparency into market prices. Our tools provide this service in real-time and allow users to perform FX forwards analytics on them. We develop high visibility applications for FX valuation, idea generation and price discovery workflows, as well as high volume real-time pricing engines.

Commodities

The Commodities group builds products that offer transparency in supply, demand, and pricing of oil, power, natural gas, metals and agricultural goods. We build systems and functionality to house everything from hourly power transmission rates to 15-minute updates on ship movements. Technical opportunities run the gamut from architecting systems to designing databases to UI development. Another aspect of this group is to track and manage the lifecycle of millions of futures and options securities across 100+ exchanges around the world. Our futures and options product makes discoverability of such securities easy, which proves to be a very important for our clients in a dynamic environment.

Economics

The Economics group puts the fundamentals of our economy in front of hundreds of thousands of clients every day. We develop the tools that manage real-time releases of economic statistics coming from governments around the world. We also develop analytics and visualizations of economic data to help users better understand the underpinnings of our financial system.

Equity

The Equity group's product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make investment decisions aimed at increasing alpha. This functionality is among the most used across the Bloomberg terminal and is invaluable to clients. The product allows for clear understanding of vast global data sets spanning 30+ years, big data analytics, real-time alerting and complex financial data. We build applications for discovering and analyzing market trends, aggregating and evaluating analyst predictions, and screening and back-testing investment ideas. The group is made up of fast-paced teams passionate about time-to-market, performance and visual design.

Fixed Income Core

The Fixed Income Core group develops software to support analytics and data that move global fixed income markets. We cover government, corporate, money market, municipal and preferred instruments. Our clients depend on our pricing algorithms, high performance calculation libraries, trading applications and real-time big data analysis to make informed decisions. Our applications are used a million times a day and our APIs are invoked billions of times a day.

item.title: Big Data Software Engineers needed at Abide Financial Ltd (Bristol, UK)

item.title: Senior Computational Scientist at European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) (Hamburg, Germany)

We are looking for a Senior Computational Scientist to join the BioSAXS group of the EMBL.



The successful applicant will be responsible for the design, coordination, implementation and deployment
of software and method developments, ranging from integration of biophysical devices and methods at
the BioSAXS beamline to data collection strategies and subsequent analysis methods. He/she will also
be involved in the user support at a dedicated biological SAXS beamline P12 on PETRA 3 ring utilized by
over a hundred groups per year. All beamline specific developments are to be coordinated with the MX beamline responsibles, as well as Computer and Instrumentation groups.



Methods development requires collaborative maintenance of the existing code base with the other

learning approaches for data analysis and validation.

item.title: Front End Engineer required to create beauty within FinTech at Thought Machine (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a special person to join our fantastic team of Engineers (don’t believe us - check out their profiles on our company page). We use big data and machine learning to create beautiful, data rich yet practical personal finance apps...and that is just the start, our plans are ambitious which means that there is a big opportunity to grow and develop your own role within the team.


You will be working on some of the most exciting and innovative apps in FinTech as we push to revolutionise the industry. Day to day you will be working on a variety of challenging and interesting projects using some the most cutting edge open source frameworks while exploring all of the latest lunch places Old Street has to offer.

item.title: Frontend developer at Wiremind (Paris, France)
item.description:
About Us:


We are a young start-up based in Paris and dedicated to the field of Revenue Management for the transportation sector. We believe in tools that mix business intelligence, applied mathematics, ergonomics and software intelligence to make sense of very large amount of data. We aim to remove unnecessary complexity to our users while allowing them to focus on high-value actions to improve the overall margin of their business.


Our main solution is a saas software for transport companies that let them do their yield and pricing just right.


We are looking for a talented frontend engineer who is ready to work in close relation with the CTO to tackle challenges met by a young technological startup. 


Responsibilities:


You will be in charge of developping new features for the front-end part of our solution.


The back-end part is responsible for extracting data from our client's reservation system, transforming it by applying several steps (standardization, forecasting, pricing algorithms...) and loading it in our managed datastores.


The frontend is a single-page application on which clients can freely modify their pricing position according to realtime adjusted metrics like competitor's prices, daily sale's speed, suggest optimal price... 


Our technological stack is as follow:



  • Backend: Python, SQLAlchemy, Scrapy, Celery, Flask

  • Frontend: AngularJS, D3js

  • Data-store: Postgresql, Elasticsearch


Requirements:



  • Strong Knowledge of Javascript, CSS, HTML

  • Rigourous, autonomous and hard-working


Bonus Points:



  • Working experience with AngularJS or D3js

  • Experience in working in a technological start-up


Other details:


This is a fulltime position located in Paris. 
Please include a brief personalized cover letter (in english or french) with your application.
Salary: Negotiable depending on the profile and degree / training / experience.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Enterprise Evaluated Pricing at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Data License (DL) is Bloomberg's market-leading enterprise reference data product. We build and maintain high-performance systems that process & deliver billions of data points per day. Our customers are key financial players that use our products to power their trading applications, settlement, risk management, corporate action processing, and much more. As a result, they require our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces to a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, CDS, currencies, equities, and futures & options. We interact closely with our business and sales teams and have many opportunities to design and develop innovative solutions to satisfy customer demands.

The Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL) product calculates pricing for over 2 million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. DL delivers this premium evaluated pricing data with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as Net Asset Valuation calculations. We build solutions which calculate, validate, QC and deliver millions of data points in very short amount of time to fulfill client needs throughout the day. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable, and fault-tolerant architecture. To address the scalability needs of this product, we are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop. We are looking to dramatically increase our regulatory statistical offering by adding a suite of new products. These new offerings will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements that have been introduced and are currently being legislated.

In order to help us continue expanding our market share & reach, we are looking for a software developer to help us design and implement flexible, usable, and performant systems. We need a candidate who is detail oriented, has strong communication & problem solving skills, and has the desire to work in a close-knit team environment. Our work atmosphere is fast paced, spirited, and friendly. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of different technologies - C++, Python, Perl, Java, Javascript, Hadoop - whatever it takes to get the job done.

item.title: Data Processing Engineer at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
Your Mission:


Build the appropriate infrastructure to store more than tens of TB of additional data every day, and offer both batch and nearline processing capabilities, at a rate of 300,000 messages per second per datacenter, across six datacenters.


Fully automate the administration of thousands of servers with a fully open source approach using Chef.


Datacenter as a computer: efficient usage of all hardware with a common storage and computation platform using Yarn / Mesos.


High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company.


Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Brilliant Senior Ruby Developer wanted for fast-growing Edtech start-up at RefME (London, UK)
item.description:

Our stack is Ruby on Rails and Node.js, with AngularJS on the front-end. Our iOS and Android apps are written natively, and everything is built in-house. We're constantly experimenting with new technologies and we welcome people who want to push our tech to the edge.

We are looking for driven and talented developers who are interested in building a product that will make a difference every day to our growing user base. Were looking to expand our team with people who like to take ownership of the code they work on; come up with elegant solutions to hard problems; and want to contribute to making RefME a great place to work.


Benefits

You'll have the chance to re-imagine, develop, and deploy a product that is relied upon by thousands of traders every single day.

Why Scarab Research?

Great team – work with a small, cross-functional team of highly skilled engineers (ex-Google, ex-Toshiba R&D).


Lean startup – we apply agile principles both in business and in software development.

item.title: Java Devops Engineer at Spinn3r (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ideal Candidate


We are looking for candidates outside of the U.S. and Canada to maximize our time zone distribution. Ideally there should be least a 4 hour overlap with the Pacific Standard Time Zone (PST / UTC-8). We're based out of San Francisco but are migrating to the international level. If you don't have a natural time overlap with UTC-8 you should be willing to work evenings to be able to communicate easily with the rest of the team.


We're interested in someone comfortable with a generalist and devops role. You should be knowledgeable of standard system administration tasks and have a firm understanding of the role of load balancers and cluster architecture. It's 100x harder to write code if you don't know how the underlying operating system works.


We are also looking for someone with a legitimate passion for technology, big data, and analyzing vast amounts of content.


Culturally, we're a remote company and want to embrace it as a way to reward our employees. We are fine with you working in remote locations as long as you're generally available for communication and are productive.


We want someone to come in full time as a contractor role. I suspect we will need about 40 hours from you per week.  


Job Responsibilities:



  • Understanding our crawler infrastructure and ensuring top quality metadata for our customers. There's a significant batch job component to analyze the output from the crawl to ensure top quality data.

  • Making sure our infrastructure is fast, reliable, fault tolerant, etc. At times this may involve diving into the source of tools like ActiveMQ, Cassandra and understand how the internals work. We contribute a LOT to Open Source development if our changes need to be given back to the community.

  • Building out new products and technology that will directly interface with customers. This includes cool features like full text search, analytics, etc. It's extremely rewarding to build something from ground up and push it to customers directly. 


Architecture:


Our infrastructure consists of Java on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) with the stack running on ActiveMQ, Cassandra, Zookeeper, and Jetty. We use Ansible to manage our boxes. We have a full-text search engine based on Elasticsearch and store our firehose API data within Cassandra.


We have a totally new stack and infrastructure at this point. We recently did a full-stack rewrite and moved all the old code to our new infrastructure. This means we have very little legacy cruft to deal with.


Here's all the cool stuff you get to play with:



  • Large Linux / Ubuntu cluster running with the OS versioned using both Ansible and our own debian packages for software distribution.

  • Massive amount of data indexed from the web and social media.  We index from 5-20TB of data per month and want to expand to 100TB of data per month.

  • Large Cassandra install on SSD.  

  • SOLR / Elastic Search migration / install.  We’re experimenting with bringing this up now so it would be valuable to get your feedback.


Compensation:



  • Salary based on experience. We're willing to be competitive and a great company to work for.

  • Ability to work remotely at home. Live work balance is a must.
