item.title: Communication, News, And Realtime Applications And Services Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
We develop key applications that the financial community relies on to interact with one another and to keep abreast of key news and market moving information. Our responsibilities include communication tools such as Bloomberg's proprietary Email and Instant Message products, Notes and Contact Management systems, News, Market Alerts and Monitoring applications. These are delivered across both desktop and mobile platforms. Our products are built to handle high volume, low latency and high availability. In addition, we build the core systems that form the foundation of applications built by other software groups within Bloomberg.

We have a deep understanding of our product areas and work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to deliver the experience desired by our customers. As the speed of change is rapid we need people who are agile and eager to learn and develop new skills. The ability to collaborate across multiple teams and learn a depth and breadth of technical and domain knowledge is critical.

We frequently work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meet-ups and conferences.

Teams in Communication, News, and Realtime Applications and Services:

Bloomberg Chat

Bloomberg Chat is Bloomberg's instant messaging system. It is used by the entire Bloomberg community for real-time communication to exchange quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. The Bloomberg Chat team in London is responsible for ensuring the fast and efficient distribution of content through our data centers to the client application running on our customers' desktops.

Message and Collaboration

Internet Message - The Bloomberg Message system delivers over 300 million messages every day. The Internet Message system converts messages between email and Bloomberg's proprietary Message format. Software written by the team must be scalable, fault tolerant and secure. Our work also includes evolving and extending our solutions for detecting spam, malware and phishing.

Contact Management - Bloomberg's most popular functions are its communication tools (Message and Chat). Users of these systems need a fast, secure and reliable way to store their contact information. The Bloomberg contact management system contains data on over 50 million contacts, all of which can be queried in under a millisecond. In the last 12 months, we developed a brand new interface, which we continue to evolve. Our focus this year is our backend systems as we work on improving performance and scalability.

Notes - Notes is an exciting new product being developed to further improve the collaboration capabilities of the Bloomberg system. It will enable users to annotate and curate Bloomberg content for quick retrieval and organization, providing insightful ways to analyze user-generated content.

Mobile

The Mobile team has the charge to take Bloomberg's key financial and foundational applications and deliver them to all major mobile platforms. We are a mix of both client side iOS and Android specialists, and other backend developers focused on infrastructure who use their platform native skills mixed with C++ to deliver an immersive mobile experience. Developers are involved in full end to end development of native UI components and the required client and server infrastructure that connects devices to Bloomberg data services. Security and usability concerns are also a major focus for our team.

News Editing & Workflow

The News Editing and Workflow team is responsible for the tools used by the Bloomberg News organization for the timely release of accurate, market moving news. The team also develops the Bloomberg News Automation suite, which generates thousands of news stories per day with minimal latency, which is triggered by realtime Bloomberg market data and events.

News Search

The News Search team owns the search and alerting backend behind the news functionality across Bloomberg. This is one of the most widely used functions on the Bloomberg Terminal. It serves timely, accurate and market moving news to our customers by sifting through hundreds of millions of news stories. Our customers can search, analyze and set alerts for the news that matters to them in milliseconds. Developers work on scalable, low-latency solutions by making use of search and information retrieval technologies, and working with distributed systems running on dedicated farms of machines.

Realtime Applications

Alerts - The Alert product lets market participants monitor the markets. It exposes nearly every tick in the world, along with a broad range of non-pricing data from corporate actions to social media sentiment and even power station outages. The system is available 24/7 and is used by tens of thousands of traders and investors helping them respond quickly to changing market conditions. Alerts are a major strategic focus for the company and we are scaling our infrastructure and extending our feature set significantly.

Monitors - The Monitors team is responsible for providing industry-leading, comprehensive, fully custom cross-asset quote sheet applications. 200,000 of our clients rely on these applications every day. The team deploys Bloomberg's latest proprietary technologies and UI framework by making further UX improvements, while maintaining a strong focus on performance and reliability.

Trade Ideas - The Trade Ideas application allows users to exchange investment research and recommendations in order to demonstrate their skills. The Trade Ideas Platform comprises high-performance distributed multi-threaded services, real-time publishing, both SQL and NoSQL databases, with desktop, web and mobile clients.

item.title: System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services at Peak Games (Istanbul, Turkey)
item.description:
System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services



Peak Games' Technical Operations team (TechOps) is responsible for building, scaling and maintaining highly available systems, and is also the first line of defense against all outages. TechOps detects and solves the issues in a proactive manner. Because of being a service department, TechOps engineers have limitless exposure to all technologies used in the infrastructure of all games, including numerous bleeding edge technologies. We are looking for system engineers that want to automate just about everything you can think of and build a development and deployment pipeline and set of tools that can effectively deliver our games and services. Our team is responsible for automating the entire stack of high performance, large scale, geographically dispersed resources throughout its life-cycle. We have an app stack that will challenge you and diversify your skills. Ideal candidates will have experience of AWS and/or other cloud tech. You will be building our infrastructure in AWS, EC2 or our own private hardware and software resources. You will work side by side with our engineering teams and architects to design and implement a scalable and robust cloud delivery infrastructure.


Major Responsibilities/Activities



  • Work closely with the engineering teams to design, deliver and manage our services with high uptime

  • Participate in failure, load and performance tests to ensure applications are production ready

  • Ensure security of the production infrastructure, systems and applications

  • Engage in the development of continuous integration strategy. Define, develop and maintain CI processes and systems

  • Automate, implement, administer, and maintain our databases, local and cloud-based servers including provisioning, backups and restores, upgrades, and monitoring

Come join a dynamic startup while learning the latest technology, Big Data, Cloud based platforms, and business analytics. You will work with other team members to build testing frameworks, insure quality of our products and develop methodology around best practices for performance and integration. The fast paced, startup culture of Logentries makes it the ideal place to advance your career and quickly gain experience in a vast variety of areas.

item.title: Infrastructure Production Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Bloomberg Careers - Infrastructure Production Developer 


The Role:


Bloomberg's Infrastructure Production group in R&D delivers a wide range of technologies for the Bloomberg environment. The team builds out common services that every Bloomberg team can use and consume to monitor, visualize and diagnose their applications and infrastructure. We also are the forefront in implementing modern technology ideology within the organization and assist all of the teams with implementation, automation and design. The Production Engineering team is a new team inside of the Bloomberg environment and is one of the most fast paced and soon to be widely used across the entire company. You will have the ability to be apart of a large cultural shift within the Bloomberg organization. If you like large scale systems, billions of data points a day, automating all of the things, hacking on opensource software and making a cultural impact, ask us where to sign up.


What You'll Do:



  • Design, architect, automate and deliver large scale production ready services for Bloomberg Employees to consume.

  • Build internal tools to monitor, visualize and diagnose all aspects of applications & hardware in the Bloomberg stack.

  • Work closely with our product and platform teams with architecture, design and scaling challenges they may have.

  • Help teams replace legacy software and design patterns with modern technologies.

  • Develop and maintain documentation, training and SLAs for managed infrastructure

item.title: Cloud Application Security Architect at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio Security Architects are responsible for securing the architecture of Twilio’s platform. The Security Architect will be a core member of the Security team focusing on securing and designing networks and applications that process the immense amount of data we capture every day.


About the job: 



  • As an experienced infrastructure-security engineer, you will be securing architecture that is instrumental in operating globally available, resilient and highly performant services used by hundreds of thousands of developers and apps.

  • Successful candidates will be strong network and operational security engineers with deep experience in raising the security posture of cloud-based networks, systems and applications.

  • You will also rely on your application-development background to lend understanding to a development-centric company.


Responsibilities:



  • Drive the technologies and policies needed to secure Twilio's data.

  • Work with the engineering teams to help choose technologies, design system architecture and threat-model systems.

  • Work with product management on practical prioritization and with engineering teams on technical approaches to improve security posture.  Drive and own projects that improve Twilio's security architecture, such as Credential Management, Authorization & Access.

  • Coordinate with Sales Operations and Legal help understand new requirements and impact to customers.

item.title: Software Developer: Casual Data-Driven Firm at TFS Capital (West Chester, PA)
item.description:
TFS Capital LLC is a boutique asset management firm in West Chester, PA. We are seeking a well-rounded software developer to join our development team. This developer will help maintain and expand our proprietary automated data-driven trading systems. As a key member of a small development team, you will be an integral part of all aspects of our mission-critical trading infrastructure. In addition to working with existing systems, you will be assisting with making and implementing design decisions for new and improved data and software architecture. The position is full-time in our West Chester, PA office.


Technology is at the heart of our business. At TFS, you and the rest of the technology team will work directly with traders, quants, and portfolio managers to solve interesting and challenging problems using technology. Your actions will directly impact the success of our business.


TFS Capital will not consider applicants who require H1-B Visa sponsorship for this position.


Key responsibilities



  • Work with the rest of the development team to expand and maintain the firm’s proprietary software systems

  • Work directly with the trading desk, analysis team, portfolio managers, and other business groups to support existing systems and implement new ideas

  • Onboard new, diverse, large datasets and create appropriate ETL processes


About the IT Team
We are a small team of developers and operations admins who work together to develop, maintain, and expand our in-house trading software. In addition to our code, we integrate and assist with development of code from other teams, including the traders and analysts. We work directly with traders and analysts daily, and most of the TFS team on a regular basis.


We’re primarily a Windows shop, but use Linux where it fits best. The bulk of our software is written in Java, but we also have a ton of Perl and MATLAB, and some Python and C#. We use Microsoft SQL Server for relational data storage.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Bloomberg Mail Infrastructure at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Bloomberg Mail is a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and many other types of communication on the Bloomberg Terminal. Our users rely on Bloomberg Mail because of its real-time performance, massive scale, ironclad security, tight integration with financial data and applications on the Bloomberg Terminal, unique features like message retraction and "your message was read!" notification, machine learning-based message classification and, most importantly, singular access to the Bloomberg network of 350,000 financial professionals. We are looking for exceptional Senior Software Engineers who are interested in designing and building the next generation of this unparalleled product.

Our system is built on top of Open Source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available, large-scale distributed system includes a comprehensive storage and search infrastructure, real-time email transport and delivery pipeline, real-time classification engine for user-based and machine learning-based tagging, APIs for integration with other applications and systems, as well as a feature-rich and powerful user-interface optimized for our specialized customers.

The Mail team is looking for C/C++ experts who are interested in working on high-performance infrastructure. A developer in this role will work in a highly distributed, multi-threaded environment on problems including indexing and retrieval of mail and files for both core databases and Search, APIs to that data for internal clients, and ensuring stability and scalability of a system that has increased its traffic 20% year over year for the last five years.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Keen IO (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Keen IO is seeking engineers to join our Platform team. We build and nurture an Analytics API that processes user data and queries around the clock, across diverse industries. Whether it’s gaming, e-commerce, advertising, publishing, or IoT, our platform aims to make Analytics so easy for developers that they can focus entirely on their product. Every day, every week, every month our challenge is to scale with a constantly growing data deluge and evolve along with our user’s needs.


About the Platform Team


We work together in a pretty novel fashion - servant leaders are elected from the team, by the team. Responsibilities normally held by a single manager are separated across multiple roles. We have very open discussions about our shared priorities.


We’re always iterating on how we work and what we build. We’re growing fast and we know that what worked a year ago won’t necessarily work a year from now. This applies both to the technology and the organizations of our teams. We want to provide the best analytics experience for developers and co-create the best work environment for each other - willingness to evolve is essential.


About the Job


By centralizing a data pipeline for hundreds of companies, we operate at a scale that none of them have to worry about. Looking to the horizon, we need to look at every piece of our infrastructure with a critical eye. We need to stay ahead of the curve. You will help us be thoughtful and deliberate about tackling the right bottlenecks at the right time. You’ll help make working on the platform easier and easier. You’ll have the opportunity to gain deep understanding of distributed systems and teach others! Most importantly, you’ll collaborate with some pretty amazing humans.

item.title: Research Analyst - Cybersecurity at Institute for Defense Analyses (Alexandria, VA)
item.description:
Overview


The Operational Evaluation Division (OED) has an immediate career opening for an Analyst with operational or research experience to support cybersecurity assessments during operational testing of the effectiveness, suitability, and cybersecurity of Major Acquisition Programs in the Department of Defense.  IDA takes great pride in the rigor, quality, and timeliness of its analyses, which are produced in an atmosphere that encourages independent thinking and objective results.  Work at IDA is conducted in a team environment and often involves a multi-disciplinary approach. 


Responsibilities


The Analyst will support and advise mid- and senior-level civilian and military Department of Defense regarding cybersecurity operational test and evaluation of Major Acquisition Programs.  The position involves analyzing the design, execution, and results of operational testing for cybersecurity to provide independent assessments to the Director, Operational Test and Evaluation.  Close interaction with officials responsible for the planning, development, and execution of such assessments and operational tests is required.  Strong scientific and technical skills, particularly in the area of quantitative analyses, are required, as well as the ability to speak and write clearly, think analytically, and work independently.  Travel is required.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer ASP.NET C# at Frontiers (Lausanne, Switzerland)
item.description:
We are looking for a senior software engineer ASP.NET to join our Software Engineering team and take responsibility for one remote development team.
Your primary responsibilities include:



  • Lead the offshore development team to implement technical and functional improvements to our website and the integration of third party products.

  • Identify opportunities to improve and accelerate the Frontiers platform, both technically and functionally, and coach the team in new technologies.

  • Deep dive in performance and quality improvements.

  • Focus on delivering and maintaining an excellent user experience.

item.title: Team Lead Platform at Watty AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Watty is connecting and making sense of the world's energy data in order to help consumers and companies use energy in smarter way. Our platform already handles 20 million data points per day - and it will be your your job to continue improving our platform to handle a 1000 times more. You will be involved in the whole development cycle from planning to coding and testing to deployment. You would make sure that the development processes flows smoothly to ensure our continuous deployment. You will lead the backend team that currently has two developers and you will report to Watty’s CTO.


Without a strong passion for what we do, and for developing your own skills, you'll find the work here too difficult.


The role offers a unique opportunity to take ownership over Watty's entire platform that may well handle a significant portion of the world's energy data within the next 10 years. You'll work alongside a passionate team that has built the market leading technology in the field of disaggregation. As the Platform Team Lead you will not only be part of the team but also of the company through equity compensation. Read more on watty.io.

item.title: Web Crawling Frontend Developer at Bloomberg LP (Princeton, NJ)
item.description:
The Role:

Data Technologies R&D in our Princeton, NJ office is seeking a talented, motivated UI programmer to assist in re-imagining and development of our Web Crawler creation application suite. Bloomberg's web crawling technologies are some of the most advanced web scraping capabilities in the world. Candidate must be experienced in designing and coding applications, possess strong object-oriented analysis and design skills, and have experience with web technologies (html, xml, xslt, http). Candidate should have significant experience in the areas of multi-threading and design patterns.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer at Intent Media (NY, NY)
item.description: As a Sr. Software Engineer at Intent Media you’ll code and innovate for new products and scaling initiatives that are changing the E-commerce industry. Our engineering teams implement exceptional user experiences; help some of the world's leading travel companies and make smart decisions based on data; and enable our customers to serve tens of millions of ads every day. We're also in the midst of expanding our products to sites around the world. Your first assignment will be to work on Search Compare Ads or Property Price Ads, two of our products that are currently experiencing exceptional growth. You'll tackle a fascinating functional task: taking an already high-throughput platform that's operating in a handful of countries and expanding it with a truly international rollout. You'll collaborate with other software engineers, QA engineers, product managers and data analysts. Beyond our core Java platform, you'll employ a breadth of technologies including Javascript, analytic SQL, Ruby and more.

item.title: iOS Developer at Jongla Oy (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Want to develop a mobile messaging app for our worldwide user base? We are looking for an iOS Developer to join our awesome team in Helsinki!


As we are rapidly growing, we are looking for a new iOS Developer to join our team. Your job is to design and develop our constantly evolving iOS app. If you have a vision for the future of mobile messaging and the desire to make history, join us!


The more of these you know, the better:



  • iOS app development with Xcode, Objective-C, Git

  • UIkit, Core Data, Core Animation, Storyboards and GCD

  • Debugging with LLDB

  • XMPP protocol

  • Ability to write clean, high quality code and refactor and optimize existing

  • Fluent English skills (working language)


For further information, please download Jongla app and ping our developer João: +358 50 447 7050, joao@jongla.com.


About Jongla


We are a team of 22 guys and girls representing 13 different nationalities. The cultural richness is not only fun, but a great advantage for the development of a global application too.



  • Appreciative, friendly and family-like atmosphere

  • Flexible hours and remote working supported

  • Great benefits like extended health care

  • Always good coffee, tea and fruits


Apply today


Join us to build the most innovative and user-friendly messaging app out there! Send your application to jobs@jongla.com with the title “iOS Developer” 26th of August the latest! Please, tell us about your projects to showcase your skills. Include your CV and salary request too. Non-EU citizens need a work permit in Finland.


http://get.jong.la

item.title: Application Developer For IB - Instant Messaging Product at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Instant Bloomberg (IB) is Bloomberg's instant messaging system, which is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. We have a user-base unlike any other in the company and handle close to 250 million post events per day. This usage is expected to grow even more in the future.

The IB Application team is responsible for developing/maintaining new client facing features to keep our product competitive and also cater to the growing demands of our clients. We work very closely with our clients and business representatives to seek requirements and implement creative solutions. This position also requires collaborating closely with our core infrastructure teams for UI development thereby providing great opportunities for learning and networking.

item.title: Senior C++ Software Engineer at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
The nX Systems R&D team, based in Lugano - Switzerland, is seeking an experienced software engineer with an in-depth knowledge of C++.

You will build resilient, scalable, high-performance back-ends for critical client-facing financial applications.

You will be responsible for the full process of software delivery, starting from feature definition through scoping, implementation, debugging, rollout, monitoring, and maintenance. This includes software development and engineering tasks, as well as coordination and communication.

item.title: Principal Platform Architect at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
The Principal Platform Architect is responsible for the design and implementation of Coupang’s backend platform.  Successful candidate will work in a collaborative environment with Coupang’s architecture committee to recommend improvements to our platform.  The candidate will also work closely with strategic agile teams developing new components to enhance the services provided to Coupang’s customers.


Joining the Coupang USA team will give you an opportunity to work with a world-class development team on disruptive technologies and applications including:



  • Highly Scalable and Reliable services oriented architecture

  • Big Data Analytics supporting data collection, modeling, and optimization

  • Strategic domains such as mobile payments, pricing, search, personalization, and supply chain management

  • Consumer driven web and native mobile interfaces and APIs

item.title: Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you wish to work on technologies like Java, Scala, Git, Linux, Bash, Splunk, AWS EC2?


If yes, keep reading…


We are hiring a Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala for our HERE Places team.



About the Team


The HERE Places API team is a part of the HERE Search and Places group. We work with an agile process and every team member gets the opportunity to analyse, develop and test software. The team supports the analysis of usage data, monitoring of production systems as well as supporting clients of the API.


The API layer is implemented in Scala and we are committed to test-driven development and pervasive automation of everyday tasks. 


We run extensive functional and performance test suites upon every commit. We also make extensive use of Java in the search backend as well as JavaScript for our playground and demo UIs.



Key Responsibilities



  • End-to-end delivery of new features of the HERE Places API  


         -Work with Product Management to analyse requirements


         -Plan and implement new features in cooperation with other teams


         -Ensure quality of software and documentation


         -Click the Release Button



  • Evolve the existing automated testing and deployment architecture as needed to fulfill new requirements

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer - Complex Systems (f/m) at Delivery Hero (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We're a young Delivery Hero spin-off and we’ve taken on a large and complex problem. We’re building a real-time distributed system which connects to multiple data sources. Our daily lives include asynchronous messages, conflicting data, a rich data model, open ended problems, NP algorithms, pair programming, discussing (and implementing) unconventional solutions, and lots of Python coding. If this sounds like how you’d like to spend your time, please get in touch with us.





Your Mission:




  • Work with the team to design and build a complex real-time distributed logistics system

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Machine Learning at Workday (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Please Note: 
- This position requires existing work-authorization in the United States.
- If you don't already have U.S. work authorization, please don't submit your resume.


About the Team:
SYMAN is the agile data-engineering team within Workday. We build predictive analytics into Workday’s applications to help the world’s largest companies make strategic decisions about their people and finances. We are the former Identified team recently acquired by Workday.


This is an opportunity to contribute to the technology behind data normalization, search relevance, recommendation systems, and machine learning. And you’ll need to accomplish all this while achieving horizontal scalability and high availability.


We have retained our startup culture and are continuing to apply our agile principles within the larger organization. We don’t believe in QA for the kind of work we do, so the burden of quality falls on the developers. We practice scrum, pair programming, extensive automated testing, and continuous deployment. We expect that you have 3-5 years’ experience and a CS related degree.


Does this describe you working on a new generation data development team in a fast pace environment? If yes, please apply!

item.title: Software developers wanted in Central London (.NET, C#) at Voiceflex (London, UK)
item.description:
Voiceflex are a long-established telecoms carrier specialising in voice and data communication services across a wide-range of markets.


We are looking for bright, motivated developers to join our team. You will not only maintain and extend our existing range of products, you will help define our software methodologies and processes in a friendly, supportive environment.


You will primarily have experience in .NET, but will happily be open to trying out new technologies and new frameworks – the right tool for the job. You will be pragmatic, resourceful and not afraid to get your hands dirty every once in a while.

item.title: Write Code, Learn from the Best, Change the World! at Literacy Bridge (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
If you want to learn and apply a broad range of technologies while helping the world’s poorest people avoid hunger and deadly diseases, then this unique opportunity may be for you. Through partnerships with organizations like UNICEF, Literacy Bridge uses technology to help people in some of the world’s most remote villages, often without electricity, learn to grow more food and stay healthy.  We do this today for 175,000 people; with your help, we will reach millions more.


You will be Literacy Bridge’s first full-time software engineer, working in a startup-like environment with the mentorship of volunteer senior engineers from places like Twitter, BMW, Zillow, Groupon, Tableau Software, and the Apache Software Foundation. You will work on a broad range of projects such as our:



  • Java-based audio content management system to allow people around the world to contribute local-language audio recordings of health and agriculture knowledge


  • Java-based usage statistics data gathering system integrated with visual data analysis and reporting


  • C-based firmware of our Talking Book audio computer, a battery-operated device with an innovative audio-based interface and the ability to conduct and track quizzes on knowledge retention


Note about working remotely: To work remotely, we would require an initial 3-6 months in Seattle, U.S., and ongoing semi-annual visits for one or two weeks.


You would also have the opportunity to travel to Ghana to meet with our users, partners, and local staff.

item.title: SAP HANA Test Cloud (Senior) Developer Job at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.As a member of the SAP HANA Infrastructure team you are equally in charge for preparing the playgrounds for new innovative development tasks as well as for constructing and operating a stable productive environment to support our fully automated development process. Backed by a data center full of high end servers we do more than just Continuous Integration. We do state-of-the-art C++ development based on Open Source components like Linux, Jenkins, Bugzilla, Gerrit, Git, CMake and Python that have proven to be a solid base for large scale development. Be excited about all the impressive things we do in addition to produce great software.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

As a (Senior) Developer in the SAP HANA Database team you will be working with a group of exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. You will need to:
- Develop and improve the HANA build- & test infrastructure
- Debug complex SAP HANA infrastructure issues
- Administrate, monitor and maintain SAP HANA infrastructure components and test servers Your tasks will also include:
- Close cooperation with the SAP HANA Database development, enabling core developers to provide new coding in quality as fast as possible
- Continuously improve the quality of the SAP HANA Database by implementing new quality measures

WORK EXPERIENCE

- 3+ years of relevant work experience

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

Required skills We require that you meet the core competencies and skills listed below:
- Advanced skills & experience with Linux/ Unix, network & storage system
- Very good analytical skills, familiarity with root cause analysis, debugging and analyzing complex problems
- Knowledge of cutting-edge approaches in software quality assurance
- Basic knowledge of data base architectures
- Ability to work well in close teamwork in an distributed team over several international locations
- German and English both spoken and written Programming knowledge:
- Good knowledge of software architecture and object-oriented design
- Python and Shell-Scripting Preferred skills A plus will be skills in:
- Using Git, Gerrit, Jenkins & Bugzilla APIs
- Perl & C++
- Parallel programming/distribution strategies for data or tasks
- Code profilers & code checkers like CPP checker or address sanitizer
- GNU Make, CMake, Ninja
- Cluster file systems (GPFS, OCFS)101014132

item.title: Mobile iOS Developer (f/m) at UBIMET GmbH (Wien, Österreich)
item.description:
UBIMET has its headquarters in Vienna, Austria and ranks among the leading weather service providers in Europe. International experts in the fields of meteorology, physics, biology and geography issue customized, individual and precise weather forecasts for several millions private and industrial customers in many countries. The company founders and the shareholder (Red Bull) pursue the goal to be the weather service with the world's best quality forecasts. In order to deal with a rapidly growing number of potential clients, we are looking for highly skilled, exceptional people to reinforce our team in the position of


Mobile iOS Developer (f/m)


(iOS, Full-time)


As part of the Mobile Development team you will develop the latest and greatest mobile weather apps. This is an amazing opportunity to be involved in every step of the development process, from brainstorming product ideas, to pushing apps outside the door.


Key Responsibilities



  • Development of intricate and innovative native weather apps

  • Participation and contribution in all phases of the product development lifecycle, including requirements definition, specifications, development, testing, product release and maintenance

  • Contribution to the existing mobile app portfolio for B2C markets

  • Maintainance and development of new features for existing apps

  • Implementation of Proof of Concepts for internal projects

  • Close intra-departmental collaboration with User Experience Designers and the Meteorological Development team

We offer

  • Excellent career opportunities

  • Comprehensive training within a friendly atmosphere

item.description: The person will be included in ground-breaking projects on customer sites where he will have the ability to partake in decisions from inception, architectural definition and requirements definition for development and deployment teams.

item.title: Computer Systems Support Administrator at Institute for Defense Analyses (Alexandria, VA)
item.description:
Overview


This position, under general supervision, provides technical support, Help Desk, and administration for IDA’s endpoint systems and client based services. Responsibilities can include the preparation, configuration, installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, or disposal of all end point systems. Duties can also include the coordination, maintenance, troubleshooting, resolution, and follow-up of Help Desk tickets, Change Requests, and administrative duties. Due to the nature of this position, and the requirement for extended coverage, this position may be required to work hours outside of a regular schedule.


Responsibilities


1.Assembles, configures, delivers, implements, maintains, and provides technical support and user assistance for a variety of multiplatform endpoint systems, telecommunications, conference support (audio-visual) equipment, and client based services. Ensures component compatibility with existing baseline and network architectures, compliance with corporate IT policy, and staff member requirements though a consultation process.
2.Processes, coordinates, troubleshoots, resolves and provides technical assistance in support of Help Desk tickets and Change requests. Maintains the customer support service areas and provides customer assistance with portable endpoint systems.
3.Performs a range of administrative tasks to include warranty and license maintenance, records management, configuration management, office administration, scripting problem resolutions, conference support schedules, and maintaining the tape/disk library and media libraries for offsite storage,
4.Assists in the development, design, and architecture of new technological solutions; participates in systems research, testing, and software command scripting.
5.Performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


•Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar science or engineering discipline or equivalent work experience in related field.
•One year minimum experience, 2 to 3 years preferred, supporting microcomputer software, hardware, associated peripherals, networks, and computer user support.
•Experience with Microsoft Windows operating systems; experience with Mac, UNIX and Linux desired.
•Working knowledge of Ethernet, TCP/IP, network cabling, wireless, and remote access methodologies.
•Must be self-motivated and able to work with general to no supervision.
•Must be willing to work hours outside of a regular schedule.
•Ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal form and with all levels of employees; possess good interpersonal skills.
•Ability to obtain and maintain appropriate Security Clearances.
•Possess or able to obtain DoD 8570 IAT certification within six months of hire strongly preferred.


IDA is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that is free from discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, marital status, genetic characteristic or any other legally protected condition or characteristic.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer Java/Big Data at Criteo (Grenoble, France)
item.description:
CRITEO is looking to recruit senior software developers who turn it up to eleven for its R&D Center in Grenoble (South-East from France). Your main missions will be to :


- Build systems that make the best decision in 50ms, half a million times per second. Across three continents and six datacenters, 24/7.


- Find the signal hidden in tens of TB of data, in one hour, using over a thousand nodes on our Hadoop cluster. And constantly keep getting better at it while measuring the impact on our business.


- Get stuff done. A problem partially solved today is better than a perfect solution next year. Have an idea during the night ? Code it in the morning, push it at noon, test it in the afternoon and deploy it the next morning.


- High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company. But if a single bug goes through, the Internet goes down (we’re only half joking).


- Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: (Associate) Developer for SAP HANA Database Development Infrastructure Job at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.The SAP HANA Database is the basis for new, ground-breaking SAP applications and is widely agreed to be a highly valuable asset in the SAP software portfolio. In-memory computing is made possible through recent technology advances in main memory, multi-core processing, and data management. It leverages technology innovation to establish real-time analysis of business data and combines both transactions and analytics to improve existing business processes with a dramatic increase in performance. The SAP HANA Database as basis for the in-memory computing shows enormous promise as a key driver for the SAP market of the future. The SAP HANA Database Infrastructure team develops the infrastructure for the SAP HANA Database developers. It supports continuous integration of C++ coding into the SAP HANA Database core engine, featuring state-of-the-art bug & patch tracking, code review, sophisticated automated testing facilities and advanced release management systems. Major components are Git, Gerrit, Jenkins and Bugzilla with custom-tailored extensions in conjunction with in-house developed software. We seek graduates to extend our SAP HANA Infrastructure team.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

As an (Associate) Developer in the SAP HANA Database team you will be working with a group of exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. You will need to:
- Develop and improve the HANA build- & test infrastructure
- Debug complex SAP HANA infrastructure issues
- Administrate, monitor and maintain SAP HANA infrastructure components and test servers Your tasks will also include:
- Close cooperation with the SAP HANA Database development, enabling core developers to provide new coding in quality as fast as possible
- Continuously improve the quality of the SAP HANA Database by implementing new quality measures
- Work closely together with the SAP HANA Build team and the SAP HANA Delivery team

WORK EXPERIENCE

We seek an (Associate) Developer (0-2 years work experience). We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path. Your set of application documents should contain a cover letter and tabular CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references (if available).

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

We require that you meet the core competencies and skills listed below:
- Programming knowledge: - Good knowledge of software architecture and object-oriented design - Python and Shell-Scripting
- Advanced skills & experience with Linux/ Unix, network & storage system
- Very good analytical skills, familiarity with root cause analysis, debugging and analyzing complex problems
- Knowledge of cutting-edge approaches in software quality assurance
- Eagerness to improve quality of the continuous integration process for software written in C++
- Basic knowledge of data base architectures
- Ability to work well in close teamwork in an distributed team over several international locations
- German and English both spoken and written A plus will be skills in:
- Using Git, Gerrit, Jenkins & Bugzilla APIs
- Perl & C++
- Parallel programming/distribution strategies for data or tasks
- Code profilers & code checkers like CPP checker or address sanitizer
- GNU Make, CMake, Ninja
- Cluster file systems (GPFS, OCFS)101014132

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice that one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lightweight Java8 backend running on DropWizard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


This job requires extensive Java programming language experience and also the knowledge of how modern Java is done. We favor lightweight frameworks like DropWizard, we value a good domain model (DDD), we think in single responsibility (micro)services, we prefer good refactoring skills, pragmatism and craftsmanship.

item.title: Senior Backend Developer / Sys Admin at Greenhouse Innovation (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Greenhouse Innovation is looking for an ambitious, entrepreneurial back-end developer with System & Database Administrator experience, that helps us pave the way forward. You've been around the block in Back-end Land, but good is not yet good enough for you. Your view is broad: you don't hesitate to show your skills in other disciplines and enjoy bringing a team to a higher level.

We're proud of all our products, but in particular:



  • Selly: Our online retail platform featuring apps, backend & sites for shopping centres, shop keepers and consumers (sellyshopping.com)

  • Snipperwall: Leading the social conversation platform (snipperwall.com)

  • Snipper: The one-minute social video app (getsnipper.com)


This job posting allows you to work in these projects (and others on the horizon)


About the job
You'll help us extend & harden our Java-based backend infrastructure, help us make the jump to scaling it architecturally, server-wise, database-wise, storage-wise and code-wise.

You can help us streamline our database storage and retrieval for working on a globally scalable level, and maintain and improve our servers and toolsets both for internal and external use through the application of good tools and smart technologies.

Buzzwords to help you decide
MySQL meets NoSQL, Java, Tomcat, XML, JSON, HTTP, REST, Jersey, Jenkins, OAuth, async programming, map/reduce, scalability, security, Apple PNS/Google Cloud messaging, Cloud providers (Amazon AWS in particular), scripting (bash, python etc) and Linux/Unix knowledge is a must!


Note: You need an EU work permit for this job

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Advidi (Amsterdam, Nederland)
item.description:
If you would like to be involved in shaping the future of internet advertising (innovation), develop features which will be exposed to hundreds of millions of users every day (big data), go off the beaten path to design and develop high performance and high availability web applications (challenges), then you will be pleased with what Advidi has to offer. The Advidi SOA is composed of multiple critical components which are handling large amounts of live traffic and is the backbone of our business workflow. Thus, high availability, zero-downtime and minimum response times are critical.


We like to organize ourselves in small, focused, autonomous teams (4 or 5 developers and a product owner). You will have a say in architecture, planning, and how new product features are designed. During the trimester planning, you’ll also have the opportunity to bring your ideas to the table and take part in planning new features and initiatives.


As a Senior Software Engineer you will be responsible for the development of exciting new features for the company’s core software products and for extending and maintaining our SOA. We are looking for people who love clean code, work in a test-driven manner, would like to work on projects that add value to business and would enjoy working within an inspirational environment.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at ICFLIX (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will be a part of a small, geographically distributed, cross-functional DevOps team that is massively scaling icflix Solutions cutting edge streaming platform infrastructure. This team is committed to delivering the highest systems uptime and operations transparency. The global team provides a matrix approach to 24x7 infrastructure engineering and support services.


Do you crave the adrenaline rush of supporting the production infrastructure that powers MENA’s first online streaming platforms offering thousands of hours of Arabic, Hollywood, Bollywood content to over 400 million people?  Are you a fanatic when it comes to quashing operational inefficiencies in web infrastructure?  Do you get a kick out of automating routine tasks with a few lines of code? Do you exemplify the ethic of, “If you have to do something more than once, automate it”?

item.title: Engineering Manager - Billing & Payments Infrastructure at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio is seeking an Engineering Manager for our Billing & Payments Infrastructure team. This is a leadership role, reporting to the Sr. Engineering Manager of Billing & User Data, focused on nurturing and expanding a team of engineers, providing people management, and driving projects to successful, on-time delivery through our agile process.


About the job:


Twilio is a company built by developers for developers. You must not only have the professional expertise to understand your team’s engineering and business challenges, but also the technical acumen to build great software.


Responsibilities:



  • Partner with the Technical Lead to make long-term architectural decisions about Twilio's micro-transaction platform.

  • Take personal responsibility as the delivery manager and set clear expectations for Finance and R&D billing integrations.

  • Work directly with Technical Lead and Product Manager to track velocity and plan sprints for the engineering team.

  • Manage & grow a world-class team of engineers that think about the customer experience.

  • Own quarterly deliverables with highly-visible and effective communications with Senior Management in R&D and Finance departments.

  • Manage your direct reports in an empathetic, high-touch way, including weekly/bi-weekly 1:1s. Coach and unblock them on a daily basis. Encourage and teach them to drive to complete key objectives. Assist in their longer term career and skills development. Excite them with new challenges and opportunities.

item.title: Forensisch software architect at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software architect


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Word jij enthousiast van cutting edge frameworks en nieuwe technologieën?



Je vertaalt bij het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) de wensen van stakeholders naar concrete oplossingen. Dit doe je bij de groep Software Engineering, in het bijzonder voor het forensisch big data-platform Hansken.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Hansken draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren, denk  aan e-mails, chatberichten en GPS-coördinaten. Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Naast het dienen van een belangrijk maatschappelijk belang is Hansken ook een technisch zeer uitdagend project waar je telkens met nieuwe technieken in aanraking komt.



Als forensisch software architect ben jij voor Hansken de persoon die de wensen van stakeholders vertaalt naar concrete oplossingen. Je bent communicatief sterk en kunt Hansken uiteenzetten aan klanten en het management. Samen met ontwikkelaars beoordeel je nieuwe technologieën en frameworks op toepasbaarheid in de huidige architectuur. Vervolgens zorg je dat deze gebruikt worden. Je trekt de kar bij het besluitvormingsproces over gebruikte technologie en (technische) ontwerpbeslissingen op abstract niveau. Hierbij neem je onderbouwd besluiten en verdedig je deze. Bovendien leg je de architectuur vast en bewaak je deze.



Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van Hansken. Je bewaakt de afgesproken principes en kwaliteitsrichtlijnen. Tot slot zul je zelf weinig ontwikkelen, maar beoordeel je wel kritisch de ontwikkelde code en zorg je dat deze voldoet aan de afgesproken architectuur.

item.title: Trading, Analytics And Execution Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
The Role:

The Trading, Analytics, and Execution teams at Bloomberg develop technology that ensures that the global financial markets run smoothly. The applications and infrastructure built by our teams connect supply and demand, across all asset classes, on worldwide exchanges. Trillions of dollars of capital move through our systems daily; and as a result, market leaders rely on us to flawlessly and seamlessly manage their positions and execute their orders.

We help our clients navigate an increasingly complex business with best-in-class tools to manage risk and regulation. Using the latest technology in our enterprise analytic tools, we provide unique insights that enable our clients to make better investment decisions.


Teams in Trading, Analytics and Execution:

Asset and Investment Manager (AIM) Trading Solutions

AIM is a large-scale, high-performance, distributed software system that is fully hosted and managed. AIM delivers unparalleled, multi-asset, hosted solutions for Order Management, Electronic Trading and Execution, Portfolio Management and Back Office activities. Derivatives are a growing area of focus for Bloomberg & the AIM business. The AIM Derivatives team is responsible for the maintenance and development of multiple existing applications covering Foreign Exchange (FX), Credit Default Swaps (CDS) and Interest Rate Swaps (IRS) derivatives trading. Our software is also closely involved with global regulations and our customers rely on AIM to ensure their compliance with the complex and evolving regulatory landscape.

Enterprise Connectivity and Integration

The Enterprise Connectivity and Integration team moves data between Bloomberg's Enterprise products and client systems. Our user interface provides the user with a single place to configure and monitor all of their data traffic across the Bloomberg system. The data we transmit is critical to our clients' operations so our systems must be reliable, resilient and fast.

Equity Trader

The primary focus of the Equity Trader group is to provide real-time analytics based on market and order-related data to clients in the financial industry. We develop highly resilient and efficient applications to monitor, enrich and display market activity as well as order flow. These services are performance sensitive and at peak capacity process hundreds of thousands of orders or trades in a single second. We architect solutions to distribute and integrate our data in several client-facing applications that are part of the Bloomberg Terminal and leverage these services within non-terminal enterprise products. Our role also involves building compelling and interactive user interfaces to expose our data and help build an intuitive workflow. As a result our products are business critical for thousands of clients who access them millions of times a day.

Fixed Income Electronic Trading (FIT)

The FIT team has a strong foothold in the fixed income space with over 90% market share in asset classes such as Credit Default Swaps and Interest Rate Swaps. This is an exciting time to join the team as we look to increase our product offering, while consolidating the considerable gains made in the changing and challenging trading environments. Projects will include building new trading platforms and enhancements to our existing offering. Our team members are involved in all aspects from product design to release, working on a mix of ticketing, server infrastructure and connectivity.

Foreign Exchange Electronic Trading (FXGO)

With over $5 trillion traded every day, the FX market is the world's largest market, and we are building our Bloomberg FXGO Trading Platform to be a premier multi-counterparty platform. You will be part of a rapidly growing team and immediately responsible for key new projects and initiatives. Our team owns various parts of the Bloomberg FX Trading Platform, which includes a 24 hour low latency multi-bank streaming trade application, post trade delivery system, confirmation and settlement centre and integrations with sell-side and buy-side clients.

Institutional Sales

The Institutional Sales Applications group develops multi-asset applications for Sales, Traders and Research Sales professionals. Our goal is to provide tools that empower salespeople and their managers to provide world-class service to their institutional clients. These tools leverage sophisticated algorithms to present simple answers to common questions that a salesperson faces throughout the day. Successful members of the team have a strong interest in finding solutions that manage and distill large volumes of disparate data to produce clear and powerful insights, and they are excited by the prospect of working in this important and rapidly evolving business.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics

The Portfolio and Risk Analytics team develops applications that provide transparency and insight to asset managers and analysts, empowering them to make smart financial decisions. The team develops an integrated access layer to multi-asset risk, return attribution, characteristics, intra-day P&L monitoring and portfolio optimization. Our London team focuses on delivering a comprehensive, high-throughput, distributed access layer that provides complex, multi-dimensional portfolio and risk analytics to various on-screen applications, professional reporting platforms, data visualization workflows, alerts, and others. We offer ample opportunity to contribute towards the design and implementation of core portfolio technologies as well as financial products.

Sell Side Equity Order Management Systems (SSEOMS)

SSEOMS is becoming a global enterprise-wide order management system. We are a fast growing business within Bloomberg, and on our way to becoming the leader in the industry. Developers will gain valuable equity trading and order management expertise in a very fast paced, real-time, mission critical environment. We are developing low-latency, high capacity sub-systems that handle orders, trades, risk, position, commissions, middle office, compliance and connectivity to the major exchanges around the globe.

Trade Order Management (TOMS & ETOMS) Trading Solutions

The TOMS product is used by financial professionals all over the world to support their trading, offering, pricing, risk and portfolio management needs. Our London TOMS team is responsible for the ever-growing Foreign Exchange functionality within the product. This involves connecting to other internal systems as well as building low-latency, high-volume processing systems to manage the large portfolios that our clients maintain. TOMS delivers a global, multi-asset, solution for trade capture, inventory management, and middle office operations. Our team provides powerful tools that allow traders to manage positions, make markets, and manage their risk and P&L, all in a streamlined, customized straight-through-processing workflow.

ETOMS is an industry-leading, multi-asset class electronic workflow solution for the sell-side community. The team develops low-latency connectivity solutions to European exchanges, as well as trading tools and workflows.

Tradebook

Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker, a US Electronic Communication Network, and a technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting Equities, Futures, Options and FX trading.
Providing market access to 120+ liquidity venues globally, our focus is on developing low latency & real-time black box trading systems, algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions.

item.title: Frontend Developer (m/f) at Celonis GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
What’s it like working at Celonis?



  • Rewarding work, knowing you’re working on something that adds real value to companies and to the people who love to use it.

  • Get it done. Zero bureaucracy. Make a direct impact.

  • Work together with passionate people who put team before ego. People who can turn on a dime and embrace rapid changes.

  • Work at the forefront of Process Mining and join us to create disruptive and world class data analytics solutions that will revolutionize how businesses see at their processes.

  • Work on a widely used standard software product with the highest standards and requirements.


What we give you in return



  • Top notch salary

  • Hardware of your choice

  • Develop with the latest tools, libraries, frameworks, and workflows with a high qualified team

  • No IE8 support

item.title: Java Programmer at RavenPack (Marbella, Spain)
item.description:
Position immediately available for an experienced software professional. You will work within an international team of developers skilled in Java, SQL, Python and Common Lisp.


The ideal candidate will have excellent skills as a software engineer and professional experience delivering backend applications developed and deployed on Linux.  You should be fluent in current Java technologies and tools.  Experience in the following technologies and procedures is a plus:



  • Continuous integration and test driven development practices

  • Project management and build automation tools: Maven, Sonatype Nexus and Jenkins

  • Knowledge and experience with J2EE frameworks

  • SQL and JPA

item.title: Algorithm and Software Developers for Computational Biochemistry at D. E. Shaw Research (NY, NY)
item.description:
Extraordinarily gifted computational scientists and engineers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery. 


Candidates should have a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open-source accomplishments.  Relevant areas of expertise might include parallel computing on high performance computing systems employing multi-core, GPU, or special-purpose architectures, numerical analysis, C/C++, or Python programming, data-intensive computing, compilers, operating systems, or distributed systems, but specific knowledge of and level of experience in any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation. 


Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for molecular dynamics simulation and data analysis both on commodity clusters and on Anton, a massively parallel special-purpose supercomputer of our group’s design.  Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work closely with a number of the world’s leading computational chemists and biologists, and to make fundamental contributions within the fields of biology, chemistry, and medicine.


To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/CS


D. E. Shaw Research does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

item.title: Senior SQL Developer at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description: Do you love writing queries and stored procedures? Do joins, temporary tables, loops, unions, and cross apply speak your language? Is optimizing the performance of SQL code your kind of challenge? Namely is looking for a skilled SQL developer to contribute ideas, innovation, solutions and code to our product. This position will handle multiple projects and requests in fast paced environment while ensuring the best possible experience for both internal and external customers.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Aol Adtech, Frankfurt (Dreieich, Germany)
item.description:
About AOL/ADTECH


At AOL, we’re radically redefining the world of online media. By bringing together innovative technologies, premium brands, original content and award-winning journalists we're transforming the way people around the world connect with information, entertainment, and each other. The home of a world-class collection of premium brands, AOL creates original content that engages audiences on a local and global scale. We help marketers connect with these audiences through effective and engaging digital advertising solutions. Building these large-scale digital advertising platforms that handle billions of requests per day is the core business of ADTECH, which is a subsidiary of AOL.



JOB DESCRIPTION



AOL Engineering – Frankfurt/Dreieich


The Opportunity – Java Software Engineer


ADTECH’s team in Dreieich creates large scale, high available software components that are all part of our digital advertising platform. This spans from real time systems that handle several thousand transactions per second to big data solutions that process many terabyte of data on every given day

item.title: Senior Solution Architect (Europe) at Hazelcast (Istanbul, Turkey) (allows remote)
item.description:
Europe (remote various cities)


As a Senior Solutions Architect, you will work directly with customers and users to help them understand how they can use Hazelcast to achieve better performance and reliability.  In addition to supporting a Regional Sales Manager in Europe the Senior Solutions Architect is a Hazelcast advocate who loves to conduct training sessions, talking at conferences, being active in the community and consulting on distributed computing problems. 


It is a big plus, if you have worked on Hazelcast, or other IMDG and/or NoSQL solutions.

item.title: Senior Developer at COzero (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
COzero is searching for talented senior developers in Sydney looking to change the way businesses use energy.


Our product ranges cover traditional electricity retail, energy monitoring, energy efficiency programs, energy audits, creation and trading of environmental certificates and support for commercial solar installations.


The Senior Developer's role is to ensure the continual delivery of the EnergyLink platform such that its milestones are met to support internal and external users of the platform. The role also entails support for the CTO, across other business services as required.

item.title: Salesforce Developer / Administator at Pearl Capital Business Funding (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking a talented full-time Salesforce developer / administrator to maintain and build out our current Salesforce instance. Aside from supporting our internal business processes, we have funded initiatives to build entire new applications to support our customers’ businesses.


As we are presently a small team, we are looking for ambitious self-starters who will help define and guide the company’s technological vision.


Responsibilities



  • Maintain our current Salesforce application, supporting our internal business users, including Sales, Underwriting, and Support

  • Use Salesforce best practices to design and build out solutions to fulfill business needs

  • Improve the existing application to meet Salesforce design standards

  • Build out new applications to support our customers and white-label initiatives

  • Work with back-end developers to integrate Salesforce data into other internal systems

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer, Synthetics at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
New Relic 
Full Stack Software Engineer, Synthetics 
Portland, OR



New Relic is software analytics. Fueled by real-time data from production software, we provide clear, actionable intelligence about high-velocity web and mobile applications and their end-users. Our first, and very successful, SaaS tool for such analytics monitors real-time traffic from real users. The Next New Thing for New Relic is monitoring real-time traffic from synthetic users.


As one of the engineers building this product, you'll be designing the architecture, writing the code, and, of course, monitoring it all by automating browsers with New Relic Synthetics.



Some of the things we work on:



  • How to make the process of scripting a browser more fun and less pain

  • How to present large amounts of browser metrics to customers in a simple but meaningful way

  • How to orchestrate hundreds of browsers running synthetic transactions across the globe and ensure that all transactions are both reliable and properly sandboxed

  • How to ensure that we’re capturing all possible transaction metrics even if they appear not meaningful at first



Skills & Experience that are relevant to us:



  • Experience with browser automation technologies such as Selenium/Webdriver/Chomedriver, PhantomJS, Zombie.js, etc…

  • Open source contributions

  • Experience in a backend language like Java, Ruby, Python or Node.js (but, to be honest, we mainly use Java)

  • Experience building front-end Javascript applications (we use Angular)

  • Experience building products on Amazon Web Services and understanding of operational/uptime tradeoffs

  • A web app or API that you have played a key role in shipping

  • Success working in small and fast paced teams



How to apply: 


Please click the link below and attach your resume. In your cover letter send us examples to apps you've built and code you've posted to Github.



A little about us:


New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our customers use New Relic every day to optimize millions of applications.


New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 & 2014 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.


Our office is in the tech mecca of Portland, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats and great coffee. We provide competitive compensation including equity and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.)— all while maintaining the energy, agility and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.


New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.  We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.



Apply Here:http://www.Click2Apply.net/76kf7mdrj3



PI91710626
