item.title: Technical Software Architect at ASML (Veldhoven, Nederland)
item.description:
Introduction
Are you challenged by demanding projects in a multidisciplinary context? Are you motivated by business value of software technology? Do you have the technical capabilities to provide innovative architecture adjustments which enable our product roadmap? Are you able to technically steer a team of professionals to refine and implement your specifications? Do you like working in an agile software development context using modern software technologies? Please contact us today.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Software Function Cluster Architect.

Job Mission
As a Software Function Cluster Architect you will be responsible for specification of the software functionality and technical guidance of product realization. Simultaneously you organize a software technology roadmap (and its updates). Furthermore, you identify and demonstrate the relevance of the roadmap options towards key stakeholders. You do this the context of the cluster as identified in the functional breakdown. Together with the engineering team you work on the contribution of your function cluster to the business success of ASML metrology products and holistic lithography solutions as a whole.

Job Description
As Software Function Cluster Architect in our YieldStar software team you will be a key player in a cross-sector, multi-disciplinary environment. You will have to demonstrate skilled knowledge in analyzing technical solutions and you have excellent attention to details and a high level of accuracy. You will be responsible for the specification, verification and validation of the cluster software architecture for the ASML metrology machines. The core of your work is a translation of the overall (Sub-)system Design into a cluster software architecture that meets associated requirements. You will collect and agree on all the specifications, create the budgets associated with functional and non-functional requirements (such as resource usage, cost of goods, maintainability, and availability).

If needed, you will negotiate with other clusters and even other projects to optimize the specifications. Technical decisions include variation points on cross-product, cross-platform aspects, and application of state of the art software technologies where businesswise appropriate. You will also be expected to interact with the dynamic and diverse ASML community. It is essential that you get to know your internal customers who need your specific competence to create solutions in the scope of the function cluster. Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills are crucial. You will work towards meeting expectations and you are flexible. You are ambitious and willing to embrace the opportunity to improve. You will identify and understand the needs of our clients and be responsive, logical, and flexible.

To achieve your mission, you initiate regular architecture meetings to analyze issues and to support, steer, and plan solutions. If needed, you update the cluster software technology roadmap. You will present findings and results to management. A 1st year contribution as developer in a function cluster team enables you to prepare for this role.

Main Responsibilities



  • Defines and maintains function cluster software technology roadmap

  • Collects, challenges, and documents functional and non-functional requirements to be addressed in software

  • Defines a software architecture by means of which the requirements can be met

  • Guides the software developers in the construction of software within the established architecture

  • Vendor selection for off-the-shelf software products.

  • Aligns fit of technical solutions across the clusters

  • Assessment of functional and integration risks

item.title: Software Engineer at Futuremark (Espoo, Finland)
item.description:
We are looking for talented developers to join our development team in Espoo for full-time, permanent positions in our User Experience team.


The user experience team participates in the development of the software clients on all platforms (currently Windows, iOS, and Android), all websites and online services and the integration of the clients with the online backend - basically anything and everything involved with end-user interaction. Main focus is on Java development, but software client development across different platforms also offers opportunities to work with other technologies.


Our development culture values innovation and personal initiative. We are looking for a developer who is able to design, implement and maintain reliable solutions using modern working methods such as test driven development and quick release cycles.

item.title: Embedded Software Engineer at Levant Power Corporation (Woburn, MA)
item.description:
Job Description


We want a talented embedded software engineer to work on a breakthrough active suspension system. You will be part of a small software engineering team developing the embedded firmware that controls power electronics and vehicle dynamics and feel. We are looking for a bit-hacker that will develop device drivers, algorithms and controls, multi-threaded designs, diagnostics, communications, and distributed networking in an embedded bare metal environment.



Put Aside the Details for a Moment


We want you to love what you do. We want you to have hobbies like building and creating, robotics, playing an instrument, racing go karts, or traveling; whatever it may be, we like to have people on our team who are passionate about exploring and pushing their creative limits. You love a good challenge, and have great aptitude in problem solving and debugging to get to the bottom of it. If this sounds like you, rest assured that Levant is a place where you will be recognized, rewarded, and fulfilled by your work.



Responsibilities




  • Embedded software development in C to run advanced motor controllers and energy mangement systems for vehicles




  • Translate high level control systems into high performance efficient code




  • Board bring-up for new GenShock controller designs




  • Software test and QC




  • Device driver development and interfacing for CAN, UART, SPI, Flash




  • BLDC motor control (sensorless and sensored with new algorithm development)



  • Develop distributed processing architecture for embedded controllers via CAN

item.title: Platform Analyst at Associated Electric Cooperative, Inc. (Springfield, MO)
item.description:
Come to a place where your talents are appreciated, your voice is heard, and your work has an impact.  Candidates must be passionate, talented people who love solving unique problems, wearing many hats and working with customers.



The Springfield Headquarters is currently seeking applicants to fill a Platforms Analyst position in the Corporate Services Department of the Information Services Division.  The Platforms Analyst role works with business partners and other development members to define and review system specifications. The Platforms Analyst will manage significant projects involving external parties, the technical team and business partners. This will include overall ownership of milestones and deliverables, project proposals, business justification and communication efforts. This position will then oversee the evaluation, acquisition, integration, configuration, design, administration and troubleshooting of the enterprise wide platform systems including but not limited to SharePoint, SiteFinity, and K2 Blackpearl. The Platforms Analyst will be called upon as needed to perform various tasks on projects, including solution design, development, testing, debugging, and deploying. To be successful, this role will require a varied mix of skills including the ability to prioritize, communicate, analyze problems, develop solutions and understand numerous technologies. This position interfaces primarily with other team members, external parties and business partners.

item.title: Software Developer at ESRF (Grenoble, France)
item.description:
The Instrumentation Services and Development Division (ISDD) is now seeking to recruit a:

Software Developer
Permanent position

THE FUNCTION
In the context of the ESRF upgrade programme, the accelerator complex will require a significant evolution of its control system, using an architecture based upon TANGO and C++ codes. This includes sophisticated feedback and automation protocols to satisfy high geometrical, stability and timing constraints.

As a member of the Accelerator Control Unit (ACU) in the Software Group, your main missions will be:



  • software development and maintenance for accelerator control and related infrastructure

  • writing documentation and test programs

  • installing and testing the control software during the commissioning phase and maintain it during the years to come

  • interfacing new instruments for remote control use

  • participation in the other ACU activities and support (including on-call duty)

item.title: Wanted: Dangerous PHP developer at Network Merchants LLC (Roselle, IL)
item.description: The software development team at NMI is a small, agile group that works closely together but requires independent thinking and motivation. Developers have direct influence over the design and implementation of their code and are heavily involved in application testing. Expertise should include fluency in coding, strong troubleshooting and analytical skills, good communication skills and a genuine passion for solving problems related to scalability, performance, security, and redundancy.

item.title: Senior Full Stack PHP / LAMP Engineer at Cleanify (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Join a fast growing, VC-funded, tech startup in the on-demand services space. Cleanify is like Expedia for local home & office cleaning services.


We are looking for a Senior Full Stack PHP / LAMP Engineer who possesses a passion for pushing web technologies to the limits and will work with our team of talented engineers to design and build inspiring interfaces that will optimize our business. The successful candidate will work on our web/mobile-web product adding new features and working closely with our CTO and designers.


Responsibilities:



  • Participate in the design, architecture, development, implementation and maintenance of various system components

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.

  • Development of integration technologies to rapidly integrate with various systems.

  • Work on bug fixing and improving application performance.

  • Participating in technical planning and architectural exercises.


Additional Information:



  • Health benefits

  • Competitive equity

  • Ground floor opportunity, no ceiling

  • Awesome culture: fun work environment, social events and awesome mentors/network

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer, Core Modeling at Schrödinger (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our mission:



To improve human health and quality of life by empowering researchers with advanced computational techniques that transform the way chemists design drugs and materials.



By building and deploying breakthrough scientific software solutions and forming collaborations and partnerships, we help scientists accelerate their research and development activities, reduce costs, and make novel discoveries that might otherwise not be possible.


The position:



As an engineer in Core Modeling, you will use current engineering practices to provide fast feedback to our in-house scientific developers, who build the physics-based software solutions we provide to our customers. The main focus of the position is in improving our continuous integration system, optimizing our build system, and creating tools to facilitate testing.



You'll work in a team environment that emphasizes code review, unit testing, and continuous delivery of our own code.


The Core Modeling Infrastructure team supports scientific developers in building and testing and provides ways for them to scale up their calculations. We also work on chemistry infrastructure libraries that provide molecule I/O, cheminformatics, and graph-theoretical algorithm support.


Responsibilities




  • Drive projects that will make scientific developers more efficient and robust

  • Maintain and improve the continuous integration build system

  • Work with the infrastructure team to maintain test infrastructure and make it usable for scientific developers

  • Expand test automation, including performance and system tests

  • Communicate with others about how to change our systems for the better

  • Optimize performance of the build system


Minimum Requirements




  • B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent work experience

  • Excellent coding skills: You have built maintainable production tools

  • 3 years of relevant work experience: development, ops, and/or test automation experience

  • Expert knowledge of a scripting language (python preferred)

  • Good systems knowledge of Linux

  • Continuous integration experience (Jenkins, buildbot)

  • Good understanding of git

  • A desire to learn new things and enthusiasm for solving interesting problems

  • Self-motivated and reliable

  • The ability to figure things out


Pluses




  • DevOps experience or an interest in learning how to automate all parts of the development cycle

  • Cloud computing experience (AWS, VMWare)

  • Configuration management experience (chef, salt, puppet)

  • Django experience

  • Science interest or minor (chemistry, biology)

  • Compiled language experience (C/C++)

item.title: Linux kernel graphics driver engineer - London-based at Intel Corporation (London, UK)
item.description: The Intel Open Source Technology Center's Visualization/Media Engineering team is responsible for developing multiple aspects of graphics software, display driver development and simulation environment development. In this role, you will be a key contributor to the Intel Linux kernel graphics driver: adding support for advanced platforms well before they are released, improving the driver for maximum performance and functionality and working directly with key community maintainers to get your work added to the Linux kernel.  Google’s Android and Chrome operating systems incorporate this driver for use on Intel-based devices such as tablets and Chromebooks.  Intel's complex, high performance GPU silicon needs a skilled engineer who can work with silicon teams to leverage each new generation of advanced GPU architecture.

item.title: Senior Unity3D Engineer (f/m) at Kabam, Inc. (Peking, China)
item.description:
Kabam, Inc. (“Kabam”) creates, develops, and publishes games that are available on mobile devices via its own dedicated channel in the Apple App Store, Google Play, and the Amazon Appstore. Valued at more than $1 billion, Kabam is the 6th fastest growing company overall in North America, according to Deloitte LLP. The company has been profitable since 2012. Kabam's Kingdoms of Camelot franchise has grossed more than $250 million, making it one of the top 10 strategy franchises of all time. Kabam has also created four titles that have grossed more than $100 million each in their life. In 2014, Kabam had three titles rank in the Top 50 Grossing apps on iOS. Kabam has more than 850 employees around the world, with corporate headquarters in San Francisco. The company's investors include Alibaba, Canaan Partners, Google, MGM, Intel, Pinnacle Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Warner Brothers and others. More information about Kabam can be found at www.kabam.com. 


For our department in Beijing, China we are looking for a Senior Unity3D Engineer (f/m) who is willing to move to Beijing permanently. 


What you will do:


The Mobile Developer will be responsible for the design and implementation of many features across our upcoming mobile titles. As part of our new mobile team you will work closely with product and engineering leadership to define, scope and build out features and best practices. Responsibilities include:


- Design and code new features and enhancements across all our product offerings


- Collaborate on finding and fixing bugs and scalability/optimization issues


- Help automate, maintain and enhance our internal reporting and administration tools



What we are looking for:


We're looking for someone with a strong foundation in computer science who consistently comes up with creative solutions and new ideas.


- 2+ Year as mobile game engineer


- Familiar with Unity3D


- Expert on Java or C/C++ or Javascript


- iPhone / Android experience is a plus


- Shader/Render/OpenGL 3D skills is a plus


- Familiar with Social Game or Mobile Game.


- B.S. in Computer Science or related field from an excellent university (or equivalent experience)


- Excellent problem solving skills


- Driven and self-motivated, a self-starter who can work without needing direct supervision


- English is a plus



If you are interested, please send us your application in English directly on to our website http://careers.kabam.com/careers/job/oaBl1fwR/

item.title: Full Stack PHP Developer (100% remote) at Deals Extra (Sydney, Australia) (allows remote)
item.description:
What we offer:
High level of responsibility in designing a viral marketing platform for business owners.
Work wherever, when ever you want, as long as you meet 30~40 hours a week.
Be apart of a team of A players.

Our team
Rob - Ex-Macquarie Capital, Ex-Groupon Australia. University of New South Wales Science/Law Scientia Schollar, Top 60 in Australia in university entrance exam 99.90 UAI. Traveled over 40 countries
Claire - Ex-Goldman Sachs, Ex-RBS, University of London Mech Engineering
Percy - Curtin University Mech Engineering, top student in cohort, vice chancellors list. 3 year web development experience

rob@dealsextra.com.au

item.title: Software/System Engineer at Stratocore (Paris, France)
item.description:
The European Software Engineer position requires broad stroke competency, providing front-line and back-end technical support to our prospective and established clients at pre and post sales levels at an international level



  • Technical Support: Technical support requests, Client site implementation, Infrastructure maintenance and scaling



  • Development: API/Scripting for integration. Programing to generate reports and views. Work directly with software development team planning, designing and creating functionality



  • Coordination: Participate in high-level client contact. Help ensure implementation processes, provide high-level IT software trainings; coordinate with client IT tech teams and Stratocore IT teams. Work directly with software development team.

item.title: Java Developer in Fintech 100% in Zurich City at swissQuant Group AG (Zürich, Switzerland)
item.description: You are an expert in Java or another object oriented programming language. You can work independently or as part of small groups in the development and delivery of software components and services. Your mastery of technology allows you to build prototypes quickly to help support business development and to build high quality robust products. You will be responsible for the technical delivery of multiple projects and provide technical leadership to other quant engineers in software design and development. You will liaise with clients and technology partners to identify requirements and define technology architecture. You are confident and articulate and possess excellent presentation skills. Your excellent multi-tasking and time management skills complete your profile and ensure your success.

a10:author.a10:name: MDA Information Systems LLC - Ypsilanti, Michigan

item.title: Software Engineer at MDA Information Systems LLC - Ypsilanti, Michigan (Ypsilanti, MI)
item.description:
MDA Information Systems LLC is hiring top-notch software engineers to help build the cutting-edge applications our customers need.  This can take a lot of forms, from web-based frontends (HTML/JavScript) to distributed Oracle databases to backend image processing with heavy duty number crunching on big images.  A lot of the work has got an R&D feel to it with the stability of long-standing contracts.  We’re looking for developers that think this stuff is fun, have a sophisticated understanding of software systems and applications, and have the desire to innovate on what’s been done in the past.



If you’ve got a solid background in C++, Java, web design, or database design, we’d love to have you as part of our team.



Company: MDA Information Systems LLC is a major supplier of weather information and geospatial intelligence. The firm serves a diverse client base including commercial and governmental organizations in agriculture, energy, defense, and civilian government.



MDA is an industry leader in earth observation remote sensing technology and image processing.  We build satellite ground systems that enable users to acquire and process imagery from the most sophisticated Earth-observing satellites in the world:  much of the satellite imagery that you see on Google Maps was generated by our software!



To be qualified you must be a US Citizen and be eligible to obtain TS/SCI Clearance

item.title: Senior Back-end Engineer (Node.js) (f/m) at Kabam, Inc. (Peking, China)
item.description:
Kabam, Inc. (“Kabam”) creates, develops, and publishes games that are available on mobile devices via its own dedicated channel in the Apple App Store, Google Play, and the Amazon Appstore. Valued at more than $1 billion, Kabam is the 6th fastest growing company overall in North America, according to Deloitte LLP. The company has been profitable since 2012. Kabam's Kingdoms of Camelot franchise has grossed more than $250 million, making it one of the top 10 strategy franchises of all time. Kabam has also created four titles that have grossed more than $100 million each in their life. In 2014, Kabam had three titles rank in the Top 50 Grossing apps on iOS. Kabam has more than 850 employees around the world, with corporate headquarters in San Francisco. The company's investors include Alibaba, Canaan Partners, Google, MGM, Intel, Pinnacle Ventures, Redpoint Ventures, Warner Brothers and others. More information about Kabam can be found at www.kabam.com. 


For our department in Beijing, China we are looking for a Senior Back-end Engineer (Node.js) (f/m) who is willing to move to Beijing permanently.



What you will do:


- Write well-structured and architected code in Node.js for new game features and administrative tools.


- Follow best practices to ensure optimized performance and maintainability both in the application code and database structures.


- Maintain the stability and performance of the server for very large numbers of players.



What we are looking for:


- Strong knowledge of computer science, software design fundamentals, and OO design patterns.


- Deep understanding of server programming languages such as Node.js, Java, PHP, Python, or Ruby.

If you are interested, please send us your application in English directly on to our website http://careers.kabam.com/careers/job/o3140fwS/

item.title: Infrastructure Platform Engineer (Chef) at Bloomberg LP (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Bloomberg Careers - Infrastructure Platform Engineer (Chef) 


The Role:


Bloomberg's Infrastructure Platform group in R&D delivers services which support the fast-paced Bloomberg environment. This includes key infrastructure capabilities used across all of Bloomberg's products and services.


As a Infrastructure Platform Engineer, you will be primarily responsible for the design, maintenance and administration of the system and services built to automate our compute environment. Our enterprise uses Chef for this function and we are deploying Chef across all of Bloomberg's unique large-scale systems. Not only will your work be used by thousands of technologists at Bloomberg, but as an active open-source contributor, Bloomberg encourages you to work on projects and commit code that raises the bar for the community as a whole.


Talk to us about how you can become part of one of the newest, most technical diverse Chef installations in the industry; we have problems to challenge even the best engineers!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer: Web UI Applications at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
OVERVIEW:


At Exosite, you will be working with a top-tier team to build web-based front end applications for Exosite products.  At Exosite we love building highly responsive, engaging user experiences for this data driven world in which we live, work, learn and play.


As part of the Exosite Product Team you will have the opportunity to give input into the entire design, development and deployment life cycle of the applications you are building.  Your primary objective will be to architect and implement web-based client side application code and user interfaces within a fast paced environment that is building the next generation of products for connected devices and applications.


WHO YOU ARE:


You are primarily a software engineer that shines at programming web-based user interfaces.  You have an exceptional ability to create well-designed software that meets the marketing and user experience requirements gathered from key stakeholders.  You are satisfied with nothing less than the best, yet know how to deliver to business needs.


You have experience mentoring junior level developers and are an excellent oral and written communicator, comfortable with engaging both internal and external stakeholders.  You proactively and positively engage within a team environment to deliver software of the highest quality.


You know that documenting and testing your code is an essential part of development.  You write tests that validate the implementation of your documented design and that ensure regressions do not occur.

item.title: Technical Implementation Specialist at Rally Health, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The business/systems analyst role will support the Rally Enterprise pillar as a technical resource. This will include a variety of requirements analysis/development tasks, as well as documentation and process improvement. This resource will also engage in and manage external facing conversations with Rally’s Enterprise partners.


Roles & Responsibilities include:


Specific Responsibilities:



  • Provide Post-sales Requirements analysis and development support to multiple Enterprise teams.



  • Help evaluate, define, and improve process around requirements development and handoff in these areas.



  • Help develop Single Sign On (SSO) creation processes and documentation.



  • Configure inbound and outbound SSO using PingFederate and track all relevant details in the SSO inventory document.



  • Provide a technical resource during SSO kickoff conversations and act as a liaison with partner technical teams as needed during development and testing phases.



  • Develop and improve descriptive documentation around new partner onboarding.



  • Provide a technical resource to support conversations around new partner onboarding.



  • Interface with Partner/Client technical teams to help with solution development in cases where these requirements push us into the brave new world of previously undeveloped functionality.



  • Act as an escalation path for certain production support issues.


General Responsibilities:



  • Planning: related to the tasks associated with business analysis and the software development lifecycle (KanBan, Scrum, Agile).



  • Stakeholder Analysis: identify the stakeholders who will be impacted by requested changes and requirements and make sure those dependencies are communicated.



  • Risk assessment: identify risk, probability, impact and mitigation strategy.



  • Relationship Management: assess and grow relationships with external partners and 3rd party vendors. Determine when and how to leverage these relationships as new problems present themselves.   



  • Elicitation: questioning techniques to gather information at the right level of detail and scope to represent all of the stakeholder’s needs, and the ability to ask questions that lead to an understanding of the business need rather than what they want.



  • Manage Requirements: understand the requirements change process, and traceability. (Help to build this out in the current organization.)



  • Interface analysis: the understanding of technology infrastructure and how it interconnects, including sharing data to achieve a business goal.



  • Writing requirements using different approaches such as use cases, activity diagrams, sequence diagrams and state charts, data dictionaries, class or entity relationship diagrams.



  • User experience, knowing how a user interface helps the user to successfully complete a task, also known as usability.


Requirements:



  • Minimum of 5 years experience working in some combination of: business analysis, systems analysis, programming, operations,  or other technical pursuit that relies heavily on problem solving and learning from your mistakes.



  • Must be adaptable, proactive, energetic, and willing to learn and deliver on a variety of tasks and responsibilities



  • Superior verbal and written communications skills



  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment focused on continuous product innovation



  • Background with Agile, Scrum, and other software development methodologies is strongly preferred



  • Familiarity with JIRA is a bonus



  • Must be strong with attention to detail including proven ability to manage simultaneously competing priorities



  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary



  • Ability to think strategically and execute methodically


Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer: Web Services at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
OVERVIEW:


At Exosite, you will be working with a top-tier team to build web services for Exosite products. At Exosite we are focused on building massively scalable systems that run this data driven world in which we live, work, learn and play. As part of the Exosite Product Team you will have the opportunity to give input into the entire design, development and deployment life cycle of the web services you are building. Your primary objective will be to architect and implement web service code and APIs within a fast paced environment that is building the next generation of products for connected devices and applications.


WHO YOU ARE:


You are primarily a software engineer that shines at programming web services. You have an exceptional ability to create well-designed software that meets the marketing and user experience requirements gathered from key stakeholders. You are satisfied with nothing less than the best, yet know how to deliver to business needs. You have experience mentoring junior level developers and are an excellent oral and written communicator, comfortable with engaging both internal and external stakeholders. You proactively and positively engage within a team environment to deliver software of the highest quality. You know that documenting and testing your code is an essential part of development. You write tests that validate the implementation of your documented design and that ensure regressions do not occur.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at Zeta Interactive (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Innovation, collaboration, excellence and fun are at the core of everything we strive for at Zeta Interactive. We want to speak with you if you are passionate about elevating your career to the next level while making a tremendous impact at Zeta!


You will work with some of the best and brightest talent in the industry, challenging you to think out of the box and simplify and solve complex  problems in creative ways.


As a Lead Software Engineer, you will work (and own) challenging software engineering problems that can help revolutionize the digital marketing landscape. You will own  a problem from the beginning, partner with different functional groups and peers to define and understand it in a fast paced and iterative environment, and then lead execution on its solution. You will inspire others in the team with your work and creativity.

item.title: C# Developers building geospatial data and visualisation software at Landmark Information Group (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for enthusiastic and talented Developers to join the Product Development team of our market leading geospatial data and visualisation products. This will support one of our defined business units which boasts significant growth plans, based from our Exeter office. Our wide range of products provide digital mapping, site-specific environmental risk information and solutions to the property industry.


You will be part of a vibrant and ambitious team who are making a real difference to our business by designing and delivering first class software in an environment of dynamic and outcome focused delivery. Our objectives are technically challenging and we deliver products which generate a key part of the business’ revenue. Are you looking for a challenge that will push your boundaries in terms of your personal development, and help contribute to business success through developing innovative products for our customers? If so, we’d love to hear from you.


Our developers have an important voice in how our products are constructed, so an open and collaborative approach to change is essential. Our teams have great opportunities for personal development and therefore the role would benefit a self-motivated learner.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Internal Tools at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Sr. Software Engineer to help build tools for monitoring and tracking the performance of various aspects of our distributed platform.  This role will exercise your creativity and ability as an engineer to design and create tools to work against various big-data systems, such as Couchbase, Apache Kafka, and Vertica.  You will work as a full-stack engineer, developing in the database access layer, service layer, UI layer, and everything in between.

Candidate should be familiar with the different parts of the Java application stack as well as Python, but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings.  However, you should have a true passion for technology that is apparent in your work and/or personal projects. You will work in an agile, high-pace environment with other talented engineers to build mission-critical tools with high-visibility.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and build tools for the QA team to properly test and monitor their respective systems.

  • Work with different platform developers to expose any vulnerabilities in their respective systems.

  • Build SLA reporting tools for managers to determine the health of the overall system and uptime metrics.

  • Improve and maintain the different internal tools written in Java and Python.

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and help them architect code intelligently).

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Reboot the classroom at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Developer at Sparx, you’ll be integral to the team from day one, helping to make the big decisions, shaping team objectives and driving our technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be leading the development of the core technical framework of the tablet-based Sparx system and driving its evolution. You’ll work with all members of the team – from data scientists to content developers – to find solutions to the most challenging problems we face when building a system of this scale.


You’ll be responsible for designing and implementing components for the Sparx system, writing high quality, reusable code that focuses on usability, scalability and innovation. Program it how you want it, see how it works in a full classroom the next day and then dive straight back in to making it better and trying out the next idea. We’re pretty flexible at Sparx and you’ll have the freedom to do whatever it takes to get from A to B. We have one shared ambition: to improve educational outcomes for all.

item.title: Sr. Quality Engineer, Machine Learning Team at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are searching for a senior-level engineer to be a part of our overall quality assurance and software testing efforts.  You will be responsible for verifying different aspects of our ad platform, with a primary focus on automated test development.  This includes building test harnesses, as well as writing test scripts in Java.  You will work side-by-side with our development team in an Agile environment.

Candidates should have a passion for quality and an interest in testing on high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will be working with a Java application stack that leverages open-source tools like Zookeeper, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for test automation that is apparent in your past work.


Responsibilities:



  • Build and extend custom test harnesses to validate proper behavior of our Real-Time-Bidding engine

  • Develop automated scripts to simulate and validate 3rd party integrations

  • Work with application engineers to ensure monitors provide visibility and feedback on Key Performance parameters in production environment

  • Design creative approaches to solving technical challenges dealing with high volume, low latency data workflows

  • Be the gatekeeper for production releases and point person for investigating any related issues

  • Organize and conduct test planning meetings with engineers and product managers

  • Establishing performance benchmarks and automating the verification of this benchmark as part of the continuous delivery system

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. (Singapore)
item.description:
This role is also available in Kuala Lumpur and Jakarta with appropriate cost of living adjustments.


Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. is a fully-funded and well-connected start-up providing cutting edge software development and hardware solutions for the next era in information technology.  


The company is looking to bring together an international team of world-class developers to deliver a highly confidential, critical IT service for a long-term, major government contract in Southeast Asia. This project will ultimately provide a high-profile system to be used by millions of users in the specified country.


Role


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be building a large scale, data intensive Web application using the latest technologies in an Agile environment. Your primary responsibilities will include:



  • Application design, engineering and development

  • Follow Agile practices, such as TDD, BDD, pair programming etc.

  • Own a set of stories and manage their end-to-end implementation

  • Work with distributed team to deliver end-to-end solution

  • Present and conduct demo for users, stakeholders, and technology groups as and when required

  • Using industry best practices to deliver quality deliverables


What We Offer



  • World-class software development facilities

  • Startup environment with minimal bureaucracy

  • Learning opportunities to acquire the latest and most advanced development skills (we invest heavily in our employee training and development)

  • Agile work culture, focused on innovation, team work, and open collaboration

  • Flexibility of job location (Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Jakarta)

  • Greenfield development with opportunity to be involved in full Dev lifecycle

  • Health/relocation benefits available

item.title: Developer at Typeform (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
Typeform did to web forms what Tesla has done to cars: completely reimagined online forms from the ground up. Typeform is growing at a tremendous pace because of its heavy emphasis on amazing UX, strong product/market fit, and future products that will blow you away. This is a ground-floor opportunity for you to be a part of something fun, exciting, and supremely rewarding.


As an engineer at Typeform, you should have a solid understanding of software architecture and design patterns. You should be able to knowledgeably talk about OOP/DDD/SOLID and it would be great if you have a strong desire to innovate, learn about new technologies and be ready to take a part in the building of the product.


We're currently hiring for:



  • Front End: As a front-end engineer at Typeform, you would be responsible for creating and innovating on every corner of the front-end platform at Typeform.



  • Back End: As a back-end engineer, you will need to be able to build and design large scale applications for our platform to support millions of form responses and provide realtime data analysis.



  • API Integration: The API integration team is focussed on seamlessly integrating the Typeform platform with other 3rd party services such as Salesforce, Wordpress, Google spreadsheet and Mailchimp.

  • Full-Stack: We have need of full stack developers in a number of areas of our business to work simultaneously on the front and back end.


Benefits



  • Flexible working hours

  • Half day Fridays

  • Amazing office space (including terrace and BBQ)

  • 24 days of holiday (you can take your birthday off)

  • Private health insurance

  • Nice equipment

  • Yoga classes

  • Free team lunches

  • Fresh organic fruit

  • Wear your slippers within the office

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously, while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice what one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Require.js, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lighthweight Java8 backend running on DropWizzard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


Extensive experience with a modern MVC Javascript framework (Ember, Angular, Knockout) is a must for this position.

item.title: Software Engineer at Zeta Interactive (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our team in San Mateo, CA. This role will work under direction and mentorship, helping build solutions to complex software engineering problems, which require frequent use of ingenuity and creativity. The Software Engineer will interface with technical leads and product managers while building new products as well as upgrades, and enhancements or fixes to existing products.

Please note we are considering local candidates only. 


Responsibilities:



  • Display a passion for software development.

  • Create code that is simple, extensible, testable and robust.

  • Collaborate with other team members to evolve our development processes.

  • Participate in technical group and design discussions.

item.title: Forensisch software engineer at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software engineer


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving


Ben jij een ervaren software-engineer met interesse in low-level datastructuren?


Je werkt bij de groep Software Engineering van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) aan onze data-analyseapplicaties en libraries.


Als forensisch software-engineer duik je diep in de low-level datastructuren en algoritmiek. Je gaat werken aan complexe applicaties die binnen en buiten het NFI worden gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering. Denk hierbij aan het reverse-engineeren van onbekende bestandsformaten of bestandssystemen, om zo forensische sporen zichtbaar te maken. Ook draag je bij aan de verbetering van het vakgebied software-engineering en denk je mee over een efficiënte inrichting van het ontwikkelproces. Hierbij zorg je dat de forensische kennis zo goed mogelijk wordt geborgd.

a10:author.a10:name: The Electronics Online Group / redcoon GmbH (member of Media-Saturn Group)

item.title: Technical eCommerce Search Guru / Elasticsearch Expert (m/f) at The Electronics Online Group / redcoon GmbH (member of Media-Saturn Group) (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are The Electronics Online Group, a business division of Media-Saturn Holding GmbH, managing a portfolio of diversified online commerce brands. The core of the EOG is the redcoon GmbH, a leading online provider of high quality electronics brand products. Represented in 8 European countries, we today employ more than 700 employees.


Besides merger & acquisition of interesting new businesses as well as accelerating new online commerce talents out there, we are creating our own new startups. Therefore we are building a sophisticated, state-of-the-art component platform which we will use in our startup cases as base for the best possible TCO and time to market. Among other key components,  Elasticsearch will be one of the search engines in our platform strategy. Therefore we have following job opening in Munich (sometimes Ingolstadt):


Technical eCommerce Search Guru / Elasticsearch Expert (m/f)


Responsibilities:



  • You know the last line of code and behaviour of Elasticsearch and other search engines?

  • Implementing the Elasticsearch standard in a shop is boring for you as your real thrill is to perfect the search results coming back?

  • In your world search behaviour and categorization of information is totally old school and you are looking to work on the next intelligent search?

  • Therefore you just sit down and develop mock ups and proof of concepts because the code is already in your head?


->Then you are the one we are looking for!

item.title: Platform Engineer at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
We're looking for somebody who's equally at home writing a script to replace EC2 instances, troubleshooting Linux TCP/IP latency, and building out a continuous-delivery pipeline for software in half a dozen different languages. Monitoring, capacity planning, and on-call emergency response also fall within the domain of this position.


You'll be working closely with a tight-knit team of software developers, project managers, and other platform engineers to guide the evolution of an ensemble of SaaS products supporting the Internet of Things. This means that in addition to the technical responsibilities already laid out, you'll need the confidence and passion to share ideas, deliberate, and execute decisively with other experienced engineers.

item.title: Software Developer C++ (m/f) at Definiens AG (München, Deutschland)

• Building the next generation product suite for Definiens customers

For more information, please visit: www.definiens.com or watch the following video to get an impression on how it's like to work at Definiens, in the product development department.

item.title: UI Developer at Circonus, Inc. (Fulton, MD) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are currently seeking a skilled User Interface Developer with an eye for detail who is interested in working on a feature-rich site. We like playing with the latest technology and enjoy complex problems. If this sounds like something you would like to help us with, keep reading.


About the Job



  • Maintain and improve our current interface and codebase—new features are added constantly, but we like to make sure the old features still work

  • Estimate work involved for tasks assigned to you

  • Identify current or potential issues and be able to explain and resolve them

  • Provide feedback on user experience and suggest improvements

  • Be able to adapt to work with many different styles of code

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Messaging at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Twilio platform enables companies to integrate communications directly into their applications via simple cloud APIs and with on-demand global reach.  Twilio is therefore challenged with abstracting away a world of complexity so that our customers can go global without concern for managing a global communications network, carrier integrations and relationships throughout the world.


About the job:


As a member of the messaging team at Twilio, you will enhance and scale the SMS and MMS platform that touches millions of people every day. To take it to scale, you will be developing a complex distributed platform in Scala and Java and will be concerned with availability, throughput, latency, and data integrity. There will be a significant data component so you will be working with distributed SQL and NoSQL databases and caches.  At the core are cloud technologies that enable deployment and management of computing resources globally.  


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects and Engineering leaders to define, architect and build new customer-facing features.

  • Own, operate, and maintain your team’s services in a distributed production environment. Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.

  • Drive quality by writing unit, functional, load and performance tests.

  • Release, monitor, and maintain features in a responsible, reliable way as part of our integrated DevOps practices.

item.title: Senior System Engineer at comScore (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Netherlands)
item.description:
comScore Inc. is looking for a highly motivated all-round (DEVOPS) Engineer to join the Digital Analytix Operations team. The perfect candidate excels in bash scripting, Linux operating systems, automating standard procedures etc. You are familiar with technologies as data collection, Ruby, Perl, Nagios monitoring, MySQL, DNS or SSL certificates.


            Some interesting facts:



  • We're at 1500+ servers, and growing

  • More than 12.000 calculation cores

  • over 2.5 billion page views a day

  • over 4PB of Network attached high performance storage

  • 4 Datacenters (2 in EU en 2 in US)


 Duties and responsibilities:



  • Perform day-to-day application administration and system administration duties on Linux servers across comScore's business-critical Digital Analytix platform

  • Maintain all the DAx  (Digital Analytix) platforms

  • Respond to and resolve incident tickets and monitoring alerts

  • Automate common procedures used to resolve Incidents and monitoring alerts

  • Standardize and document common procedures that can’t be easily automated for hand-off to other resources or teams for execution

  • Participate in 24x7 on call schedule of production systems

  • Work on interesting projects with the latest technologies and hardware

In addition to supporting a Regional Sales Manager in the Eastern or Northeastern territory, the Senior Solutions Architect is a Hazelcast advocate who loves to conduct training sessions, presenting at conferences, being active in the community and consulting on distributed computing problems. 


It is a big plus, if you have worked on Hazelcast, or other IMDG and/or NoSQL solutions.


Location:  City in Eastern or Northeastern time zone to work remotely.   This role covers Eastern USA territory.

item.title: Software Developer Consultant - Singapore at ThoughtWorks (Singapore)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks welcomes talented developers who are passionate with creating great code, to join our Singapore office!. 


Being a consultancy, our teams work on a huge variety of projects. You could be part of a delivery project set up for a large hotel, building a new mobile platform for a bank, support some of our training or enablement teams or join some of our teams getting involved on inceptions with new clients and getting hands on the project from scratch.  All of this whilst building quadcopters or robotic arms in your spare time! 


Examples of some of our current and past projects:

  • HTML5 rich web applications using frameworks such as AngularJS and Amber

  • Integrated enterprise solutions on RoR covering front end to back end

  • Large scale distributed systems with big data using technologies like Storm, Hadoop

  • Continuous delivery, Infrastructure as code and one-click deployment on cloud

  • Functional programming languages like Scala and Clojure for heavy data processing projects


We don't do bureaucracy, or hierarchy and you do get lots of autonomy so we actively encourage you to experiment with new technologies without limitation.

AdClear is a growing Berlin start-up and one of the leading AdAnalytics and customer journey analysis providers. AdClear offers an integrated system for tracking, analysis and optimization of the complete online marketing.

Your job:

item.title: Mgr Acute Clinical Applications at Orlando Health (Ocoee, FL)
item.description:
The Manager of Acute Clinical Applications serves as a strategic business partner to physicians and operations in identifying gaps and solutions to both small and large scale initiatives. The Manager is responsible for developing and implanting strategies in support of Allscripts Sunrise, Allscripts Care Management, Centricity Perinatal CPN, Connect, OB Link, Fetal Monitor, DataCaptor, Dial-a-Script, Guardian RX, OmniCell, Pyxis Connect, Rx30, Star-Lite, Secure Health Messaging, SunriseFAQ, ePrescribing, Elink, Allscripts Patient Flow, SPF, Bed Management, KBMA, Allscripts ED Manager, and other clinical systems to include interfaces to other upstream/downstream systems. This position oversees the activities of System Administrators, Programmer Analysts and other technical and professional staff, in setting priorities, enforcing methodologies and standards, coordinating resources, and responding to user issues in collaboration with the Information Services (IS) Service Desk. The manager works productively and professionally with other members of the IS Management Team, and provides support and guidance to direct and/or indirect reports.


The ideal candidate will have strong technical, leadership and interpersonal skills along with management experience, the ability to create and deliver presentations to the executive level, and strong technical and clinical knowledge of Clinical workflows. To be considered, candidates must have the required education, information systems experience and demonstrated clinical workflow knowledge.

item.title: SQL Server DBA at JustEnough (Irvine, CA)

  • Administration and management of SQL databases in  development, QA and production environments

  • Troubleshoot and handle database related issues through to resolution

  • Proactive monitoring of databases both from a performance and capacity management perspective

  • Perform database maintenance activities such as backup/recovery and rebuilding/reorganizing indexes

  • Ensure that all database releases are properly assessed and measured from a functionality and    performance perspective

  • Provide technical subject matter expertise on all database design and development projects

  • SQL Development and performance tuning of database schema, stored procedures, etc.

  • Hands on SQL programing skills

  • Additional responsibilities will involve system monitoring, metric reporting, and diagnostics (all involve SQL)

  • Able to set up and upgrades of complex databases, including interfacing with source control and change control in order to generate creation, data comparison, upgrade, and maintenance scripts

  • Experience in configuring SQL Server failover clusters and high availability groups

item.title: Lead MySQL DBA at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)

We are seeking a Lead Database Administrator with good system and database administration skills. As a Lead DBA you will managing a team of DBA’s who are responsible for the performance, integrity and security of our databases which is about 50 MySQL servers and dozen of Vertica Servers. The operations team leverages some of the most cutting edge technology to simplify an otherwise complex system.

Candidates should have a passion for building infrastructure for high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will leverage open-source tools like MySQL, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for systems engineering that is apparent in your past work.

item.title: Software Developer in Test - Drivers at DataStax (Santa Clara, CA)
item.description:
DataStax delivers Apache Cassandra™ in a database platform purpose built for the performance and availability demands of IOT, web, and mobile applications, giving enterprises a secure always on database that remains operationally simple when scaled in a single datacenter or across multiple data centers and clouds. We are looking for a Software Engineer in Test, focusing on the drivers and tools used to develop applications against Apache Cassandra. Can be located anywhere in the United States. 



Essential Job Functions:



  • Conceptualize, develop, and execute driver and tool code tests (coverage, duration, and stress) against local and distributed Cassandra/DataStax Enterprise (DSE) clusters running on a variety of platforms.

  • Dive deep into the code base to analyze features and bug-fixes while using debugging and profiling tools. You will work hand-in-hand with development teams to define functionality and resolve issues.

  • Have the opportunity to learn new languages, tools, and processes in a dynamic, fast-paced, small team environment.

  • Set up automated build and testing tasks across varied platforms and create analysis/tracking reports.

  • Write user-facing blog posts, driver software demos, how-to tutorials, as well as debug customer issues.



Job Requirements:



  • 2+ years in a production software development role.

  • Motivated self-starter who has experience working in a distributed team that exchanges ideas via IRC and HipChat. Must possess the discipline and focus to work independently at a remote location.

  • Understand the complexities of testing in a distributed, big data environment, and place a strong emphasis on performance tuning.

  • Strong development background using C#.

  • Comfortable with code development and scripting in a Linux environment.

  • Comfortable interfacing with the open source community and having your code reviewed via github pull requests.

  • Passion for making great software in a small company setting.

  • History of learning new technologies on the fly.

  • Possess an assertive communication style.

We're looking for a senior Java programmer, ideally with experience working on a SAAS or enterprise product.  You will work closely with the CTO and founders to discuss new feature design and API integrations.  You should have experience with system design that follows best practices and leverage REST API's, as well as the ability to ensure that our entire stack is testable and scaleable. You like solving core problems across the stack, thinking about how to leverage new tools, and optimize systems.

item.title: iOS Engineer at Beme (NY, NY)
item.description:
Beme is a hugely ambitious video-sharing platform founded by Casey Neistat and the former head of engineering at Tumblr, Matt Hackett. We’ve spent the last year stretching the limits of camera and mobile technology in ways people, including those at Apple itself, have never seen before. Firm believers that less is always more, we’re designing a product that aims to be ruggedly simple.


We’re looking for a product-focused iOS Engineer who feels just as comfortable thinking through how a feature feels to a user as they do the most efficient ways to store and render the data that fuels it.


What you’ll do:



  • You’ll have a voice in the entire product, but will focus heavily on implementing new features while maintaining a robust internal foundation for persistence and views.

  • Participate in a tight, collaborative conversation with our backend team regarding API structure, serialization, and optimization.


What we’re looking for:



  • Serious iOS SDK and Objective-C chops, having built and maintained multiple substantial apps from end to end

  • Experience building consumer products with a wide install base, including maintaining support for older hardware

  • Extreme comfort with everything from Core Data and building a pragmatic persistence layer to keeping in sync with a frequently partitioned RESTful API

  • Unfazed by completely reworking a product flow after it sees the the harsh light of real user testing

  • A pragmatic approach: interest in Swift, Reactive Cocoa, and other nifty tools, but a strong bias toward using a sturdy chisel over a laser CNC

  • Bonus: Experience with AVFoundation and streaming video protocol innards and a love for pixel perfect designs that translate across screen sizes


To apply, email a resume, portfolio site, and link to your GitHub tojobs@beme.com

item.title: Love coding, music and gaming? Nuday Games is looking for a Senior Clojure backend developer at Nuday Games (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Growing game studio Nuday Games is looking for a talented backend developer to build the Nuday Game platform, first product being Rock Science.


About the Job


The Senior Backend Developer designs and implements the backend systems and APIs to support feature development and new mobile games for a global audience. You will be a key member of the digital team and report to the CEO. You and your sharp and dedicated workmates at Nuday Games will initially focus on the Rock Science game. Together with you we’ll grow to become the world’s leading target group oriented game studio.


Not only do we develop exciting products, we use exciting technology to develop them. We believe that the combination of functional programming and Amazon Web Services allows a small team to accomplish a lot in a little time. Our game backends and platform are developed in Clojure and our deployment and operations tools are also Clojure. We don’t use Clojure “where it’s a good fit”, we think it’s a good fit everywhere!


Your challenge, should you choose to accept it, will be to build a scalable and manageable system using cutting-edge technologies. You’ll need to make sure what you build is maintainable, as you’ll be the one maintaining it. You’ll want to talk about the awesome things you’ve built at meetups, conferences, blogs and Twitter, and we encourage that. We’re proud of the tech we use and the people using it, and we’re happy for the world to know about it.


At Nuday Games, we value cultural diversity, curiosity and talent. We're big proponents of Agile and Lean ways of working, meaning that experimentation and learning are part of our core. We also value self-organisation. Here you'll have the freedom—and the responsibility—to take decisions around your own work. Our game development team is cross-competence. You'll work directly with the frontend team, game designers and product owner.


As a senior member of a small team, you will be responsible for design, implementation, operations, and help setting the technical direction of the Nuday platform. In short, we want you to do it all, and trust you to do it right.


What you will be doing


You will join our Product Team where you will be:



  • Writing lots of (clean) code that goes into production continuously

  • Get to spend 10 percent on private projects to find the next big thing

  • Gain and share knowledge with expert colleagues 


Responsibilities


You will take up the position of Senior Backend Developer. This includes:



  • Backend development, architecture (approx. 75% of working time)

  • Responsibility for quality control as well as technical competence within the tech team

  • Carry out performance reviews with other tech workers in the company

  • Internal and external presentation on the company’s platform from a technical standpoint

item.title: HPC Software Engineer C++ Specialist Job Ref 18 at First Light Fusion Ltd (Begbroke, UK)
item.description:
Vacancy Specification


First Light Fusion is looking for an experienced High Performance Computing (HPC) engineer to join our cutting-edge numerical team that is developing a set of tools for the prediction and analysis of inertial confinement fusion. The company has built, from the ground-up, a multiple-fluid compressible flow solver that brings together heavily templated C++ for performance and Python for user interaction. 


The toolset makes extensive use of third party libraries such as CGAL (www.cgal.org), OpenVDB (www.openvdb.org), VTK (www.vtk.org), and boost::python for wrapping. Work is coordinated through github and organised through agile best practices, including test driven development where appropriate.


The successful candidate will be an expert in optimising C++ for high performance scientific simulations, both in single core and many-core environments. This will include instrumenting and profiling the existing code-base, analysing results and plotting a work program for making improvements. Our toolset has been designed with parallelism in mind; however, to date, we have focused primarily on robustness and maintainability over performance. This provides an exciting opportunity for the right candidate to take a greenfield approach, while ensuring the right balance between maintainability and performance is struck.


Benefits


A competitive package, opportunity to participate in the company’s share option scheme, and relocation expenses.


How to apply


Please upload a covering letter / supporting statement and CV to http://www.firstlightfusion.com/careers quoting the job reference. We will commence interviewing candidates on 30th September 2015 and the post will remain open until filled. Two referees should be available on request.


Informal enquiries may also be addressed to careers@firstlightfusion.com. 


CVs sent by recruitment agencies will not be read, and in the event that the company receives a CV from both the direct applicant and a recruitment agency the CV will be treated as a direct application by the individual only. Unsolicited contact from Recruitment agencies will be disregarded. 


We are an equal opportunities employer. This role will be subject to background checks.

item.title: Junior Back End Developer at SMTP, Inc. (Gainesville, FL)
item.description:
SharpSpring is looking for an experienced, and innovative Back End Developer to join our team in Gainesville, FL. If you are interested in joining a growing, dynamic and successful Tech company where your work makes a significant impact on the entire organization, then we want to talk to you!

The Company

SharpSpring is a cloud-based marketing automation provider offering a next-generation marketing automation solution rivaling the industries top platforms in terms of features, functionality and performance. SharpSpring is one of the most flexible platforms on the market, offering native or 3rd party CRM integration, fully integrated call tracking, universal CMS compatibility, in addition to integration with hundreds of applications. With SharpSpring, see every lead that comes in, whether by phone or form, and compare all data side by side to get a full picture of end-to-end ROI. SharpSpring is usually less than 1/3 the cost of other competitors, yet powerful enough to be trusted by hundreds of agencies and thousands of businesses around the world. In 2014, SharpSpring was acquired by SMTP, Inc - a publicly traded company on the NASDAQ (SMTP).

The Opportunity

The Back End Developer will work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment using the latest open source technologies for software development. You will work with our experienced Development, Design and QA teams to produce and maintain the highest quality of software products. You will be part of a team that is changing the face of an industry and producing an application that is used by thousands of clients. This position allows you a huge complex product to work on where you can take ownership of your back end kingdom!

The Responsibilities

  • 2+ years experience as a Back End Developer (working with Java, C#, PHP, Python)
  • Working on complex data problems
  • Design, development, and maintenance of code
  • Experience with Big Data (Hadoop exp. a plus)
  • API development and Feature Development
  • Writing code and running appropriate diagnostic tests to proactively solve potential issues
  • Identify and solve problems creatively and efficiently
  • Design, communicate, and implement solutions effectively

The Person

  • 2-4 years of experience as a Back End Developer
  • Effective communication, decision-making, and problem solving skills
  • Professional development experience, either through a full-time job, internship or personal projects
  • Solid understanding of back end technologies
  • Familiarity with responsive web design techniques
  • Experience building and or designing web applications
  • Familiarity with PHP
  • Experience with Backbone, Ember.js and/or AMD

The SharpSpring Culture and Perks

As a team, we want to differentiate ourselves by hard work, disciplined execution, friendly service, a commitment to solving our customers' problems, and to demonstrate that we can accomplish more than others with a fraction of their resources.

Our company culture is based on the belief that our people are our #1 asset:

  • We empower you to make decisions and get things done without all of the bureaucracy!
  • We ensure communication across the organization, including actively soliciting your feedback
  • We are committed to our team's personal development at all levels of the organization
  • We offer competitive salaries and company bonus programs
  • We offer health and dental insurance for full-time employees
  • We offer a paid holidays and PTO to our full-time employees
  • We strive to reward team members who operate as "business owners" with stock option grants in our firm, creating a strong team-oriented dynamic across the entire company

About SMTP, Inc.

SMTP is a NASDAQ-listed provider of email services that is growing rapidly on a global basis. The company's easy-to-use and highly affordable SharpSpring marketing automation platform is empowering the next generation digital marketers with tools once reserved for large enterprises. The company's long history as one of the early pioneers of SMTP delivery services provides a solid backbone for the company's growth, which will be supported by its global operations. Its recent acquisition of GraphicMail provides a global footprint and both email and mobile functionality for a wide range of business users. Its profitable operation and access to the public markets for capital positions it well for both organic growth and synergistic acquisitions. Learn more about us and our subsidiaries at:  www.smtp.com

item.title: Software Engineer at Lyst (London, UK)
item.description:
Lyst are looking for software engineers who enjoy writing python to work on the huge technical challenges that come with building the world’s leading fashion commerce site.


As a software engineer you will ensure that the platform continues to over exceed shoppers expectations, helping us to constantly release new features and improve functionality. You will work in a product-led cross-discipline team on everything from helping to choose the best tools and frameworks to working with design and product exciting new features. You will have a huge chance to influence the way code, culture and product are built at Lyst.


At the heart of Lyst is a huge data aggregator that lists millions of fashion products from hundreds of retailers. On top of this we build systems that help people discover and follow their favourite fashion brands, ensuring that all of our users are inspired and happy throughout their shopping experience.


As a software engineer at Lyst some of the thing you will be working on:



  • Building real products that fix real world problems, predominantly in a Python based technology stack.

  • The huge challenges that come from working with a database with over 9 million products and a spider architecture performing 3.8 million updates a day.

  • Exposure to product specific teams fixing problems like; Shopping personalisation, Universal Checkout System, Marketing automation technology, PaaS, Our own Data Analytics platform, a new search function and personalisation etc

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Our universal checkout system that allows our users to find any item of clothing from any retailer on our platform, in stock, in their size and ready to buy.

  • Our internal and external REST API’s

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.

item.description:

You will know how to build a site from scratch, apply best practices for providing multi-lingual support, incorporate theme / skin support, obey good design standards (i.e. making use of templates to prevent duplicate work, diligently make use of style-sheets and so on) and work to current accepted web standards. You will also have experience of website/application setup and deployment.
