item.title: Senior Network Engineer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


Bloomberg's R&D Network Design & Information Security (NDIS) group is responsible for the design, architecture, development and security of Bloomberg's internal and client-facing global networks, security, and cloud infrastructures. The Core Network WAN Engineering team is the part of the NDIS Core Networks group that is focused on the architecture, development and escalated support of the global WAN infrastructure.


Bloomberg's private WAN is a sophisticated carrier-grade multi-vendor network that leverages technologies such as MPLS, MPBGP, LDP, RSVP, MVPN, etc. The private WAN currently connects 14,000+ customer sites via 100+ global POP sites using 20,000+ CE network devices and 800+ core network devices.


The Core Network WAN Engineering team is seeking a dynamic, talented and experienced network engineer who thrives on being "in the trenches". The successful candidate must possess extensive programming experience in network automation, provisioning & performance management. The candidate is also expected to possess expert networking knowledge, experience, creativity and capability to work in a complex and fast paced network technology environment. The candidate will work closely with network operation groups to provide technical assistance and guidance. The candidate will also work directly with vendors to drive feature enhancements that are necessary to meet business needs. Ability to drive relevant strategic solutions in a complex environment is highly desirable.

item.title: Senior Back End Developer at SMTP, Inc. (Gainesville, FL)
item.description:
SharpSpring is looking for an experienced, and innovative Back End Developer to join our team in Gainesville, FL. If you are interested in joining a growing, dynamic and successful Tech company where your work makes a significant impact on the entire organization, then we want to talk to you!

The Company

SharpSpring is a cloud-based marketing automation provider offering a next-generation marketing automation solution rivaling the industries top platforms in terms of features, functionality and performance. SharpSpring is one of the most flexible platforms on the market, offering native or 3rd party CRM integration, fully integrated call tracking, universal CMS compatibility, in addition to integration with hundreds of applications. With SharpSpring, see every lead that comes in, whether by phone or form, and compare all data side by side to get a full picture of end-to-end ROI. SharpSpring is usually less than 1/3 the cost of other competitors, yet powerful enough to be trusted by hundreds of agencies and thousands of businesses around the world. In 2014, SharpSpring was acquired by SMTP, Inc - a publicly traded company on the NASDAQ (SMTP).

The Opportunity

The Back End Developer will work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment using the latest open source technologies for software development. You will work with our experienced Development, Design and QA teams to produce and maintain the highest quality of software products. You will be part of a team that is changing the face of an industry and producing an application that is used by thousands of clients. This position allows you a huge complex product to work on where you can take ownership of your back end kingdom!

The Responsibilities

  • 2+ years experience as a Back End Developer (working with Java, C#, PHP, Python)
  • Working on complex data problems
  • Design, development, and maintenance of code
  • Experience with Big Data (Hadoop exp . a plus)
  • API development and Feature Development
  • Writing code and running appropriate diagnostic tests to proactively solve potential issues
  • Identify and solve problems creatively and efficiently
  • Design, communicate, and implement solutions effectively
  • Test orientated development

The Person

  • 5+ years of experience as a Back End Developer
  • Effective communication, decision-making, and problem solving skills
  • Professional development experience, either through a full-time job, internship or personal projects
  • Solid understanding of back end technologies
  • Familiarity with responsive web design techniques
  • Experience building and or designing web applications
  • Familiarity with PHP
  • Experience with Backbone, Ember . js and/or AMD

The SharpSpring Culture and Perks

As a team, we want to differentiate ourselves by hard work, disciplined execution, friendly service, a commitment to solving our customers' problems, and to demonstrate that we can accomplish more than others with a fraction of their resources.

Our company culture is based on the belief that our people are our #1 asset:

  • We empower you to make decisions and get things done without all of the bureaucracy!
  • We ensure communication across the organization, including actively soliciting your feedback
  • We are committed to our team's personal development at all levels of the organization
  • We offer competitive salaries and company bonus programs
  • We offer health and dental insurance for full-time employees
  • We offer a paid holidays and PTO to our full-time employees
  • We strive to reward team members who operate as "business owners" with stock option grants in our firm, creating a strong team-oriented dynamic across the entire company

About SMTP, Inc.

SMTP is a NASDAQ-listed provider of email services that is growing rapidly on a global basis. The company's easy-to-use and highly affordable SharpSpring marketing automation platform is empowering the next generation digital marketers with tools once reserved for large enterprises. The company's long history as one of the early pioneers of SMTP delivery services provides a solid backbone for the company's growth, which will be supported by its global operations. Its recent acquisition of GraphicMail provides a global footprint and both email and mobile functionality for a wide range of business users. Its profitable operation and access to the public markets for capital positions it well for both organic growth and synergistic acquisitions. Learn more about us and our subsidiaries at: www.smtp.com

KB&B - The Kids Group GmbH


Schellerdamm 16 - 21079 Hamburg

www.kbundb.de

item.title: Python Engineer at Mirantis, Inc. (Pozna, Poland)
item.description:
If you’re an ambitious Python Software Engineer and thrive on working on tough, real-world problems, you want to work here. item.title: Technical Project Manager Web Developement at ABOX42 GmbH (Karlsruhe, Deutschland)
item.description:
Do you remember the time when mobile phone were actually used to talk and text only? That was quite a while ago. Nowadays, the telephone is just one of many features. Pretty much the same is happening in the TV world. Simply watching TV was yesterday - with a variety of apps you can now watch on demand, personalized and across devices. Television becomes smart and as a technical project manager with ABOX42 you can help building it’s entertaining future.


ABOX42 is a leading provider of IPTV, OTT (TV via internet) and DVB (TV via Antenna, cable or satellite) set-top-box platforms which build the basis for the development of new SMART TV products.


We are looking for a dedicated technical project manager for our expanding company’s German office located in the beautiful city of Karlsruhe. As the newest member of our Professional Services team, you will be working together with our international customers while supporting the development of interactive TV solutions.


We have great things ahead of us - enjoyable work and enough space for your personal goals and career for a committed employee is just as important as the room for your ideas and creativity. You are looking for a challenge and are eager to have a versatile scope of duties? Then this is the right job for you.


Your role with ABOX42 in detail:




  • Technical support of ABOX42 customers




  • Organizational support of ABOX42 customers




  • Support in improving ABOX42 Products




  • Quality assurance of product improvements




  • Assisting in the development of the developer portal




  • Support of the sales team with technical customer requests




  • Support for technical inquiries from developers




  • What you can expect from us:






  • Flat hierarchies




  • Flexible working hours




  • A friendly, pleasant working environment and open-minded colleagues




  • Large desks, MACs and many screens




  • Varied and interesting work opportunities on exciting projects




  • The opportunity to bring your ideas to the table




  • Coffee, tea and hot chocolate at your fingertips




  • Fresh fruit and healthy sweets




  • Karlsruhe offers technology, science and quality of life with 1628 hours of sunshine,


    1000 shops, 150 km of cycling paths, 135 cultural institutions and much more

item.title: Software Developer - Experienced at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for experienced programmers that have formal computer science training and at least 5 years experience working in industry building high-performance web applications, not just CSS/HTML web pages. The right programmer for this position will be fluent in Javascript as well as a number of other languages. While they might be comfortable using framework libraries, they'll be the type of programmer that actually understands how the framework works, when it's appropriate, and when it's preferable to build thier own functionality directly. The right programmer for this position will *love* abstraction, strive for elegance, and will enjoy thinking about recursion until their brain hurts. 

This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). We were also recently named a Gartner Cool Vendor (http://blogs.gartner.com/michael-shanler/cool-vendors-in-life-science/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation expenses.

item.title: Software Engineer at MDA Information Systems LLC (Gaithersburg, MD)
item.description:
MDA Information Systems LLC is hiring top-notch Software Engineers as well as System Engineers to help build the cutting-edge applications our customers need. Positions are located in Longmont, CO and Gaithersburg, MD.  This can take a lot of forms, from web-based frontends (HTML/JavScript) to distributed Oracle databases to backend image processing with heavy duty number crunching on big images.  A lot of the work has got an R&D feel to it with the stability of long-standing contracts.  We’re looking for developers that think this stuff is fun, have a sophisticated understanding of software systems and applications, and have the desire to innovate on what’s been done in the past.



If you’ve got a solid background in C++, Java, web design, or database design, we’d love to have you as part of our team.



Company: MDA Information Systems LLC is a major supplier of weather information and geospatial intelligence. The firm serves a diverse client base including commercial and governmental organizations in agriculture, energy, defense, and civilian government.



MDA is an industry leader in earth observation remote sensing technology and image processing.  We build satellite ground systems that enable users to acquire and process imagery from the most sophisticated Earth-observing satellites in the world:  much of the satellite imagery that you see on Google Maps was generated by our software!



To be qualified you must be a US Citizen and have an active TS Clearance

UI developers are responsible for bringing the UI to life on the Frontiers website. This includes balancing the needs of our users, our design aesthetic as well as the business objectives.


Your primary responsibilities include:



  • Implementing new frontend features in line with business requirements.

  • Writing clean and well-structured code that is responsive and mobile-friendly. 

  • Optimizing page load times and user perception. 

  • Ability to coordinate with teams and stakeholders locally and in remote locations. 

  • Willingness to travel occasionally between Frontiers locations (Lausanne and Madrid).

Senior Developer – 6 month Contract


As a Senior Developer at MedReleaf, you will participate in the full software development life cycle. The majority of your work will be with web technologies; however there will be opportunity to build native mobile applications, and to do control systems integration.  


This will begin as a contract position up to 6 months, with the potential for full-time employment. Partial remote working is permitted; however up to 60% of on-site presence is required.



  • The majority of your work will be spent designing, developing and testing custom software, and performing various systems integration work with an ERP system and external web services. 

  • The software under development will range from an e-commerce system to customizing traditional resource planning tools. It is expected that you write automated tests where applicable.

  • You will also assist in the design and implementation of modern development operations strategy and protocol. For example, you will assist in setting up a continuous integration server, such as Jenkins.

  • This is a unique opportunity to be part of a team that will be designing and implementing a modern infrastructure and technology stack within an extremely high-growth start-up.

Delticom AG
Brühlstraße 11
30169 Hannover

item.title: Security Engineer (m/f) (93825) at BMW Group (Ulm, Deutschland)

THESE DAYS, AUTOMOTIVE HISTORY IS WRITTEN IN C++.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.



More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Security Engineer (m/f)

item.title: E-Commerce Developer at Nike (Hilversum, Nederland)

item.title: Senior Java Developer at VMware (Herzliya, Israel)
item.description:
We are looking for an excellent software engineer to join a team which builds the top of the edge cloud management product. Be a part of developing a state of the art product that will provide VMware customers a full set of features for monitoring, maintaining and managing the applications that are running in their virtual infrastructure; We develop using high end Java technologies with a mixture of various open source frameworks, while coping with cloud scale challenges.

item.title: Localization Developer at Translate House (Fleet, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
Translate is looking for a localization developer to join our team.


You will be working with us on Pootle, our open source community localization platform.  Pootle itself is used by commercial companies and open source projects such as LibreOffice, Mozilla and Evernote.


Your development skills in Python and Django will be important to help build Pootle.  But as, and if not more importantly, your skills and experience in localization are critical.  Marrying your experience in the issues and problems of localization with your coding skills makes the code that your produce able to address the real needs of localizers.


You will be part of a remote team, working from home. You will contribute in all aspects of the product evolution, coding, specification, testing and deployment.  We work openly with our code hosted on Github and the majority of our development work happening in public.

item.title: Technical Principal at ThoughtWorks (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’re a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. We’re dedicated to the art of software delivery, by keeping it lightweight, agile and open-source. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems to help them solve their toughest business problems. As a Principal Consultant at ThoughtWorks you have total responsibility for technical delivery on a client engagement so you are likely to have extensive experience.


As a Principal Consultant, here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks: 



  • Disrupt, Lead and Innovate.

  • Take the needs and challenges of a client and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.

  • Provide Technical leadership across all areas of the enterprise, to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions

  • Formulate and articulate the technical and political implication of real world solutions

  • Orchestrate the management of technology scope and risks

  • Mentor on approach and execution of solutions, coach on technologies and establishing a team wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction

  • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met

  • Drive ThoughtWorks’ Thought-Leadership on engineering and architectural practices and standards

  • Be an inspiration of innovation to the client

  • Become a trusted and valued partner of the client CIO/CTO and team

  • Exploit opportunities for networking and relationship building that arise out of delivery activities

  • Creates and supports sales activities

  • Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products

  • Code! We don’t subscribe to the “post-technical” ivory tower leadership style



We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel. 



We offer amazing benefits from the day you start including private medical insurance, travel insurance, income protection, critical illness, life assurance, pension scheme, child care vouchers, personal development budget, 25 days holiday and a ride2work scheme.



To apply please submit your CV and tell us why you want to join ThoughtWorks. One of our recruiters will be in touch.


At ThoughtWorks we promote diversity in all its forms and reject discrimination and inequality. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve

item.title: Software Engineer at Snapdocs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The ideal candidate is someone who plans to become a lead engineer (or perhaps a product manager) in the not too distant future.


We're a small team tackling the absolutely massive mortgage market. We're bringing modern, elegant software to a field that still relies on fax machines and manilla envelopes. We are bringing security, efficiency and joy to a paper-based pillar of the US economy.


The type of problems we're tackling involve workflow, product design, and data. Rapid feature iteration? Oh, yeah! We do SaaS for non-technical users. Everyday, our clients call and email to say that we're making them happy, and that feels great. However, in this industry, most people are unaware of what modern software is capable of. That means we must do research, gather data and talk to customers to inform each of our choices.


Snapdocs's culture is one that trusts its team members to make smart decisions. This means we value both independent work as well as seeking collaboration. We're becoming ubiquitous in one segment of the market and we're looking to hire another core engineer to help us expand further.


Competitive salary, benefits, and generous options.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Python) at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
HERE is looking for a Senior Engineer who has experience building and deploying automation systems for service delivery.  Our team is both developing and integrating exciting, cutting edge, large-scale automation and deployment technologies to provide a performant and stable platform upon which a large portfolio of HERE's data processing pipelines and content delivery services will run. A strong candidate will have experience with all aspects of the production software lifecycle, from working with stakeholders generating a development plan, through development or selection of the required tools, to deployment of the completed software to a production ready, stable environment. 
 


We are looking for a self-motivated team-player who has experience developing and deploying production-grade services in large organizations with compliance requirements.  The right candidate will have experience with all aspects of the production software lifecycle, from working with stakeholders to creating development plans, to the selection of required tools and technologies, to software development, as well as deployment of software to production ready, stable environments. Candidates should have 4+ years of professional software development and deployment experience including intermediate knowledge in continuous integration, continuous delivery and automated testing disciplines.  Candidates should have experience working with stakeholders to update existing production systems with new features.  Candidates will need excellent communication skills in order to work with stakeholders and coordinate with other team members on our fast moving projects.
 



RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Agile development of service delivery infrastructure and software

  • Continuous integration and automated testing of developed code

  • Continuous integration and continuous delivery of systems and infrastructure

  • Investigation and root cause analysis of software and system defects

  • Deployment of production ready systems and infrastructure

  • Monitoring of running processes to ensure proper functioning of infrastructure

  • Identifying and providing solutions for common needs across stakeholders

item.title: Koodisetä (tai -täti) / Senior Software Designer at Solita Oy (Finland)
item.description:
Haluaisitko päästä tekemään merkityksellisiä softaprojekteja, jotka koskettavat miljoonien suomalaisten arkea? Etsimme huumorintajulla varustettuja ohjelmistosuunnittelijoita liittymään rentoon, mutta ammattimaiseen työyhteisöömme Helsinkiin.  


Is this like a gibberish to you? We work with Finland public sector and Finnish national and international companies. Our working language is Finnish and we expect all our employees to use Finnish as their work language. If Finnish language is not your strongest asset, you can take a peek at our developer's blog http://dev.solita.fi/.


-----------


Useiden verkkoon toteutettujen softaprojektien marinoimana koodisetänä (tai –tätinä) tulet toimimaan meillä vanhemman ohjelmistosuunnittelijan roolissa. Osaamisesi rajojen sekä mieltymystesi mukaan valkkaamme sinulle sopivan JVM-stackin projektin, jossa kieleksi on todennäköisimmin valittu Java tai Clojure. Aloitusajankohdasta riippuen osallistut alusta alkaen kehitysympäristön pystytykseen tai hyppäät suoraan katettuun pöytään. Suuri osa työpäivästäsi sisältää kauniin koodin kirjoittamista, yksikkötestausta ja koodin katselmointia sekä arkkitehtuurisuunnittelua.


Projektitiimimme koostuvat tyypillisesti noin 3-6 ohjelmistosuunnittelijasta ja arkkitehdista. Arjessa projektitiimiämme tukevat lukuisat omat ja kumppaniverkostomme asiantuntijat (mm. front-end kehitykseen, käytettävyyteen ja projektinhallintaan). Työskentelemme pääosin omien toimistojemme ergonomisilla työpisteillä, ja myös asiakkaidemme tiloissa tarpeen mukaan. Mahtavilla näköaloilla varustettu, viihtyisäksi sisustettu Helsingin toimistomme sijaitsee Töölönlahden kupeessa.


Devausyhteisömme arkea


Solitalainen devausyhteisö tarjoilee suomalaiseen digitalisaatioon jäätävää osaamista, sillä jopa kolme neljästä kehittäjistämme on ohjelmoinut työkseen jo yli kuuden vuoden ajan. Melkein puolet kehittäjistämme tekee pääasiallisesti full-stack –hommia, joka kahdeksas keskittyy arkkitehtuurisuunnitteluun ja kokoaikaisia fronttikoodaajia on melkein joka kymmenes kehittäjistä. Solitalainen kädenjälki näkyy monessa suomalaiselle tutussa palvelussa, kuten Oikeusministeriölle toteutetussa Kansalaisaloite-palvelussa ja Liikennevirastolle toteutetussa Veturipäätteessä.


Projektien lisäksi meillä opiskellaan tekkiasioita työajalla kollegoiden järjestämien tietoiskujen sekä erilaisten koulutusten kautta. Jatkuva oppiminen ja uteliaisuus vievät meitä eteenpäin. Kehittymismahdollisuuksia riittää niin paljon kuin rohkeutta löytyy. Toivomme myös sinun jakavan osaamistasi tietoiskujen, koulutusten tai dev-bloggaamisen kautta. Lue Clojure-setämme Tatun viimeisin ClojureScript-kirjoitus tai mitä mieltä Jarno oli viimeisimmästä EuroClojure-reissusta kollegoiden kesken.


Työhommien ulkopuolella kokoonnumme Arduino-säätäjien Skunk Works –kerhoon, järjestämme änäriturnauksia, potkimme futista Pirkka-hallissa, suunnistamme Jukolan metsissä, heilumme heimofestareilla ja kiitämme kollegaa shampanjalla.


Neljän askeleen polku solitalaiseksi:



  1. Katselmoi koodiamme GitHubissa ja tutustu devaajiemme mietteisiin blogissamme: http://dev.solita.fi/

  2. Lähetä vapaamuotoinen hakemuksesi osoitteeseen rekry(at)solita.fi otsikolla “Software Designer, Helsinki” sunnuntaihin 6.9. mennessä. Jos sinulta löytyy koodinäytteitä esim. GitHubista tai BitBucketista, liitäthän tiedon niistä mukaan hakemukseesi.

  3. Odota yhteydenottoamme. Osallistu kutsuttaessa kahden kierroksen haastatteluihimme, jotka käynnistämme jo hakuajalla. Näistä ensimmäisessä tutustut tulevaan tiiminvetäjääsi ja toisessa pääset sparrailemaan tekkiasioista tulevien kollegoidesi kanssa.

  4. Lue palkkausmallistamme, harkitse hetki ja hyväksy työtarjouksemme.


Uupuuko vielä jotain?


Kysy rohkeasti lisätietoja rekrytoivalta esimieheltä Marilta puh. 044-7582324 / mari.pursiainen(at)solita.fi tai rekrytointipäällikkö Katilta puh. 044-0673613 / kati.kitti(at)solita.fi / IRCNet "Birgie".

item.title: Principal Software Engineer - Cloud Platform at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio is growing and we are looking for a skilled software engineer to join our cloud platform team, and to help build services and tools to support our globally distributed multi-cloud infrastructure. 


About the job:


We are looking for someone who is interested in building the next generation of cloud management services and tools to support provisioning, deploying, discovering, and managing cloud infrastructure at global web scale.

The person in this role will receive exposure to the unique set of challenges that come from scaling global services that must run at 99.999% availability.


Responsibilities:



  • Build new services from scratch, all stages from designing architecture through deploying functioning services and tools.

  • Own, operate, and maintain your team’s services across all development environments including production.

  • Build server-side technologies using open source software.

  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems in distributed computing, cloud computing, and service oriented architectures.

  • Write quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced professional software engineering environment. Primary languages are Java, and Python.

  • Mentor junior engineers.

  • Code and architecture reviews.

item.title: Senior Javascript Developer at Atlassian (Sydney, Australia)
item.description: Do you want to be at the front of the curve and the last stop before customers? As a Front End Developer, you’ll be directly impacting the customer experience through the implementation of new features and functionalities into our products. You’ll typically work in two ways, either as part of a fast moving and product driven team delivering features with focus on user experience, or cross-product where you’ll focus on new improvements to our software that enables all users to benefit. Either way, you’ll never be bored and you'll always be challenged (And you are probably the type that likes it this way).

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at Sauce Labs Inc (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Sauce Labs provides the world's largest automation cloud for testing web and native/hybrid mobile applications. Founded by the original creator of Selenium, Sauce Labs helps companies accelerate software development cycles, improve application quality and deploy with confidence across 500+ browser / OS platforms. Join us in making the world a better place for continuous integration and software development. We’re building a next generation infrastructure as a service platform.


We’re looking for Senior Systems Engineer to join our Ops Team. This role will be responsible for the successful operations and scaling of the infrastructure and software that powers Sauce Labs and launches over 10 million VMs a month.


Responsibilities:




  • Write tools and scripts to provide automation and self service solutions for ourselves and other teams




  • Design new systems to support production services




  • Install, configure and debug hardware and systems in our data center;




  • Creatively solve scale challenges regarding a rapidly expanding cloud environment;




  • Work with real hardware - high density Cisco UCS B-series blades and C-series rack-mount servers, Nexus networking (10Gb+ core network), storage (NAS and SAN), Mac-in-a-datacenter, custom appliances for mobile devices, load balancers, and beyond;




  • Help improve monitoring and identify key performance metrics;




  • Proactive R&D - discovering and implementing new tools, emerging technology, etc.;




  • Disaster recovery design, implementation, and maintenance;




  • Create NOC runbooks, procedures, documentation, and diagrams of the environments you manage;




  • Troubleshooting and resolution of server/network issues;




  • Help maintain hardware in Sauce’s colocation facilities;




  • Help build out new data centers around the globe;




  • Participation in 24x7 on-call rotation.




Here are a couple of examples of the kind of projects you might work on:




  • Optimize hardware and configuration for improving hypervisor performance.




  • Automating and migrating a system configuration to our UCS platform for faster production scaling.




  • Building and optimizing a logstash cluster for our development team to monitor and analyze production system usage.




We have a lot of big projects and decisions that need to be made, and in this role you would be a key part of that process. Sound like fun? Here’s what we’re looking for:


Our Ideal Candidate:




  • 3+ years recent experience working as a Linux administrator/engineer at scale (hundreds of systems) and designing/deploying ‘highly available’ solutions;






  • 2+ years of recent professional experience designing, developing, and operating Configuration Management solutions such as Chef, Puppet, Salt (preferred), or Ansible (preferred) at scale;




  • Solid experience in Linux tuning, profiling, and monitoring;




  • Strong skills in at least one language: Python (preferred), Ruby, Bash.




Bonus points for:




  • Experience deploying/managing KVM-Qemu and LXC




  • Solid understanding of cloud/networking/distributed computing environment concepts; including TCP/ IP connections, firewalls, VLANs, etc.




  • Experience and understanding of contemporary metrics, monitors, and logging solutions especially statsD, Graphite, ELK, Splunk, Nagios, etc.




  • Provisioning and automation with Cisco Unified Computing System Manager




  • Highly organized, able to multi-task, able to work individually, as well as within a team, and across teams;




  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written across all user levels;




  • Deployment automation in physical and virtual environments (PXE, Cobbler, MAAS (preferred));




  • Working knowledge of load balancing technologies (hard/soft);




  • Proven experience collaborating in a cross functional team environment;




  • Familiarity with software engineering practices, including n-tier architecture, configuration management, development methodologies (e.g. agile, waterfall, spiral, prototyping), etc.




Notes:



  • This role can be based in either South Bay or in San Francisco. Some travel to South Bay or SF is required.

  • Relocation available.

item.title: Sr. Site Reliability Engineer at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to help with the building and operation of our Real Time Analytics Platform. The operations team leverages some of the most cutting edge technology to simplify an otherwise complex environment.

Candidates should have a passion for building infrastructure for high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will leverage open-source tools like Zookeeper, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for systems engineering that is apparent in your past work.


Responsibilities:

  • Monitor and improve service performance and stability

  • Continuously extend and improve infrastructure components to handle growth

Do you want to be part of a great team?


The Web and Mobile Solutions team within the Division of Information Technology (DoIT) at the University of Wisconsin-Madison is a group of over a dozen software engineers that build and support custom data driven web and mobile applications for customers all across campus. Our team is currently hiring two entry-level to mid-level .NET software engineers.  The group has three technology stack focuses – ASP.NET (C#/MVC/Web Forms), Java (Spring/Grails), and mobile web development. We use a mix of server-side and client-side code to provide custom solutions to our customers and partners, leveraging cutting edge frameworks whenever possible.


Our team is currently hiring two entry-level to mid-level .NET software engineers. Our pay is competitive, great University Benefits Package and Campus Setting, the work culture is fantastic, career growth opportunities abound, and we are always striving for work life balance.


Madison is a great place to live with its lakes, culture, abundant restaurants, and changing seasons. To be persuaded:

item.title: UX Designer at Windsor Circle, Inc (Durham, NC)
item.description:
You’re a seasoned product designer who’s eager to own the overall design for new and existing product innovations to support our 9 Pillars of Retention Automation framework.  Your breadth and prior experience gives you the confidence that you can go the distance from early concept sketches to detailed interaction designs and visual assets in order to make the Windsor Circle experience enjoyable and natural for users.


You’re excited to work across desktop, tablet, and mobile platforms to craft an overall experience that truly fits into the lives of customers.  You like working hands-on and side by side with a small team of people dedicated to making a successful product and company.  Finally, you’re confident in your design abilities but also flexible enough to make necessary adjustments based on market feedback, usage metrics, and the natural bumps inherent to an agile development process.  


Responsibilities:

  • Develop conceptual diagrams, wireframes, visual mockups, click-throughs, or simple prototypes as needed to communicate ideas to the team and validate them with users




  • Continually refine and improve user-centered designs based on product goals, customer feedback, product metrics, and user research results




  • Assist in developing and maintaining detailed user-interface guidelines, design patterns, and style guides




  • Partner with product development teams to build enjoyable experiences; review designs with product managers and developers to spot difficulties, review new features as they are built to spot implementation gaps and identify future UX improvements




  • Present design work to large audiences at all levels within the company and lead constructive feedback discussions

item.title: Software Developer (Java, Cloud, .Net, Mobile) at PA Consulting (London, UK)
item.description:
At PA Consulting Group, the work undertaken by our IT consultants sits at the heart of the digital revolution. We help our clients to align their operating model with their digital strategy using our industry leading framework. 


As a Cloud and Mobile Software Developer, you’ll need to enjoy trying to clarify requirements which are not yet fully thought through. New technology is underpinning and driving enormous change throughout the world and across all our clients, so you’ll need to be able to question and propose suitable technology choices, challenge (in a positive way) our clients on design options or decisions and finally build compelling applications that delight users when they use them.


Why PA?


As a Cloud and Mobile Software Developer you’ll be given:



  • The opportunity to work with a variety of well-known clients delivering solutions across a range of technologies and platforms including open source, Google, Microsoft, Amazon and many more

  • Early access to the latest Google technologies such as AppEngine and BigQuery. We are also Amazon Web Services Consulting Partners and Microsoft Web Development partners, and use the most appropriate technology to design, build, deploy and support innovative digital solutions for our clients

  • The chance to work with wearable technology, including products like Google Glass, Android Wear, Tizen and Oculus Rift.

  • The opportunity to capture and send data in real time, grapple with unimaginably large data sets and build and launch novel digital services for customers or employees over multiple channels


Our size allows us to treat each Client as an individual – we are not tied to any vendors or technologies so are able to deliver true business value.  PA offers a career in consulting, not just a job; a stake in our firm; and an environment where individuals and ideas matter.


What we’re looking for:



  • Someone who can be inspired and inspiring when it comes to the power of technology to drive change

  • A quick learner with the ability to adapt to a variety of situations

  • Experience of commercial software delivery, particularly involving agile project delivery. Experience of Scrum, XP, Kanban and TDD is ideal

  • Someone who can demonstrate a structured approach to development, using design patterns and industry best practices as appropriate

  • Solid experience in performing complex analysis, consulting and providing technical recommendations.

  • The ability to work under pressure without much supervision, managing a varied workload, prioritise and multi-task

  • Someone who can operate in teams that cover the full spectrum of BI disciplines


About PA Consulting


PA is a leading management, systems and technology consulting firm. Employee-owned, award-winning, independent, highly successful, global, and ambitious for further growth – PA is a different kind of consulting firm. We look to hire exceptional people and provide them with opportunities that they will not find elsewhere. We are looking for opinion-formers, people who prize a culture based on respect, collaboration, and new ideas, and who have a passion for delivering solutions to the most complex and challenging issues affecting business and government.


We recognise that diversity is strength and that the differences between people add value to our organisation. PA is committed to equality and diversity and positively welcomes applications from suitably qualified candidates from all backgrounds, regardless of sex, sexual orientation, disability, ethnicity, religion or age.

item.title: Principal Front End Engineer at Gap Inc./GapTech (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
GapTech, we are passionate about delivering great customer experiences utilizing cutting edge technologies through sound agile development practices.  As we continue evolve our platform capabilities, the ideal engineer would have a passion for delivering value to our customers and a strong emphasis on quality.  The ideal candidate is experienced in using tests to drive the design of their code; using mocks and stubs as design tools for interface discovery in a way that maintains agility in the codebase while verifying functional behavior.   • Is influential and engages actively in continuously improving practices and methodology.

item.title: Technical Principal at ThoughtWorks (London, UK)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’re a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. We’re dedicated to the art of software delivery, by keeping it lightweight, agile and open-source. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems to help them solve their toughest business problems. As a Principal Consultant at ThoughtWorks you have total responsibility for technical delivery on a client engagement so you are likely to have extensive experience.


As a Principal Consultant, here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks: 



  • Disrupt, Lead and Innovate.

  • Take the needs and challenges of a client and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.

  • Provide Technical leadership across all areas of the enterprise, to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions

  • Formulate and articulate the technical and political implication of real world solutions

  • Orchestrate the management of technology scope and risks

  • Mentor on approach and execution of solutions, coach on technologies and establishing a team wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction

  • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met

  • Drive ThoughtWorks’ Thought-Leadership on engineering and architectural practices and standards

  • Be an inspiration of innovation to the client

  • Become a trusted and valued partner of the client CIO/CTO and team

  • Exploit opportunities for networking and relationship building that arise out of delivery activities

  • Creates and supports sales activities

  • Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products

  • Code! We don’t subscribe to the “post-technical” ivory tower leadership style



We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel. 



We offer amazing benefits from the day you start including private medical insurance, travel insurance, income protection, critical illness, life assurance, pension scheme, child care vouchers, personal development budget, 25 days holiday and a ride2work scheme.



To apply please submit your CV and tell us why you want to join ThoughtWorks. One of our recruiters will be in touch.


At ThoughtWorks we promote diversity in all its forms and reject discrimination and inequality. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Great chance to be part of a Healthcare project! at Telefonica Innovation (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
We are searching for a keen problem solver, that likes to find new, better and faster ways to create and test concepts and products. He/she will be a keen learner and be up to date on most tools and programming languages in order to advise us on the best ways to prototype now and develop tomorrow.

If you have a passion for technology and a vision for driving disruptive change on a global level impacting millions of people in the world, this is your opportunity: you’ll have the chance to build up something big from the ground up with full CEO backing and the freedom to completely re-think how to tackle big problems

 You’ll have the reach and impact of a globally operating Fortune 100 company while working in small, focused teams and high-energy environments to be truly disruptive.


This position would be based in Barcelona, Spain. We are willing to support you with relocation and work permit if necessary.

You must be able to:



  • Write code that is both robust and efficient.

  • Become the point of contact, first line of support and owner of the prototypes, modules and applications you work on. This includes designing, implementing, testing and maintaining code written by you or other team members.

  • Focus on the details and the things that really matter. Writing perfect code is a must, but also it is to deliver it in time.

  • You must be able to learn new frameworks, APIs and determine the best toolkit for each requirement.

  • Share knowledge and document it with the rest of the team and our customers.

  • Work with customers and understand their needs, propose solutions according to it and quickly iterate to a solution.

  • Excel as a team worker, as you will become a key factor of the success of a multicultural team.

item.title: IT Architect at Itility (Eindhoven, Nederland)
item.description:
Natuurlijk ben je een specialist. Maar wel een met grensoverschrijdend inzicht en het vermogen om in alle fases van een project je expertise in te brengen. In de rol van IT Infra Architect bij Itility ben je zowel strateeg als diplomaat, visionair én pragmatisch. Nu Senior Engineer of op zoek naar een bredere rol als IT Infra Architect? Dit is je volgende stap.


IT Architect


Wat ga je doen? 
Bij Itility krijg je de kans om ervaring op doen in de volle IT-breedte. Je doet ervaring op in complexe (internationale) IT projecten. Je gaat onder andere:



  • middels assessments en technische deep-dives, IT applicatie platformen analyseren;

  • complexe IT systemen op basis van bouwblokken re-designen;

  • feasibilities, architecturen en implementatie plannen opstellen;

  • implementaties, migraties, installaties en systeemtesten begeleiden.


Als onderdeel van een winning team werk je bij klanten als Telco’s, ISP’s of bedrijven in de hightech, semiconductor industry, finance of energy in de Randstad of in de regio Eindhoven. Het voortdurend delen van kennis en ervaring met engineers en andere architecten is part of the job.


We denken in resultaten, net als jij.


Dit is ons aanbod
Je krijgt de kans om je in een inspirerende omgeving optimaal te ontwikkelen, onder de persoonlijke begeleiding van een Senior Architect of Programmamanager. In complexe internationale IT projecten pas je de nieuwste technieken toe, in de volle breedte van het vak.


Bij Itility investeren we in elkaar. Behalve een prima salaris krijg je bij Itility veel extra's, zoals:



  • opleiding aan de 2-jarige Itility Academy en externe trainingen op maat;

  • deelname aan conferenties;

  • aanvullende variabele beloning op basis van geleverde prestaties;

  • 26 verlofdagen;

  • onkostenvergoeding;

  • auto, laptop en smartphone.


Locatie
Eindhoven tot Randstad

Career Opportunities:

We have many other openings available. For a complete listing, visit jobs.vostrom.com

item.title: Software Engineer at Noom (New York, NY)
item.description:
You


Noom is looking for an awesome Software Engineer who's a true team player and passionate about engineering, with tons of programming experience (doesn't matter if it was at Apple or in your mom’s basement) and excellent communication skills. A CS background or degree usually helps a lot, but is not a strict requirement if you really know your stuff.


Our Tech


At our core, we are a team of great engineers from world-class companies, so we take our tech very seriously. We work to improve our tools and approaches every day -- whether pushing the envelope with automated unit-tests or writing a super-optimized data analysis framework. We don't over-engineer and also don't under-engineer -- just the right tool for the job.


We take great pride in our code because we all want to innovate quickly. We build everything from Android software to C++ image recognition, from web UI to pedometer data analysis. Our apps operate off-line, and we have built lots of client-side infrastructure to lazily load and sync data with the server. This allows us to keep the server side relatively simple while still serving millions of users: Spring/Flask, Spring MVC, mySQL/Mongo.


We run Hadoop-based machine learning to find out what makes people stick to habits, create online clustering algorithms to match people to their ideal support group, serve millions of users with many terabytes of data, and tackle many difficult challenges every day. Because we are small dev team (17 strong), working at Noom gives you the unique opportunity to both use what we have created and build many more foundational technologies.  


Our Culture


We have worked hard to build an awesome company culture, stealing a bit from Google (many of us are ex-Googlers) and improving on it to become one of Crain’s “Best Places to Work in NYC 2013”  


Our tech team works with a ton of interesting Noomers and advisers, including our in-house psychologist as well as fitness experts, physicians and researchers.  We test our prototypes on sample users, averaging 2 user-tests a day, so you’ll be able to see how real people react to your work and iterate.  So unlike most tech companies, you’ll interact with a diverse network of people.  After all, we are team of problem solvers, always interested in learning and growing.


If you’re worried about being pigeonholed, fear not.  You’ll get to choose a mission (usually for 4 - 6 months) and work on the projects you’re interested in. We also have frequent company-wide hackathons. Everyone on the team is a generalist -- we explore new frameworks, and learn them quickly. We like to learn.


We are now ready to double the size of our engineering team with some incredible engineers (read on below!).


Our Company


Noom, Inc. is a mobile solutions company focused on preventative health.


Noom's research-backed products help people achieve real, positive outcomes. Noom was awarded a grant from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and was also recently selected as one of seven healthcare startups chosen to participate in the 2014 New York Digital Health Accelerator (NYDHA).


Noom's apps boast more than 32 million installs worldwide and its flagship app Noom Coach for Android has been the #1 top grossing Health and Fitness App since 2012 in the Google Play Store. Noom has offices in New York City, Berlin, Seoul and Tokyo.


But we need your help -- read on if you think you’ve got the stuff.


Our Products


At Noom we tackle some of the world’s biggest problems -- obesity, diabetes and heart disease.  We believe the best way to do this is by focusing on nutrition (TechCrunch) and fitness (GigaOm).  More than just counting calories, our mobile software applications offer intelligent, scientifically-backed, customized nutrition- and exercise-coaching designed to impact habits and behavior.  


Our flagship app, Noom Weight Loss Coach, has been the #1 top grossing health & fitness application since 2012.  It achieves the best outcomes in the industry with over 10 pounds lost per paid member.  How, you ask?  Great question!  It has:


* A coaching engine that generates personalized daily tasks & realtime motivational feedback;


* The world’s most accurate food database, crowd-sourced by users & instantly searchable;


* Virtual support groups created using automated clustering technology and tracked using scalable management tools.


* A focus on simplicity and friendliness, to make all of the above easy to use


* Many more features focused around guidance & motivation for our users


Our Benefits


If you want to learn how a startup really works on the inside, then Noom is the place for you. We have an incredible amount of transparency, with weekly all-company TGIFs where the wine and the information both flow freely (much to our legal counsel’s dismay).  Because you’ll have equity in the company and have to make many decisions in your work, it’s important for you to know what’s going on.  


We have an amazing chef (we love her!) who prepares gourmet lunches every day for all employees (along with afternoon smoothies and random breakfasts and dinners), a lively office with frequent visitors, and a dedicated team who work hard and play hard, with frequent offsites (beach, anyone?) and team outings (from shuffleboard to wine tasting).  We also have more cakes than is probably healthy (welcome cakes, birthday cakes, goodbye cakes and cakes just because -- no joke).


Plus health insurance (100% paid by Noom) and a 401(k). We also have a $200 wellness budget, which you can spend on everything from triathlon registration fees to massages.

item.title: Senior Web Services Developer - Washougal, WA at Immersive Media (Washougal, WA)
item.description:
Job Description


Immersive Media is seeking a talented web services architect/developer. This role requires a deep understanding of web server architectures, load balancing, data replication, internet security, RESTful services and tying them all together using Amazon Web Services. You will be fully responsible for our distribution server and it will be your task to evolve and expand the existing functionality which is currently written in Java using jdbc connections to a PostgreSQL + PostGIS backend sitting on Glassfish. We are looking into the possibilities of converting this server to be Meteor based and are looking for proper guidance and the expertise when the time comes to take our server to the next level.

item.title: Front End Engineer at Expedite Financial (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT THE ROLE


Our front end engineers build both consumer-facing and internal applications that transform a complicated and data-intensive domain into simple, intuitive, and delightful experiences. item.title: Full Stack Product Engineer at Pusher (London, UK)
item.description:
Pusher is a communication layer for application developers that routes data at scale and in realtime. We want to improve the lives of other developers by making hard problems simple, freeing them from operating and maintaining their own realtime infrastructure.


We're looking to expand our product team to solve more problems for developers around the world. You will be part of a new team in Engineering who will be improving on the features of our current product and developing new ones to go alongside it. You will own the technology that surrounds the core message bus and makes things easy for our customers to integrate, understand and use Pusher.


By building applications and using our APIs, you will help us solve more problems for web developers who use our product. You will influence how our APIs are designed, and work with our platform engineers to bring them to life. You will also take ownership of several of our server libraries, and develop them further.

item.title: Senior C++ Developer; architect ultra low latency trading strategies at Tower Research Capital (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are a tight-knit, 3-person trading team at Tower Research Capital. We're looking for a C++ ninja to be our lead engineer and help take our low latency trading strategies to the next level. You will be a key revenue generator, and your compensation will reflect that. You will be asked to:



  • Design, implement, test, and deploy real-time trading systems

  • Develop tools to monitor, analyze, and further automate existing trading processes

  • Measure and optimize software, hardware, and network performance

item.title: Senior Designer - UI/UX experience at Loggly (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Loggly is seeking a Sr. Designer to join our Software Engineering team. Loggly is the world’s most popular cloud-based enterprise-class log management solution.  We’ve recently received $15M in new funding to accelerate our rapid growth and we’re staffing up.


Our customers send us an explosive volume of log data 7x24x365.  Our challenge?  Make it easy for our users to instantly understand what their logs are telling them. This is real-time big data that is mission critical for our customers.  Do you have the code-writing capabilities to take on this task? And to succeed in a big way? 


About the Team


The product team at Loggly believes that the quality of our software and its simplicity reflects directly on us as professionals.  And because our customers are all engineers themselves, they notice.  We’re relentless about crafting a product that is innovative, delivers a user experience that people remember and is ever faster and more robust.


As a key and senior member on our team, you will collaborate with other executives, engineers, product management, and operations. We’re a small team so every individual matters. 


Our culture is fun, fast-paced, performance-oriented, open, collegial, and we are constantly pushing the technology envelope to the edge!  All of our positions are based in the financial district of San Francisco, CA right on top of a BART and Muni stop.


 We are looking for:


We're looking for a UI / UX Designer who can help drive the interface from both a technical perspective across all of our design assets as well as CSS code. You must be a critical, inventive thinker with a clear sense of user-centered design process, an excitement for understanding and using data, and an ability to communicate your ideas effectively.


You'll lead the evolution of our product with conceptual design, but have enough respect for your craft to be able to implement pixel-perfect design. You'll champion the voice of the user by conducting ongoing research of how people are using the Loggly product - using this feedback to inform your design. You are a part of the engineering team, and should be technical enough to grow to understand the core use cases around our audience of DevOps and SysAdmins.  


 What you'll do:



  • Translate complex visions and product functionality into simple, streamlined, and elegant designs that emphasize minimal effort for our thousands of customers.

  • Create and communicate design principles and guidelines for our team to follow.

  • Deliver detailed prototypes, mockups, wireframes, and design assets. 

  • Design tools and workflows for internal teams.

  • Run design reviews with cross-functional teams and conduct usability testing with external customers.

  • Work from high-level requirements and ask the right questions to gather all relevant information to guide design direction.

  • Quickly iterate on multiple design explorations to arrive at a simple, but robust solution, accounting for complex requirements.

  • Design for current experiences while also envisioning and creating new experiences for future features.

  • Collaborate on and present work to a range of stakeholders – executives, engineers, product managers and business leaders.

  • Stay current on emerging design trends, music innovations, and broader technologies and identify opportunities to incorporate best current thinking into product designs.


 What’s Next


If you're interested in joining the team; please send us your resume. Let us know how you fit the bill for each of our requirements. Loggly is a place that values individuality, variety, and diversity. We have lots of hikers, bikers, gamers, musicians and other interesting folks so use your judgment and write to us in your own voice about your talents.  If you have a presence on the web that we can easily access where you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or practice another craft besides designing powerful software, we’d love to hear about it.


We’ll start with an initial phone interview and based on that, we’ll invite you in to meet the team – starting with the CTO and CEO; as we said, we’re a small team and every member is important!  We hope you’ll do some research on Loggly and try out our product before you arrive.




  • Loggly is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

  • **Immigration sponsorship will be considered**

  • **NO relocation available**

  • **Must work onsite full-time in San Francisco, CA**

If you love developing quality code and having project ownership then this is the role for you!

item.title: Software Engineer (Computational Geometry) at Plethora (San Francisco, CA)

Computational Geometry Engineer for CAD
You’ll be helping us build our add-ins for CAD applications that provide helpful real-time manufacturability feedback, pricing and ordering.
Responsibilities

  • Analyze production data to improve algorithms for error detection, part costing, etc.

item.title: Internal Systems Application Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Internal Systems department develops technology and enterprise-level applications that keep the company running. We build applications and infrastructure that allow our employees to connect and perform their day-to-day jobs. Our applications range from a highly tuned in-house Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system to communication and collaboration tools.

The successful candidate will be a motivated, creative and well-rounded application developer with strong communication skills, as we work directly with every part of the organization.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Sales Intelligence (OO Development, SQL)

The Sales Intelligence group builds a metadata driven CRM. Our in-house CRM empowers our sales force, provides insights to enable product growth and helps manage all aspects of the sales cycle. Features include a flexible back-end that allows for dynamic configurations of screens and NLP integration to scrape data.

Communication Tools & Applications (C++)

The Communication Tools & Applications group supports Bloomberg's Analytics Team in building the Bloomberg HELP HELP platform. This platform enables our 300,000+ clients to connect in real-time with our unparalleled analytics and technical support staff. HELP HELP includes a number of sophisticated components including a high availability distribution system that uses NLP and machine learning to route all incoming phone calls, instant messages and emails.

Network & FIX Infrastructure (C++)

The Network & FIX Infrastructure group develops systems for electronic trading and enterprise transactional feeds for the world's largest private network, Bloomberg. Our configuration and monitoring systems are distributed across the entire network to collect real-time performance metrics. The algorithms we build optimize network traffic and connectivity for various Bloomberg products.

Security and Compliance (C++ / C#)

The Security and Compliance group builds the Bloomberg terminal's access control system and trading compliance system. The access control system manages all aspects of security including entry to our facilities and access to the Bloomberg terminal. Our tools ensure that our business and systems can operate at all times, even during power outages or transportation disruptions. The trading compliance system hosts rules of country-specific eligibility requirements for our electronic trading platforms.

Network Applications (C++)

The Network Applications group architects and develops a superior network management system used to design, provision, troubleshoot and monitor the world's largest private network. We build applications that direct client connections, send traffic from one data center to another, troubleshoot, configure network devices, and deploy and upgrade client appliance software.

Contracts and Exchanges/Contribution Entitlements (C++ / C#)

The Contracts and Exchanges/Contribution Entitlements group develops three main products: Exchanges/3rd Party Entitlements, Enterprise-wide Contracts Management and the Customer Service Web Portal. Our Exchanges/3rd Party Entitlement systems are designed to accommodate a high volume of hits. Bloomberg's legal department uses the Contracts Management System to fully automate client interaction during contract negotiations and execution. The Customer Service Portal is a web-based interface that provides clients with the tools to manage their suite of Bloomberg products.

Installations and Electronic Trading Integration (C++/SQL)

The Installations and Electronic Trading Integration group builds the configuration management tool that controls much of Bloomberg's electronic trading platform. We develop the applications that support the infrastructure of Bloomberg's order enterprise system. These applications are developed for both the Bloomberg terminal and the Bloomberg Professional mobile app.

HR Tools and Applications (C++, Node.js)

The HR Tools and Applications group builds Bloomberg's Human Capital Management (HCM) and Business Process Management (BPM) systems. We develop highly available systems that provide an excellent user experience in over 75 countries. Our group uses JavaScript-based UI frameworks, MS SQL Server, Oracle databases, and web services written in C#, C++, Java and Python.

Ticketing Systems (OO Development, SQL)

The Ticketing Systems group ensures that the global company runs smoothly, handling all types of tickets from simple temperature control requests to complex enterprise project management. The group maintains the ticketing application and infrastructure, which includes an intelligent distribution server that guarantees requests are routed to the right people. Additional features include a comprehensive suite of searching and reporting tools, intricate graphical support applications and quality assurance mechanisms.

Global Installs and Customer Support / Special Projects (C++/SQL)

The Technical Operations/Special Projects group works with our Chief Risk and Compliance Office (CRCO) to ensure that we protect the security of clients' logins and provide platinum customer service. Our tools help clients gain terminal access when traditional means are unavailable. This includes authentication using SMS messages, automated calls and system-generated security questions. The group works with the CRCO to develop solutions to protect the Bloomberg terminal from hacking.

item.title: Sr Systems Engineer at VOSTROM (Phoenix, AZ)
item.description:
Senior Systems Engineer – Emphasis on UNIX / Virtualization / Storage / Clusters

The Opportunity:

We're looking for experience systems engineers based in Phoenix, AZ metro area. Candidates should have at least five years of work history performing devops, or managing large scale UNIX-like computer systems and/or clusters (using a wide range of Linux, *BSD, and other systems). Candidates with specific expertise in systems security hardening, cluster management or automation of software and network monitoring will be given priority.

The Day to Day:

  • Manage systems with hundreds of computers running advanced, modern software
  • Plan for and deploy new infrastructure to meet growing customer needs
  • Interface with data center staff to plan and prepare for growth
  • Anticipate tomorrow's problems and set up proactive monitoring to avoid them

Requirements:

  • Substantial experience with different UNIX-like systems, more=better
  • Experience setting up database platforms (but not necessarily a DBA)
  • Experience with virtualization systems
  • Information security experience
  • US Citizenship / Legally authorized to work in US

Bonus Points:

  • DevOps experience with Linux or FreeBSD 
  • Security training and/or certifications
  • Familiarity with large scale storage systems such as Ceph or GlusterFS
  • Familiarity with large scale clusters
  • Hands-on experience with a variety of deployment / automation tools
  • Experience with Python, Ruby, Perl and/or shell scripting 
  • Mac OS X familiarity 
  • BS or MS in a technology or scientific field of study
  • High energy level and pleasant, positive attitude!
  • History of participation in organized sports (high school or college athletic teams)
  • Evidence of working well within a diverse team

Compensation:

  • Salary commensurate with experience, generally higher than competitive industries
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • Opportunities for advancement and a clear career path

About Us:

We conduct advanced technical research and develop innovative software and systems that help meet network security and reliability challenges for organizations world-wide.  You can read more at our web site.  

Career Opportunities:

We have many other openings available. For a complete listing, visit jobs.vostrom.com

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at Taxibeat Ltd (Athens, Greece)

item.title: Platform Engineer at Moltin (Newcastle upon Tyne, UK)

item.title: Full Stack Engineer (Node.js/Scala, Javascript) at Findify (Stockholm, Sweden) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for Full Stack Engineers who have a special interest in Machine Learning. If you love building products that customers love, and want to use Machine Learning to solve real-life problems, we really do want you!


Our tech stack: 


We always strive to use the most suitable tool for the job, so our stack is constantly evolving. Currently, our backend is written mostly in Scala and Node.js. We use Scala for data processing and to power our machine learning algorithms. We use Node as a web framework to facilitate the interaction with our customers via various APIs. We make extensive use of AWS, and use any component we find suitable within our architecture, so we can focus on building our proprietary tech.


We’re not afraid to challenge our choices, we love open source and above all, we’re a product driven company so technology is at the core of everything we do. You can check out our full stack on StackShare.


Our development culture:


We are a small team that moves fast and iterates. We do weekly sprints, code reviews, testing, and once your code is submitted it gets pushed to production through our continuous deployment infrastructure (using Jenkins). We put a lot of emphasis on code style, cleanliness and robustness. You will get to work with amazing engineers specializing in machine learning and distributed systems.


What you can expect from us:


As an early engineer in a small team, you’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact on the product, company vision and culture. You will get to work with the latest technologies out there, without being bound to any legacy. Have the opportunity to solve real-life problems using machine learning. We will never limit your creativity, never shut down ideas before testing them with customers and we will never be boring! it's going to be an exciting ride!


If this sounds like a company you’d love be a part of building, and you’ve got the skill set, please get in touch at: JoinUs+FullStack@findify.io



We’d love to hear from you!

item.title: Java Software Engineer at bol.com (Bucureti, Roemenië)
item.description:
Sterksen is a Recruitment Agency, for our client Bol.com (E-commerce company) we are looking for a Senior Java Developer".


Do you combine a passion for modern tooling with a drive to be at the cutting edge of the big data revolution? Can you parse and interpret a terabyte of click data on a Hadoop cluster? Prove us that you’re a forward-thinking Java Software Engineer for our client in Utrecht the Netherlands!

Your challenge
As a Java Software Engineer you develop, test and implement innovative Java based solutions for our clients retail platform and back-end processes: “You build IT, you run IT, you love IT”. How can they port web-based solutions to mobile? How can they integrate the catalogues of external vendors into the ‘regular’ company catalogue? What tools will enable them to automate the test process? You analyze these questions – often in tandem with business units – and come up with answers that go beyond functional requirements to address performance, scalability (think HBase) and security.
You provide proactive go-live support, including organizational embedding (tests, user support, demonstrations). Additionally, you develop tools that further optimize the development process itself, helping them to realize their ambition of making continuous integration a corporate standard. You adhere to best practices, including specification by example, and are regularly asked to share your ideas with the entire organization.

Your role in bullet points



  • Develop, test, and implement Java based solutions

  • Deliver software that goes beyond basic functional requirements

  • Provide go-live support, including organizational embedding

  • Develop first-in-class tools, e.g. to automate testing

  • Ambassador of innovative ideas in software development

  • You build IT, You run IT, You love IT

item.title: Cloud Integrations Developer at Atlassian (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
If you love solving problems and have a growing appetite for building robust financial systems and integrations in a dynamic environment, Atlassian has a great opportunity for you. The Business Systems team is tasked with optimizing the systems and processes that drive Atlassian from order to cash, purchasing, and people systems. You will be responsible for all aspects of designing and deploying custom interfaces and integrations across various financial modules. Projects will include building customizations and configuring existing systems in order to meet requirements that are unique to Atlassian's business model. While evaluating new technological solutions and making recommendations to enhance existing systems and tools, you will also have the opportunity to partner with Finance and IT teams to support key Business Process Transformation initiatives around Order to Cash and Source to Pay tracks, from systems stand point - this includes developing appropriate documentation for architectural, design, technical, implementation and test activities. Ultimately, it is all about building efficient systems and tools that enable finance teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.


More about You



We love developers/analysts who are self-starters, motivated, data-driven, and carry a relaxed yet enthusiastic attitude. You will need to have a BS/BA/IT Degree or equivalent experience with 2+ years of experience managing and deploying process updates and integration services to/on an ERP platform. Your colleagues describe you as a go-to person for challenges around technical integrations architecture, dealing with complex data structure patterns. If you have hands on experience with REST, Web Services, XML, XSLT and working knowledge of scripting languages (Perl/Python/Php/Unix Shell) and ANSI/SQL, then that's a big plus. You bring with you, a good 3-5 years of experience implementing and supporting ERP applications (NetSuite/Oracle/Workday) and have strong hands-on experience with Integrations like SFDC, AvaTax, 3rd Party Middleware (Boomi, Mulesoft, etc.) and off-the-shelf Billing/Revenue Recognition systems. You must have excellent written, verbal and listening communication skills and be able to prioritize and deliver the most important things first.


You are a good fit if you relish solving challenges, have the ability to see around corners and know whats coming next and your personal mantra is 'bring it on' when faced with a new challenge.

item.title: DevOps Engineer (Python) at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you the missing link between our IT Operations and Trading departments? Do you get excited about designing, developing and implementing improvements to our monitoring systems? If that sounds like you, then you might be our new DevOps Engineer.


What you will do
As a DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and maintaining software to monitor our complex trading architecture. You will work in a fast-paced environment where your actions have a direct impact on our P&L and thus on the success of Optiver. You will be working with highly skilled and engaged colleagues in an informal and dynamic setting. On top of that you will be in direct contact with our traders and technical stakeholders.


As a DevOps Engineer you will:



  • Create, develop and maintain software to monitor our complex trading architecture;

  • Join in projects to design and implement new parts of the monitoring system;

  • Deploy and support our monitoring systems and dashboards;

  • Automate the process of getting data from different sources to compare with baselines and automatically act on breaches;

  • Help users (traders and trading application engineers) gain insight in the performance of our trading systems;

  • Pro-actively think of new ways to measure our performance, by interacting with the users of the system, being trading application engineers and traders;

  • Constantly be on top of your game to increase the team- and system performance;

  • Be challenged to handle our complex and large data sets.
