item.title: Web Developer at Markit (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
• Engineer and maintain high traffic, highly visibility sites for the world’s largest financial firms and media outlets. (We received 5 billion hits last month).
• Gain exposure to the stock market and other financial data, while developing applications that present dynamic information from a variety of sources.
• Use proprietary technologies and industry standard best practices to build and deliver high performance web applications for users across the globe.
• Compliment enterprise application sites with both existing and custom jQuery plugins.
• Utilize progressive enhancement techniques to support older browsers, while simultaneously delivering cutting-edge user experience in modern browsers.

Requirements
• Solid understanding of client-side development with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
• Experience utilizing client-side frameworks like jQuery, jQuery Mobile, and Modernizr
• Ability to develop full-scale applications with C# .NET, or comparable platforms
• Experience with object-oriented principles and development patterns like MVC
• Excellent technical, analytical, and communication skills
• Experience or interest in learning mobile web development a plus
• SVN and/or GIT knowledge preferred
• Demonstrated ability to work and learn independently or as part of a team
• Must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis

Compensation
• Salary – Commensurate with experience
• Medical, dental, and vision insurance
• Company paid life insurance
• Matching 401(k)
• Gym reimbursement
• Three weeks paid vacation plus holidays, personal time, sick time and paid volunteer days
• Commuting benefits including paid public transportation (Eco Pass), bike-to-work incentives, in-door bike parking and discounted bike safety gear


Markit On Demand is a design driven technology company based in Boulder, Colorado. We’re part of Markit, a global financial information company that’s headquartered in London. Here in Boulder, where the sun shines 300 days a year, we have a team of 400+ professionals dedicated to the presentation of financial content and data for our clients in the Financial Services, Media and Healthcare industries. On any given day, you might work with a colleague in New York, a retail brokerage in the US, a newspaper in Germany, a bank in Africa, or throw ideas around with an economist in our London office. (And that’s before you meet up with co-workers for a foothills hike or brewery happy hour).

Notes
Please include a link to code samples and/or your GitHub repository in the cover letter section. You may instead include code samples as an attachment when submitting your resume.

item.title: Network Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT)
item.description:
Be more than an IT wizard! Be someone who saves the lives of animals. Best Friends Animal Society is looking for a Network Engineer.  We are working to end the killing of more than 9,000 dogs and cats who lose their lives in animal shelters daily, just for not having safe places to call home. It’s an enormous endeavor, and we need the support of a strong IT department. Come be a part of it, and never see a cubicle again. Here, IT works among the gorgeous red rock canyons of southern Utah in a warm and relaxed environment. And when you take a break, you can come pet some of the 1,700 animals who call Best Friends Animal Sanctuary their “home-between-home” on any given day.  You can spend your weekends hiking at Zion’s National Park! It’s a location you have to see to believe. And a career that will really make a difference in the lives of animals.  


Position Summary: Responsible for engineering, architecture and the daily management of Network Infrastructure, including Branch office, VPN and Data Center connectivity. Responsible for all upgrades and design engineering of complex network infrastructure, including LAN/WAN, Fiber Optic, Ethernet and Wireless infrastructures and network security. Network engineer works on projects as assigned, to integrate new systems into, as well as update, design and enhance, the existing network infrastructure.


Your main responsibilities will be working on Network Engineering, Voice Engineering/Architecture,  Fiber Optic/Data Infrastructure Engineering, System Engineering and Project Management.  


For a full description of responsiblities, please check out the posting on our Careers site.

item.title: Creative Web Designer/Marketing Analyst at Digital Animal (London, UK)
item.description:
As an Advocacy Analyst you will:



  • Educate - consult clients on the importance of advocacy marketing.

  • Build - help new clients to implement Digital Animal's technology on their websites and create successful advocacy marketing campaigns.

  • Analyse - use data to optimise campaign performance.

  • Support - help support clients in dealing with customer queries.

  • Market - help market our product to new clients through beautiful content and amazing social media marketing.


Who are we looking for?


We are looking for an Advocacy Analyst with strong front end development skills to join our team in London. You have both the ability to write good code and an eye for layout, design and UX.


You will be involved in projects from concept to completion. You will work closely with other members of the Consulting Team and with our Development Team. You will communicate directly with our Clients to establish their requirements, throughout the design and implementation of their marketing campaigns, and in the reporting of our findings and insights.


We are interested in your characteristics and not just your skills and experience.


These are the key characteristics we apply to everything we do. You will possess these characteristics too:



  • Thoughtfulness at start

  • Communication, helpfulness & openness

  • Quality & precision throughout

  • Organisation & structure throughout

  • Learning & sharing knowledge



For this specific role, we are looking for someone who:



  • Is digitally savvy

  • Is able to communicate clearly in writing and in speaking

  • Has strong numerical skills

  • Has an organised and systematic approach, complemented by creative flair

  • Pays close attention to detail

  • Believes in excellent customer service

  • Wants to learn about digital advertising and data

  • Has a passion for technology, social media, advertising and marketing

  • Wants to be part of a fast-growing startup with big ambitions


Ideally you will also have experience with Web technologies used by our clients; and with design technology, including:



  • Creative design, layout and UX

  • Coding in HTML or HTML5 and CSS or CSS3.

  • Flash, Responsive design and coding, JavaScript, and cross browser compatibility.

  • Photoshop, Illustrator, Fireworks, InDesign



Salary


Your initial salary will be between £25 and £35k, depending on experience, plus stock options.



How to apply


Send an email with a covering letter and CV to: frederic.kalinke@digitalanimal.com


In your letter, answer the following questions.




  • What’s wrong with our website?



  • Which brands market themselves well online and why?



If successful, then you will be invited for an interview at our London office.


If we like the look of each other after interviews, we will invite you to work with us for a week or two (paid, of course) so that we can see how you fit in, and you can get a real feel for what your job would be like.  We appreciate you may already be in full, or part time employment/education, if that is the case - we’ll work with you to find the best way forward.


Please phone 0207 724 9363 or email frederic.kalinke@digitalanimal.com for any further information.

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at Atlassian (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Love staying ahead of the growth curve and experimenting with new software and environments? Get on board as an Atlassian Site Reliability Engineer.


 As part of the Service Ops team, you’ll build solutions to problems that interrupt availability, performance and stability of how our systems, services and products scale. You'll also respond to alerts, pings, pages, queries and problems that you can investigate and really sink your teeth into.


You'll be working on hardware or virtualized delivery systems, automation (like provisioning systems), monitoring and data collection and configuration management (we use fab, puppet, FAI).


One thing we promise: you’ll never be bored.


More about you


We’d love if you have experience working with Apache, Nginx, Bash, Linux, AWS, virtualization technologies, Nagios, Python, Java, Puppet and yes, Atlassian products too if possible.


 The best person for this role is someone that has a collaborative spirit - in our world, it’s not about being a hero and having all the answers, it’s about sometimes saying "I don't know" and working on finding solutions rather than starting with an assumption. The team needs someone who can ask questions, learn from others and turn chaos into order.


This role would be a great fit for someone that likes to see concrete results from their work as you will be developing and delivering solutions that operate at scale - seeing your own technology efforts grow and evolve, from a proof of concept to hosting 180,000 JVMs on 50,000+ VMs running in production.


Site Reliability Engineers often wear many different hats, and are called to step up in times of crisis, so the right candidate will possess:


A clear head in the presence of alerts / Nerf darts


Solid communication skills with team members near and far


Strong knowledge of emoticons and memes


Awareness and insight into industry trends (technology, methods and tooling)


Strong scripting experience - we don't want you doing repetitive work!


Serious troubleshooting skills across different levels of the stack


Participation in an on-call rotation and occasional shift work


Understanding ITIL terminology like incident and problem would be a plus

item.title: Java Software Engineer with a passion for modern tooling at Bol.com (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
Over 5 million Dutch and Belgian customers have already discovered that bol.com is a great place to shop. Because we offer over 9(!) million products. Because our products are easy to find on any device. And because every visit is an inspiring, ‘strictly personal’ shopping experience. With 15 to 20 million page views per day, bol.com is a textbook example of a state of the art big data environment. This environment is developed and maintained by 30+ Scrum teams. From desktop to mobile, and from product catalogue to CRM systems; our Scrum teams create the bol.com landscape and make it future-proof. Do you combine a passion for modern tooling with a drive to be at the cutting edge of the big data revolution? Prove to bol.com that you’re a forward-thinking Software Engineer!


As a Software Engineer you develop, test and implement innovative Java based solutions for our retail platform and back-end processes. How can we port web-based solutions to mobile? How can we integrate the catalogues of external vendors (bol.com Plaza) into the ‘regular’ bol.com catalogue? What tools will enable us to automate the test process? You analyze these questions – often in tandem with business units – and come up with answers that go beyond functional requirements to address performance, scalability (think HBase) and security. You provide proactive go-live support, including organizational embedding (tests, user support, demonstrations). Additionally, you develop tools that further optimize the development process itself, helping us to realize our ambition of making continuous integration a corporate standard. You adhere to best practices, including specification by example, and are regularly asked to share your ideas with the entire organization.


Your role in bullet points



  • Develop, test, and implement Java based solutions

  • Deliver software that goes beyond basic functional requirements

  • Provide go-live support, including organizational embedding

  • Develop first-in-class tools, e.g. to automate testing

  • Ambassador of innovative ideas in software development

item.title: Software Test Engineer (m/f) (88555) at BMW Group (Ulm, Deutschland)
item.description:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR DYNAMIC DEVELOPMENT PROCESSES.



If it's good enough, we make it better. To be included in a BMW, every element has to be first-class. The best way to guarantee this is to start with ideal conditions and an outstanding team of specialists. Are you ready to overcome every obstacle, to turn exceptional ideas into reality and to set new benchmarks? We’re ready too, so our team in Ulm is currently seeking a:


Software Test Engineer (m/f)
Job reference: 88555


Cars, Linux, Python, C, C++, Git, Gerrit: you name it -- we have it! We offer you a chance to work in an international team at BMW Car IT, which acts as a company-internal vendor of software, cooperating closely with other departments responsible for designing and building automotive software components. You work together with your scrum team to understand the features and their technical implications. You will identify use cases and create automated test cases on different levels (module, subsystem, system). Your work takes you through test planning, designing and developing test cases and test automation frameworks like xUnit and GoogleTest. Special attention is given to test automation, where you are responsible for test design, test execution, analysis of test results, defect analysis and reporting. Continuous improvement and optimization of test tools and processes complete your list of tasks. An important aspect of your work will be to bridge commercial QA practices and ideas with Linux Community standards.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Java Lead Engineer (m/f) (98074) at BMW Group (Ulm, Deutschland)
item.description:
EVEN IN ELECTRONICS, YOU CAN GO AGAINST THE CURRENT.
SHARE YOUR PASSION IN A TEAM OF FREE THINKERS.


More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly new solutions. Naturally, that includes flexible working models, so that our IT specialists are free to go in unconventional directions. We want to keep pushing the limits of what's possible, so our team in Ulm is currently seeking a:


Java Lead Engineer (m/f)


Job reference: 98074


BMW Car IT (a 100% subsidiary of the BMW Group) is offering you a challenging position in the field of Java Lead Engineer. We are looking for an experienced Java/JEE engineer to establish a company-wide continuous integration (CI) service based on Jenkins. You will be part of an international team of highly talented software engineers at our site in Ulm, Germany. Together you will drive innovation and improvements in BMW"s software engineering practices. You improve and extend the existing code base, driven by customers’ requirements and you are responsible for discussion and guide architectural issues within the development team. Furthermore you work closely with customers to find the best possible CI process. In addition you improve performance and scalability of the CI system.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.

item.title: Software Project Leader (m/f) at Harman Becker Automotive Systems GmbH (Karlsbad, Deutschland)

As a Harman employee, you will have the opportunity to actively shape the future and be an important part of Harman's success story. Our dynamic and international business offers you numerous opportunities to further develop and make an impact. Your knowledge and commitment will be rewarded with an attractive compensation package. HARMAN is an employer who values equal employment opportunities for both, women and men. Applications from qualified women are particularly welcome.

item.description:

Qt Creator provides a cross-platform, complete integrated development environment (IDE) for application developers to create applications for desktop, embedded and mobile device platforms, such as Android and iOS. It is available for Linux, OS X and Windows operating systems.


To continuously keep our mobile related tooling up to date we are searching for an experienced C++ developer, preferably with background on mobile technologies and platforms.


Responsibilities

  • Harmonize connectivity for multiple platforms

item.description:
As the Technical Director at GameDuell you will establish best practices, processes, methodologies, and overall solutions for the studio. You will ensure, that all our development staff, game engineers, shared tech engineers, and tech operations are aligned towards common objectives, have opportunities for professional growth, and take ownership over our technical future. You will work with other engineering teams to ensure that our large-scale gaming services continue to scale and evolve to meet our future gaming needs.






Your tasks




  • Full accountability for all our technology, architecture and tech processes in the studio

  • Ensure technical alignment of multi-platform (mobile, canvas) development

  • Identify, communicate and pursue key strategic engineering efforts

  • Drive communication across all disciplines in coordinating engineering plans

  • Lead technical design reviews to identify potential problems

  • Identify/plan tool development to improve productivity

item.title: Automated Test Engineer at iXara Ltd (Great Gaddesden, UK)
item.description:
iXara is looking for a software tester to help construct, expand and maintain a suite of automatic tests for our new cloud-based products. The position will also include work on automatic tests for Xara’s Designer product range and some manual testing, particularly using mobile devices. 



  • The position is suitable for someone who is keen to become an expert in the field of automated testing of web based products.

  • Collaborate closely with the development team to develop test strategies and help to isolate and reproduce bugs.

  • Innovate to find ways to effectively automate tests that would otherwise have to be executed manually.

  • Monitor and maintain the regression test suite in a continuous integration environment, alerting the development team to problems found with the software.

  • Continually improve the test suit in terms of adding tests to increase test coverage, improving the robustness of existing automatic tests and increasing test execution speed, again in collaboration with the product developers.

  • Keep up to date with the latest test automation technologies for web and mobile testing.


This is a permanent position, based in iXara's country mansion HQ in Hemel Hempstead. 


Competitive salary dependent on experience, plus benefits including company pension contributions & private medical insurance.

item.title: System Engineer at Rocket Internet (Berlin, Germany)
item.description: We are currently seeking for an experienced System Engineer to reinforce our team and help us in launching successful Internet projects all over the world. You will be taking on an eclectic mixture of tasks regarding software and systems and will be helping to design, build and maintain the core infrastructure underpinning a highly complex and massive scale platform. Your mission will be to ensure the project’s success concerning the development and enhancement of our prolific international internet-startups. You will encounter new and challenging situations every day and will be in charge of technical support and the management of availability, efficiency and scalability of software and systems. At Rocket you will help us develop fast growing Internet companies and benefit from the broad expertise of our high-energy IT team. In return, you can expect an attractive salary and various opportunities to grow on, both, a personal and professional level.

item.title: Embedded Software Engineer at Intel (Leixlip, Ireland)

As an Embedded Software Engineer, you will play an integral role in designing and developing software for new Quark silicon devices, ensuring that we develop outstanding products.

item.title: UI Tools Programmer (C#/WPF) at Rockstar Games (Edinburgh, UK)

The UI Tools Programmer role will involve developing and maintaining current and future GUI applications to be used across multiple projects and platforms. Our GUI development includes working with frameworks and technology related to content creation through to the game engine. RESPONSIBILITIES

SKILLS

As a member of the Web Applications team, you’ll be responsible for refining, evolving and innovating new features to improve the speed and functionality of our software applications.  By utilizing your expertise with all aspects of the software development lifecycle (architecture through release) and your strong coding skills, you will influence internal teams to develop software that will take our job seeker experience to the next level.

item.title: Senior Backend Web Developer at Architect (London, UK)
item.description:

item.title: Operations Engineer at Hudson River Trading (NY, NY)
item.description:
Ops Engineers at HRT support and maintain the production trading platform. In many ways, they are HRT's traders. In a high performance environment, immediate awareness of and reaction to systems and trading issues is essential.  It is the job of the Trade Ops team to oversee the internal systems, all connections with external markets, and develop software tools to keep our trading efficient and processes as automated as possible.


Ops Engineers are the nucleus of all other teams at HRT — from strategy and business development to systems administration, and from accounting to core developers — they combine their efforts to create and maintain a high-quality, robust trading platform. This approach is both tactical and strategic: Ops is the first line of defense during the trading day but also is pivotal for rolling out the newest technologies.


While a technical background is a plus, common-sense and a can-do attitude are the only true prerequisites.

item.title: Web Application Architect at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for a web application architect that has formal training in computer science, and experience designing scaleable applications. 

This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website.

As a part of ASML’s Metrology Software department, you will provide the software solutions that realize the metrology system functions, producing sub-nm measurement and control accuracy. Cooperate with other disciplines and suppliers to ensure the timely realization of competitive, achievable and serviceable products. Participate in the definition of system specifications

  • Reshaping the software architecture to facilitate the efficient implementation of the required functionality within a machine environment.

  • Taking the lead in decisions about the direction that need to be taken and driving these ideas.

  • Show technical leadership to assist and steer Software Engineers and influence stakeholders to realize the software architecture changes and development methods.

item.title: Software Design Engineer at ASML (Veldhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Introduction
Is solving complex software engineering problems your passion? Does working in a multi-cultural environment make you spin? Does contributing to world’s most advanced lithography machines make you feel proud? Then this might be the right opportunity for you.

Job Mission
As a part of ASML’s Metrology Software department, you will provide the software solutions that realize the metrology system functions, producing sub-nm measurement and control accuracy. Your solutions emerge from sound software engineering practice and take low effort to develop and maintain. You choose for system-wide experience and drive for successful customer deployment.

Job Description
ASML’s lithography systems deliver nanometer accuracy at high productivity. The required accuracy level cannot be achieved by hardware and mechatronics solutions only. At system level, imperfections of the subsystems need to be measured and corrected. The Metrology Functional Group creates mathematical models describing the lithography machine and its imperfections. The parameters of these models are calibrated using several sensors present in the machine. The calibrations of the machine can be done offline in a dedicated calibration test, or inline while running production. Afterwards, the calibrated parameters are used to control the machine in such a manner that the inaccuracies are corrected.

Solutions of the Metrology Functional Group are implemented in software by the Metrology Software Department. Your role is to design, realize and integrate high-quality software engineering solutions, allowing fast and efficient delivery of complex metrology functions. Within the Metrology Software Department, we are reshaping our software architecture to facilitate seamless implementation of the metrology functions in our software. By introducing engineering practices such as Model Driven Engineering, we increase our engineering efficiency.

item.title: Web Development Manager at University of Scranton (Scranton, PA)
item.description:
The University of Scranton is a regional institution of more than 6,000 undergraduate and graduate students located in northeastern Pennsylvania near the Pocono Mountains. Recognized nationally for the quality of its education, Scranton is one of 28 Jesuit colleges and universities in the United States. It is committed to providing liberal arts education and strong professional and pre-professional programs in the context of Ignatian educational principles, focusing on the care and development of each individual. The University’s 58-acre hillside campus is in the heart of Scranton, a community of 75,000 within a greater metropolitan area of 750,000 people and is within two and a half hours of New York City and Philadelphia. Since 2003, the University has invested more than $237 million in campus improvements.

The University is seeking a qualified individual to fill the position of Web Development Manager. The Web Development Manager coordinates and performs development, maintenance, enhancement and design of strategic areas of the University website. This position will assist in maintaining and extending the University's brand by developing engaging web experiences. In addition, the Manager provides advice, insight, and recommendations on future concepts, development, and direction of the University's web presence. The Manager provides strategic coordination and project management for the University's content management system in collaboration with a cross-divisional leadership team, engages and manages external Web developers/designers within budget to assist in the completion of projects, and evaluates the effectiveness, usability, and accessibility of University web sites using analytics and other performance measures. This position also supervises a web developer.

Minimum Qualifications:
The right candidate will have a bachelor's degree in computer science, website design and development, information technology, or a closely related discipline. Three years of experience in the design, creation, and implementation of professional websites is required. The position requires previous experience with an organization's website built with an enterprise content management system (CMS), experience managing web and content production, information architecture, user experience, interactive design, and analytics/testing (including mobile), as well as proficiency with HTML, CSS, and XML. This position requires strong project management skills.

For more information and to apply for this position, please visit our website http://apptrkr.com/662018 . Only applications submitted through our online application system will be accepted for this position.  

The University is committed to developing a diverse faculty, staff, and student body and to modeling an inclusive campus community which values the expression of differences in ways that promote excellence in teaching, learning, personal development, and institutional success. The University welcomes Veterans, minority persons, women, and persons with disabilities to apply. The University of Scranton is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer/Educator.

You should like to break things, be exhilarated when you discover that really complicated bug, and be detail-oriented enough that you've actually had people comment on it.



Responsibilities:



  • Work with developers, product owners, and other members of the agile team to create test plans and test cases to ensure complete, thorough test coverage of new features and reported issues

  • Perform both manual and automated testing

  • Extend the automation test framework when appropriate

  • Validate code changes against existing test suites

  • Investigate test and production failures, perform root-cause analysis and create detailed, complete incident reports.

  • Participate in product and feature design with developers.

  • Support product deployments to test and production environments.

item.title: Senior System Administrator (z/VM, z/Linux) at Marist College (Poughkeepsie, NY)
item.description:
Senior System Administrator (z/VM, z/Linux)


The Department of Information Technology at Marist College invites applications for a Senior System Administrator to assure the operational integrity and connectivity of servers, and deploying integrated solutions to solve customer needs and requests. This includes administration of z/VM and z/Linux servers, along with preparing, installing, testing and maintaining z/Linux.



The Senior System Administrator will develop and maintain applications, backup/recovery, and disaster recovery procedures; Monitor security and report potential or existing problems; Work closely with other departments to develop and deploy integrated solutions to solve customer needs and requests; and participate in planning, designing, and implementing client/server based solutions. The person in this role will also participate in and provide support for college initiatives, participate in the Open Source community, and work with vendors.     



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline is desired, but not mandatory. A minimum of three years of experience in server administration is required. A minimum of three years of experience in troubleshooting hardware and software problems, and knowledge of and experience with networks and networking devices are preferred. Candidates must have a thorough understanding of z/VM and Linux Server operating systems. Knowledge of REXX, Perl, and/or other scripting and programming languages helpful.



Marist College is an independent and comprehensive liberal arts institution located in New York's historic Hudson River Valley. Situated on 210 acres overlooking the Hudson River, it enrolls 4,787 traditional undergraduate, 799 full and part-time graduate and 543 continuing education students. Marist also has a branch campus in Florence, Italy, and extension sites throughout New York. Marist has been recognized for excellence by U.S. News & World Report, TIME Magazine, The Princeton Review's The Best 376 Colleges, and Barron's Best Buys in College Education and is noted for being a pioneer in the area of online degree programs.


To learn more or to apply, please visit http://jobs.marist.edu. Only online applications are accepted.


Marist College is strongly committed to the principle of diversity and is especially interested in receiving applications from members of ethnic and racial minority groups, women, persons with disabilities, veterans, and persons from other under-represented groups.


AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER


Apply Here PI91562874

item.title: Analytics, Trading, And Execution C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Analytics, Trading, and Execution is the largest and fastest growing department in R&D, and we are looking to add skilled software developers to our six core groups. The applications and infrastructure we build connect supply and demand across all asset classes on worldwide exchanges. Trillions of dollars of capital move through our systems daily; as a result, market leaders rely on us to flawlessly and seamlessly manage their positions and execute their orders.

We are looking for bold, energetic, and independent developers to take ownership and responsibility in growing our industry leading applications. The ideal candidates should be able to lead projects, work with the business, meet clients, and understand their workflows to build high performance software. Our engineers are responsible for front-end UI/workflow applications, server-side/back-end development, system design, and high performance transactional database programming.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Trading Solutions

Trading Solutions is the largest group within Analytics, Trading, and Execution. The group designs and builds Bloomberg's three core order management systems, a fully developed connectivity and integration product and an order execution platform. These mission-critical trading applications are used by broker dealers and investment advisers throughout the world for managing orders, executions, quotes and positions. We are the global leader in building and delivering vital financial trading applications that allow banks and investment managers to manage their order flow, risk, P&L and the entire trade life cycle. Institutions rely on our advanced tools for market compliance, connectivity and algorithmic strategy trading. Collectively, our teams provide a front to back environment to meet our clients' ever changing needs.

Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities

The Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities (FICC) electronic trading group develops a global product that facilitates dealer to client trading, liquidity, and straight through processing using the Bloomberg terminal. It is the primary mechanism by which our buy-side clients source liquidity. Over the last 20 years, FICC has evolved from selling a simple dealer platform to offering a sophisticated trading platform with an array of trading styles. Responsibilities include infrastructure design and implementation, database management and user interface development.

Equity Trader

The Equity Trader group provides highly resilient, efficient, configurable and distributed real-time trading platforms. We build the analytics used to make trading decisions, the UI used to interact with the market and other traders, tools to automate workflow, and advanced alerting to monitor ongoing activity. The system handles millions of transactions per day and enables traders to send orders to over 5,000 liquidity destinations globally. The transactions are published and mined for real-time analytics and post-trade execution analysis, and are then fed back into the system to shape tomorrow's trading decisions.

Institutional Sales Applications

The Institutional Sales Applications group develops multi-asset applications for sales professionals that empower them to provide world-class service to their institutional clients. Our applications leverage sophisticated algorithms to present easy to understand answers to questions that a salesperson faces throughout the day. Successful developers are interested in finding solutions to manage and distill large volumes of disparate data.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics

The Portfolio and Risk Analytics group develops applications that provide transparency to asset managers and analysts, to help them to make well-informed financial decisions. Our clients use our real-time system for performance analysis and returns attribution, risk analytics, intraday monitoring, optimization and idea generation. Portfolio and Risk Analytics also provides a suite of global, transparent and independent indices to serve the needs of the investment community. Our team applies broad financial and mathematical knowledge across a range of asset types to develop a constantly growing set of analytics. The scale of these calculations offers opportunities for optimizing the system using Hbase, Spark, Redis and Solr. The team is redesigning a large part of our architectural stack to keep pace with the tremendous growth of our product.

Tradebook

Tradebook is building the next generation low latency trading platform, which supports multi-asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets. Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker and technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting equities, futures, options and FX trading. We focus on developing real-time black box and algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions to 120+ liquidity venues globally.

item.title: Senior C# WPF Developer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Senior C# WPF Software Developer you will make Coolblue work using brand-new Vanessa applications. 1000+ colleagues use your applications on a daily basis.


What you tell your friends you do
"I'm the glue that connects the pretty screens to the data."


What you will really be doing



  • Develop WPF applications software with a slick and intuitive interface. 

  • Buddy up with the designers and Web API developers.

  • Deliver quality work, which is easily maintainable and future-proof. Concerning the 3-tier application itself, we like MVVM, since it helps in making our applications loosely coupled. 

  • Consume the data from our web services, so you can focus on creating an intuitive user interface.

  • Write testable code that will be continuously tested and deployed by TeamCity and Octopus Deploy, and will have a real effect on live environments.

  • Coach and provide feedback to fellow developers.

  • Think about technical choices, such as our architecture, tools and processes.


 How will you be doing this?



  • You will actively participate in your multidisciplinary team's Scrum process.

  • You will receive and pro-actively get feedback from end users and developers. After evaluation of this feedback you might incorporate it in a new iteration.

  • You will actively think about technical choices, such as our architecture, tools and processes. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • You open pull requests, review the code and give feedback that makes your team even better.

  • You will perform code-reviews in order to provide feedback that makes your team even better, and to maintain a high level of quality in our code bases.

  • You will work in a motivated team to deliver on sprint commitment. 

  • You will actively improve overall software quality. Write SOLID and testable C# code.

  • There is always a budget for good ideas.



What we have worked on last quarter
Creating an application with a slick and intuitive GUI for our financial department, which uses our SOA to consume and store the data, enabling them to perform the part of their day-to-day operations in regards to dealing with suppliers.

What a day in the office might look like
Today is the first day of the new sprint. Yesterday you and your teammates demoed the work of the former sprint. The round of applause, the future users gave to your team was well deserved, since the WPF application is showing some serious advantages over the current way of working, and is looking very slick to beat. 'Sure', you think, the end result was good, but things could've gone a little better. In the retrospective following the demo you're able to praise the good end result and vent some constructive feedback. After the small replay in your head, you assign the top user story to yourself. The debtors from the financial department want to be able to approve or reject the agreements the purchasers create, in order to be a second set of eyes.



You walk by the web services team, thinking that for now you're going to have to mock the calls regarding the agreements, but the service containing the functionality has already been released. Attached to the user story is a smooth design, with new icons and storyboards. You spot the use of an element that doesn't exist in our WPF toolkit yet. You're going to take until lunch to decide how you will implement the control.

Team
You will be working in a dedicated and smart team with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from XAML, the ins and outs of the upcoming C# 6, Unit tests and somebody who knows Git inside out. Your team will be complemented by a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. Each of these roomies will challenge you, both technically and in a game of Nerf.

item.title: DevOps Engineer / FinTech Startup at IEX (New York, NY)
item.description:
IEX is looking for what we are calling our next System Reliability Engineer – you may also know this role as DevOps, WebOps, SystemsOps, and so on. The right person for the job will be an insatiably curious tinkerer with technical chops, who may or may not have done this type of role before. Bonus points if you take an interest in the stock market, though a willingness to learn all about the inner workings of the market is a must. In this role, you’ll be constantly optimizing and automating our processes and systems, in an effort to improve reliability, scalability, and maintainability. Plus, you’ll take on real-time responsibilities, such as monitoring, incident management, and recovery.


Coding and scripting is part of our daily life (we like python, bash, awk, sed and we are currently exploring Go). You’ll be exposed to how the technology interacts with the business side, and will gain a deep understanding of application logic and business data work-flows which is essential during the recovery process when an incident occurs. Experience with any layer in our stack (Linux, Java, C++) is highly beneficial particularly around the areas of performance and capacity. Experience in an agile environment is a plus, and a willingness to tackle the challenge of innovating within a regulated environment is key.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Responsible for monitoring the health of our systems

  • Participate in the engineering process as we design, build, and manage our systems.

  • Build tools to monitor and automate processes.

  • Be a core contributor in our change management and the post mortem processes

  • Troubleshoot issues across the whole stack - hardware, software, applications and network.

  • Document current and future configuration processes and policies.

  • Translates customer needs and projected product utilization to operational reliability targets.

  • Write systems reliability plan and report progress on attaining reliability targets to team and senior management.

  • Guides other functions (e.g., development, market operations, business development, subscribers, etc.) on reliability techniques, application and system functionality.

  • Educates and mentors team/company on operational best practices

item.title: Software Engineer at MetaBank (Sioux Falls, SD)
item.description:
Do you enjoy solving complex business problems in a fast-paced, collaborative software development environment? Would you like a new challenge? Are you looking for a stable, growing company that provides work/life balance and cutting edge technology?


Due to company growth, we are expanding our software development team. We are committed to skills development, enhanced training, and career progression for qualified candidates. Does this sound like something you’d like to be a part of? Come join us! Together, we can change the way people use money.


Job Summary:


Coordinate activities surrounding all software development. Specifically, participates in the architecture and design, oversees development and maintenance efforts for enterprise applications.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Review, analyze, and modify existing systems including coding, testing, debugging, and deployment efforts in support of enterprise needs.


Participate in requirements process providing feedback and engagement to ensure sounds processes are developed.


Provide support for complex issues within existing systems and applications, including resolution of user issues, errors in system data, and general maintenance items.


Create solutions based on experience, sound judgment, and creative problem solving.


Assist in solving complex development problems through the use of good design and practical experience.


Ensure business remains current and competitive in find emerging technologies to improve business processes.


May be asked to mentor, lead or direct the work of others.


Ensure high availability and reliability of business applications.


Demonstrate personal commitment to excellence in service to customers and other employees.


Conduct business with strict adherence to bank policies and procedures. Participate in the bank's Performance Management System.


Other duties may be assigned.

item.title: Systems Engineer at WB Games San Francisco (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Warner Bros. Games Inc. seeks a System Engineer for the WBG San Francisco Platform department. As a System Engineer at WB Games San Francisco, you play a central role that ensures our core technologies are of the highest standards and are easily reused across all of our titles and platforms.

This position requires close collaboration with all the Studio Technical Director as well as the game teams to define and implement the systems, features and tools that will be shared across our titles. You will also be a leader in establishing best practices, workflows and identifying problem areas / opportunities for improvement in the codebase.


Responsibilities include:



  • System / Feature / Tool design & implementation / Library & Service integration.

  • Establishing / refining standards & best practices.

  • Performance optimization.

  • Assess middleware and 3rd party solutions.

  • Documentation.

item.title: Senior Platform Engineer (Distributed Systems) at Sentient Technologies (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sentient Technologies has built the world’s largest and most powerful intelligent system on the planet. We use massively distributed artificial intelligence to solve the world’s most complex problems.


We're looking for an experienced and passionate platform engineer to join the Distributed Computing team. The Sentient Platform makes effective use of a million cores (outside of data centers), to solve problems in several domains that would be impossible to approach on other platforms.  


The next version of the platform is orders of magnitude bigger.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at NFL (Culver City, CA)
item.description:
The National Football League is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help make our applications amazing & incredible to use! We recently released our first Open Source project, launched a new iOS app & our team is thriving with start-up methodologies.


What’s it like to be an NFL Senior Software Engineer?



  • You have a voice at the table to innovate our software development

  • You own the custom mobile-centric software application products you build for our fans

  • You create replay-worthy experiences for our fans

  • You build products for our use of video, social & live data applications

  • You champion a legacy suite of online applications unlike any other

  • You feel the engagement of your work used by over 60 million of our fans


We’re growing our team with permanent, onsite talent & competitive compensation packages that include full healthcare benefits, bonus, pension, 401K, employee discounts, reimbursements as well as NFL Media Culture Committee perks (see our company page for more details).


Our NFL campus on Los Angeles’ west side houses the offices as well as studios for NFL Digital Media & NFL Network.

To apply, please send us your latest resume & links to your work!

item.title: Coffee Ingesting API Building PHP Developer at MediaMath (London, UK)
item.description:

We are looking for a PHP Developer with commercial experience working on LAMP systems with frameworks, who has worked in depth on both the front and back ends. You will contribute to all areas of the codebase initially, with the opportunity to specialise as the business grows.

  • To work on any other software development projects required by the company

item.title: Associate Implementation Engineer at Q2ebanking (Austin, TX)
item.description:
This position is a technical implementation role that requires mid-sized application troubleshooting and support experience.  Work as part of the Platform Advancement team and focus on optimizing our clients’ environments by implementing updated adapters, participating in configurations for platform upgrades and other as needed components into the production environment. 


Essential Job Functions:



  • Modify software as necessary including, but not limited to, changing scripts, reviewing application logs and making necessary modifications in database tables to optimize the client’s production environment

  • Construct and schedule automated processes and create custom processing scripts

  • Implement updated adapters, components and bug fixes into production environments

  • Regularly troubleshoot complex client application, integration and environment issues

  • Troubleshoot and resolve customer problems of a complex nature such as code defects, product configurations (files or data), networking, platform, third party communications, hardware configuration or other issues commonly encountered in systems operation in a networked environment

  • Thoroughly document and track production environment modifications

  • Manage multiple projects while regularly receiving escalated cases from management and prioritize accordingly

  • Regularly document and report product/application defects to Development team, and escalate unresolved problems to the appropriate resources

  • Establish relationships with other partner teams that impact technical support. (e.g. tool teams, third level team, QA, Development)

  • Follow internal change control process to implement any required product modifications

  • Contribute to a knowledge/FAQ database for supported software

  • Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Forio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Forio is looking for an experienced Senior Web Developer to work full-time out of our San Francisco office. As a Senior Web Developer at Forio, you’ll be developing web applications to help us build HTML5 data visualizations, games, and simulations. You’ll join us in experimenting with different platforms and technologies, and you’ll know that you are playing a leading role in the future of web simulation. Route Optimizer:

https://forio.com/app/showcase/investment-portfolio-stock-market-simulation/

item.title: Backend Developer at Idea Couture (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Idea Couture is looking for a senior web developer to join our technology group to build great things and generally help invent the future.

We operate in collaborative, cross-functional teams, working on problems from multiple perspectives until we get it right. Programming chops and great interpersonal skills will help you be a leader in our dev team. You'll need to be comfortable facilitating discussion, taking feedback, presenting to stakeholders, working in a constantly evolving agile environment and motivating yourself and your team.

We're a tight-knit team and we want to bring in someone to help us grow in intelligent ways while maintaining the speed and quality of our work. You'll spend most of your time developing, but depending on what you're interested in or good at – technical architectures, firmware for physical computing, native mobile apps – there's a lot of room to branch-out.


Responsibilities



  • Working with our process and helping to continue evolving it.

  • Contributing to development plans and performing code reviews.

  • Establishing technical architecture for scalable solutions.

  • Demoing your work to the team and clients.

  • Mentoring other developers and helping them grow their skills.

  • Keeping current of news in technology and sharing it with the team.

  • Crafting thorough, succinct user stories including test cases.

  • Writing Clean Code.

item.title: Interaction Developer at mySidewalk (Kansas City, MO)
item.description:

Your work pushes you to claim a developer title before designer. You’re observant. item.title: Passionate backend C# developer at Zylinc (Hellerup, Denmark)

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer f/m at Smaato Inc. (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
The Systems Engineering Team at Smaato operates a highly available, globally distributed, latency bound web service hosted exclusively on Amazon Web Services. Our environment relies heavily on Ubuntu LTS in EC2, as well as many other AWS services. We are actively expanding to include new technologies and new operational capacity through automation and monitoring. We are also looking into all that new and hip container stuff.


Key Responsibilities:
You are an experienced Linux Systems Engineer, comfortable with working in terminal, and editing in vi. You lust for automating infrastructure tasks, and are willing to take on a slew of challenges to help build something new and enable us to meet new challenges.
You dream of running large clusters of systems efficiently, and quickly resolving problems as they appear. Your desire for a monitored and properly metricked platform borders on obsessional. You have used BSD and four different flavors of Linux, and found them all just not quite perfect enough. You see the potential in quickly adjusting infrastructure around the needs of the moment, and prediction around upcoming requirements.

MFEX also operates through a subsidiary www.fondmarknaden.se

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer (f/m) at Drooms GmbH (Frankfurt, Deutschland)
item.description:
Drooms is a leading provider of secure cloud solutions in Europe. We provide specialist software to allow secure access to confidential documents as well as the ability to safely share them with third parties beyond company firewalls. Confidential business processes such as commercial real estate sales, mergers & acquisitions or Executive Board Communication are handled securely, transparently and efficiently with Drooms.


Customers include the world's leading real estate companies, consultancies, law firms and corporations such as Metro Group, Evonik, Morgan Stanley, JLL, JP Morgan, CBRE, Heuking and UBS.

SENIOR RUBY ON RAILS DEVELOPER (F/M)


with deep domain knowledge and plenty of hands-on experience to join us. Beyond the required technical ability, we are looking for individuals with a "just do it" attitude, a passion for building awesome stuff and a desire to disrupt industries.


What you'll be doing

  • Writing code that can work at massive scale

item.title: Scientific Software Deployment Engineers at D. E. Shaw Research at D. E. Shaw Research (NY, NY)
item.description:
Exceptional Deployment Engineers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded high-performance computing and research group based in New York City.  These hires are expected to contribute to the development of scientific workflow systems, deployment of software and infrastructure, standardization of tools, regression testing, configuration management, and/or third-party support for our simulation tools packages.

Ideal candidates will have strong Python programming and scripting experience, exceptional communication skills, and a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open source accomplishments.  Other relevant areas of expertise might include high-throughput workflows, structured and unstructured data management and analysis, distributed systems software, software release management, automation testing, and quality assurance, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than a track record of achievement and innovation.

Our group is developing multiple generations of the Anton supercomputer, a massively parallel special-purpose machine that speeds up molecular dynamics simulations by orders of magnitude and is designed in part to fundamentally transform the process of drug discovery.



If you are interested in working closely with a team of the world’s leading biologists, chemists, and computer scientists, please use the link below to submit your application materials.  We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/SciDev

D. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team.  We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming.  We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

item.title: // CriteoSeniorDeveloper.cs - Senior Software Engineer in Paris, France at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
using System;


using System.Linq;


namespace CriteoQuestions


{


    class Program


    {


        static readonly uint THRESHOLD = 5;


        static uint Question(string text)


        {


            Console.WriteLine(text + " [y/N]");


            string answer = Console.ReadLine();


            return answer != null && answer.Equals("y") ? 1U : 0U;


        }


        static void Main()


        {


            string[] questionTexts =


                {


                    "Looking for a new challenge?",


                    "Want to work in the heart of Paris?",


                    "Do you enjoy solving hard problems efficiently and creatively?",


                    "Would you like to work where Big Data is more than a buzz word?",


                    "Want to work on a product at true web scale with 30B HTTP requests and 2.5B unique banners displayed per day?",


                    "Would you like to know more?"


                };


            uint score = questionTexts.Aggregate<string, uint>(0, (current, text) => current + Question(text));


            Console.WriteLine(score > THRESHOLD


                                  ? @"Contact a.dia@criteo.com today"


                                  : @"That’s a shame, you can learn more at http://labs.criteo.com/ maybe we can change your mind?");


            Console.ReadLine();


        }


    }


}

item.title: IT Business Analyst at Brandt Information Services (Tallahassee, FL)
item.description:
Do you love fishing and hunting, or just going outdoors? Join Brandt's team of inventive developers, project managers, and business analysts to support the creation and enhancement of solutions and systems that support fishing and hunting license issuance, boat registrations, and other outdoor activities.


Brandt Information Services is looking for business analysts to support software design operations, development, and implementation of web-based software applications for recreational fishing & hunting licenses, boat registrations, and outdoor events.


The Business Analyst will be responsible for working with both Brandt's customers and project management team to document work flows and processes based on user requirements and configuration needs. The Analyst participates in scrum meetings and sprints to ensure software development meets customer and system needs and functionality.


The ideal candidate will have at least 1-2 years’ experience in a Business Analyst role for an IT organization and a Bachelor's degree.


Brandt Information Services celebrates 30 years of innovation in 2015 and is looking for the best programmers and project management team to support our constantly growing operations and maintain best in class solutions in a work hard/play hard environment. Be a part of a team that values your ideas and gives you the tools and resources to design and implement your best innovations and concepts! Apply today!


Brandt Information Services, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or religion or other legally protected status

item.title: Senior UX Designer at Abcam (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
About the role 


Abcam, a global leader in their industry, are looking for a Senior UX Designer to support its phenomenal and continued growth. Working out of the HQ in Cambridge you will be responsible for defining, shaping and delivering intuitive and engaging user experiences that define our commitment to our customers and consumers across desktop, tablet and mobile.


As a member of the Digital Marketing team you will be an experienced UX practitioner. You can demonstrate a strong understanding of usability design principles and have a passion for creating and advocating original, sophisticated solutions. You are a focused individual and have the drive to achieve objectives and deliver on ambitious growth strategies.


You’ll be in good company working alongside an experienced and multi-disciplinary team with expertise honed at recognised leading brands. As Senior UX designer you will help shape and champion UX disciplines in all areas, communicating your ideas to senior stakeholders.


In this role, you will:


- Design and enhance digital interfaces and user experiences across Abcam’s platforms


- Lead the production of and refine UX outputs including; research, user journeys, testing, prototyping, low and hi def wireframes


- Create intuitive experiences when addressing more sophisticated, complex functionality


- Advocate industry standard user experience functionality and design where appropriate


- Analyze and provide user behavior data to support your recommendations


- Balance ‘ideal’ UX experiences against practical implementation from an IT challenge and development effort perspective


- Motivate and support teams that operate in an agile framework

item.title: Customer Support Specialist at Rival Systems, LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Rival Systems, LLC is looking for a Customer Support Specialist to drive the company’s onboarding and education initiatives as it emerges as a competitor in the Chicago trading industry. This is an opportunity to make an immediate impact in an open, merit­-based environment with exponential career growth available.


Responsibilities



  • Quickly obtain a comprehensive knowledge of Rival’s proprietary trading and risk applications.

  • Responsible for installing, onboarding, and training new trading groups.

  • Investigate trades in question by parsing data from exchange fixed logs.

  • Perform Linux Server monitoring and gain familiarity with command lines.

  • Act as escalation point providing remote and onsite support to troubleshoot and resolve end user technology issues.

  • Work with senior systems administrators to test, debug, and deploy infrastructure.

  • Work with internal development groups to support development initiatives.

  • Document and prioritize user requests and provide end users with updates and timelines for completion.

  • Coordinate option settlement procedures with end users and run settlement process.

item.title: Mobile Developer / Android Expert at EROAD (Auckland, New Zealand)
item.description:
EROAD is an NZX listed technology company that provides road charging, tax, compliance and commercial services to the heavy and light commercial vehicle sectors.


EROAD has set the standard as the first GPS-based service provider to offer a government-approved electronic RUC and highway tax solution. A key to EROAD’s success is its core competency and ongoing investment in design, product development, manufacturing and operations to maintain its technical leadership and competitive advantage.


We’re looking for the world’s best mobile developers to join our high performing team in Auckland, New Zealand. As a mobile developer you'll be working in an agile team on EROAD mobile applications using cross platform technology (Xamarin).

item.title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer at Third Space Learning (London, UK)
item.description:
Come and join a tight-knit tech team that values continuous learning, delivers creative and high-impact solutions, and genuinely enjoys the work that we do on a day-to-day basis.


You will spend the majority of your time writing code and working as a member of the scrum team. That includes working on tasks from the sprint board, adding and improving functionality, ensuring that tests are written to maintain good quality development, fixing and improving things done previously and working in web development.


Over the next 12-24 months, these are the tech challenges we (you?) will be working on:



  • New virtual classroom - we are building a standards-compliant classroom comprising of an HTML 5 whiteboard and WebRTC voice channel, which works entirely in the browser without installation or plug-ins

  • Learning via Big Data - we are partnering with the Institute of Education, UCL, and Edinburgh University to build a system that can understand the interactions that take place within a maths class to intelligently (and automatically) determine best teaching practice. This is in early stage planning, but is likely to include multiple regression analysis, neural nets, machine learning, and voice recognition

  • PaaS - we are moving our platform architecture toward micro-services to provide automated scaling, and a PaaS to support external clients

  • Mobile - as more schools adopt tablets, notably iOS and Android, we will be building out a mobile solution for Third Space students

item.title: DevOps Engineer for VC backed fast growning Start-up at Ice.com (Menlo Park, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Our mission is to use software and analytics to bring transparency to the opaque world of jewelry. We are backed by leading VCs including Khosla Ventures, Maveron, and Crosslink. 

Note: we acquired the domain name (Ice.com) a year ago (it is unrelated to the previous company). 

A few reasons why you should be interested in this opportunity:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor (founding CMO of one of the largest e-commerce retailers, Build.com) and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including stock options. 
  • Small (17 person) and agile team. 

What we'd like to see:

  • Experience running a large-scale mobile and web operation
  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible or Fabric
  • Strong Linux skills (Ubuntu preferred)
  • Strong Python development experience
  • Hands-on knowledge of high-availability approaches such as load balancing, failover, clustering and disaster recovery
  • Familiarity with performance and security best practices
  • Passion, drive, energy, a sense of humor and a great attitude!

Initial Responsibilities Include:

  • Build and improve platform services including web application hosting, databases, and networking
  • Automate the provisioning, configuration, scaling, and monitoring of our platform
  • Manage vendors and integrations used to deliver Ice.com services
  • 24/7 on-call rotation
  • Promote knowledge sharing and DevOps culture across our entire engineering department

Some of our Perks:

  • Entrepreneurial culture
  • Great Health care, Vision, and Dental plans
  • Build a team and product from the ground up
  • Have a suggestion? ...We would love to hear it. :)
  • Jewelry discounts for yourself, wife, or kids ;)

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.
