item.title: Full Stack .NET Developer at Springbit, Inc. (Johns Creek, GA)
item.description:
How about an opportunity to play an important role on a small software development team in Johns Creek, GA? Maybe you live nearby and would like to shorten your commute? Maybe you want to work with a number of Microsoft development tools and technologies and some of the best open source software?


This team works on web apps built with ASP.Net MVC, ASP.Net Web API, Twitter Bootstrap, JQuery, and Angular. They work with Windows apps built with WPF and MVVM. They work with mobile apps built with Xamarin. And it's all backed by a DDD-influenced architecture with data in SQL Server 2012.


All new code is written in C#. Some open source projects that are heavily used are Castle, NHibernate, FluentNHibernate, log4Net, MassTransit, Topshelf, and Dapper.


There is a seemingly-endless supply of new project work in the pipeline that will be built using the technologies mentioned above and we need you to help get those projects done. In addition to coding, you'll participate in daily stand ups, design meetings, and customer review meetings. Full disclosure: some support of existing systems will be expected.


The developers work in an open, but respectfully quiet, environment with fast, new computers and dual monitors. Free snacks abound and flexible hours can be arranged. This small development team does work hard, but they have fun too. There are regular beer nights and the team has also been known to cut out a little early on occasion for a random TopGolf outing.


This is a contract only position and pays a very competitive rate.  Someone that fits in well will likely have the opportunity for contract renewal or possibly to convert to full-time.


Local candidates only please. Candidate is needed onsite in Johns Creek, GA.

item.title: Senior UI Engineer - Product Research at JUST EAT (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior or Mid-Level UI Engineer in Product Research you will discover new and innovative ways to empower consumers to love their takeaway experience across our 15 countries.


As an Engineer in Product Research what will you be doing?:



  • Working in a small team that believes a few passionate people can have a big impact. Think of us as a lean startup disrupting from within.

  • We use many different technologies, designs and data to quickly bring ideas to life and we've got more ideas to try (although always want more) than we have time to build them.

  • We'll stay small and lean but we want to add a few key designers and engineers in our Bristol innovation hub to help us bring great new experiences to our millions of consumers faster than ever before.

item.title: Embedded Linux Engineer at Renesas Electronics Europe Ltd (Wooburn Green, UK)
item.description:
Renesas is the world's leading microcontroller vendor. We are looking for an Embedded Linux Developer to join our design group in Bourne End near Maidenhead where we developing a variety of advanced embedded solutions for our newest range of quad-core devices based around the ARM Cortex A15 and A7 processors. You will work on the development of core solutions such as drivers for SDIO, PCI Express, USB, Ethernet, NAND Flash, Quad SPI display, audio, DMA, MMC, SATA and Video capture as well as Linux Kernel porting (3.x.x). Other interesting areas include Wayland graphics, Virtualization, Heterogeneous Multi Processing (HMP) on A15/A7 (big.LITTLE processing) and Multimedia.



This is initially a 6 month contract with similar length extensions the norm. Daily rate £300 to £360 based on experience.

item.title: Developer (DevEngineer) at ING (Bucharest, Romania)
item.description:
At ING Bank, we work according to the Scrum-Agile methodology.


In short time sprints, you will be bringing new business expectations from paper to production. Your exact role within a project will depend on the type of project and your technical skills, but the main focus will be on:



  • gathering the requirements;

  • designing and developing the functionality;

  • testing the developments;

  • implementing aftercare (monitoring/maintenance);



In addition, the key responsibilities in the position of Developer are:


Analysis and Design: refinement of the product backlog and decomposition of product backlog items into user stories; estimation of the complexity of user stories and decomposition of user stories into sprint tasks; the creation of designs, including solution and data models, user experience, and application architecture;


Coding & Packing Configuration: code debugging / code refactoring / configuration of middleware for application use and configuration of applications and packages;


Build and Package: configuration of build servers and workflow;


Tests: creating automated functional tests for user stories; building SMOKE tests as well as building and executing (automated) functional and integration tests; building (automated) user acceptance and production tests.

item.title: Senior Systems Architect at Zymeworks Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Systems Architect to help improve our software infrastructure. We pride ourselves on developing useful and robust software, and would like to have a world-class development environment for our team including automated builds, continuous integration, monitoring and fault tolerance.


 As Senior Systems Architect, your responsibilities would include:



  • Facilitating the transition of our platform from our own in-house cluster to the cloud

  • Creating and managing standardized software development environments for the Software Development team

  • Interfacing between Software Development and Systems Administration teams 

  • Developing automated systems for deployment, monitoring and fault tolerance

  • Working with the systems team to provide the necessary services for the software development team

  • Helping improve software deployment, monitoring and development processes taking into account systems requirements

  • Laying the foundation for a strong DevOps team, and establishing a common language between developers and system team members.

  • Envisioning long term goals for our infrastructure along with the Software and Systems team leads.

item.title: Development Operations Engineer at Megaport Operations Pty. Ltd. (Brisbane, Australia) (allows remote)
item.description:
To assist with automation of existing and future systems and infrastructure, collaborating with both the development and networking teams and enabling the success of both our present and future environments, which add to the success of the business as a whole.


Key area of responsibility



  • Own and manage our cloud-based infrastructure deployment

  • Monitor, operate and maintain seamless application server updates

  • Create new information pipelines to aid reporting at all levels of the business

  • Identify improvements in the development process

  • act as second level support for NOC engineers.

  • Implement and maintain monitoring tools for production hardware and application servers.

  • Manage backups for file systems including data for various application such as Git, Bugzilla, Puppet, apache servers, VOIP customer calls.

  • Work with developers in selecting the correct technologies and processes for future product deployment to production.

  • Research potential new technologies to be used for development, operation of various tools needed for deployment, configuration and monitoring


 Key objectives or deliverables



  • Provide a robust, reliable platform that supports the systems and infrastructure

  • Support, develop and suggest new tools on our environment

  • Provide expert integration and automation advice to the development and engineering teams to ensure cloud-based infrastructure is world class

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Sainsbury's (Coventry, UK)
item.description:
Sainsbury’s is leading the charge in retail digital innovation. We’re building centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry from where we’re crafting world-class apps and services. Call yourself ambitious? Wait until you meet our team. We’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around and this is your chance to get in the mix.


We’re looking for a DevOps Engineer with a real bug for automation. Someone who’ll go all-out to keep delivering, enhancing and supporting our game-changing business applications, relentlessly looking for ways to make improvements to platform stability and increase the pace of change. And, all the while, making sure our service level is protected and our business value increases.


As a DevOps Engineer you’ll:


• Build widely distributed systems from scratch and improve existing ones
• Deliver and create infrastructure as code
• Code and containers packaging
• Enjoy real collaboration with teams as you design and implement CI/CD pipelines
• Automate wherever possible, always knowing where the ‘too far’ mark falls
• Inspire amazing performance and best practice
• Get everyone in the business in the DevOps mind-frame
• Be part of the on-call and out-of-hours rota as needed

item.title: Mobile Application Developer at IT School Innovation (Pretoria, South Africa)
item.description: IT School Innovation is looking for a passionate and talented  developer to join our  team. You will be directly involved in developing  our flagship mobile application, used by students and teachers in our innovative e-learning environment. Working on our app is both challenging and rewarding since it involves concepts such as server communication, webviews, UI/UX design, encryption, databases, Google APIs, media player technologies etc. You will collaborate with developers working on other mobile platforms, as well as server programmers and designers, to make exciting new features happen.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Java Dev wanted to help us create disruptive pirate games at Geonomics (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a senior Full Stack Java Developer for our Build, Payments and Players (BPP) product team.  You’ll be working with 2-3 other full-stack developers to help create genuinely innovative web- & mobile-based multi-player games that combine interactive gameplay and visuals with “soft-core” (low-stakes) gambling.  The games have a pirate treasure theme and are overlaid on Google Maps.  We’re not a “me too” site and there isn’t a book on Amazon telling you how to build what we’re doing: it hasn’t been done before so we need to be able to work it out for ourselves.


Responsibilities


Reporting to a hands-on technical Dev Lead, and in close collaboration with your team’s Product Manager, you and the rest of the team will be working to clear and sane deadlines to create, improve and support front- and back-end code for the cross-product functionality such as payments and account management.  (Additionally, from time to time your team will likely be helping out the individual game product teams with new features.)  The team works within a framework of weekly sprints and daily code releases to Production. You’ll share responsibility for ensuring all our code is clear, robust, well documented, unit tested and peer-reviewed. Code quality here is far from a box-ticking exercise: engineers here take the initiative in proposing – and implementing – improvements to our standards, processes, tools and systems.  Like all developers here, you’ll be writing production code from your first week onwards.


People


Judging by the unsolicited CVs they send us, most recruiters think we are looking for people with a gaming background, or with knowledge of geographical information systems, or who’ve worked for Facebook/Amazon/Google. They are wrong.  We’re far more interested in your ability and aptitude than the exact list of technologies and frameworks that you know, or what industries you’ve worked in, or how well we recognise your past employers.


The engineers who work here are very bright but also friendly and approachable. Almost everyone on the team has a strong academic record, including a 2:1 or above in maths, science or engineering from a top university. They all understand the fundamentals of both computer science and commercial software development – and, amongst other things, have a good appreciation of performance and scalability issues. Everyone who works here makes a difference; you can rely on your colleagues and they rely on you.

item.title: Information Systems and Technology Leader at TRIUMF (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
As Canada’s national laboratory for particle and nuclear physics and related sciences, TRIUMF operates in a heterogeneous computing environment, providing site-wide services and support in Information Systems & Technology, Information Management and Software Application design and development.  


As Leader of the Information Systems and Technology Department, you will have overall responsibility for the strategic and operational management of TRIUMF’s IT infrastructure and software applications services, and will be expected to provide the vision, leadership, and management for maintaining, updating, and transforming IST for the purpose of maximizing overall performance of the organization.    You will lead and mentor an existing team of IST professionals to drive and implement IT applications and infrastructure across the organization. More specifically, you will:



  • Lead formation and execution of the IST strategic plan.

  • Direct and manage the IST team ensuring that priorities are defined, requirements are developed and appropriate processes are established and maintained.

  • Organize and lead the IST team to effectively provide the following services:


    • Networking and telecom

    • Cyber security

    • Server, printing, file storage, and backup

    • Email and website hosting

    • Desktop computer and application support

    • Audio-visual and web conferencing


  • Organize and lead the IST team to effectively provide the following capabilities:


    • Supporting in house systems (ie. ERP, PDM, document server) and main web site

    • Maintaining, developing, and implementing business applications



Requirements and Qualifications:



  • Track record of building and leading IST groups whose output delights stakeholders.

  • Ability to distill multiple stakeholder inputs into needs and aggregate needs into a coherent vision and plan



  • Ability to integrate traditional, new and emerging technologies into administrative functions

  • Ability to develop new insights into situations and to question conventional or existing approaches

  • Ability to assess issues and make accurate, timely decisions based upon research, consultation,



  • Excellent working knowledge of networking and server architecture and protocols

  • Excellent working knowledge of modern web based software development methods and tools.



  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, coupled with sound judgement and the ability to build consensus, make appropriate decisions, and implement solutions

  • Experience with systems design and development from business requirements analysis through day-to-day management

  • Excellent communications skills, including verbal, interpersonal, written and presentation

  • Experience working in regulated environments

  • BSc in computer science, software engineering, information systems or related discipline

  • At least 15 years progressive leadership experience within the information technology industry, 10 of which should include technical experience with system development and implementation, and 5 or more years of experience at the enterprise level

  • Previous experience with ERP implementation or rollout, in particular Agresso, will be considered an asset

  • Legally able to work in Canada on a permanent basis (Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident)


We offer:



  • 3 weeks of vacation to start increasing to 4 weeks after 2 years; plus time off between Christmas and New Years

  • 12 statutory/civic/paid holidays per year

  • Excellent dental, extended health, and vision care benefits

  • Defined Benefits Retirement Pension Plan

  • 35 hour work week

  • Competitive hiring salary

  • Relocation expenses if necessary

  • An excellent opportunity to enhance your career portfolio in a high profile national research facility


TRIUMF is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace, and we welcome applications from all qualified candidates. Your complete application package should be submitted by email as noted below, and will include the following:



  • Employment Application Form

  • Cover letter indicating Competition #475 and salary expectations

  • CV

  • Reference details






TRIUMF Human Resources (Comp. # 475)






eMail: recruiting@triumf.ca


All documents must be submitted in one of the following formats:



  • PDF (preferred)

  • Plain Text

  • Microsoft Word






Applications accepted until September 28, 2015


TRIUMF Human Resources, 2015-08-28

item.title: Java Lead wanted to help us create disruptive pirate games at Geonomics (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a hands-on Java Development Lead for our Instant Win Games product team.  You’ll be leading 2-3 other full-stack developers to help create genuinely innovative web- & mobile-based multi-player games that combine interactive gameplay and visuals with “soft-core” (low-stakes) gambling.  The games have a pirate treasure theme and are overlaid on Google Maps.  We’re not a “me too” site and there isn’t a book on Amazon telling you how to build what we’re doing: it hasn’t been done before so we need to be able to work it out for ourselves.


Responsibilities


Reporting to the CTO, and in close collaboration with your team’s Product Manager, you will be dividing your time in roughly a 50:50 split between hands-on development and management. You and your team will be working to clear and sane deadlines to create, improve and support front- and back-end code for our Instant Win Games products. As well as managing and technical mentoring of the other developers on the team, you’ll be responsible for project estimating, scheduling, tracking and task assignment – all within the framework of weekly sprints and daily code releases to Production. You’ll be actively involved in architecture decisions and you’ll share responsibility for ensuring all our code is clear, robust, well documented, unit tested and peer-reviewed. Code quality here is far from a box-ticking exercise: engineers here take the initiative in proposing – and implementing – improvements to our standards, processes, tools and systems.  Like all developers here, you’ll be writing production code from your first week onwards.


People


Judging by the unsolicited CVs they send us, most recruiters think we are looking for people with a gaming background, or with knowledge of geographical information systems, or who’ve worked for Facebook/Amazon/Google. They are wrong.  We’re far more interested in your ability and aptitude than the exact list of technologies and frameworks that you know, or what industries you’ve worked in, or how well we recognise your past employers.


The engineers who work here are very bright but also friendly and approachable. Almost everyone on the team has a strong academic record, including a 2:1 or above in maths, science or engineering from a top university. They all understand the fundamentals of both computer science and commercial software development – and, amongst other things, have a good appreciation of performance and scalability issues. Everyone who works here makes a difference; you can rely on your colleagues and they rely on you.

item.title: Chief Software Architect - .NET - $100K at Crossover (Cebu City, Philippines) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you one of top Software Architects in the world?  Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete?  Are you 10x more productive than the typical developer?  Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.  At Crossover, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. Sound too good to be true? Take a closer look...


What to Expect as a Chief Software Architect at Crossover


At Crossover you will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architecture problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.


Compensation


At Crossover, you’ll earn extremely competitive wages while enjoying the flexibility of working from virtually anywhere on the face of the earth:




  • Salary: 50 USD/hr




  • Position type: Full time (40 hours per week)




  • Location: Global




Next Steps


Ready to join? Start the process now by applying through our application link. If you meet the qualifications, we will proceed with a series of tests and interviews. Crossover is eager to see what you have to offer our cutting edge global workforce.

item.title: Graduate Software Engineers / developers: C, C++, IOS, Android, Objective C. at Acano (Uxbridge, UK)
item.description:
Acano is an exciting technology start-up founded by a team of highly experienced engineers who have a proven track record of numerous previous successful start-ups. With our R&D headquarters based in Uxbridge, West London, we develop products which unite previously incompatible audio, video and web technologies in coSpaces— virtual meeting rooms, only radically better.  We are engineering the next generation of unified communication technology.



We have been very successful over the last 2 years and have grown to 160 employees across 9 global offices.  Our growth continues and therefore we are looking for a range of graduate software developers  to join our full stack R&D environment. Acano places considerable emphasis on finding the very best graduates. Graduates who join us rapidly become highly valuable members of the R&D team.



We know that our great products and commercial success spring directly from the intellectual energy and technical passion that our R&D teams put into their work; therefore we ensure we provide an environment that cultivates the talents of our graduates. Acano is built on a strong foundation of values and a culture that is quite unique in the industry.

item.title: Back-end Senior Developer at Avaaz.org (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Avaaz is a global civic movement with a community of almost 41 million members and growing. Already, we've been a key force in bringing UN statehood recognition to Palestine, passing revolutionary anti-corruption legislation into law in Brazil, smuggling in sat phones to Syria and humanitarian relief into Burma, and so much more. We’re nimble, multi-lingual (17 languages and counting!), and fiercely independent (100% funded by small online donations from members). We’ve held over 10,000 rallies and events in every country in the world (including the largest climate march in history) and raised over $50 million online. But we’ve just scratched the surface of what’s possible -- and we need the right Senior Developers to help take Avaaz to the next level.



The Senior Developer will be a member of the tech leadership within the organisation, and will take on the challenge of creating a modular, service-oriented back-end that will enable us to scale. We are looking for candidates who have intimate familiarity and experience with industry best practices in software engineering. A strong candidate will have expertise in areas including software design, testing, and technical management. They will also support junior developers, and must be excited to train and mentor them to maintain a high level of quality while implementing solutions quickly.



Our stack:




    Web servers provisioned on AWS




    Legacy web application written in PHP with a MySQL storage




    New micro-services developed mostly in Python, using MySQL and Big Data storage engines




    New front-end service developed using React





Responsibilities:




    Ensure existing and new systems are robust to high traffic, and resilient to failures.




    Ensure that the tech team produces clean, maintainable, extensible, and well-tested software.




    Ensure that our code and software architecture correctly utilize applicable design patterns.




    Support our transition to service-oriented architecture through the design, development, and implementation of micro-services.




    Support continuous improvements to our engineering processes.




    Assist with recruitment and developer training, to ensure that all software developers achieve and maintain a high level of skill.




    Mentor more junior developers on their professional journeys within the Organization.




    Lead and oversee the development of new tools as required by the Organization.






Location:


Avaaz is a virtual organization, with most of our work done over email, telephone and Skype. Our staff are based in cities all over the world and meet at team retreats twice per year. Avaaz covers office costs, either to establish a home office or to rent one, and we support staff to house themselves in local similar organisations when preferred.



Compensation and Benefits:


Salary varies with location and experience, but is highly competitive with leading non-governmental organizations. Benefits also range with location, but include 5 weeks paid vacation per year.





10 more reasons to join Avaaz!


1. We’re winning -- our campaigning works and we’re changing politics and practices across the world. Check out our recent victories at http://www.avaaz.org/en/highlights.php. Or see what the world’s media is saying about us at http://www.avaaz.org/en/media.php.


2. Our tactics are bold and effective -- we do what’s needed to win campaigns, whether it’s pioneering the use of satellite phones and critical technology to support democracy movements or rallying the largest climate protests in history.


3. The mission is the metric -- large funders don’t control our strategy. We work with members to do what’s best for the world each and every time.


4. We thrive in risky situations -- we don’t let powerful forces like Rupert Murdoch’s media empire bully us with legal, brand or financial threats. We’re experts at navigating risk and meeting threats head on, in the media, the courts or on the streets.


5. We pay sustainable salaries -- our salaries are competitive and we believe in supporting long term commitment to the work we do.


6. Our team is awesome -- it’s chock full of brilliant people at the top of their fields in law, politics, civil society and more. We’re no drama and a heck of a lot of fun.


7. We have great work-life balance -- it’s a professional responsibility and there’s huge support to nail it. We believe we all work best when we are rested and enjoying a full life outside of the office.


8. You can be anywhere -- except for a few roles that require a specific location, our staff can be based anywhere with an airport and a great internet connection. If you want to work from one of our large offices in New York or London, you can do that, or live on an island somewhere!


9. We’re fiercely meritocratic -- our hierarchy is based on judgment and we are constantly checking it against objective standards that are 100% transparent. We believe in the best ideas becoming instantly recognized and adopted, and all jobs and roles are assigned meritocratically.


10. There’s no drama -- we work as one team to change the world. You may need to see it to believe it, but we’ve got a team where gossip, drama, internal politics and all that draining stuff just doesn't exist.

item.title: Lead Visualization Engineer at Poll Everywhere (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
You love the idea of building impactful visualizations that millions of people will experience, live, during presentations, class lectures, or broadcast events. You obsess over every last detail of data visualization from the tick of an axis to the smoothness of animation. You’re extremely thorough with testing because you know that if your code blows up onstage during an event, you’ve lost the trust of the presenter and the entire audience. You favor intuitive, scannable visualizations to esoteric ones that look cool. You prize clarity and truthfulness over glitz and glam in your designs.

Working with a great team of engineers is an important foundation for building and distributing your visualizations. We’re in the midst of breaking apart our core Ruby on Rails web app into a pure JSON API and a front end that consists of several single-page JavaScript applications. We also have some nifty Backbone.js integrations with firehose.io, our home grown realtime web framework.

Did you know that we ship a purpose-built web browser within PowerPoint and Keynote that is programmable via JavaScript? Think of it as Cordova for presentation applications that has native hooks into presentation software, like start/stop presentation, and next/previous slide.

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Core Services at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
The online travel market never stands still. The opportunity is huge and the competition is fierce. At Hotels.com, we're in the thick of it. We live and breathe travel. Our technology team is insanely passionate about using the best technology and processes to give our customers the best possible experience when finding hotels for their business or leisure travel needs. We want them to feel the same passion for travel that we do.


Why build your career at Hotels.com?



  • You'll get to work with some spectacular people both from the technology team and wider business

  • You will get to work on a lot of awesome technologies such as Kafka, languages such as Scala and Akka and ways of solving problems such Reactive Streams.

  • We work hard to create a supportive, collaborative, and fulfilling place where you can progress your career

  • We have many of the best bits of a start-up but with the resources of the world's biggest travel company

  • We love open source and actively participate in the open source community

  • We win prizes (Netflix Cloud Prize for one)

  • We do hackathons where you can branch out of your usual area to contribute something different and innovative

  • We host and speak at meet ups

  • We want everyone on our team to have the tools and resources to succeed in their career

  • We get to do all of this in a lovely, comfortable office in a nice, central part of London

  • You will learn a lot about software engineering, architecture and contribute to a cool product

item.title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
You’ll use your skills and expertise to help bolster, improve and optimise our testing process to ensure robustness of the Sparx system.  You’ll be working directly with developers and other quality assurance engineers, immersing yourself into our Agile/SCRUM environment.


If you’ve got a strong academic background in a technical subject, experience with programming languages and a passion for technology, then you’ll relish this opportunity.


Key responsibilities:



  • Performing quality reviews to ensure solutions meet our high standards.

  • Providing early feedback from exploratory testing to resolve issues as soon as possible.

  • Logging, retesting and closing bugs, reproducing and debugging issues and providing developers with good bug reports.

  • Helping to maintain our testing and demonstration infrastructure and hardware.

  • Designing and implementing automated tests.

  • Working with the wider Sparx team to ensure the product is the best it can be.

  • Being a good team player – help out if someone asks.

  • Being positive and infectiously enthusiastic about the values and vision of Sparx.

item.title: Product Manager, Stack Overflow at Stack Exchange (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Come help us build the future of Stack Overflow! We’re looking for a product manager to represent the users of Stack Overflow and imagine new ways to help them share knowledge and get answers to their questions. This is your chance to have a huge impact on a site that sees over 4+ million visitors and 15+ million pageviews per day.


You’ll work with our passionate team of developers, designers, and fellow product managers to propose and execute ideas. As a product manager, your role on the team will be to represent our users and communicate their needs. You’ll do that by interacting with them regularly through Meta (http://meta.stackoverflow.com and http://meta.stackexchange.com) and Chat (http://chat.stackoverflow.com), conducting one-on-one user feedback sessions, and analyzing usage data and heatmaps.


You’ll do a lot, but some things you should be excited about: 



  • Making developers’ lives better: Help make 25 million developers' lives better by improving their daily experience of Stack Overflow

  • Working in the open: propose ideas and prototypes on Meta (http://meta.stackoverflow.com) and evolve them based on community feedback

  • Creating public artifacts: write blog posts announcing new features and why they matter

  • Testing and iterating: nobody gets it right on the first try, which is why we prefer to prototype, test, and rapidly iterate based on data and user feedback

  • Convincing passionate developers: our community cares deeply about Stack Overflow. You should be excited about convincing them why your ideas will make the internet a better place, humble enough to admit when you’re wrong, and passionate enough to not back down when you’re right.


We’re looking to hire the best person wherever you are in the world. We work remotely (see http://blog.stackoverflow.com/2013/02/why-we-still-believe-in-working-remotely) so you’ll likely work from home and interact with the team over Google Hangouts and chat, usually during US and European working hours. We have offices in New York, London and Denver, so if you’re in one of those cities you’ll have the option of working out of an office.

item.title: QA Engineer at Remedy Partners Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The QA Engineer should be well-versed with automated PHP, Java and Javascript testing.  As a QA Engineer, you'll be responsible for coding and creating automated test frameworks for the various languages in use, as well as participating in the design and development of Automation test strategies, using GUI verification, User defined functions, Database verification, API testing, Smoke test sets and Functional test scripts.  Qualified candidates will have extensive experience with performance testing and providing reports on test results.



Key Responsibilities:




  • Learn from mentors and code review feedback



  • Focus of quality and repeatability



  • Consult with functional groups to understand and design requirements



  • Identify, escalate and tackle problems head on    



  • Strong analytical skills



  • Highly pragmatic with a focus on delivering business value



  • Willingness to openly debate the pros and cons of a technology or solution



  • Ability to context switch when required

item.title: Junior Front End Developer at SMTP, Inc. (Gainesville, FL)
item.description:
SharpSpring is looking for a Junior Front End Developer to join our team in Gainesville, FL. SharpSpring is the fastest growing company in the area and we need a Front End Developer that is passionate about user experience and is excited about creating a product that makes an impact on millions of users! If you are interested in joining a growing, dynamic and successful Tech company where your work makes a significant impact on the entire organization, then we want to talk to you!

The Company

SharpSpring is a cloud-based marketing automation provider offering a next-generation marketing automation solution rivaling the industries top platforms in terms of features, functionality and performance. SharpSpring is one of the most flexible platforms on the market, offering native or 3rd party CRM integration, fully integrated call tracking, universal CMS compatibility, in addition to integration with hundreds of applications. With SharpSpring, see every lead that comes in, whether by phone or form, and compare all data side by side to get a full picture of end-to-end ROI. SharpSpring is usually less than 1/3 the cost of other competitors, yet powerful enough to be trusted by hundreds of agencies and thousands of businesses around the world. In 2014, SharpSpring was acquired by SMTP, Inc - a publicly traded company on the NASDAQ (SMTP).

The Opportunity

As a Front End Developer at SharpSpring, you have the unique and adventurous opportunity of working with our product and creative groups on challenging design and production problems across our platform. You will work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment using the latest open source technologies for software development. In this opportunity you will be developing a high-quality, fully functioning, large-scale produce that is used by thousands of our partners. If you have the experience we are looking for and are a well rounded developer, this is an opportunity to get in on the ground level and work on a platform that is changing the face of an industry.

Responsibilities

  • Design, development, and maintenance of code
  • Writing code that is cross browser compatible
  • Work with a cross functional development team to engineer deliverables and quality software solutions for our Partners
  • Writing code and running appropriate diagnostic tests to proactively solve potential issues
  • Identify and solve problems creatively and efficiently
  • Design, communicate, and implement solutions effectively
  • Comfortable working on the command line

The Person

  • Must possess 1-3 years experience in web development and user-interface code for large scale websites
  • Extensive expertise of front end technologies (HTML, CSS, JS, PHP)
  • Effective communication, decision-making, and problem solving skills
  • Professional development experience, either through a full-time job, internship or personal projects
  • Strong design skills
  • Familiarity with responsive web design techniques
  • Experience with any of the following: Javascript modules, client-side unit testing, Chrome Developer Tools
  • Experience working with vector and raster graphics in applications such as Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Experience building and or designing web applications
  • Familiarity with PHP
  • Experience with Backbone, Ember . js and/or AMD

The SharpSpring Culture and Perks

At SharpSpring, we strive to create an environment where you can flourish. As a team, we want to differentiate ourselves by hard work, disciplined execution, friendly service, a commitment to solving our partners problems, and to demonstrate that we can accomplish more than others with a fraction of their resources.

Our company culture is based on the belief that our people are our #1 asset:

We empower you to make decisions and get things done without all of the bureaucracy!
We ensure communication across the organization, including actively soliciting your feedback
We are committed to our team's personal development at all levels of the organization
We offer competitive salaries and company bonus programs
We offer health and dental insurance for full-time employees
We offer a paid holidays and PTO to our full-time employees
We strive to reward team members who operate as "business owners" with stock option grants in our firm, creating a strong team-oriented dynamic across the entire company

About SMTP, Inc.

SMTP is a NASDAQ-listed provider of email services that is growing rapidly on a global basis. The company's easy-to-use and highly affordable SharpSpring marketing automation platform is empowering the next generation digital marketers with tools once reserved for large enterprises. The company's long history as one of the early pioneers of SMTP delivery services provides a solid backbone for the company's growth, which will be supported by its global operations. Its recent acquisition of GraphicMail provides a global footprint and both email and mobile functionality for a wide range of business users. Its profitable operation and access to the public markets for capital positions it well for both organic growth and synergistic acquisitions. Learn more about us and our subsidiaries at: www.smtp.com

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer at Excelian (London, UK)
item.description:
Excelian are currently looking for a delivery focussed Front-End technologies consultant who is looking to join a fast growing and cutting edge technical consultancy. With multiple, large projects in and around trading and risk management systems, Excelian are looking for people to match the ambitious, creative and collaborative environment which we strive to create.


Excelian Technical Consulting focuses on Technology Innovation and is investing in R&D in the following 3 key areas:



-          User Interfaces and User Experience


-          Big Data and NoSQL


-          Cloud and Grid Computing



Consultants will be given the opportunity to work within these streams internally, get certified on key technologies and contribute to Excelian’s open source projects aligned to these key domains as well as work on client projects.


The consultant will have to be passionate about User Interfaces and User Experience, with experience of building large-scale web applications. We are looking for consultants that enjoy building systems within a team of like-minded colleagues who care about quality and delivering to client requirements. You’ll be used to working on a shared codebase and passionate about continuously improving the development process through automated testing, build and deployment. And while always keen to expand your knowledge you’ll understand how to best apply the tools and technology available to you.



Role/Responsibilities –


-          Hands on development of frontend/some server side components


-          Leading technical development of more Junior developers


-          Architectural design of large scale systems


-          Technical management of project/team


-          Input into presales and proposal activity around User Interface / User Experience

item.title: Software Engineer at Tome, Inc. (Royal Oak, MI)
item.description:
What will you create this year? We’re jeans and hoodie friendly, backed by unlimited caffeine and an arsenal of modern development gear at our disposal.


Tome Software has immediate openings for additional software engineers to join our development team in downtown Royal Oak. If you’re looking to work with a proven and award-winning entrepreneurial team to change the status quo of tech through passion and hard work, here’s what you need to know about us, and what we need from you.



Over the last year we launched OfficeIQ, a software/sensor solution, with our furniture partner Humanscale. The OfficeIQ product motivates users to be more active by objectively measuring activity via sit/stand workstations and non-disruptive reminders. We also launched a mobility application (MoDe:Link) with Ford that connects multimodal mobility systems (public transit, mapping, parking, etc.) to connected eBikes. All Tome engineers have the opportunity to work on various projects, with new challenges constantly arising. Many of our current projects are still super secret (shhh!) and provide a unique opportunity to work with some of the best customers and some of the most-interesting problems in the world.


About Tome: A passion for connecting hardware products to software applications led Jake Sigal and Massimo Baldini to establish Tome, Inc. in April 2014. Founded in metro Detroit, Tome develops connectivity products to keep people mobile and active, while creating value as a focused niche within the larger Internet of Things movement. Tome is a member of the StartUp Health accelerator, based in New York City. Sigal and Baldini sold their previous startup, Livio, to Ford Motor Co. in 2013. Learn more about Tome at http://www.tomesoftware.com.

item.title: Do You C#? - Expert developer for internal tools and automated tests at Milestone Systems (Brøndby, Denmark)
item.description:
Your passion and your quest


Delivering quality software is your passion and your quest. You have the technical expertise, proven coding skills and now the opportunity to make this a reality. From our engineering playground at Milestone Systems, you will continuously maintain and innovate our in-house solution for automated testing of Milestone Systems’ product suite. A glimpse from your everyday contains:



  • Design and development of high quality software used for continuous integration and test automation

  • Providing improvements and new ideas for our continuous integration framework

  • Working closely with our development teams in Copenhagen, Denmark and Sofia, Bulgaria



The Test Automation team and our engineering playground


The focus of your team is to invent, design, build and maintain our test automation framework, and in cooperation with our feature teams develop test suites for our software. In this regard, you will also be engaged in instructing and supporting the end users of our tools and frameworks, why your communication skills must reflect this.


Our work is closely coordinated between our teams in Copenhagen and Sofia. You will have daily contact with developers in both locations as we drive the Milestone test automation effort. The rich interaction between functional and cultural diversities foster creative play with technology both in the daily collaboration and at the annual Engineering Challenge, where all functions meet to innovate new features.



Your tech stack and other important skills


You will be in contact with a wealth of Microsoft technologies including C#/.NET, TFS, WCF Services, Powershell, and Microsoft System Center 2012 R2. It is desirable that you have an interest in Windows instrumentation and we expect that you exhibit a deep understanding of .NET including topics such as reflection and LINQ. Other required skills/experiences are:



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering

  • 3 years of experience with developing commercial software

  • You need to B# on C# and .NET

  • Fluent in written and spoken English

  • Experience with Microsoft System Center 2012 R2

  • Analytical and structured

  • Interest in teamwork across functions and countries

  • Kick-ass attitude and will to confront any challenges standing between you and building great solutions



Career and perks


Milestone Systems is a great place for you to continue your career. We have a career model that supports your development, and the perks are numerous:




  • Individual career path – technical and leadership growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular 1:1 follow-ups with your manager

  • Multicultural environment with IT professionals from a wide range of countries in a high-tech organization

  • Healthy work environment - company sponsored “All Inclusive” program with breakfast, lunch, afternoon snack, fruit and beverages, health insurance, massage and company bikes

  • Social work environment – active employee club hosting events like cooking classes, tasting events, outdoor activities, cultural events, Friday bar and annual Christmas and summer parties

  • Work life balance – flexible working hours and five extra vacation days



The future is up to you


Take your valuable C# skills to the next level. Become part of our fast growing high-tech company by submitting your CV in English today.


For more information, please contact Software Architect & Engineering Manager, Lars Hammer at +45 50 842 565, or visit our website: www.milestonesys.com.


The future is up to you!

item.title: Team Lead Backend PHP at trivago (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries. We believe in personal development through flexible, self-directed work and cross-functional opportunities. Enjoy a working environment that encourages new ideas, fun and challenging the status quo!

We’re looking for a skilled PHP developer to lead, inspire and grow our back-end development team. In this role, you’ll have the overview of our PHP architecture and Symphony framework, work with an inspirational team and implement own ideas to strategically drive our back-end system to the next level. Are you passionate about working in an agile environment and a strong believer of scrum and test-driven-development? Are you as good with people as you are with PHP? Then we want to hear from you!


Your responsibilities:



  • Coach and mentor a team of 15 PHP developers.

  • Support recruiting of further team members by conducting interviews and working together with HR on creative recruiting efforts.

  • Initiate, promote and allocate the resources for technological innovations.

  • Be up-to-date and passionate about new technologies. Evaluate their potential for trivago to continuously drive change.

  • Ensure and improve performance, reliability, flexibility and maintainability of trivgo’s PHP applications.

  • Support test-driven development, continuous integration and continuous deployment.

  • Collaborate with and provide technical consultation to Product Owners, Frontend Developers, Technical Account Managers and Business Intelligence Analysts.

  • Foster continuous knowledge transfer between front & backend developers.

item.title: Systems Engineer - AWS DNS at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
This position is based in our Development Centre in Dublin, Ireland.

Are you ready to create systems to power one of the largest e-commerce companies in the world? Amazon.com has over 70 million customers, and developers all over the world rely on our storage, compute, and virtualised services via Amazon Web Services. We support systems at massive, and ever-growing, scale. We rapidly integrate new technologies to expand our customer offerings. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure and our goal is to become “The Infrastructure Platform” for the world.



The AWS Infrastructure DNS team is seeking enthusiastic and talented Systems Engineers to design, build and operate the large-scale control plane software used to drive the Amazon DNS fleet. We run systems that are critical to the platforms that Amazon's global retail, AWS and Kindle businesses run upon -- the DNS services in Amazon's datacenters and integration of Amazon's systems with the likes of Amazon Route 53 to manage public DNS.



Our key challenges include reliable delivery of updates, which continually raise the bar on latency, update propagation times, and security of the DNS infrastructure. As a lead member of our growing team, you will design and develop highly visible products, be involved in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and interact with many other engineering teams across Amazon.

Basic Qualifications

· Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

· Proficient in any of Python, Java, Perl, C/C++.

· Comfortable working with Linux, or other Unix operating systems.

· Obsession with delivering highly available and performant systems that surpass customer expectations.

· Have a passion for automation.



Preferred Qualifications

· Experience with REST, resilient and scalable web services and cloud environments a plus.

· Experience with agile development methodologies and DevOps environments a plus.

· Excellent knowledge of server hardware and software troubleshooting.

· Strong desire to build; sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.

item.title: Project Manager - ERP at GroupeSTAHL (Sterling Heights, MI)
item.description:
Position Summary


The Project Manager is responsible for overall planning, mobilization, coordination, execution, delivery and completion of ERP projects on time and within budget. The Project Manager is responsible for having capacity to manage a portfolio of projects if needed.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities



  • Lead the planning and implementation of projects for Groupe Stahl

  • Facilitate the definition of project scope, goals and deliverables per client’s needs

  • Define project tasks and resource requirements

  • Develop full scale project plans using Project Insight and Microsoft Project and Excel

  • Work with client to satisfactorily plan and schedule project timelines to guarantee on-time delivery for client

  • Track project deliverables and communicate with client sponsors to deliver on-time and within scope and budget

  • Provide direction and support to project team

  • Keep all stakeholders updated on progress of project

  • Analyze business/technical requirements and objectives, perform fit/gap analysis, and provide client recommendations.

  • Document all client engagements including the creation of design documents, technical specifications, process documentation, specification, system deployment documents, ERP system integration and interface documents and publishing reports as necessary

  • Implement and manage project changes and interventions to achieve defined project outputs

  • Provide project management expertise throughout entire project


.

item.title: node.js Developer (m/f) at Shopgate GmbH (Butzbach, Deutschland)
item.description:
Start-up Facts


Shopgate is the leading SaaS platform for online shops to create mobile websites and apps and become successful in mobile. We’ve been growing very rapidly since going live in 2011, up to a talented team of 147 employees in 3 offices in Europe and 2 in the U.S. Our vision and our unique position in an exploding mobile shopping market offers us new challenges everyday. Simply because we do not just develop new software solutions: We develop the best mobile shopping solution in the world! Make our challenge to your personal challenge and join our awesome team!


Your Mission


To expand our unique position in the mobile shopping market, we are looking for a node.js Developer (w/f) at the earliest possible date for our office in the Castle of Butzbach. You need to have the passion to develop high performance and high availability microservices, to make a decisive contribution in the evolution of our product.


Your Daily Business

item.title: Front and Back end development of webshop at Tobii AB (Danderyd, Sweden)
item.description:
Tobii Dynavox, part of the Tobii group, is the world leader in eye tracking and speech generating devices - products that help individuals with speech and motor impairments live a richer and more independent life. Headquartered in Stockholm Tobii covers a global market with offices in USA, Germany, Norway, Japan and China. 


Our business unit Tobii Dynavox takes the eye tracker technology and touch based technology into the Assistive Technology market developing groundbreaking solutions for communication, computer access, and greater independence for our users. We make it possible for people to control their computer only with their eyes; to talk, surf, email, chat, control their environment, listen to music and much more. We give our users the Power to be You! Take a look here if you want to learn more!


We are now strengthening our online communication and sales channels by building up a focused team for E-commerce. If you want to be part of a new, dynamic and tight team with the possibility to take on diverse challenges, you now have the chance. While we start to build this team we want to find people that like to work with different things and can take on as many of the team’s responsibilities as possible.


You will work closely with team members both in Sweden, US and other countries.


The teams work will include a variety of different tasks such as:



  • E-commerce system configuration and development.

  • System integration between the E-commerce systems and other systems, such as ERP, CRM systems and our customer portal myTobiiDynavox

  • Front end development of our webshops

  • SEO and SEM of the webshops

  • Add products to the webshops and work with product configuration and product information management

  • Develop our online solutions in line with global regulations for taxes and customs etc.

item.title: Junior Stack Developer at ABOX42 GmbH (Karlsruhe, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for a dedicated Junior Stack Developer.for our expanding company’s German office located in the beautiful city of Karlsruhe. As the newest member of Software Engineering Team you will be working together with our international customers while supporting the development of interactive TV solutions.


We have great things ahead of us - enjoyable work and enough space for your personal goals and career for a committed employee is just as important as the room for your ideas and creativity. You are looking for a challenge and are eager to have a versatile scope of duties? Then this is the right job for you.


.Your role at ABOX42 in detail:


As a developer with us you will work on the unique ABOX42 Software Stack enhancing it's features.  Along the way  you’ll tackle challenging problems, continue to learn new skills and have an impact on our software, our clients and your colleagues.

 
The ABOX42 Software Stack is currently written in PHP (Codeigniter, SlimPHP, composer, MongoDB, MySQL, AWS EC2/S3/CloudFront) and a very heavy dose of Javascript (jQuery, UnderscoreJS, BackboneJS, RequireJS, HTML5, CSS3 using Less).  You might have a greater interest in some of these technologies than others, but we're looking for people who want to make a well-rounded, full-stack contribution to every part of a project.
 
We’re always keeping an eye out for new ways to solve problems, so we’ll work together to keep up with the latest technologies and methodologies. And since we’re a rather small company, your ideas and contributions will be noticed from day one


What you can expect from us:



  • Flat hierarchies

  • Flexible working hours

  • A friendly, pleasant working environment and open-minded colleagues

  • Large desks, MACs and many screens

  • Varied and interesting work opportunities on exciting projects

  • The opportunity to bring your ideas to the table

  • Coffee, tea and hot chocolate at your fingertips

  • Fresh fruit and healthy sweets

  • Karlsruhe offers technology, science and quality of life with 1628 hours of sunshine, 1000 shops, 150 km of cycling paths, 135 cultural institutions and much more

item.title: UI Architect at iCIMS (Matawan, NJ)
item.description:
At iCIMS, we are passionate about building best-to-market software that delivers a great user experience (UX) - easy-to-use, aesthetically appealing, efficient and fast. We are expanding the UX/UI practice and need a User Experience specialist to help grow a User Experience/User Interface Center of Excellence and drive the UX/UI program. As the number of development teams grows the COE is expected to: Define UI/UX standards, guidelines and processes Enable the development teams by providing components, tools, frameworks, coaching and training Governance to ensure that products meet the UX goals by working closely with agile teams We need a good balance between thought and program leadership, best practices, and development skills. You will work closely with our top notch UI developers to accelerate our product experience and with our Product Management team to drive the longer term product UX roadmap. You must be comfortable with high level interaction design, creating prototypes and selecting/developing common UI framework components. In this role you will also provide design and guidance on specific product features.


Responsibilities



  • Design and develop highly usable web applications for our ICIMS Talent Acquisition products

  • Research and fix challenging usability and interaction issues as they arise

  • Lead user experience best practices for agile team members

item.title: Java Software Engineer at ZuluTrade (Pireas, Greece)
item.description:
As the successful candidate you will be joining the Backend department of ZuluTrade. We are proud to be a team of experienced, dedicated and effective engineers. We are responsible for creating, running and improving the "brain" behind ZuluTrade.com and other related services. It consists of a swarm of applications we created from scratch, written mainly using Java SE and EE technologies.


What you will be doing in ZuluTrade Backend?

Then it's on to you to start helping the best way you can by identifying and fixing problems. We will define an area that you will be responsible for. We will periodically define the goals to help the team, improve the products and add value to the company. As you gain credit, you will start building your own systems. The more effective you become, the more time we will save to play with new ideas and technology.


Ideal candidate:



  • Passion for engineering: analyzing and fixing things

Any experience with the below is a plus:

item.title: Oracle SOA Architect (f/m) at Home24 AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your duties at Home24



  • You will be responsible for the architecture and design of our SOA landscape implemented in Oracle SOA Suite

  • Actively manage in requirements, design and analysis sessions to ensure sound team decision-making and effective SOA strategy

  • Build BPEL processes to support orchestration of web services.

  • Work with SOA development team to implement SOA components like Repository and Universal Description Discovery and Integration registry to manage WebServices.

  • Participate in team reviews of design artifacts and code, make changes as required, and recommend alternative solutions where appropriate.

  • Design, code, unit test, system test, performance test, debug, implement, and support application systems either through new development of systems, enhancement of existing systems, or 3rd party products.

  • Work with technical and functional teams to ensure effective delivery of systems.

  • Use software development methodologies and standards as defined by organization to effectively code and deliver systems.

  • Work with technical teams within group as well as outside group to ensure effective delivery.

  • Follow established processes for configuration and release management to ensure that all project artifacts are managed, integrated, and versioned according to standards.


What we expect from you



  • Preferably Master’s degree (in Computer Science, Math, Electrical Engineering or related field) and best case 5-7 years of related experience.

  • 3-5 years experience in SOA Platform Architecture and Development, including 2 years working with Oracle Enterprise Applications.

  • Significant knowledge and experience designing and developing Enterprise Service Bus/SOA/Integration Tier Architecture (BPEL/Business Process Orchestration, WebServices, J2EE).

  • Strong understanding of Service Oriented Architectures.

  • Understanding of business requirements from a Business Team & Development perspective; translate to SOA services & architecture

  • Strong background in systems architecture and relevant technologies, including portal technologies, middleware technologies, and J2EE.

  • Strong skills in Services Design Best Practices, Service Performance Monitoring, Service Performance Tuning, Service Interface Specifications.

  • Strong Object Oriented skills using open architecture standards as well as best practices, design principles, and techniques with regards to: BPEL, UML, WSDL, JDBC, SQL, XML/XSL, SOAP, WebServices

  • Ability to collaborate and have open communication across functional borders


What we offer you



  • A highly motivated team of professional developers, database and system operators, quality and product managers

  • Opportunities for advancement – independence and the opportunity to take on responsibility

  • Openness to new ideas and creativity

  • Experiential depending and negotiable salary

  • Benefits like employee discount, team events, language courses etc.


If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, we look forward to hearing from you. Please send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, if available), as well as your expected salary and earliest possible start date.

item.title: Senior Information Security Analyst at NASDAQ (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
JOB SUMMARY:


Information Security is responsible for coordinating the protection of the organization’s core business operations and information against real-world cyber threats, by employing technology, policy, processes, education programs, and sound design techniques across the enterprise. To be effective, information security must be a team effort involving the participation and support of every Nasdaq worker who deals with information and information systems.


Where will you be working?


Nasdaq is critically dependent on information and information systems. The good reputation that Nasdaq enjoys is also directly linked with the way that it manages both information and information systems. For example, if private customer information were to be publicly disclosed, the organization’s reputation would be harmed.


Guidance, direction, and authority for information security activities are centralized for all Nasdaq organizational units in the Information Security department. Nasdaq information must be consistently protected in a manner commensurate with its sensitivity, value, and criticality.


What are your daily activities?



  • You will be responsible for performing penetration testing of web applications, code, system architecture, and/or risk assessment reviews on enterprise systems along with providing specific recommendations for addressing identified vulnerabilities and risks.

  • The position requires working  with development teams to review application security findings and to assist with the remediation efforts.

  • This position requires that you have excellent interpersonal and team working skills. You will work in a high pressure, real time operating environment and need to have strong communication skills. The successful candidate is analytical and highly technical and a self-starter.

item.title: Android Engineer, Prime Now Delivery Experience at Amazon (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Prime Now is Amazon's newest benefit for Prime members, which offers one-hour delivery on tens of thousands of daily essentials through a new mobile app. Prime Now is powered by Amazon’s growing network of fulfillment centers and transportation technology that utilize high-end technology to speed up order delivery times for customers. Now, Prime members can skip a trip to the store by shopping on the Prime Now app for products like paper towels, shampoo, books, toys and batteries with orders delivered right to their door in an hour or less.



Our Transportation Technology group is responsible for designing and implementing software that makes the delivery of these items possible in one hour or less. Our software has to take into account item, delivery associate, network and environmental constraints to provide a fast delivery experience for our end consumers. We develop backend services, websites and mobile applications to aid the delivery process.



It is still Day 1! We have many openings for individuals to help us innovate in this space. We are looking for talented SDEs to design and build these new systems. You will work on hard problems at scale and will have autonomy to deliver. You will learn about real-time adaptive transportation solutions, routing algorithms and optimizations, operating on large scale datasets, mobile development and more.


  • Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • Experience developing Android and/or iOS applications.

  • 5+ years of software development experience with the following technologies:

  • Expert knowledge of Java and the JDK

  • Expert knowledge of the Android Developers Kit

  • Advanced Android UI Skills (Fragments, Custom view components)

  • Experience writing multi-threaded apps

  • Expert knowledge of Eclipse, IntelliJ or Android Studio

  • Experience with the application submission/provisioning process

  • Expert level debugging and analysis skills using ADB




  • Proficiency in object oriented development and ability to apply OO concepts

  • Excellent interpersonal, business management, time management, and developmental skills.

  • Experience with version control

  • Demonstrated ability to meet or beat assigned targets and deadlines under normal circumstances, and ability to make trade-offs and when needed to optimize outcome when conditions change

  • Ability to communicate with other employees in the company in both technical and non-technical roles.




  • Experience in building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.

  • Experience with databases.

  • Have designed and developed a complete Android app from top to bottom

  • Web Services experience as it relates to mobile apps

    Solid understanding of Android UI paradigms from Gingerbread to Lollipop

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at University of Maryland, College Park (College Park, MD)
item.description:
University of Maryland, College Park


Department of Residential Facilities


Senior Software Engineer (Position # 100981)



The University of Maryland is a global leader in research, entrepreneurship and innovation. We rank No. 21 among public universities by U.S. News & World Report and in the top 40 research institutes worldwide by the Institute of Higher Education. We’re also among Glassdoor’s top 10 highest-rated D.C.-area employers. We offer IT professionals excellent opportunity in a stimulating, innovative, and highly rewarding environment.



DUTIES: Reporting to the Assistant Director, IT Services, this position serves as lead programmer/analyst for complex information systems including integration of programmed solutions with commercial software. The incumbent analyzes, designs, creates or modifies, maintains, and enhances critical applications use campus-wide by department staff and within the departments served by Residential Facilities. This position serves as part of the joint development team with Facilities Management (FM) for the University’s enterprise-wide Facilities Management System (FMS) using the current version of IBM’s Tririga Facilities Manager.



QUALIFICATIONS: Required - Bachelor’s degree in management information systems, information technology, computer science, or related field; will accept work experience for a degree, with one year full time experience equivalent to 30 credit hours.  Minimum of  five years IT experience performing business systems solution analysis, system architecture and design, programming, testing and implementation services.  Has written and/or incorporated software specifications and testing plans into programming, completed individually or within a team environment.  Progressively more complex programming experience with individual programming languages, rapid development tools, and/or application building platform toolsets to create complete applications as defined by customer specifications. Configuration, administration and/or programming IBM Tririga products is strongly preferred but will train qualified candidate. Preferred –Experience with application web database application development, and using object oriented analysis and design development tools.  Experience with report generation programming. 



SALARY and BENEFITS – Starting salary in the high $80’s.  Benefits include 25 days annual and personal leave; 14 paid holidays; 15 days sick leave, tuition remission up to 8 credits per semester; choice of two retirement programs; and eligibility for a variety of group health insurance plans.



TO APPLY: Review of Applications will begin August 28th and will continue until position is filled. To apply, submit a resume with cover letter and a list of references online at https://ejobs.umd.edu. Click on“Staff Positions” and follow the directions for position #100981. The University of Maryland is a smoke free environment since July 1, 2013. For more information about the position and the department, visit http://www.drf.umd.edu/programmer.



The University of Maryland is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


Minorities, Women, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities are Encouraged to Apply.



Apply Here: http://www.Click2Apply.net/49r45zs9r4



PI91518819

item.title: Mobile Web Front End Developer at Overstock.com (Salt Lake City, UT)
item.description:
Mobile Web Front End Developer


Full-Time Salt Lake City, UT


Job Description: 


Be part of a front end development team creating and maintaining a major retailer's mobile shopping site. Using current JavaScript architecture principles to create a lean and fast website, Evolve and elevate yourself and your team through constant learning and skill building. Join a closely-knit team working in the context of a large development organization, take on a varied set of challenges in a casual, friendly and sometimes fast paced work environment. If you have a passion for your work, and do it because you love it; if you are a self-starter, and love to learn; then you may have a place on our mobile front-end team. Must be comfortable using JavaScript frameworks in general, working with single page applications and willing to learn Backbone.js/Marrionette.js in a module-patterned Grunt build context.


Job Responsibilities: 



  • Create and maintain JavaScript modules on our mobile, single page application website.

  • Work with different development and QA teams to code JavaScript and HTML/CSS/Handlebars templates.

  • Test and verify projects through an agile development process

  • Write clean and concise code. 

  • May have to work off-hours on occasion when issues come up. 

  • Update internal documentation as new features are created and deployed. 

  • Adhere to mutually-decided architectural concerns. 

  • Learn and incorporate new libraries and technologies as needed.


Job Requirements: 



  • B.S./B.A. Computer Science or related field

  • 3-5 years of professional website coding experience

  • Expert with HTML/CSS/JS best practices and writing clean, semantic code

  • Proficient with JavaScript, good knowledge of JavaScript frameworks and build processes

  • knowledge of GIT, TDD and Continuous Integration  workflows  

  • Understanding of OO and functional programming principles, especially with regard to HTML/CSS/JS and creating reusable UI components

  • Expert troubleshooting JavaScript/HTML/CSS bugs and using debugging tools

  • Experience optimizing front end code for performance/speed

  • Experience using version control and working on web projects in a team environment - meeting deadlines

  • Ability to code detailed, functional pages from 

  • Working knowledge of HTML5, CSS3 and current trends

item.title: Android Developer - Judopayments partner with Apple Pay (contract 3 months) at Judopayments (London, UK)
item.description:
Do people call you The Android?  Can you work in a team of superheroes and defeat the villains group called "bugs"? 
Can you make sexy best in class features that leave competitors wondering, "who was that masked avenger"? 
Is your second name "testing" because your enemies fear you will hunt them down with unit and integration tests?
