item.title: Sr. Android Engineer, Prime Now Delivery Experience at Amazon (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Prime Now is Amazon's newest benefit for Prime members, which offers one-hour delivery on tens of thousands of daily essentials through a new mobile app. Prime Now is powered by Amazon’s growing network of fulfillment centers and transportation technology that utilize high-end technology to speed up order delivery times for customers. Now, Prime members can skip a trip to the store by shopping on the Prime Now app for products like paper towels, shampoo, books, toys and batteries with orders delivered right to their door in an hour or less.



Our Transportation Technology group is responsible for designing and implementing software that makes the delivery of these items possible in one hour or less. Our software has to take into account item, delivery associate, network and environmental constraints to provide a fast delivery experience for our end consumers. We develop backend services, websites and mobile applications to aid the delivery process.



It is still Day 1! We have many openings for individuals to help us innovate in this space. We are looking for talented SDEs to design and build these new systems. You will work on hard problems at scale and will have autonomy to deliver. You will learn about real-time adaptive transportation solutions, routing algorithms and optimizations, operating on large scale datasets, mobile development and more.


  • Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • Experience developing Android and/or iOS applications.

  • 8+ years of software development experience with the following technologies:

  • Expert knowledge of Java and the JDK

  • Expert knowledge of the Android Developers Kit

  • Advanced Android UI Skills (Fragments, Custom view components)

  • Experience writing multi-threaded apps

  • Expert knowledge of Eclipse, IntelliJ or Android Studio

  • Experience with the application submission/provisioning process

  • Expert level debugging and analysis skills using ADB




  • Proficiency in object oriented development and ability to apply OO concepts

  • Excellent interpersonal, business management, time management, and developmental skills.

  • Experience with version control

  • Demonstrated ability to meet or beat assigned targets and deadlines under normal circumstances, and ability to make trade-offs and when needed to optimize outcome when conditions change

  • Ability to communicate with other employees in the company in both technical and non-technical roles.




  • Experience in building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.

  • Experience with databases.

  • Have designed and developed a complete Android app from top to bottom

  • Web Services experience as it relates to mobile apps

    Solid understanding of Android UI paradigms from Gingerbread to Lollipop


Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with all applicable local, state and federal laws.



Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer- Female/Minority/Disability/Vet

Come help build Canada’s largest and most innovative online eCommerce destination.  Does contributing to a large-scale eCommerce platform, supporting millions of products, tens of thousands of orders per day and millions of site visits and page views once sound interesting?  You will apply cutting edge development technologies to solve hard-core scale and integration problems and build high-demand, multi-threaded eCommerce applications.  You will apply your existing PHP/J2EE knowledge to a large-scale real-time eCommerce platform through the design, implementation and support of new and existing eCommerce features.

It’s not for the meek here, but if you have what it takes, we will push you hard and you’ll gain incredible experience and knowledge solving challenging software engineering projects.

item.title: Video Engineer at Clearleap (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Video Engineer


ABOUT US


Television today spans far beyond the traditional TV set. Its the last few seconds of a basketball game streamed to your iPhone and all of season two on your tablet. Clearleaps software products allow TV networks, cable and satellite providers, and major studios to offer video on tablets, smart phones, connected TVs and PCs. Clearleap is committed to hiring talented, dedicated, and creative individuals that want to be a part of a fast-paced environment that is changing the way television is viewed and we need you!


THE ROLE


The Video Engineer will be responsible for working with other engineers to make sure Clearleaps video transcoding farm is producing high quality video at breakneck speeds. A qualified candidate for the Video Engineer position will understand MPEG encoding, audio/video multiplexing, and be able to develop tools to transform media to meet customer requests. The ideal candidate will have an excellent understanding of digital video and audio and demonstrate a passion for bringing digital streaming entertainment to the home.


Key Responsibilities Include:



  • Design and implement media processing pipelines.

  • Support development, QA, and Operations with installing, configuring, and maintaining our systems.

  • Actively participate in a program of continuous improvement of platform documentation


EXPERIENCE/SKILLS REQUIRED



  • Bachelors degree in computer science or other relevant field required

  • Must have 3-5 years of specific video expertise

  • Must have 10+ years of C/C++

  • Strong knowledge of Java

  • Expert knowledge of ffmpeg, mplayer, and other media tools.

  • Video encoding with x264 and other commercially available encoding systems

  • Expertise in or good understanding of one or more of the streaming video formats such as MP2TS, HLS, HDS, Smooth, DASH etc.

  • Outstanding follow-through and problem solving skills, resourcefulness, attention to detail, personal accountability, and communication skills (both verbal and written)

  • Strong ability to multi-task multiple competing priorities

  • Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix systems as well as UNIX based systems (such as OS/X or Solaris)

  • Working knowledge in Internet technologies such as XML, web servers, and other Internet/network-related protocols

  • Strong hardware and software troubleshooting skills


ADDITIONAL PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE



  • Video Encryption and Digital Rights Management (DRM) like Playready, Adobe Access, Widevine, Irdeto.

  • Familiarity with Elemental, Ateme, Telestream, or Digital Rapids transcoders

  • Software development in Java or Groovy

  • Experience with Video QC Tools like Manzanita, Baton, Ineoquest


BENEFITS



  • Competitive salaries

  • Company subsidized medical, dental, and vision coverage

  • Company paid life, short term and long term disability insurance

  • 401(k) and stock option programs

  • 15 days of vacation in the first year

  • 10 paid holidays and 2 floating days

  • Free lunch Wednesdays

  • Free snacks and drinks, including soda fountain

  • Gym membership and race fee reimbursement

  • Onsite gym and showers

  • 3 scooters, 2 ping pong tables, 1 foosball table, and corn hole!

  • Regular fantasy sports leagues and quarterly cooking competitions (with prizes!)


We offer a flexible, exciting, and entrepreneurial work environment and look forward to you joining our team!

item.title: QA Engineer at Gumtree (Richmond, UK)
item.description:
Seeking an experienced QA Engineer to join Gumtree's team based in London, Richmond.

Gumtree is part of the eBay Classified Group, the world leader in online classifieds, with 12 brands that span the globe.

Founded in London in 2000, Gumtree is today the UK’s leading classified site, with over 14.5m unique visitors every month and over 9.5m app downloads. The platform enable people to trade everything from cars to home items and find jobs, local services, community events and even somewhere to live.

Our mission is to help create a world where people share more and waste less. Our focus is on delivering a first class trading experience founded on the classified pillars of Local, Free and Easy’.

Gumtree is looking for an experienced QA Engineer with automation skills and passion for Continuous Delivery. As part of your role, you will be taking ownership of the entire QA process within an Agile cross-functional delivery team (4-5 people in size).

The Team

In the Product Development team we work in small, cross-functional product focused teams where everyone is involved in the complete life cycle of a software product. We are trying to be as lean and as agile as possible in all aspects of what we do. We believe in build-measure-learn product development loop and continuously deliver our features in smallest valuable chunks. On average we release 10 times a week and continuously improving our technical platform and delivery process to be able to release more often.

Key Responsibilities

You will be expected to:

• Work within a development team and with stakeholders to define feature/projects acceptance criteria

• Define testing strategy for features and product changes

• Extend automated testing suites to continually improve automated test coverage and coordinate with developers to improve unit and integration tests

• Perform manual exploratory testing and regression testing if required (as defined by the QA him/herself)

• Work across other teams with other QA engineers on improve overall Gumtree testing strategy and Continuous Delivery process

Skills/Experience

• At least 3 years' of QA/Testing experience in a technology-led company preferably working on a web-based systems

• Experience working in Agile environment, ideally with Kanban and with continuous integration

• Experience of writing automated tests using Selenium WebDriver and any of ScalaTest, JUnit, TestNG, Cucumber or JBehave

• Experience with version control tools, (Git, SVN)

• Degree in a discipline which requires application of analysis skills (e.g. engineering, software development, computer sciences)

• Exposure to issue management and bug lifecycle (Jira, BaseCamp, Bugzilla etc)

item.title: Java Backend Developer at Qapital (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Qapital is looking for an enthusiastic and talented Backend Developer (Java) to join our team in Stockholm. At Qapital, all of our developers make a difference from early in the development process, and we work in short iterations with small wins duly celebrated. If you join us, you’ll get to be part of a team that is changing the way people think of everyday banking. We are collaborative, empathetic, and pragmatic, and it’s important that this internal culture scales with us as we grow.


The Qapital backend systems are structured in large part according to the Microservices pattern, and expose a RESTful HTTP API to our client apps. The core services are all developed in house, while we integrate with multiple external platform providers for more low-level banking infrastructure services.


Can you code confidently at all levels of the back-end stack? We want to meet you. Do you also have ideas outside the usual conventions, and frequently come up with new ideas for building applications? Then we really want to meet you.


How we work


At Qapital every developer is a part of the entire lifetime of a new feature. From the initial idea, forming the hypothesis of how it will improve the experience to developing it and finally following up on the results as it is released.


We work in short iterations to get new features out to users as quickly as possible. We typically focus the entire team, from designers to backend and frontend developers on one feature because we think that with teamwork comes great innovation and knowledge sharing.


We are all eager to learn and develop and we believe in a culture where sharing experiences and giving feedback comes natural.


A diverse team is best positioned to truly serve our market, and diverse applicants bring ideas, abilities and perspectives that we haven’t even considered yet. We especially encourage you to apply if you are part of a category or group that is normally underrepresented in the tech industry.

item.title: Embedded Software Validation/Automation Engineer at Intel Corporation (Leixlip, Ireland)

That's where you come in. We need innovators and proven communicators like you to push our thinking. Analyzes test results to ensure correct functionality, determine root causes of failures and recommends corrective action.

item.title: Medior Software Developer at ASML (Veldhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Introduction
Do you enjoy capitalizing on .NET software technology in an Agile development context to create solutions that our customers appreciate, and that make operators feel they’re in control? Are you fascinated by mathematics and its practical applications? If so, this could be an exciting opportunity!

Job Mission
Within business line Applications the D&E YieldStar software groups address the area of complex machine control software. You will be end-to-end responsible for realization of software in C# in one of the application functions’ software teams, contributing to development of the YieldStar software platform. This is done using a scrum/Agile way of working.

Job Description
You like to contribute to ASML’s fastest growing business by delivering solutions to complex engineering problems in a multi-disciplinary team-effort. In this position you are a member of the Critical Dimension (CD) metrology, Overlay (OV) metrology, or Diffraction Based Focus (DBF) metrology application software team. The teams address development of algorithms for reconstruction and optimization, and integration thereof in new applications and workflows that enhance metrology capability for our customers. In the scrum team you take initiative to address user stories in this scope. You are guided by the scrum master (team lead), function cluster architect, and product owner (project lead).

Furthermore, you cooperate with other software team members, and involve Customer Support (CS), Holistic Application Development (HAD) team members, and Manufacturing representatives. Your eagerness to experience the fit of our solutions at the customer makes you willing to use opportunities to travel. As a Software Develper you will act as fast learning software professional, and contribute to software realization using a disciplined agile/scrum based way of working. You apply software engineering practices such as requirements engineering (user story definition), object oriented analysis and design, implementation in C#, testing, and integration in the YieldStar software platform. You are eager to pick up knowledge on metrology recipe setup, reconstruction and optimization algorithms, and workflows associated with the OV, CD, or DBF application functions.

Main Responsibilities



  • Act as scrum team member

  • Demonstrate end-to-end ownership for feature/story based software engineering

  • Align specifications with stakeholders in the function team and the software platform lead

  • Secure both software and product quality

  • Ensure adequate fit of software deliverables in the YieldStar software platform

  • Software realization, including design, testing and documentation

  • Act as buddy in pair-programming

  • Contribute to continuous improvement of our Agile software development for the software department as a whole

  • Transfer knowledge to colleagues in both D&E and sectors supporting operations and providing consultancy (e.g. CS, HAD)

item.title: Dynamics NAV Developer (f/m) at Home24 AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your duties at Home24



  • You will be part of our in-house ERP development team and develop solutions for our current Microsoft Dynamics NAV System

  • Code, unit test, performance test, debug, implement, and support application systems either through new development of functionality or enhancement of our existing functionality

  • Apply your architecture knowledge to increase the scalability of our ERP System and help us to prepare for the newest version of Dynamics NAV

  • Work together with project managers, business analysts, testers as well other teams from integrated solutions to ensure effective delivery of functionality

  • Use software development methodologies and standards (based on Microsoft Guides) to effectively code and provide a high quality

  • Take ownership for you developed software and continuously work to improve the existing system


What we expect from you



  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree (in Computer Science, Math, Electrical Engineering or related field) and preferably 3-5 years of related experience.

  • At least 3 years of experience in Microsoft Dynamics NAV Platform including NAV Classic & RTC Environments

  • Strong understanding of Dynamics NAV Standard with profound knowledge of NAV modules (warehouse, finance, purchasing, sales)

  • In depth SQL & database knowledge as well as the ability to develop in at least one additional programming language

  • A good understanding of software architecture concepts related to object orientation and services.

  • certificates for NAV and SQL would be a plus


What we offer you



  • A highly motivated team of professional developers, database and system operators, quality and product managers

  • Opportunities for advancement – independence and the opportunity to take on responsibility

  • Openness to new ideas and creativity

  • Experiential depending and negotiable salary

  • Benefits like employee discount, team events, language courses etc.


If you are interested in being a part of an exciting success story, we look forward to hearing from you. Please send us a copy of your resume and relevant credentials (including a copy of your diploma, if available), as well as your expected salary and earliest possible start date.

item.description:
If you love wine and are passionate about building something new and big – this position is for you. You’ll be a lead developer building a consumer-facing website. You must have experience leading teams of developers, mentoring and guiding more junior developers, assigning tasks, reviewing work and taking responsibility for quality and functionality of the deliverables. 


You must be a highly-motivated, detail-oriented, self-starter with a proven track record of delivering highest quality, scalable solutions. You'll need to be flexible, smart, and tenacious. You’ll be working regularly with senior management, creative design (UI/UX) and other engineering team members, to define and develop solutions and features, so top notch communication and interpersonal skills are a must.


As a start-up, this position has the upside opportunity of taking over responsibility for our engineering team. We want people on board, who have ideas and visions on how to enhance information management for both wineries and wine lovers. We are looking for team members who never settle for the status quo and can continuously take the product to the next level.

item.title: PaaS Software Developer at Cloud Foundry (London, UK)
item.description:
The Cloud Foundry engineering team is looking for a few great engineers to join us in building an open source platform that transforms how the world deploys and scales software.


You


You love shipping features, but know that well factored code is what lets you keep shipping features in the long run.  Maybe you get antsy writing code without tests, or perhaps you’re a large-scale system operator interested in leveling-up your coding skills.


Either way, you measure your success by the success of your team; you are interested in learning about distributed systems; and you are excited to work on open source.


Us


Cloud Foundry is co-developed with Pivotal Labs, a leader in the field of agile software development. We are opinionated about how software should be built. We pair program, all-day every-day, because we know it delivers remarkable results. We work in small teams, and rotate between them frequently. We believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge, and refocus.


As part of the London team, you’ll be immersed in all the latest database technologies – Cassandra, Neo4j, Redis, MongoDB, Memcached, Elasticsearch, and more.  A solid understanding of these services as well as VM and container technologies (cgroups, LXC, Docker) is a plus.


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.


We’re seeking more amazing developers to add to our London team. Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter.

We are looking for enthusiastic


JUNIOR JAVASCRIPT DEVELOPERS (AngularJS/node.js/WebGL)(f/m)


As a Javascript Developer (f/m) you will play a major role in our development team and help us create a fabulous E-commerce platform with cutting edge 3D customization tools.


YOUR TASKS

  • You work closely with our international, highly skilled and professional development team in an agile development environment

  • You train yourself continuously to ensure that your skills are up to date


OUR OFFER


Join a creative, smart, self-motivated, and experienced group of people at a successful company where your input will make a real difference. We offer a competitive compensation package, flexible working times, and great opportunity for advancement and long-term career building. We invest in the personal development of our people and provide high-end equipment for their work.


We work in short cycles in order to adapt our software continuously to our business needs. We like to use the newest available technologies and mainly use open source solutions when it comes to development. We work in small, agile teams using methodologies such as SCRUM, pair programming, TDD/BDD and continuous integration/deployment. Your ideas are always welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better. Besides a dynamic, highly motivated international team, you will find minimal hierarchies, quick decision-making and a pleasant working atmosphere.


For more details: https://mycs.com/#!/career

item.title: Awesome Android Developer for Fitness Apps at Wahoo Fitness (Atlanta, GA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Our Software Engineers build amazing running, cycling, and workout apps for our wearables / sensors as well as our API. If your passions are fitness and app development then this is your dream job.


Wahoo Fitness develops awesome fitness products that include both the hardware and software. Our products range from fitness monitors (e.g. our TICKR heart rate and motion analytic sensor) to world-class training devices like the KICKR bike trainer. We use Bluetooth Low Energy, iOS, Android and the latest in server-side technology to create innovative hardware and software. We work with Apple, Nike, Strava and others to help shape the industry.


We are looking for Software Engineers to be based in our Atlanta offices (near Chastain Park). Remote work is possible for awesome candidates but would only be considered for people with experience working remotely in Agile Scrum teams. Competitive compensation package (including healthcare) based on experience. 


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Work in a small, dynamic team to develop and maintain our Android software, including the Wahoo Fitness workout app, 7 Minute Workout, Wahoo Android API and Wahoo Utility App.

  • Implement support for new Wahoo sensors as they become available.

  • Liaise with other members of the team through virtual and physical meetings.

  • Liaise with customers via email/online forums to gather technical info and trace issues.

  • Share development/team organization work in an agile-scrum environment.


AWESOME WORK ENVIRONMENT



  • Work collaboratively with others who share your passion for sport fitness and technology

  • Our industry is cool – wearable technology and motion analytics is hot

  • Dress code: we don’t have one. Most people wear shorts and t-shirts.

  • Vacation policy: we don’t have one. Arrange vacation with your manager and don’t count days.

  • Its ok to work out during the day – in fact, testing our products is encouraged daily.

  • Annual allowance to pay for race entries or fitness club.

  • Two company-subsidized health insurance plans (PPO and HSA) plus dental, vision and 401k plans.

  • Adult beverages most Friday afternoons

  • Macs are standard issue

We have great things ahead of us - enjoyable work and enough space for your personal goals and career for a committed employee is just as important as the room for your ideas and creativity. You are looking for a challenge and are eager to have a versatile scope of duties? Then this is the right job for you.


.Your role at ABOX42 in detail:


As a developer with us you will work on the unique ABOX42 Software Stack enhancing it's features.  Along the way  you’ll tackle challenging problems, continue to learn new skills and have an impact on our software, our clients and your colleagues.

 
The ABOX42 Software Stack is currently written in PHP (Codeigniter, SlimPHP, composer, MongoDB, MySQL, AWS EC2/S3/CloudFront) and a very heavy dose of Javascript (jQuery, UnderscoreJS, BackboneJS, RequireJS, HTML5, CSS3 using Less).  You might have a greater interest in some of these technologies than others, but we're looking for people who want to make a well-rounded, full-stack contribution to every part of a project.
 
We’re always keeping an eye out for new ways to solve problems, so we’ll work together to keep up with the latest technologies and methodologies. And since we’re a rather small company, your ideas and contributions will be noticed from day one


What you can expect from us:



  • Flat hierarchies

  • Flexible working hours

  • A friendly, pleasant working environment and open-minded colleagues

  • Large desks, MACs and many screens

a10:author.a10:name: NYU Center for Advanced Imaging Innovation and Research

item.title: Research Software Engineer C++ at NYU Center for Advanced Imaging Innovation and Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Our Group


The mission of the Center for Advanced Imaging Innovation and Research (CAI2R) at New York University School of Medicine is to develop innovative solutions to key problems in today’s medical imaging practice and to make these developments rapidly available for patient care. The center is embedded into the Department of Radiology and brings together a unique group of ~70 full-time researchers, consisting of imaging scientists, developers, clinical researchers, and research technicians. It is located in the heart of New York City on Manhattan’s east side, in a landmark building that also houses our radiology offices and multiple clinical MRI systems. This close proximity enables us to test our next-generation imaging techniques very rapidly in a clinical setting and to obtain immediate feedback from physicians.


Our scientists have access to over 12 modern MRI systems, including various clinical MRI scanners as well as a PET/MR and 7T MRI system. We are supported by a team of onsite industry scientists. A dedicated RF lab can be used for custom coil and phantom building. Extensive computational resources are available for numerical simulations and for the development of computationally demanding image reconstruction algorithms.


For more information about our center, please visit http://cai2r.net.


Available Position


To support our research projects, we are looking for a highly motivated and qualified software engineer with a strong passion for creating the next generation of radiologic imaging techniques, aiming at earlier and more precise detection of diseases. The successful candidate will work together with our researchers on exciting software projects, including our open-source processing framework Yarra and other open-source tools for the medical-imaging community. Additional responsibilities include code maintenance and testing, programming of modules for our web portals and development of web applications for supporting multi-center studies. If desired, a portion of the time can also be used to conduct own scientific work and to engage in some of our ongoing research projects.


Requirements for this position include:


-  University degree in computer science


-  Strong development skills with proven professional experience in C++, QT5, and Boost


-  Profound experience with Linux, preferably including package management, and state-of-the-art web-development techniques, including design and implementation of RESTful APIs


-  Experience with distributed version management tools such as Mercurial or GIT


-  Experience with virtualization and cloud-computing infrastructure, such as AWS, Azure, or OpenStack, and preferably knowledge about container systems such as Docker


-  Experience in managing open-source projects


-  Preferred: Experience with image-processing techniques and the DICOM standard


-  Self-driven work attitude and good organizational skills


We offer a competitive salary and benefits package. For candidates applying from abroad, a work permit and visa can be obtained through the medical center’s immigrations office.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager - $100K at Crossover (Bangalore, India) (allows remote)
item.description:
If you are an elite Software Engineering Manager eager to gain unprecedented visibility to the top technology companies throughout the globe, employ your technical and managerial skills to oversee cutting-edge software in a high-intensity environment, and earn $100,000 USD per year while working from virtually anywhere on the planet, this job is for you.


What to Expect as a Software Engineering Manager at Crossover


Crossover is looking for Software Engineering Managers who demonstrate outstanding managerial skills as well as the technical background to deeply understand the code their teams are developing. You will be expected to demonstrate both a mastery of the technical skills associated with the projects at hand, as well as the managerial ability to motivate, build, and monitor your team. Specifically, you will be responsible for overseeing from 4 to 6 teams of 3 to 4 individuals. You will own the process of breaking specifications created by the product management team into clear tasks and timelines, as well as assembling the results into high value, reusable components. Under your leadership, we expect to see consistent improvement in both static code quality metrics and weekly production.


Compensation




  • Salary: 50 USD/hr




  • Position type: Full time (40 hours per week and up)

Next Steps


Start the process now by following our application link. If you meet the qualifications, we will proceed with a series of evaluations and interviews. Your evaluations will consist of both an in-depth, code-based assessment designed to evaluate your technical proficiency, as well as a management assessment designed to evaluate your skills as a team leader. Crossover is eager to see what you have to offer our cutting edge global workforce.

item.title: Manager, Software Engineering at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
iRobot Corporation, with a mission of “empowering people to do more” is at the forefront of the development of robotics and artificial intelligence technologies. iRobot has a global presence, operates across three markets: Home Robots, Defense and Security, and Remote Presence, and has become one of the world’s preeminent specialist designers and builders of robots. iRobot invests in the development and growth of its people, in a culture of empowerment, innovation and fun. You will be expected to lead the full software lifecycle for all San Francisco web-based projects, in addition to guiding technical scoping, design and implementation of web and application offerings to support Tigerspike’s business goals.


We want people who love being involved in challenging and completely innovative work. At Tigerspike we work with a wide variety of clients from numerous sectors including Retail, Media, Healthcare and Financial. We work at the cutting edge of technology and help our clients realize their ambitions by utilizing that technology.


If you love technology, are excited about working with some amazing clients, thrive in a team-based culture, then Tigerspike could be the place for you!

item.title: Quality Assurance at SHOP.CA (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
As Quality Assurance team member, you are an integral part of SHOP.CA’s Research and Development team.  You are responsible for all quality assurance practices in the company.  This includes QA testing and verifying that new product releases are ready for release to production, ensuring that the company meets and exceeds its service level agreements by developing and managing Quality of Service performance and availability monitoring processes, and ensuring that the SHOP.CA user experience is error-free, fast and efficient.


You are an individual who can learn fast, has 3-5 years experience in the R&D teams of enterprise-class software companies, leading online marketing solutions or digital agencies and has patience for the details. You never assume something works correctly the first time and you get great satisfaction out of proving developers wrong!  You like to break code, tear it apart and get to the bottom of bugs, performance testing, automated testing and the like. You show initiative and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves, challenge the development and operations teams to reach higher standards of performance and availability and be 100% focused on getting the job done.


Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for creating/executing test plans for all SHOP.CA applications.

  • Responsible for build management of the company’s source code and managing a complex QA environment

  • Responsible for building tools to monitor the performance and availability company’s production systems including defining a set of Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s) that summarize the system health. To present to management regular QoS reporting of system availability and to make recommendations to R&D management on ways to improve QoS KPIs.


We work in an aggressive, energetic and sometimes frantic environment where exceptional coders thrive. You must be willing to join an early stage, hyper growth company that will require significant time commitments to be successful. It’s not for the meek here, but if you have what it takes, we will push you hard and you’ll gain incredible experience and knowledge solving challenging software engineering projects.

item.title: Senior Quality Assurance Developer at Kronos (Montréal, QC, Canada)
item.description:
• Collaborate with both the scrum team on its deliverables and your colleagues in the quality organization.

  • Implement test automation for the next generation UI.

  • Ensure a high quality user experience.

  • Work closely with our UX team to assess testing feasibility and identify risks.

  • Setup/configure/maintain automated testing environments in a continuous integration setting.

  • Develop test documentation, execute tests, and monitor results using application lifecycle tools.

  • Provide complete automated testing coverage for areas of responsibility.

  • Review business and functional requirements documents in order to create appropriate test documentation.

  • Deliver a set of reusable, modular tests for UI components.

  • Transform manual test documentation into robust, efficient automated test scripts.

  • Continuously improve upon the productivity and efficiency of our automated testing efforts using innovative tools and techniques.

  • Adhere to and promote standards for test development best practices.

  • Stay current on new technologies and evangelize future adoption of next-generation automation tools and best practices as appropriate.

We want people who love being involved in challenging and innovative work. At Tigerspike we work with a wide variety of clients from numerous sectors including Retail, Media, Healthcare and Financial. item.title: Senior Android Developer at WorldRemit (London, UK)
item.description:
Our Story: 


At WorldRemit we are changing the way people send money abroad. We’ve taken something complicated and made it simple. Tap the WorldRemit App or click our website and your international transfer is made – to a bank account, cash pickup, Mobile Money, or airtime top-up. We send to more than 120 countries and the number is growing all the time.


Changing the world isn’t easy – That’s why we like to hire smart people that like to make things happen. We are a small, agile team who is motivated by seeing the work they do. We are focused on clean, quality code and building a product that will be used around the world by millions and eventually billions of people.


As a Senior Android Developer you will build our very first native Android app in collaboration with the product and design team. You will help design and architect our first native mobile app and work across the entire product life cycle from concept, design, build and test to deployment to app store and support. If you have experience and a proven track record of building awesome apps, let’s get in touch.


What you’ll be doing day to day:



  • Write well-structured, commented, beautiful clean code

  • See unit testing as a benefit, not a chore

  • Feed your opinions to the product team

  • Be close friends with tracking tools, not enemies

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer (ASP.NET) at Aimia (Newark, DE)
item.description:
OVERVIEW:


Aimia has been around for a long time, but is always changing and pushing new limits. Aimia Inc. ("Aimia") is a global leader in loyalty management. Employing more than 4,000 people in over 20 countries worldwide, Aimia offers clients, partners and members proven expertise in launching and managing coalition loyalty programs, delivering proprietary loyalty services, creating value through loyalty analytics and driving innovation in the emerging digital, mobile and social communications spaces. 


Aimia is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: AIM).


Aimia is a fast-paced environment with a business casual work atmosphere.  We focus on our clients, and our entire team does what it takes to get the job done right and exceed client expectations.


As part the Software Development team for our Smart Button Software as a Service (SaaS) division, you will be part of a small highly focused team responsible for building the core of our industry leading loyalty marketing platform. 


The Smart Button Loyalty Platform is the software behind many of the customer rewards programs you already know.  Serving clients in the retail, consumer packaged goods, hospitality, travel and gaming industries.  Our division is expanding rapidly as we scale out to serve clients in new markets around the globe.


This is a chance to build enterprise scale cloud solutions, for a great company where loyalty is truly our business.  We follow Agile Software Development practices to deliver a new product release (to all clients) every six to eight (6 – 8) weeks. 


We are located within walking distance from downtown Newark and the University of Delaware.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • This is a highly technical, hands-on role for a quality assurance engineer interested in the craft of software development and wanting to keep their skills current. 

  • Responsible for the design, development and maintenance of testing automation scripts for integration testing of large program modules within the loyalty platform.

  • We work in an open environment using “ticketed” support and development systems, which are used to coordinate feedback with the QA team.

  • Must be a self-starter able to work independently, while being flexible enough to context switch in an evolving environment.

  • High technical ability, attention to detail, good communication skills and the ability to collaborate with other development and IT team members are attributes of an ideal candidate.


QUALIFICATIONS/KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:



  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Sciences or related technical field.

  • Minimum 5 years of professional QA Testing

  • Familiarity with ASP.Net Development tools and practices preferred.

  • Knowledge XML, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML is ideal. 

  • Comprehension and working knowledge of the following skills is desired:

  • Highly scalable distributed multi-tiered system design

  • NET Framework

  • ASP. NET Development tools and practices

  • Visual Studio (2012 or later)

  • Ticketing System (Fogbugz, TFS, etc.)

  • Source control (Source Gear Vault, Source Safe, TFS, etc.).


This job description is intended to convey the general nature and scope of the position and not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required.  All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.


Click on the link below to apply for this position:


https://home.eease.adp.com/recruit/?id=13441641

item.title: Operations Engineer at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Summary


You’re passionate about building systems at scale, and enjoy engineering them to the point where they run super smoothly. When people are brainstorming ideas, you’re already thinking about solutions. You have great fun pushing a system to its performance limits, but plan for not needing that in practice. You love working in a team, your closest coworkers and project stakeholders just the same. If that sounds like you, we’d like to hear from you!


The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for an experienced Operations Engineer to join our Technical Operations team. In this role, you will contribute to an open source based infrastructure serving more than 500 million people every month.

  • Investigation, architectural design, and implementation of Wikimedia infrastructure and services

  • Improve automation tools and processes to support development, deployment and maintenance

  • Emergency incident response and diagnosis of system outages or alerts

item.title: WEB DESIGNER (Information Officer 3) at Southwest Minnesota State University (Marshall, MN)
item.description:
WEB DESIGNER (Information Officer 3) - vacancy at Southwest Minnesota State University in Marshall, MN. Full-time position, $43,681- $64,060/year. The Web Designer is charged with being a part of a team that manages the Southwest Minnesota State University official public web site, www.smsu.edu. The designer is responsible for developing and implementing strategies to use the website to convey the institutions key messages to various audiences. The Web Designer develops and implements effective web site features that serve the needs of prospective students and their families, current students, faculty and staff, business and community leaders, the media and other key audiences. This includes developing concepts and procedures for continuous improvement of the site; generating written and graphic content for the site; implementing design templates accurately and consistently; ensuring usability, functionality and ease of navigation; keeping information on the site accurate and up to date, ensuring that the site presents a positive image and conveys key messages about Southwest Minnesota State University.



Minimum Qualifications (expected to have to enter job)



  • Bachelor’s degree in web design, computer science, digital media, communications, graphic design, or related field OR an Associate's degree and two years of experience using content management tools

  • One year of current work experience with web design

  • Current knowledge and practical experience with web technologies and applications such as CSS, JavaScript,HTML5

  • Specific knowledge and experience using the Adobe Web Premium Suite and/or the software tools included in that Suite

  • Strong knowledge of web marketing

  • Experience utilizing social media tools such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, etc.

  • Ability to work within a team environment on an award-winning web site

  • Ability to work collaboratively with all departments within the university

  • Strong interpersonal, organization, written and oral communications skills

  • Ability to quickly learn and apply new web design and development methods and technologies

  • Self-motivated and flexible with the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment

  • Attention to detail is essential as well as strong skills in editing, proofreading, spelling and grammar usage

item.title: Java engineer at Canva (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
At Canva, we work everyday to make a significant positive impact on society. Our mission is to democratise design.

Since launch in April 2013 we have grown exponentially, and the journey has only just begun. Join Canva, and be part of this adventure. We are one of the world’s fastest growing startups.

Your colleagues, like you, will be the top of the industry. We mean it, when we say it is important to us that you love coming to work.

Our culture is unlike anywhere else and our offices are designed and constantly improved to let you do great work.

At Canva you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really love. Just check out our Twitter stream.

Engineering is a core part of who we are. We work hard to have a best of breed engineering culture. You will work with a carefully selected team of ex-Google, VMware, ThoughtWorks, and Atlassian engineers. Foremost; the engineering team takes pride in it’s focus and prioritisation around engineering fundamentals. The team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand, and to strike a measured balance between getting things done and long term maintainability. The team is tight, with no big egos, and welcome self-driven engineers to come and join in on the adventure.

We run Java+Python , using a mix of SQL and NoSQL stores.

item.title: Director of Mobile Engineering at Work Market (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Work Market is the leading platform for freelance labor. Our freelance management platform is providing the biggest brands in the world and freelancing businesses, with a solution that allows both sides to manage an end-to-end contract engagement at scale. We are right in the middle of a rapidly growing freelance economy that will make up 50% of the workforce by 2020.



What We Do:


We enable clients with the ability to expand and contract their workforce based on market demands and allow them to stay relevant and efficient in a competitive marketplace. We provide access to on-demand subject matter experts that allow companies to be productive and efficient. We offer freelancers the ability to have a flexible work schedule and to be selective about their project engagements while also building their portfolio.



Our Team:


Our engineers build the freelance management (FMS) platform and workflows that allow our customer to be more efficient and effective in a competitive marketplace. We are customer driven, our engineers work closely with the Product team to help define and articulate a vision for the Work Market FMS platform. We focus on providing simple, elegant solutions to complex problems



Responsibilities: 




    Provide hands-on leadership to a growing team of mobile software developers.




    Co-develop mobile strategy and roadmap for Work Market’s native iOS and Android apps.  




    Build prototypes and mobile applications to meet the demands of our large iOS and Android audiences. 
    Scale and oversee development work through vendor and contractor services. 






    Travel to New York (HQ) and establish relationships and bridge communication gaps between technical and non-technical colleagues, teams, and senior managers. 




    Executive manager of the office.




Qualifications: 




    10+ years of software engineering experience 




    6+ years in management 




    Successful background leading mobile software development teams




    Experience in API development and integration




    Experience scaling and augmenting development teams through vendor and contractor services 




    Knowledge of mobile architecture best practices 




    Proven track record with iOS and Android 




    A deep understanding of the differences between user interaction on a phone and tablet 




    Excellent coding and testing skills in Objective C and Java 




    Exceptional written and verbal communication abilities Experience with HTML 5 and JavaScript a plus 



    A Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics

item.title: Team Lead QA (m/f) for Forge of Empires at InnoGames GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
InnoGames, based in Hamburg, is one of the leading developers and publishers of online games with more than 150 million registered players around the world. Currently, more than 350 people from 30 nations are working in the Hamburg-based Headquarters. We have been characterized by dynamic growth ever since the company was founded in 2007. In order to further expand our success and to realize new projects, we are constantly looking for young talents, experienced professionals, and creative thinkers.


The Team Lead QA is both part of the leadership team within a product, and of an agile game development team, building and scaling a game played by millions of players. As both a people manager and technical tester, you will provide a comprehensive QA strategy for the game and proposes respective quality targets in line with the business goals. You will directly manage a team of Quality Assurance Testers, providing technical and team leadership.



Your mission:


• Review requirements and provide feedback for product managers
• Initial feedback for newly developed features through exploratory testing
• Automation of service level and UI level tests
• Develop system test plans / beta test plans
• Coordinate testing activities with development teams and the release manager
• Report regarding and follow up on product quality status



Your profile:


• 3-5 years of professional experience in software testing
• Several years of professional experience in Java
• A degree in technical sciences or relevant work experience
• Experience in automating tests on the UI level as well as on the service level
• Hands-on testing experience regarding web applications
• Experience in using HTTP debugging tools, such as Firebug
• Good understanding of SDLC
• A passion for computer games
• Enjoying working and communicating in a team
• Good inter-personal skills, ability to build relationships at all levels of staff
• Proactive and motivated individual with a structured, disciplined way of working
• Superior creative and innovative problem-solving skills
• Fluent English language skills


Preferable:


• Experience in testing mobile applications
• ISTQB/ISEB certification



Our benefits:


• Further education, e.g. regular trainings, a flat-rate for reference books
• Opportunity to attend relevant high-level conferences, congresses and industry talks
• Relocation-support and welcome days
• Flexible working hours and the possibility for home office
• Regular feedback in all directions and employee surveys
• Free drinks and fresh fruits
• Company gym, Gaming area, roof terrace with BBQ
• Frequent company and team events
• After-Work “Get together”



Be bright - Light up your career!

Do you enjoy challenges? Would you like to become part of a dynamic team and work as a Team Lead QA (m/f) for Forge of Empires with us?

Then we look forward to receiving your application (cover letter, CV and references) as well as your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date through our online application form at innogames.com. Your contact person for this job offer is Christopher Grundmann.

item.title: Seeking Software Engineer-Must Love Dogs! at Radio Systems Corporation (PetSafe) (Chapel Hill, NC)
item.description:
We are a team of empowered software engineers and we are looking for another kick-butt coder. We work on awesome projects (BLE Trainer, Connected Feeder, Connected Fence). We work with awesome people (Categories, Engineers, UX, Customers). We work with awesome technologies (iOS, Android, PHP, NodeJS, MongoDB, AWS, MQTT). Check out www.petsafe.net-Connected products for some examples of our work!


This role is responsible for the development, troubleshooting, maintenance and documentation of web, mobile, and desktop applications. This role will develop according to industry best practices and will place a specific emphasis on user experience and performance. 



  • Put the customer first when developing software. The customer experience is paramount.

  • Write clean and testable code that follows SOLID and DRY principles.

  • Document the systems you write for future reference (this does not mean comment-overkill)

  • Assist in the project decomposition and planning processes.

  • Actively participate in team discussion and if everyone is agreeing too quickly attempt to argue an opposing viewpoint.

  • Hold your teammates accountable. You are expected to call them out. If they commit dirty code to a published GIT branch, it is your responsibility to let them know.

  • Accept feedback and opposing viewpoints as an opportunity to grow.

  • Do not hold back ideas. Not all ideas are good ideas, but some of the best ideas come from the seeds of a bad idea.

  • Always be professional and respectful.

  • Work with no assumptions, constraints, or preconceived notions of can’t.

  • Be resourceful and think of new ways to do and not ways to not do.

  • Be willing to learn. We are a cross-trained team. You will work on technologies that are new to you.

item.title: Linux Yocto Developer (m/f) (96459) at BMW Group (Ulm, Deutschland)
item.description:
EVEN IN IT, PEOPLE ARE MORE IMPORTANT THAN IT.
SHARE YOUR PASSION FOR COMPLEX NETWORKS.


Networks are about more than IT Networks. They are about connecting people who make things possible. Close teamwork is key to understanding how IT can help integrate processes into systems. We put this insight into practice, and it's part of our success.



We want to stay ahead in the future, so our team is currently seeking a:
Linux Yocto Developer (m/f)
Job reference: 96459



GNU/Linux, Yocto, Python, C, C++, /bin/sh, git, and fancy cars: we have it all!
We offer you a chance to work in an international team at BMW Car IT, where we are cooperating closely with other BMW departments and companies responsible for designing and building automotive software components. You can focus on one of two key development areas.



1) SDK developer (m/f)
Your job is to develop our Software Development Kit (SDK) for an embedded Yocto Linux platform. The SDK will give developers a state of the art IDE, cross compilation environment, debuggers, and connections to real and virtual target HW. You will combine the best open source and proprietary solutions to a seamless developer (m/f) experience for hundreds of SW developers (m/f).



2) Yocto developer (m/f)
This work includes diverse activities ranging from analyzing and planning software deliveries in cooperation with the development teams, to supporting developers and integrators in compiling, packaging, testing and debugging software components of a fully embedded Linux distribution. We work with agile principles, and contribute to establish a highly automated build and test infrastructure that supports our developers (m/f) and ensures that we keep the quality standards high. Your work will result in a state of the art head unit for BMW cars!


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.
