item.title: e-Commerce Developer at Squla (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Your role?


Activities and responsibilities:




  • Building and implementing shop features for the Squla platform web application

  • Understanding e-commerce requirements and able to formulate optimal solutions for those

  • Individual contributor, but able to work well with a loosely structured team

  • Able to communicate across different functional teams, and not just technical colleagues

  • Full stack responsibility: front-end, back-end

  • Able to write good quality code which is clean and maintainable

  • Testing your features and being fully responsible for them when they go live

  • Maintenance and bug-fixing as required

item.title: QA Analyst at Big Viking Games (London, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The Nitty Gritty: 


We are on the hunt for a full-time QA Analyst to help us in our quest of creating the most fun social and mobile games. As QA Analyst, your primary responsibility is to create and execute test cases for assigned features while communicating issues, risks and test statuses in a timely and detailed manner. You are a key player in helping us provide our fans with the best gaming experiences available. This position is available at our London, ON studio. 


The Duties:



  • Upstream testing and analysis to prevent bugs from entering the integrated game code. You're a gatekeeper; no bug is getting past you!

  • Create, maintain and execute test plans that test a product from end-to-end

  • Verifying and broadcasting performance results on multiple environments and platforms. You are a quarterback of communication and ensure that tests and procedures are properly understood, carried out and evaluated.

  • Executing test routines for integration, system, load and performance testing

  • Effectively collaborating with team members to achieve the best results - you play well in the Viking sandbox. 

  • A Titan of triage, you properly catalogue priority and severity of issues found during the QA testing process


The Loot:



  • Competitive salaries with generous time off policies

  • Health, dental, vision, life and disability benefits

  • Employee stock option plan; this way we all get to celebrate in the success

  • We frequently celebrate hitting milestones after work or even in the middle of the afternoon by going to paintball, movies, Canada's Wonderland, and a patio to name a few in addition to various in-studio events.  All work and no play makes for a dull Viking.

  • Stocked kitchen, breakfast & hot catered lunches daily! Viking can't work on an empty stomach.

  • A gaming lounge with competition grade foosball, XBOX 360, PS4 & Wii U. Kick back and relax or dominate your fellow Vikings (in a totally HR friendly way).

  • If you cannot live without caffeine like us, we have an arsenal of freshly roasted coffee beans which can be crafted into great coffees, espressos or lattes just for you!

  • Free in-studio registered massage therapy. Viking muscles need love too.

item.title: Software Engineer - Visual Editor at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Summary


As a core engineer you will be deeply involved in the VisualEditor project, building a sophisticated, elegant and responsive visual interface for editing content on Wikimedia websites using JavaScript, CSS, AJAX and HTML5 technologies. You will join the Editing Department, where we build collaborative, inclusive tools for creating and editing free knowledge.


Description



  • Develop Visual Editor's contextual and toolbar-based interaction tools, ensuring they are simple, consistent and intuitive on all platforms

  • Help develop other elements of VisualEditor as needed

  • Participate in and conduct design and code reviews, and discuss discuss design, development & testing of features

  • Support testing efforts for deployments of features

item.title: Perform at your best to give us the best software performance! at kCura (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The QA Software Engineer- Performance is responsible for delivering results for kCura's core products by:



•Identifying and communicating baseline expectations for the performance of kCura’s core products •Driving software performance requirements through exploration of projected configurations and environments of kCura’s core products •Ensuring the availability and efficiency of the environments that product development uses to develop and test kCura’s core products.



The QA Software Engineer- Performance performs the following functions, in addition to others, in the administration of his or her position:



Performance Testing


•Involvement with the team on processes and practices related to performance, load and scalability testing.


•Implement scalability and performance requirements by exploring the bounds of our core products.


•Contribute to pre-release feasibility studies to assure our software requirements and technical designs are testable and capable from a performance perspective


•Perform the execution of baseline performance and load tests per release to assure our core software products have not regressed.


•Create automated scripts to simulate multi-user, multi-tiered systems running in different environments under various configurations.


•Involvement in the design, documentation and execution of backend tests for software installations, deployments, licensing, recovery and upgrades.


•Analyze performance results and recommend optimizations to hardware/software configurations, database design, and environment setup.


•Provide testing assistance to the development teams for the creation and execution of new performance and load tests for newly developed functionality.


•Gain knowledge from Client Services on client infrastructure setup, performance bottlenecks, that help drive the way we performance test/debug/optimize our core products


•Support Client Services by offering expertise to customers on domain specific setup and tuning of our products in their environment.

item.title: Mobile Application Developer (iOS, Android) at Solstice Mobile (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Solstice Mobile has several opportunities for software engineers that are excited about development within the mobile platform ecosystem (iOS, Android and Windows 8). Our mobile developer opportunities range from junior to mid level development roles. You will be working on client-facing projects with Fortune 1000 companies in the mobile and enterprise software space. You will be given the opportunity to innovate using the latest mobile technology trends such as bluetooth LE (beacons), M2M and IoT, advanced physics and rendering engines, social media and collaboration platforms and many others. Solid communication skills, a servant leadership attitude, a love of learning and an analytical mind are a must. You will be building enterprise mobile web (HTML5, JS, CSS) and native iOS (Objective C), Android (Java) and Windows 8 (C#) mobile applications


What you can look forward to:



  • Gaining technical knowledge of software, hardware and open source technology stacks

  • Helping evaluate emerging cross platform frameworks

  • Partnering with top notch designers to create award winning user experiences

  • Bridging the gap between elegant front end design and existing enterprise back end architectures

  • Being mentored by more experienced mobile developers and architects to foster your career path and growth

  • Mentoring others less experienced than you to foster their career path and growth

item.title: Frontend Web Developer - London at Toaster Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
Toaster Ltd is a specialist digital creative agency based in London. We are currently working on some amazing digital projects for clients such as Google, YouTube, Toyota and Lavazza. We work alongside Google Creative Lab to craft ideas, explore concepts and execute pixel perfect sites for projects such as Chrome Super Sync Sports, Life in a Day, Youtube SpaceLab, Google Science Fair and We L’Aquila to name just a few. 


We are looking for experienced front-end developers, full-time or freelance, to work on exciting web projects that push the boundaries of what’s possible online. This role also revolves around working closely with clients and other team members, prototyping mobile first web experiences using Javascript / CoffeeScript and WebGL.


We try to let programmers focus on what they enjoy doing which we find is also usually what they are most efficient at. Depending on your skill set, your role could either focus on the layout / UX programming or designing and implementing core features for web apps.


You may choose to focus on writing carefully crafted web layouts and interactions using HTML/CSS/JS. The challenges involved require a good understanding of cross-browser quirks, best practices for implementing the layout of web apps, and web performance optimisation, especially working with CSS animations while maintaining good framerates and page weight across all platforms.


Otherwise you might want to focus on developing core components and features. We’re looking for programmers with experience designing and implementing applications using a modular approach. The majority of our work is written in JavaScript using Google Closure Library, but you may also take part in projects that involve working in other popular languages.


You will explore the very latest technologies to produce innovative interactive prototypes and game experiences for Google Creative Lab and other clients.

item.title: Front-End Web Application Engineer at Autodesk (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Are you passionate about building elegant, beautiful and easy-to-use graphical web applications? We’re a small, agile team of smart people building a new web-based platform for authoring interactive 3D experiences based on reality capture data. We support artists, museums, educators and engineers in sharing their fascinating stories.


We are looking for a highly motivated front-end web developer with a focus on interactive graphics. You are excited about the latest web technologies and graphics APIs, and you love beautifully designed and highly functional web applications.


As a global leader in 3D design, engineering, and entertainment software, Autodesk helps people imagine, design, and create a better world. Autodesk accelerates better design through an unparalleled depth of experience and a broad portfolio of software to give customers the power to solve their design, business, and environmental challenges. In addition to designers, architects, engineers, and media and entertainment professionals, Autodesk helps students, educators, and casual creators unlock their creative ideas through user-friendly applications.


Job Title and Number: Front-End Web Application Engineer; 15WD18208


Location: San Francisco, CA


Responsibilities



  • Create elegant, robust and easy-to-use web applications

  • Design, implement, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable front-end modules and widgets

  • Build cross-browser solutions optimized for a wide range of devices

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas


Qualifications



  • Proficiency with JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, and CSS3

  • Knowledge of 3D graphics, WebGL and Canvas a very strong plus

  • Proficiency with at least one other major programming language (C++, C#, Objective C, Java)

  • Solid understanding of common design patterns, object-oriented programming, and testing methodologies

  • Strong problem solving skills

  • Be willing to learn, help your teammates, share your knowledge, and receive feedback

  • Flexibility to work well in a small, agile team on a wide range of tasks


Extra Points



  • Experience with graphics APIs and UI libraries

  • Experience with libraries and tools such as RequireJS, Sass/Compass,Angular, Underscore

  • Experience in native mobile development (iOS, Android)


To apply, or for questions, please contact us directly at: imagine.design.create@autodesk.com

item.title: Lead Interactive Developer at MARC USA (Pittsburgh, PA)
item.description:
At Marc USA everything we do starts with uncovering radical insights that incite powerful reactions.


With nearly 300 employees and growing, from offices in Chicago, Pittsburgh, Miami and Boston, we have created a culture of collaboration and multi-dimensional creation; built on celebrating what makes each of us unique.


Our Pittsburgh, PA office is looking to add a Lead Interactive Developer to our team.  As the leader of the development group, the Lead Interactive Developer supports the SVP of Digital Experience Development in managing the people, tools, and processes of the group to ensure that MARC can provide marketing technology expertise and support to account teams and clients.  We are looking for a leader who is equally passionate about technology and the challenges and opportunities of growing and managing a team.  The lead developer is expected to set the standards for how the group executes and manages development, and is responsible for constantly improving the capabilities and maturity of the group. The lead developer is responsible for managing the relationship, expectations, and services provided to the account teams and business functions.  As such, he also owns managing the satisfaction of clients (internal and external), selling the group’s capabilities, successfully teeing up work (proper estimating and expectations), and translating technology challenges and opportunities for non-technical stakeholders.

item.title: Web Developer at Greenhouse Partners (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Who We Are:



Greenhouse Partners is a professional services firm focused on the growth of brands and people. We have high profile, national and international clients and work with early stage growth companies and leaading small to mid-size national brands across multiple verticals including consumer packaged goods, real estate, cable, financial services, and many more.



We serve our clients through five core competencies:



  • Greater Purpose and Culture: Includes Vision, Values, Mission, Culture Development and Evolution, HR Strategy, and Internal Understanding and Buy-in

  • Research, Insights, Brand Strategy: Includes all forms of Stakeholder and Competitive Research, Actionable Insights, Brand Positioning, Annual Planning, Content Strategy, Brand Personality, Brand Architecture, Brand Roles

  • Core Creative: Includes Name, Logo, Tagline, Visual Identity System, Concepts, Campaigns

  • Stakeholder Experience: Includes Digital, Advertising, Social, Video, Sales Support, Grassroots, Mobile, Retail Environment, Internal Communications, Thought Leadership, Events, Public Relations

  • Innovation: Includes Ideas, Methodology, Facilitation, Products, Services, Packaging



Our culture is inspiring, entrepreneurial, and collaborative – driven by smart, strategic, creative people focused on growing our clients’ brands. Greenhouse Partners has a high-performance environment requiring creative problem solving and a commitment to doing amazing work.




What We Are Looking For:



Digital Associate: We are looking for a Web Developer with 4-8 years of experience who wants to work in a collaborative, entrepreneurial, positive environment. Our ideal candidate will possess strong knowledge and experience in all things digital.



Job Description:



  • Consult with broad team on strategic discussions and decisions related to all-things-digital

  • Consult with our design team on IA/UX/UI best practices during the design phase

  • Export optimized graphics (standard and high-dpi) from PSD design files

  • Translate PSD files into standards based HTML/CSS/JS using responsive design

  • Setup hosting environment and address technical requirements for CMS 

  • Install CMS and needed add-ons

  • Integrate front-end programming into CMS

    • Maintain ongoing client needs and development within CMS





Must Haves:



  • Expert knowledge of HTML5, CSS, and PHP

  • Deep knowledge of JavaScript language, not just specific frameworks

  • Demonstrated CSS framework experience including but not limited to Sass

  • Able to design, code and assemble an entire website from concept to delivery

  • Knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator, and Flash

  • Experience with SEO, SEM, social media, mobile and app development

  • Up-to-date on digital trends and strategic implications related to decisions

  • Conceptual skills and general design skills are a plus.

  • Ability to lead complex development projects, including working with client-side development teams (sometimes integrating with data services), and translating complicated topics into understandable concepts for the client



Bonus Points:



  • Experience with Git code versioning system

  • Drupal

  • Wordpress

  • ExpressionEngine

  • Previous integration experience with ASP.NET



Applicants must be committed to:



  • Exhibiting a high level of personal accountability in work product and career growth of self and others

  • Bringing energy, passion, and optimism to work every day

  • Doing amazing work



Please email portfolio and resume to Greenhouse Partners at kgreenawalt@greenhousepartners.com and include “Digital” in the subject line. No calls please.

item.title: Full-Stack Rails Developer at BloodHub (Phoenix, AZ) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a full stack web developer or someone who wants to evolve into a full stack web developer to help us accommodate our steady growth. We have a mature, market leading web application and we ship new code regularly. All of our developers engage in a blend of direct customer support, bug fixing, and new feature development. This position will have the occasional day where all you do is fix bugs or answer customer support emails. That said, our focus is to challenge your creativity throughout the stack and help grow your skill set because we want you to be with us for many years.


    Our development process is agile. We expect developers to write specs and cucumber scenarios. We use wireframes and paper prototypes as much as possible. We consider BDUF a four-letter word. We do not micromanage and at times it will be up to you to choose work items and make sure they get done. If you need someone else to keep you busy then this position will not be a good fit.


    We are based in Phoenix, Arizona but are willing to consider remote candidates as long as you are frequently online between the hours of 10 a.m. and 4 p.m. AZ Time (-0700) during the workweek. This position if for a contractor or an employee depending on your availability and preference. Compensation and benefits are negotiable and based on your experience and skills.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Sainsbury's (Coventry, UK)
item.description:
Digital innovation at Sainsbury’s has never been stronger. We’re leading the way for the retail industry, building world-class apps and services from our centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry. And our ambition knows no bounds. That’s why we’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around – and you’re next on our list.


We’re looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to work across both production and non-production environments, tirelessly delivering and supporting changes to our systems and business applications. It’s about driving the pace of change forward whilst maintaining the integrity of our services and, ultimately, increasing the value of our business.


As a Senior DevOps Engineer you’ll:


• Offer inspirational coaching and mentorship to up to four DevOps engineers
• Implement DevOps technologies and processes, e.g.: containerisation, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, metrics, monitoring, etc.
• Automate wherever possible whilst always knowing how far is ‘too far’
• Act as subject expert on at least one of the team’s applications
• Work collaboratively with all delivery teams to transition changes into production
• Track system and service performance to make sure we’re meeting SLAs
• Be part of the on-call and out-of-hours rota when necessary

item.title: Product HW/SW Support Engineer at The Intellisis Corporation (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Our Product Team is responsible for delivering ASIC and board products to our customers. The support of the products as well as basic design data will be key to our success and our customers success. Each member of the team is armed with the field experience to deliver real world, real-time solutions.

We’re looking for product developers with customer-facing experience who want more direct customer interaction and experience. It’s important to be a careful listener, with the ability to demonstrate knowledge and professionalism throughout customer engagements. Successful candidates will have an Electrical Engineering degree and a minimum of 5 years relevant experience. This position reports to the Sr. Director of Professional Services.
 
We offer a focused, driven culture and an exciting working environment. If you are excited about helping Intellisis lead the Machine Learning revolution, we would like to talk to you. Salary is commensurate with experience and the company offers health insurance and an employee-funded 401(k).

item.title: Software Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer at Teamworks (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Position Purpose: Teamworks is seeking a highly qualified and hard-working individual to join our Development team as a Software Quality Assurance Engineer.  The position would be responsible for helping the testing team to fully validate the systems functionality and supporting business processes to ensure it operates as specified and in a way that provides an outstanding experience for clients.  Specific responsibilities include full end-to-end testing, writing test scenarios and cases, troubleshooting problems, creating and tracking defects, and related data.   Most of all, we want someone who is resourceful and loves the challenge of adapting new tools and technologies to make testing more effective and efficient.  We promise you will not be bored due to the wide breadth of topics and functionality within our application from mass communication, team travel planning, calendar synchronization and electronic document processing.  All of which would need to be tested on various platforms including the web and mobile applications.  The QA will:

  • Develop, publish and implement test plans.

  • Execute test plans against requirements documentation.

  • Document software defects, using a bug tracking system, and report defects to software developers, monitor bug and resolution efforts and track success.

  • Collaborate with other stakeholders to define and refine the QA process and how it interacts with the development team.

  • Write and maintain test automation for both Server and Client side code.

  • Define and track QA metrics such as defect densities and open defect counts.

  • Attend design reviews, requirements sessions and technical team meetings.

  • Understand business requirements and business operating processes / procedures in order to guide development of effective Acceptance Testing deliverables that fully test impacted business and operational groups.

  • Develop or specify standards, methods, or procedures to determine product quality or release readiness.

  • Testing of mobile applications on various devices.

item.title: Talented developers in Southampton and London at Alliants (London, UK)
item.description:
Hello! Here's what we do...
Alliants are a bunch of people who care about building the right thing, and building things right. All of our work comes from recommendation, which is why we don’t have a sales team. Whether we're building a new startup, growing a large product, coaching in dev processes, designing new tech strategies, or refactoring a large old behemoth, each interaction we have has created more work for us.


We’re based in London and Southampton, so if you like the bustle, varied culture and tiny apartments; or instead like the sea, paddle-boarding to work and smell of farms we can accommodate you.


What were looking for
A company based on recommendation needs people who have pride in what they do. You understand how good design helps mature a system, and have probably read Martin Fowler or Uncle Bob on well designed clean code, you like to keep abreast of what you don’t know or use, like new languages like Elixir or Rust. You appreciate the professionalism that TDD (or good tests) affords. You know the trade offs of monolithic architectures and that newer ways, like micro-services, have trade offs too. And ultimately you know that there is no universal correct way of building software.


We’re a knowledge based business - people come to us because we know what to do and how to do it. So we don’t hire people to just write programs. We need people who help us build our own knowledge, and do things better. We’re not afraid to prototype and give talks on our ideas, and encourage all to do the same.


Although technical competency is important, we want people passionate about software. We think that passion is visible in our work. We’re looking for people of all levels, grads to senior developers.


How we work
We almost always try to be highly agile, goal/data driven, and collaborative. Our clients may not be. But even then our consultants and coaches are on hand to help them change to a more innovative way of working.


We predominantly use Rails for web and iOS and Android for mobile. But we're always interesting in other technologies like Node.js, Angular.js, Go. 


We like good work/life balance, limits to bureaucracy, and to letting people figure things out themselves. We have standards if you want to use them, but teams are empowered to ignore or improve on them as their work demands.


That sounds great! What else?
We have all the usual things like healthcare, life insurance, pensions, parties, conference & training budgets, your choice of hardware, beer fridges. But why not tell us what you want from your work life and see if we fit with each other.

item.title: Java Tech Leads to work with our £1billion investment in our Digital Technology at Lloyds Banking Group (London, UK)
item.description:
To help us build and develop the best team of talented Designers and Developers, Lloyds Banking Group IT have opportunities for highly experienced, hands-on Software Engineering Technical Leads.


You’ll make a significant contribution to help us transform our software engineering development and delivery processes and practices.


You’ll have the opportunity to provide the technical leadership and guidance across our Build and Test teams that will help us develop and deliver market leading software engineering change, shaping the future direction of the architecture of Lloyds Bank internet banking platform.


Technically, you’ll be a seasoned software development practitioner (preferably within Java/JEE stackand Spring stack), with a strong understanding of IT architecture domains (specifically application, integration and data architecture).


You’ll also be highly familiar with Agile methods (like Scrum, XP) and techniques (like TDD, BDD), as well as DevOps practices (continuous integration and deployment, integrated configuration / change management, automate-everything approach).


We can offer you substantial financial remuneration and unparalled personal and career development opportunities.


Lloyds Banking Group also provides an excellent working environment. We are adapting an Agile environment where we also encourage a flexible working approach to our Software Delivery.

item.title: Network Architect at Belk (Charlotte, NC)
item.description:
The Network Architect (NA) is a member of the Belk Infrastructure Engineering team and is responsible for leading the process that aligns our technology foundational components to business system initiatives.  The NA role is to coordinate, direct, and design network infrastructure activities as well as provide technology direction in support of the project and support teams.


The NA possesses a broad knowledgebase with a focus on strategic technologies including: Cisco Networking technologies including (LAN, WAN, SAN, VoIP, Wireless, Firewall), HP Networking, Palo Alto, Checkpoint and similar non-Cisco technologies.


The NA will also work with decision makers in other departments to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support cost-effective technology solutions.  The NA will participate in overall IT planning, bringing a current knowledge and future vision of technology and systems.


The NA role works in close partnership with Belk’s Domain Architects, the Enterprise Architecture and Security teams aligning technical solutions to business and technology strategies. This position will be responsible for designing and delivering solutions which are fault tolerant, flexible, and scalable to support our development, test and production environments.


The scope of this position includes collaboration and participation with all IT Infrastructure core components; furthermore, the NA will be a liaison between Belk IT and Belk’s business partners, such as HP Enterprise Services, and will work collaboratively to maintain and operate all related systems in support of end-user access, performance, and stability.

item.title: Senior Linux System Administrator at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) and/or its various support companies throughout the world are looking for people to support the business in the fast-growing hotel markets.


We are looking for a Senior Linux System Administrator to join our headquarters in Amsterdam, NL. As a member of our IT Production Team you’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of people. You’ll be working on 7000+ boxes placed in different live operating data centers around the world. You will be part of one of the biggest e-commerce companies in the world and work with some of our industry’s smartest people. You will work on a wide range of technologies which include UNIX, Linux, CentOS, puppet, chef, Perl, Python and more. By proactively thinking about scalability we can ensure the growth of Booking.com.


B.responsible


Booking.com is all about teamwork and it's what keeps us motivated. We push the limits of our open source technology stack as we solve the challenges that come along with scaling to meet the phenomenal growth of Booking.com. As a Senior Linux System Administrator you will:



  • Combine your knowledge and expertise with the goals of our business to support and maintain a world-class infrastructure and to enable our continued growth

  • Analyze, monitor, configure, and maintain the existing system and identify possibilities for improvement;

  • Ensure the reliability and continuity of our global systems;

  • Cooperate with other System Administrators, Engineers, DBA’s, Developers and Product Owners during projects;

  • Research, deploy and implement new systems and solutions, for example on automation or scalability;

  • Advanced troubleshooting;

item.title: DevOps Team Lead at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Sainsbury’s is leading the charge in retail digital innovation. We’re building centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry from where we’re crafting world-class apps and services. Call yourself ambitious? Wait until you meet our team. We’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around and this is your chance to get in the mix.


We’re looking for a DevOps Team Lead who can really inspire our engineers, making sure they keep on delivering game-changing solutions to our business applications. The pace is fast and you’ll make sure it stays that way, but that doesn’t ever mean compromising on integrity, so you’ll also be incredibly keen to protect the quality of service and business value.

• Be a DevOps guru who can bring our way of working to life for engineers

item.title: Java Developer at EmbedIT (Praha, eská republika)
item.description: Our developers are so passionate about programming - they even dream about it. If you can code in your sleep too, you´ll be in good company. A Czech company, which develops and customizes own financial systems for 10 top world markets.

item.title: Director of Engineering, Programmatic TV at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Director of Engineering to lead a team to build the strategic programmatic TV products for TubeMogul.  Responsibilities include leading the team to make the right design decisions for front-end user interface, microservices, real-time bidding and partner integrations. 

The ideal candidate is highly organized, action-oriented, and accomplished in the development and deployment of "Web scale" systems.  You have a pragmatic, results-oriented approach to application architecture and are excited to work on a Javascript and Java application stack.

In-depth Product/Domain knowledge - will demonstrate significant experience and deep understanding of a product and its users.

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Zeta Interactive (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
You will work with some of the best and brightest talent in the industry, challenging you to think out of the box and simplify and solve complex problems in creative ways.


We're looking for a talented and seasoned Senior Web Developer to join our team. You should be someone who can take an idea from concept to execution and then test it in all the browsers. You should be able to speak fluent jQuery and have a love for the latest web dev trends. You should also be able to provide leadership and mentorship for other members of your team who may be geographically distributed.

Responsibilities

Why Work For Us:
