item.title: Android Engineer (Washington, DC) at LivingSocial (Washington, DC)
item.description:
You know LivingSocial as the marketplace to buy and share the best things to do in your city and beyond. And while we're bringing excitement and value to our merchants and consumers, we're also committed to creating a world-class environment for our employees. Our talented LivingSocialites bring an all-hands-on-deck approach to our work, taking pride in being collaborative, creative, and flexible. If you’re passionate about working as part of a team to drive value to businesses of all sizes, you may have just found your new home.


LivingSocial is revolutionizing local eCommerce. With millions of consumers and tens of thousands of merchants using our web and mobile tools, we're constantly improving our suite of products. Using data to drive decisions, our engineers are solving hard problems at the heart of our business. We’re looking for hungry, creative, and pragmatic engineers to help us continue innovating - you can learn more about our team on our tech blog and our public github repository.


We are looking for an experienced Android Engineer to join our talented team that wants the opportunity to make a difference and deliver value on a regular basis.


Your responsibilities:



  • Working across the software stack (UI, back-end, datastores, services)

  • Shipping new releases often

  • Collaborating daily with your team and other groups

  • Working on a distributed team

  • Iterative and incremental development

  • Fixing existing production issues as much as building new solutions

  • Taking smart risks and championing new ideas


Desired skills, experience & qualifications:



  • 3+ years of mobile development experience; preference given to candidates who have experience with large applications of some scale

  • Passion for creating an immersive user experience on a mobile platform

  • Background in developing and working with RESTful APIs

  • Dedicated, pragmatic approach to problem-solving

  • A preoccupation with staying on top of industry trends and technologies


 Compensation:



  • Competitive base salary and bonus plan

  • We’ve got you covered with health, dental, and vision offerings and a fantastic 401(k) matching contribution that vests immediately

  • Generous paid time off program

  • Some of our offices offer commuter benefits, all of our offices offer snacks...lots of snacks

  • Opportunity to work with committed, talented people with a great sense of humor


LivingSocial appreciates your interest in our company as a place of employment. It is the policy of LivingSocial to provide equal opportunity for employment to all qualified employees and applicants, regardless of race, religion, religious affiliation, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, or veteran status. This policy applies to all areas of employment including recruitment, placement, training, transfer, promotion, termination, pay, and other forms of compensation and benefits. The company will comply with its legal obligation to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities.

item.title: Senior or Mid-Level iOS Engineer - International Product Development at JUST EAT (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior or Mid-Level Android Engineer at JUST EAT you will work on a product that generated over £1billion worth of orders in 2014, but wait... It's still growing!? 


As an Engineer in International Product Development what will you be doing?:



  • Our International Product Development team work on our platform and apps across 15 different countries.

  • Working in Continuous Delivery / Deployment and having full stack control to meet your's and your teams objectives.

  • Using OKR's to be aligned with company wide objectives, and create great clarity about what will make the boat go faster!


If you are a Senior Engineer you will:



  • Will become a trusted technical authority and specialist in one or more technical areas of your team. You’ll be someone the rest of the team and your Technology Manager can turn to for engineering advice and guidance.

  • Collaborate with other product development teams and use their feedback as a basis for improvements.

  • Write technically sound, clean, maintainable code – with practical application of established patterns and practices.

item.title: Team Lead - Software Development at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com is looking for a hands-on Team Lead for one of our back-end software development teams. As a Software Development Team Lead within Booking.com you will contribute directly to the success and growth of the #1 accommodation booking website in the world. You will work on a complex, large scale, world renowned product and witness real time impact of your work. We offer an international, result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, Booking.com is the place to B!


B.responsible


Our software development strategy is agile and we work in small Scrum teams of 5-7. We do several rollouts every day, are data-driven and do extensive A/B testing. Our technical culture derives strongly from our strong ties to the Perl community. Even if you do not know Perl, Booking’s Perl rock stars will help you get up to speed in order to be able to start solving real problems from day one. 


Your main focus as a Team Lead is leading your team of software developers to success. To get to know our technical environment you will start off as a hands-on Software Developer in the first few months. Your responsibilities will include:



  • Leading a team of 4-5 software developers

  • Working with the team and the product owner to define a prioritized backlog of stories that the team will tackle during a given sprint

  • Working closely together with other teams to ensure a stable and reliable product

  • Being fully hands-on in terms of writing code and participating in software development projects

  • Playing an active role in developing new features for a high performance, scalable web platform

  • Assessing and communicating how your work impacts business and other systems

  • Monitoring team’s progress and take ownership of removing any impediments that slow the team down

  • Mentoring people on the team and help them improve their game


B.skilled



  • You have a minimum of 5 years of hands-on software development experience

  • You have experience with coding in more than one programming language, e.g. Python, C, C++, C#, Java, Ruby or PHP

  • You are eager to learn Perl

  • You are an open source fanatic

  • You have a sound understanding of programming fundamentals and their application to highly scalable web based systems

  • You have led a small team


B.offered


We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.


This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.  We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!


Booking.com BV, part of the Priceline Group (NASDAQ: PCLN), is the global market leader in online hotel reservations.  Established in 1996, www.booking.com is available in 42 languages, offers more than 500,000 hotels and accommodations in 200 countries, features 27+ million reviews written by guests after their stay, and attracts online visitors from both leisure and business markets around the globe.  The Booking.com group has over 8,500 dedicated employees in 120+ offices and offers a dynamic work environment with a culture that is open, innovative and performance oriented.  We believe our people and their passion is what makes us successful.

item.title: Junior Software QA Engineer - Business Operations and Strategy at trivago (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
As the Business Operations and Strategy team we see ourselves as a start-up within a start-up. We build innovative applications and invent game changing products to shape trivago’s future. In this role, you’ll conceptualize and manage the development of new applications that optimize internal workflows and enable departments to unveil new opportunities. Working in a fast-paced, agile software development environment, you’ll work cross-functionally to build unconventional technical solutions that fit our unique organization. Sounds like a challenge you’re ready for after uni or after working in a similar field? Then we’d like to hear from you.

We are looking for an ambitious individual to learn the trivago approach to software quality assurance. Instead of following test-instructions, you’ll be detecting problems and root-causes by combining IT skills with exploratory testing, an analytical mind, healthy mistrust and the ambition to find bugs before anyone else does.


Your tasks:



  • Be part of a team that invents and builds applications that match the needs of an innovative and rapidly changing company.

  • Test all aspects of newly developed features for web-based applications to ensure they’ll work on current and future browsers, operating systems etc.

  • Learn to write test plans for manual and automated testing.

  • Work with developers and projects owners to detect malfunctions and deliver software that is bug-free.

  • Critically question the usability of product owners’ new ideas.

  • Recommend design improvements or corrections throughout the development process

  • Contribute during planning and coordination of new software releases.

item.title: Backend developer Java at EsperantoXL (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
What this job’s about


Typically, our backend developers spend their days assigned to small team working on a specific customer project (e.g. mobile platform integration Railpocketfor Dutch Railways) or on a generic product (e.g. routing optimization engine for DHL). Developers mostly work with JEE platforms (think JBoss, GlassFish or similar), or OSGi containers (think Felix, Karaf, ServiceMix, etc.) that sit behind our cloud infrastructures. On top of that, there are non-standard assignments from time to time to keep your thinking fresh.


How our teams operate


We breathe, eat and drink agile in general, and Scrum in particular (although there is Kanban work as well). We have certified scrum masters constantly on the lookout for improvements. Our developers are deeply involved in technical details, but we encourage them to build a good understanding of customer’s needs and business processes. It’s not uncommon to see a developer showing a customer how to make an improvement to an existing practice. We value deep technical skills and broad expertise which both contribute to a fruitful cooperation with our teams and customers.


What we offer in return



  • A competitive salary (company shares available in 2015);

  • Substantial training budget to drive your need to develop yourself;

  • Diverse assignments with a focus on tangible results;

  • Plenty of room for initiative (discuss architecture, introduce new tooling, convince others);

  • Flexible working hours (you can start working between 7.30–10.00 and working from home is possible on some days);

  • A top-notch mobility program (yes, you can get a lease car if you wish);

  • A great spacious office, with lots of sunlight and a breathtaking view over a traditional Dutch wei with the Lopik tower piercing the sky on the horizon;

  • A very active party committee, that organizes outings and team building events with alarming frequency.

item.title: iOS Developer at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) is looking for an iOS developer to join our team in our Amsterdam headquarters.  As a member of our IT Production Team, you’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements that impact millions of people. You’ll be working on 7000+ boxes placed in multiple, live, data centers around the world, as well as working within one of the biggest e-commerce companies in the world.  


B.responsible


Booking.com is all about teamwork and it's what keeps us motivated. We push the limits of our open source technology stack as we solve the challenges that come along with scaling to meet the phenomenal growth of Booking.com. As iOS developer you will:



  • Maintain and enhance our iOS application

  • Translate requirements and mock-ups into fully functioning features

  • Develop new and existing iOS applications features

  • Provide estimates on development cycles

  • Implement conversion experiments (A/B tests)

  • Partner with designers to help define and implement User Interface improvements

  • Work with team members on server-side integration


B.ig Bonus



  • Experience with Apple Approval & Distribution Process, Ad Hoc & Enterprise Distribution

  • SQL knowledge and/or willingness to learn

  • Have built an approved store App

  • Experience working with A/B testing

  • You are passionate about open source and contribute

  • You’re not afraid to solve deep technical challenges of a whole new level at a huge scale

  • You have an intrinsic curiosity in technological innovations and you are always on top of the latest trends


B.offered


We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.


This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in the Netherlands.We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

item.title: Architect/Senior Developer and Leader Scala, Java Backbone, js, Bootstrap at TIM Group (London, UK)
item.description:
We will be looking for a passionate developer to join us in the new year and help us bring new products to market and find creative ways to build and enhance systems that solve our financial clients’ needs. We expect a Senior Developer to mentor and lead other developers, as well as add to our technology teams skill set that ranges from deep technology knowledge to start-up experience to financial systems knowledge.


Our Business


Our systems help manage billion-dollar portfolios, feed complex quantitative financial models, and fuel the sales and trading desks of the world's largest investment banks. We give our teams the freedom to use the tools and languages that they need to solve the problems inherent in these systems.


Due to our rapid business growth since launching our products in 2005, we have grown our development teams both in our London office and remotely. We offer a fun, challenging, and rewarding working environment and the opportunity to work with world-class talent to help you build a world-class career.


Our Technologies


Our systems are written primarily in Scala and Java on the server-side, and for our web-apps, we largely develop rich front-ends using Javascript and tools like Backbone, js and Bootstrap. We integrate into MySQL and MongoDB databases, as well as MQ services and our continuous delivery infrastructure. We contribute into the open source community, and you can browse our work here:  https://github.com/youdevise. As well as hear our thoughts about this and everything else on our blog here: https://devblog.timgroup.com/


Our Process


We enter new markets using a lean start-up approach based on minimum viable products. We believe discipline allows us to go faster. We use agile development techniques such as test-driven development, pair-programming, and continuous delivery. We actively seek to learn and improve through retrospectives, lightning talks, and various meet-ups that we host in our offices. We expect our developers to care about how to design software and systems that our clients will love, and will want to solve their problems quickly and iteratively seeking creative ways to build valued systems.

item.title: Senior Linux Administrator/Architect at Proofpoint (Belfast, UK)
item.description:
Proofpoint is award-winning, is positioned by Gartner as a leader in both Secure Email Gateway and Enterprise Information Archiving and is the leading provider of Next Generation Cloud-based Security, Compliance and Governance solutions for enterprise communications and collaboration.


We help 45% of the Fortune 500’s Top 100 and many other Enterprise and SMB organisations around the world to defend, protect, and govern petabytes of their most sensitive data with an infrastructure comprised of over 14,000 physical servers, 8 Datacenters and many thousands of virtual servers. We operate at serious scale and it is growing!!


At Proofpoint, you will find an environment where innovation comes from creative collaboration and where everyone is empowered to go fast and have fun. And if you find joy in making the impossible, possible, you will feel right at home with our team!


Summary:


We are looking for an outstanding Administrator/Architect with previous experience working in a highly-available production environment (e.g., we're running at 99.999%) that can support large-scale customers in the cloud (e.g., we have multiple Fortune 500 customers). This is a hands-on role that includes significant Operations and Infrastructure strategy and planning.

item.title: Java Developers - come work with our £1billion Digital Technology investment at Lloyds Banking Group (London, UK)
item.description:
As part of our £1billion investment in our Digital technology, Lloyds Banking Group IT has an opportunity for a highly experienced and talented Lead Application Designer.


Leading our team of Application Designers, you’ll work with our Architecture colleagues and take ownership of delivering end-to-end technical capabilities needed for the most secure, resilient and user friendly digital experience for our 10+ million Digital Banking customers.


You’ll be essential to our success in meeting unprecedented demands to extend and evolve the platform by exercising technical leadership and solid business acumen through the full SDLC.


You’ll have the opportunity to shape the future direction of the architecture of Lloyds Bank internet banking platform, while working within existing constraints and supporting the monthly release of business functionality to production.


You’ll also be able to deliver functionality visible to millions of UK customers, while ensuring the stability and resilience of the complex landscape of systems involved.


You’ll encounter challenging technical problems to be solved within existing constraints, while expected to also challenge the status quo and look for, and drive, improvements in technology and processes of the SDLC.


Technically, you’ll be a seasoned software development practitioner (preferably within Java/JEE stack), with a strong understanding of IT architecture domains (specifically application, integration and data architecture).


Ideally, you’ll also be experienced with Agile methods (like Scrum, XP) and techniques (like TDD, BDD), as well as DevOps practices.


We can offer you substantial financial remuneration and unparalled personal and career development opportunities.


Lloyds Banking Group also provides an excellent working environment. We are adapting an Agile environment where we also encourage a flexible working approach to our Software Delivery.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Indiegogo (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Role: 
At Indiegogo, you will have the opportunity to literally change the world and people’s lives by developing new features for our consumer platform to make it even more robust. You’ll work with exceptional developers and there are lots of interesting technical challenges to tackle,including projects dealing with heavy transaction volume, scalability and data. 

You will: 
* Build a marketplace that empowers people to follow their dreams 
* Architect, design and implement beautiful, performant & scalable Ruby code 
* Create features for the international payment system which sees millions of transactions per day 
* Extend the reach of our platform APIs 
* Always staying innovative (we use Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch and more) 
* Work with the latest and greatest JavaScript & front­end tools: We use Angular, Gulp, Mocha, Chai, Jasmine, Karma and more 
* Work collaboratively in a fast paced XP environment ­­ pair programming, TDD, BDD, and continuous integration

item.title: Java Jedi Architect at Marfeel Solutions SL (Barcelona, España)
item.description: If you feel like a Java Jedi, or you feel in the path to become one, join the Marfeel Force you must.

item.title: Infrastructuurspecialist at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Infrastructuurspecialist


Ministerie van Veiligheid en Justitie, Nederlands Forensisch Instituut


Functieomschrijving


Je levert bij het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) een belangrijke bijdrage aan het ontwerp en de inrichting van de technische infrastructuur van verschillende platforms.


Als infrastructuurspecialist buig jij je over het beheer van de technische infrastructuur en alle componenten van een platform, waaronder de hardware, netwerksoftware, protocollen, communicatieverbindingen, beheermechanismen en de onderlinge afstemming en koppelingen tussen netwerkcomponenten.


Je ontwerpt hiervoor de netwerkinfrastructuur en de hardware infrastructuur en richt deze in of je participeert hierin. Je monitort de platformbelasting en adviseert proactief. Ook los je incidenten op en je rapporteert hierover.


Het Nederland van nu zoekt ICT’ers. Bij de Rijksoverheid werk je als ICT-specialist aan belangrijke thema’s als privacy, security en cybercrime. Ook draag je bij aan ontwikkelingen in big data, cloud-oplossingen en bring your own device. Zo werk je mee aan het Nederland van nu.

item.title: Lead Backend Engineer - Financial Process Management at Oxford Valuation Partners (NY, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Oxford Valuation Partners is a leading financial advisory firm, specializing in Private Company Valuation, Mergers & Acquisitions, and 409a Reports. OVP works with startups and venture capital firms to provide critical business services to emerging firms raising capital, allocating options, and heading towards IPO or sale.


OVP already provides its clients with top-notch professional services. Now, we're bringing those services into the online arena, so our clients can collaborate better with our expert staff to manage and control key financial aspects of their corporations.


The world of funding, financing, and compliance is complex and challenging, and underpins much of the vibrancy in the tech sector today. This position is a good opportunity to gain exposure to this space, learn how it all works, and advance the state of the art in financial applications. 


Our application is being developed as an RoR app using Postgres. 


As a developer, you should be a strong problem solver with a focus on simplicity, performance, and security. It is your job, literally, to make sure that our clients' finances are calculated correctly and that their information is held securely. At the same time, we expect our tools to be on par with the best consumer-oriented websites in terms of utility, interface, and performance. A solid core will enable us to do that well.


This role initially entails implementing features related to equity modeling and management and user messaging. Over time, we expect you to architecting and implement components all across the application.


Our application is Ruby on Rails using PostgresQL as the data store. In keeping with modern programming standards, we're working towards an API-first, continuously integrated system.  As the lead backend developer for the project, you have a key role in making the application shine, and we expect you to be fluent with modern patterns and expectations.


You'll also be responsible for leading API integrations with complementary tools and for designing and implementing our own APIs.


The team is distributed so strong communication skills and openness to collaboration are important as well. We use Git and Slack as our primary collaboration tools.


This role is a full-time contract role. It may evolve into a staff position based on personal performance and the success of the application.

item.title: Senior Front End Javascript Engineer/Team Lead at Groupon International (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Groupon is realigning its global platform towards a full SOA architecture around highly scalable JVM backend and Coffeescript+Node.js driven frontends. The Berlin-based Merchant Experience department is the central hub for all merchant-facing web and mobile applications. We are looking for an experienced front end developer to lead the existing, highly skilled team in implementing exciting new features for Groupon Merchants.


Responsibilities :




    Work closely with UX/UI, product management and other teams to conceive, create and design unique web experiences on a full client side application




    Evaluate the existing frontend infrastructure and code and provide a design and plan to move to a single page architecture




    Provide technical leadership to the existing team to use their existing knowledge to build a modern frontend application capable of fast development




    Rapidly add new functionality, solve complex problems and ship battle-tested code

item.title: Senior Java Developer (m/f) wanted! at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced Java developer who wants to take responsibility in a powerful startup environment! We are a team of strong IT experts that creates new startups from scratch and scale them big in europe and worldwide. In the past we successfully ramped-up a lot of startups like minodes and Intelipost.





Why we are different? - 5 reasons to work in the Project A environment:



(1) We are open-minded for new technologies and we use them when it makes sense.

(2) We are 100% pragmatic. You’ll work in an agile environment with frequent architecture talks, but without eternal planning meetings.

(3) We love lean and efficient solutions and prefare Tomcats over EJB container.

(4) Our internally developed framework does the annoying tasks for us and we can focus on the really interesting issues.

(5) We belief in a strong interdisciplinary teamwork of development, business-intelligence, marketing and operations.

item.title: Senior Backbone/Ruby on Rails Developer at Strategyzer Inc (Toronto, ON, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
**** No recruiters or outsourcing companies please ******

We're looking for a Senior Backbone Developer with a very specific focus on front-end web programming.  If you have a mastery of JavaScript and deep experience with modern front-end frameworks such as Backbone, Ember, AngularJS, etc. this is the perfect opportunity for you!

Two major applications make up the bulk of the Strategyzer.com platform: Learn and Build.  Learn is our custom-built online learning platform and Build is our cloud-based collaborative business model and value proposition canvas sketching tool.  We also offer online companion tools to complement our international bestseller "Value Proposition Design".   The applications themselves are written in Ruby on Rails, but due to the highly interactive nature of the software, much of the programming complexity happens on the front end.  Our application's codebase consists of 40% Ruby, 40% CoffeeScript, and 20% Javascript. The Ruby/Rails component serves as an API feeding data upstream to Backbone client-side.

item.title: Exploitatiespecialist PaaS at Rijksoverheid (Apeldoorn, Netherlands)
item.description:
Exploitatiespecialist PaaS


Belastingdienst



Functieomschrijving


Heb jij een paar goede handen?



Niemand zal het een prettig idee vinden dat zijn of haar fiscale gegevens worden opgeslagen in een commerciële omgeving. In het IPAS/JHOP team bij het Centrum voor Infrastructuur en Exploitatie (B/CIE) zijn we bezig met het opzetten van een cloudomgeving voor De Belastingdienst en voor eventuele andere Rijksonderdelen. De services binnen deze cloudomgeving die we leveren zijn er in verschillende smaken. Bij Ipas/Jhop leveren wij een PaaS omgeving (Platform as a Service). Het team is georganiseerd in devops. Er vindt zowel development als operations werk plaats.



De functie die we voor je hebben is een puur operationele. Je gaat je bezighouden met de exploitatie en het beheer van Java hosting op de IPAS en de IPAS zelf. Daar ligt ook je hart. Je gaat je ook bezighouden met het deployen van patterns en applicaties en je adviseert aan je opdrachtgevers en in de derde lijn aan gebruikers. Monitoren en het voorkomen van incidenten is en belangrijk deel van je werk. Oplossen van incidenten wordt ook onderdeel van het werk. Je wordt bij ons intern opgeleid VOOR het pure applications team. Je bent een stevige vrouw of man die niet verwacht dat er de hele dag iemand klaarstaat om je te vertellen wat je moet doen. Het is geen 9 tot 5 job en standby staan maakt op den duur deel uit van de functie.



Het Nederland van nu zoekt ICT’ers. Bij de Rijksoverheid werk je als ICT-specialist aan belangrijke thema’s zoals privacy, security en cybercrime. Ook draag je bij aan ontwikkelingen in big data, cloud-oplossingen en bring your own device. Zo werk je mee aan het Nederland van nu en de toekomst.

item.title: IOS Developer at ICT Automatisering (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
iOS Developer: Creative mind in app development
Eindhoven, The Netherlands, 32-40 hours/week

The job
The mobile app development team is a relatively new group within ICT, consisting of an international group of colleagues, English is the team language. As we are looking to grow the opportunities within mobile development, we now have a position as senior iOS developer available. However, we are not just looking for a developer, we are looking for a creative thinker who has the ability to work on Proof of Concepts, communicate with our clients at a business level and inspire the team.

Our main focus areas are Smart Manufacturing, Smart Energy and Global Health. The biggest challenge the app team faces whilst building their apps is the human interaction with data and smart machine control. To develop the best interfaces, you have to be able to get into the user’s mind. This ability is something we are really hoping to find in our new iOS developer!

item.title: Full-Stack Web Developer at Stack Exchange (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Come help us create the future of Stack Overflow and Stack Overflow Careers. We're looking for passionate, creative developers who are excited about solving new problems. As a full-stack developer, you'll work with everything from front-end HTML, CSS and JS to server-side C# and several different data stores including MSSQL Server, Redis, and Elasticsearch. We don't expect you to know everything coming in, so we'll pair you with mentors who will help you grow and develop your skills.


We want to hire the right person wherever you are in the world. If you’re in New York or interested in relocating to our office, you’ll enjoy some amazing amenities like private offices and in-house chefs. If not, we’ll help you create your dream office at home, wherever that might be.

item.title: Backend Developer, Open Source at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com is looking for Software Developers who are passionate about their craft, who thrive on challenge and who believe in success through collaboration – people who would complement our existing team of developers!


We offer an international, result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, Booking is the place to B!


B.responsible


Our technical culture derives strongly from our strong ties to the Perl community. We appreciate what open source means both for our business and also for internal projects. Some of our most useful hacks inside the company have come from someone scratching the proverbial itch.


Even if you do not have Perl experience, your colleagues will help you get up to speed in order to be able to start solving real problems from day one. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team. Our development strategy is agile and we work in small Scrum teams of 5-7. We do several rollouts every day, are data-driven and do extensive A/B testing.


As a Software Developer, you are responsible for the development, performance, and scaling of our public website as well as internal systems, which includes using: Perl (5.14), DBI, Mason, Moose, Sereal, Plack, nginx, Javascript, MySQL, Memcached, Redis, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, git, and CentOS Linux.


Important aspects of the job include:



  • Rapidly develop next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance systems.

  • Solve issues with the site and internal systems, prioritizing based on customer impact

  • Act as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences

  • Collaborate with the team, Team Leaders and Product Owners to prioritize projects


B.offered


We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT also has monthly hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.


This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
Senior Software Developer


CRITEO is looking to recruit senior software developers who turn it up to eleven for its headquarters in Paris, France.


Your mission:


Build systems that make the best decision in 50ms, half a million times per second. Across three continents and six datacenters, 24/7.


Find the signal hidden in tens of TB of data, in one hour, using over a thousand nodes on our Hadoop cluster. And constantly keep getting better at it while measuring the impact on our business.


Get stuff done. A problem partially solved today is better than a perfect solution next year. Have an idea during the night ? Code it in the morning, push it at noon, test it in the afternoon and deploy it the next morning.


High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company. But if a single bug goes through, the Internet goes down (we’re only half joking).


Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Experienced software developer in the field of Sustainable Energy Solutions at The Sustainables (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Experienced software developer


We are looking for a smart and driven software developer to strengthen our team to build the best photo-measurement tools and platforms in the industry. The tools and platforms we develop are used for the remote analysis of houses in order to accelerate the transition to sustainable energy.  


A few examples of our systems currently in use are:



  • Solar Remote Quote: an application used by solar panel installers to measure tilted roofs, design a solar system and create a detailed quote in less than 5 minutes.

  • Wall insulation Remote Quote: An application used to generate automated wall insulation quotes, by auto recognition of windows and remote surface measurement.

  • An application enabling home owners to create a detailed paintwork quote by taking smart-phone pictures only, supported by our database learning engine and photo auto recognition.


With the use of for example 3D laser scanning imagery (LIDAR) and advanced photo measurement techniques we are always looking at ways to enhance the accuracy and user friendliness of our tools and platforms.


We offer:



  • A lot of responsibility within the R&D team to make the difference by deploying your knowledge to make sustainable energy solutions available to the general public;

  • High pace, short cycle developments, directly result driven;

  • Interesting imaging and big data set challenges;

  • A lot of flexibility and freedom of choice in the use of tooling;

  • Flexible start and finish times, or partially working from home;

  • An informal environment and motivated colleagues.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Digital innovation at Sainsbury’s has never been stronger. We’re leading the way for the retail industry, building world-class apps and services from our centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry. And our ambition knows no bounds. That’s why we’re recruiting and developing some of the most talented colleagues around – and you’re next on our list.



We’re looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to work across both production and non-production environments, tirelessly delivering and supporting changes to our systems and business applications. It’s about driving the pace of change forward whilst maintaining the integrity of our services and, ultimately, increasing the value of our business.



As a Senior DevOps Engineer you’ll:




  • Offer inspirational coaching and mentorship to up to four DevOps engineers

  • Implement DevOps technologies and processes, e.g.: containerisation, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, metrics, monitoring, etc.

  • Automate wherever possible whilst always knowing how far is ‘too far’

  • Act as subject expert on at least one of the team’s applications

  • Work collaboratively with all delivery teams to transition changes into production

  • Track system and service performance to make sure we’re meeting SLAs

  • Be part of the on-call and out-of-hours rota when necessary

item.title: UX Designer (m/f) - Rocket Internet at Rocket Internet SE (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description: As a UX designer, you will tackle complex web and mobile ecosystems and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs across many ventures. As part of our agile team of designers you will work in close collaboration with Product Management, Engineering, Research and Marketing in a fast-paced, highly-dynamic environment to create the most beautiful, relevant, and user-friendly products in the world.

item.title: Software Engineer at Maritima Dominicana (Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic)
item.description:
Maritima Dominicana is expanding quickly. We aim to provide a seamless experience for our clients and hope to serve as a bridge between the Dominican Republic and the world. We are looking for people who can work the full stack, though they prefer to focus on the user interface and experience of the app. You want people to sit in front of the app you build and understand what it is meant to do. 


All levels of experience are welcome. The degree to which you might do more or less of something would depend on this.


With that said, this is what your job will most likely look like.


Immediate needs:



  • Refactor and repackage our systems that are currently using Non-SQL databases that are inaccessible with C# and .NET.

  • At our current pace we will be done Q1 2016. We are looking to finish sooner.


What you will be assigned at first:



  • Fix something from our list of faulty UIs. Good JS chops are prized.

  • Jump onto one of our 24 applications and implement pending changes.


On-going responsibilities and longer-term projects:



  • Prepare for our 8:30 stand-ups. We do Scrumban.

  • Maintain a personal Kanban board for work assigned.

  • Ensure that the project Kanban board stays updated.

  • Packaging of our internal libraries into reusable components.

  • Lead Friday learning sessions. We know you will be learning on the job. Are you ready to teach?

  • Accommodate ongoing client-requests for integrations. We try to make the experience as seamless for our clients.

  • Forming part of our Support Center rotation. Everyone who can program helps out at the support desk. This is our way of keeping our department in sync with our business.

  • Suggest ideas and improve our systems as you see fit. If an idea is easy to build, please improve the system as soon as possible. We have a lot of warts!


You can reply to the ad or email gtk@mardom.com.

item.title: Tech Lead API Driven Web Applications at M&S Digital (London, UK)
item.description:
About the Team:


We’re a multi disciplined team working to build a high volume API driven site. We provide APIs for mobile and the web, and an customer facing section of marksandspencer.com.


We deliver using agile practices, and seek to be a model for best practices for M&S development.


Our back end tech stack is Spring Boot & Java 8 running on AWS with Cloud Formation for infrastructure provisioning. On the front end we’re building with Angular and Scss, supporting mobile web with responsive stylesheets. We also use some Ruby/Sinatra applications for monitoring.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Web at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Sr. Software Engineer to help build out TubeMogul's next generation of elegant and responsive web interfaces. The role will require hands-on experience across the stack- from MySQL query optimization to cross-browser responsive HTML/CSS.

Candidates will be familiar with the technologies we are using but may have not necessarily had the ability to work on them in their current job setting.  That's generally OK.  However, you should have true passion for technology that is apparent through your previous work experience.  Further, the best candidates are excellent team players, as one of the benefits of working at TubeMogul is coming to work with people you can rely on. 


Responsibilities: 



  • Collaborate closely with product managers and designers to produce extraordinary user experiences

  • Design and code in PHP, JavaScript, and HTML/CSS

  • Ship new features and bug fixes every week

  • Optimize UI performance and responsiveness

  • Pro-actively look to retain TubeMogul’s edge as a world-class product

item.title: Producer at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The Opportunity


As a producer you will be instrumental in supporting the development team in achieving excellence in terms of delivering software. You will help facilitate the lean development process, track progress against Key Performance Indicators and will help organize and support planning and other daily activities as the team requires. You will be expected to showcase your excellent organisational, problem solving and analytic skills.


What we are looking for



  • You have 4-5 years of Software Project Management or Software Product Management experience, ideally in an e-commerce company

  • You have sound knowledge and experience of managing and supporting software development using industry standard agile project management methodologies

  • You have effectively managed features and requirements documents, project management documents and team roadmaps.  You are able to bring a team together to craft a joined up plan, you understand risk mitigation and dependency management.

  • Activities such as Backlog grooming, Task Prioritization, Roadmap Management, Daily Standups, User stories, Jira, Product/Feature Mockups and Processes diagrams are in your DNA

  • You have strong communication skills and actively drive projects, breaking down complex problems into manageable, structured work packages. You effectively manage stakeholders and third party expectations and undertake periodic, appropriate reporting

  • You have drive and are you motivativated to get things done.  You lead by example, you talk data, you facilitate, you resolve, you negotiate and get things done

  • You thrive in an international environment and are fluent in verbal and written English 


Your Responsibilities



  • You will be the organizational engine of your team, responsible for managing product releases and executing the end-to-end integration plan

  • Your main focus will be on non-core-engineering tasks to enable successful end-to-end delivery and operation.  You will be expected to manage your team’s external project dependencies, external deliverables and roadmaps

  • You will refine requirements from Business KPIs, features and user stories

  • Your special focus will be on ensuring all end-to-end delivery tasks are completed for a successful product release

  • You will be part of an engineering team and you will play  key role in facilitating the team to take them forward. On a day-to-day basis, you will work very closely with the team and will facilitate taking decisions as a unit


What you can expect from us



  • Autonomy and trust to deliver using agile techniques in an entrepreneurial environment

  • A career development path developed jointly with you with potential for developing breadth and depth in skill set

  • A unique corporate culture where results are what matters, all within a relaxed office environment

  • A highly motivated international team of colleagues who will both inspire and support you


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Manjuri Sinha at jobs@zalando.de

item.title: DevOps Manager at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
There’s no retail business more embedded in the digital world than Sainsbury’s. Our centres of excellence in London and just outside Coventry are leading the charge in crafting world-class apps and services. The team here is one of the most ambitious and talented around and we’re now looking for a DevOps Manager who can bring real credibility and leadership to it.


Revolutionising the way we deliver business applications to production and non-production environments will be your focus. You’ll have a team of experts in their respective fields of DevOps to enable you to do it. So it’s about inspiring and motivating them to keep driving change at pace, whilst never compromising on the integrity of our services and their business value.


As a DevOps Manager you’ll:


• Manage your team by example, gain the confidence of stakeholders and help prioritise Product Managers’ workloads
• Design solutions using the latest technologies and methodologies continually striving to improve quality and reduce time to market.
• Lead implementation, bringing strategic savvy and impeccable standards to forge simple solutions
• Define service levels and do all you can to deliver beyond them
• Be all over emerging DevOps technologies – figuring out ways that new innovations can help our business and making sure we’re all on-board
• Take responsibility for departmental budget, meeting CAPEX and OPEX targets

item.title: Java Developer at EROAD (Auckland, New Zealand)
item.description:
Who is EROAD?


EROAD is an NZX listed technology company that provides road charging, tax, compliance and commercial services to the heavy and light commercial vehicle sectors.


EROAD has set the standard as the first GPS-based service provider to offer a government-approved electronic RUC and highway tax solution. A key to EROAD’s success is its core competency and ongoing investment in design, product development, manufacturing and operations to maintain its technical leadership and competitive advantage.


Why work at EROAD?


We have outstanding opportunities for experienced java developers who are interested in an exciting career in a fast-growing technology company.  We have a larger than average R&D division of high-performing engineers/developers working in an agile environment, across Java, web, mobile, firmware, analytics and testing. We employ only the best and we ensure our staff have the skills, training and technology to do their best work.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Cocoa/OS X at Malwarebytes (Clearwater, FL)
item.description:
Who We Need       
Our team is looking for a Senior Mac OS X Developer who loves the challenge of building products to solve the hard problems.  Specifically, the job is to extend the same great protection we provide our Windows customers to Mac users.    The ideal candidate will have solid experience creating products for the Mac and running on lots of computers.


What You’ll Get To Do



  • Design and develop anti-malware products for Mac

  • Research new ways to solve the hard problems of protecting Mac users from exploitation

  • Create automated tests

  • Work with highly talented engineers working on products and systems that protect millions of computers every day

  • Integrate your products with our cloud systems for protection, licensing, updates, telemetry, metrics

item.title: Senior Back-End Engineer at Autodesk (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Are you passionate about building, responsive and reliable cloud services? We’re a small, agile team of smart people building a new web-based platform for authoring 3D interactive experiences based on reality capture data. We support artists, museums, educators and engineers in sharing their fascinating stories.


We are looking for a highly motivated software engineer with experience in server side software development based on Node.js. You design, develop, test and deploy our back-end services based on Autodesk’s cloud services and infrastructure.  


As a global leader in 3D design, engineering, and entertainment software, Autodesk helps people imagine, design, and create a better world. Autodesk accelerates better design through an unparalleled depth of experience and a broad portfolio of software to give customers the power to solve their design, business, and environmental challenges. In addition to designers, architects, engineers, and media and entertainment professionals, Autodesk helps students, educators, and casual creators unlock their creative ideas through user-friendly applications.


Job Title and Number: Senior Back-End Engineer; 15WD18207


Location: San Francisco, CA


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement elegant, reliable and scalable cloud services

  • Integration with AWS and Autodesk cloud services and infrastructure

  • Recommend best practices around design and architecture

  • Communicate effectively and responsibly in an agile environment

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas


Qualifications



  • Experience in designing robust and scalable RESTful web services

  • Proficiency with Node.js, JavaScript and JSON/XML

  • Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases such as PostgreSQL and Cassandra

  • Solid understanding of common design patterns, distributed and even-driven programming, and testing methodologies

  • Strong problem solving skills

  • Be willing to learn, help your teammates, share your knowledge, and receive feedback

  • Flexibility to work well in a small, agile team on a wide range of tasks


Extra Points



  • Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and standard web APIs

  • Experience with Git, Python and shell scripting

  • Experience with Amazon Web Services

  • Experience with other major programming languages (C++, C#, Objective C, Java)


To apply, or for questions, please contact us directly at: imagine.design.create@autodesk.com

item.title: Software Engineer (Backend) at PlayLab Ltd. (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
We are a mobile games company based in Bangkok, Thailand.  We do everything in-house. That means we don't outsource any of our work. We focus on casual games for both IOS, Android and other platforms. 



 The role


As a software engineer on our backend team your prime responsibility is to create and support features needed in our games as well as working together with systems engineers on the team to ensure reliability and scalability of the platform.


You will get to work on technologies such as Ruby (mostly RoR), eventmachine, MySQL, Redis and Cassandra. We are however not set on these technologies and they will most likely change in the future, you will be part of figuring out which technology to bring in next.


What you would be doing:



  • Collaborate with system engineers to improve current features and bring new into production.

  • Making sure our backend is of great quality.

  • Get hands-on experience with building a scalable backend for millions of users.

  • Build a nice platform for our game developers to built great games on top of

  • Investigate and implement new technologies to improve our service.


About the backend team:


Our culture is fairly startup-y, with a flat hierarchy and lots of freedom to work on what you think is important. We try to hire smart people, and trust them to do smart things. We track player progress, store game state, handle in-app purchases, and process large amounts of analytics data, amongst other things. 


Our engineering culture also like in the startup world - we test heavily, move fast, automate everything. We do regular code reviews, and weekly tech talks to share skills.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at TransferWise (London, UK)
item.description:
Full Stack Developer



TransferWise is a VC-backed, international money transfer start-up co-founded by Skype’s first employee and backed by some of planet's most experienced innovators, including Sir Richard Branson and PayPal founder Peter Thiel, we're disrupting the world of currency & international money transfer. That means flipping a gazillion dollar industry on its head and taking power away from banks and the establishment.


We’re looking for talented full-stack coders to join our London office with solid experience with both front end and back end web technologies. Not only will you build awesome product features that contribute to user growth, retention and delight, you will also be empowered and encouraged to contribute and your own ideas.


You will collaborate with product managers, UX and design experts, data scientists and other developers to work towards one unified goal - growth. You will be joining either of the following teams:



Growth:


As part of our newly formed Growth team, you'll be involved in driving the social growth of our user base.


Product:


As part of the Product team, you'll be making sure that the user journey is as precise and delightful as it can be. You'll join a great team that is customer focussed to it’s core.

item.title: Junior Java Developer (m/f) wanted! at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for an Java developer for one of our ventures who wants to take responsibility in a powerful startup environment!

We are a team of strong IT experts that creates new startups from scratch and scale them big in europe and worldwide. In the past we successfully ramped-up a lot of startups like Toroleo, Minodes und Intellipost.




Why we are different? - 5 reasons to work in the Project A environment:


(1) We are open-minded for new technologies and we use them when it makes sense.

(2) We are 100% pragmatic. You’ll work in an agile environment with frequent architecture talks, but without eternal planning meetings.

(3) We love lean and efficient solutions and prefare Tomcats over EJB container.

(4) Our internally developed framework does the annoying tasks for us and we can focus on the really interesting issues.

(5) We belief in a strong interdisciplinary teamwork of development, business-intelligence, marketing and operations.

item.title: Senior Developer (Brno) at Kentico software (Brno, Czech Republic)
item.description:
Do you want to be part of the success story of a once-small Czech company that made it big in the software industry? We are seeking experienced senior level developers that love writing clean and highly scalable code. If you possess a thorough knowledge of the .NET framework, and just cannot get enough, and are seeking new challenges every day, enjoy working in a team using the Agile methodology to deliver a successful product, then you’re a great fit for our development department.


 The main topics we are working on in the upcoming future are:



  • Better support for MVC development

  • Geo-replication

  • Big data storage and business intelligence

  • Integration of cloud search providers

  • Integrations with best-of-breed CRM, ERP and Marketing Automation platforms (Salesforce, Dynamics, Marketo, Hubspot, …)

  • Support of ASP .NET 5

item.title: Site Reliability Team Developer at Stack Exchange (NY, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Stack Exchange is growing fast, and our infrastructure needs just keep getting bigger.  We’re looking for a developer to join our Site Reliability Engineering team of outstanding sysadmins and developers working on sites that see 3000-4000 hits per second during peak times.


At Stack Exchange we’re passionate about our technology.  We own and operate our own infrastructure, and take the time to do it right.  We like to stay on the cutting edge of technology, so you will always being working with or working towards using the latest and greatest there is.  We get all the hardware we need for redundancy and performance, and we create our own tools when needed (like our open source monitoring system).


Some projects that you will be working on:



  • Bosun and scollector - our open source monitoring system and data collection agent written in Go

  • Opserver - our open source dashboard and additional monitoring tool

  • Building systems to automate some of the SRE pain points around a mixed Windows and Linux environment including deployment, patching, inventory, and config management

  • Extend some of the open source projects we use including logstash and puppet


Technologies you’ll work with:



  • Windows 2012 and 2012 R2

  • Modern Linux distributions - we’re running CentOS 6 and 7

  • IIS, DFS, Multi-site AD, SQL Server 2012 and 2014

  • Go and C# as primary languages, plus some work in Powershell, Python, etc.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Zymeworks Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer to help improve our software infrastructure. We pride ourselves on developing useful and robust software, and would like to have a world-class development environment for our team including automated builds, continuous integration, monitoring and fault tolerance.


 As Senior DevOps Engineer, your responsibilities would include:



  • Interfacing between Software Development and Systems Administration teams 

  • Facilitating the transition of our platform from our own in-house cluster to the cloud

  • Creating and managing standardized software development environments for the Software Development team

  • Developing automated systems for deployment, monitoring and fault tolerance

  • Helping improve software deployment, monitoring and development processes taking into account systems requirements

  • Working with the systems team to provide the necessary services for the software development team

  • Laying the foundation for a strong DevOps team, and establishing a common language between developers and system team members.

  • Envisioning long term goals for our infrastructure along with the Software and Systems team leads.

item.title: Server Side Engineer at Spanning by EMC (Austin, TX)
item.description: We believe strongly that a well-designed application makes customers happy, reduces support costs, and removes the need for static documentation. We ensure that every feature is customer driven, and simple enough to explain on a single page wiki.  Rather than hire into well defined categories, we are looking for engineers that want to take ownership, deliver results, and make a difference in many different parts of our product and process evolution.

item.title: .Net Developer at EsperantoXL (Utrecht, Nederland)
item.description:
What this job’s about


Typically, our .Net developers spend their days assigned to small team working on a specific customer project (e.g. mobile platform  Railpocket for Dutch Railways) or on a generic product (e.g. routing optimization apps for DHL). Developers mostly work with Xamarin Studio for cross platform development to iOS or Android platforms.  On top of that, there are non-standard assignments from time to time to keep your thinking fresh.


How our teams operate


We breathe, eat and drink agile in general, and Scrum in particular (although there is Kanban work as well). We have certified scrum masters constantly on the lookout for improvements. Our developers are deeply involved in technical details, but we encourage them to build a good understanding of customer’s needs and business processes. It’s not uncommon to see a developer showing a customer how to make an improvement to an existing practice. We value deep technical skills and broad expertise which both contribute to a fruitful cooperation with our teams and customers.


What we offer in return



  • A competitive salary (company shares available in 2015);

  • Substantial training budget to drive your need to develop yourself;

  • Diverse assignments with a focus on tangible results;

  • Plenty of room for initiative (discuss architecture, introduce new tooling, convince others);

  • Flexible working hours (you can start working between 7.30–10.00 and working from home is possible on some days);

  • A top-notch mobility program (yes, you can get a lease car if you wish);

  • A great spacious office, with lots of sunlight and a breathtaking view over a traditional Dutch wei with the Lopik tower piercing the sky on the horizon;

  • A very active party committee, that organizes outings and team building events with alarming frequency.

item.title: Senior PHP Developer (m/f) wanted! at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced PHP developer who wants to take responsibility in a powerful startup environment!

We are a team of strong IT experts that creates new startups from scratch and scale them up in Europe and worldwide. In the past we successfully ramped-up Startups like Tirendo, nu3 and saatchiart.
Why are we different? - 5 reasons to work in the Project A environment:

(1) We are open for new technologies and we use them whenever it makes sense.

(2) We are 100% pragmatic. You will work in an agile environment with frequent architecture talks, but without eternal planning meetings.

(3) We know about the benefits of TDD, BDD and Clean Code and make use of it!

(4) We are not afraid of huge architectural challenges. For instance we developed our own e-commerce software called “Yves & Zed” (more http://goto.project-a.com/)

(5) We belief in a strong interdisciplinary teamwork among web development, business-intelligence, marketing and operations.

item.title: FIRMWARE ENGINEER at Intel Corporation (Gdask, Polska)
item.description:
The Cloud Platform Group (CPG) is seeking for a Firmware Engineer. In this position you will work on low-level programming, system architecture, operating systems, device architecture and hardware design, as well as source code development, review and maintenance (C/C++), unit and system level test and verification.
You will be working on next generations products and will have an opportunity to gain experience on best in the world server technologies that will be released to the market in few years. You will be a member of a cross-functional, cross-geo team that is very process-oriented and that delivers a world class server platforms based on Intel silicon.

Your responsibilities may include but not be limited to:
- Understand feature requirements, architecture and design.
- Firmware development (mainly in C language)
- Unit Tests development
- Firmware debugging
- Firmware integration with other server HW and SW platform components, like CPU, PCH, BIOS, OS etc.

item.title: Network Security Engineer at County of San Luis Obispo (San Luis Obispo, CA)
item.description:
County of San Luis Obispo

Network Security Engineer

Opening Date/Time: Fri. 07/24/15 12:00 AM Pacific Time
Closing Date/Time: Thu. 08/14/15 11:59 PM Pacific Time
Location: City of San Luis Obispo, California
Department: Information Technology Department

Salary:
$35.13 - $47.20 Hourly
$6,089.20 - $8,181.33 Monthly
$73,070.40 - $98,176.00 Annually

For more information go to http://apptrkr.com/650024/default.cfm

San Luis Obispo County is accepting applications for NETWORK SECURITY ENGINEER.

If you are an analytical thinker that enjoys browsing device logs with your morning coffee, this is the job for you! The County is implementing a number of exciting IT initiatives, which require staff to provide creative solutions across the County's diverse organization. We are looking for talented information technology professionals to join our team. You will be asked to lead and successfully complete technical projects as a team member and as an individual contributor.

The County of San Luis Obispo is one of largest employers on the California Central Coast. We offer a generous collection of benefits, including paid sick time, vacation and holiday pay, and defined benefit pension plan.

The Ideal Candidate:
The ideal candidate will have a strong proficiency in Cisco Internetworking, IP MPLS, Scripting, Cisco ASA Firewalls, IPS/IDS, and complex enterprise networks. You must have the ability to organize, lead, and successfully complete technical projects and be skilled at process automation and reengineering. Those individuals who embrace identifying new ways of doing things and who are not afraid to try new ideas are ideal candidates for this position.

Typical Tasks and Representative Duties:
(Not in order of importance)

• Performs a variety of activities related to the analysis, installation, programming, application and troubleshooting of networking systems and related equipment for County needs.

• Coordinates information and resources to assure proper and timely installation, maintenance, modification and repair of network systems, equipment and devices; administers, evaluates and modifies network systems to assure proper security and operation; monitors and inspects projects to assure accuracy, completeness and compliance with County technology and proper adaptation with existing systems.

• Provides technical support and assistance to network customers; participates in answering and directing questions and concerns from County personnel, departments and internal department inquiries; assists field technicians with installation, network connection and other technical issues as required.

• Performs a variety of preventive security monitoring activities; evaluates systems for unnecessary or unsafe activities and develops solutions to avoid exposures; identifies and corrects errors and performance flaws; performs regular backups of operating systems to assure adequate network information availability.

• Participates in a variety of other assigned activities such as developing and maintaining procedural manuals, flow charts and diagrams.

• Designs, implements, monitors and maintains enterprise networks using LAN/WAN inter-networking technology, including network protocols and management systems, using diagnostic tools.

• Configures, installs, operates and maintains network hardware, appliances, software and related servers.

• Works with data circuit providers to install, configure and troubleshoot circuits.

• Evaluates and recommends network hardware and related hardware and software.

Employment Standards:

Knowledge of:
• Current technological developments/trends in area of expertise
• Network systems, protocols and security
Principles, practices and methods of WAN/LAN networking including fiber-optic and copper cable systems, data circuits, routers, switches, hubs, network operating systems, network appliances, firewalls and security
• A wide range of computer and networking software and hardware systems and related technologies
• Installation, configuration and maintenance of personal computers networks and/or related hardware and software
• Computer/network systems infrastructure requirements and standards, security systems, applications, procedures and techniques
• Interpersonal skills using tact, patience and courtesy
• Oral and written communication skills
• Information Technology Department’s strategic direction and goals

Ability to:
• Perform a variety of activities related to the analysis, installation and troubleshooting of networking systems and related equipment for County needs
• Analyze and assess computer/network architecture requirements, determine optimum, cost-effective solutions and make recommendations
• Plan, develop, coordinate and support multiple projects
• Coordinate information and resources to assure proper and timely installation and maintenance activities
• Provide training, technical support and assistance to network customers
• Design, develop and implement new networks or network modifications and design solutions for network problems and malfunctions
• Perform assigned work duties in an accurate, timely and professional manner
• Understand and follow directions and attain goals
• Comprehend information and instructions concerning work duties and answer questions regarding assigned tasks
• Stay abreast of emerging and changing technologies and adapt to changing technology and constraints
• Work effectively with others including those of diverse perspectives and possess strong interpersonal skills such as listening, speaking, advisory, mediation, reconciliation and consensus building
• Maintain positive working relationships and communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, with resource managers, customers, vendors, peers, subordinates, other government agencies and the public
• Foster a spirit of teamwork and advocacy when meeting with staff and members of departments
• Maintain a safe and orderly work area

Education and Experience:
An associates degree or 60 semester units or 90 quarter units from an accredited college or university or completion from a job-related, accredited vocational institution; (Job related experience involving the analysis, installation, programming, application and/or troubleshooting of networking systems and related equipment may substitute for the required education on a year-for-year basis).

Licenses and Certificates:
A valid driver’s license is required at the time of application. A valid CALIFORNIA driver’s license is required at the time of appointment and must be maintained throughout employment. Successfully pass a thorough background investigation.

How to Apply
An initial application review will be conducted. Candidates who meet the minimum qualifications and are best qualified will be invited to participate in selection activities which may include online assessments, performance exams, written exams, and interviews.

Final candidates will be required to have an in-depth background review performed before proceeding in the process. Please note that references will not be contacted until the end of the process.

If you have questions or would like to discuss the opportunity further, please contact Human Resources at hr@co.slo.ca.us. Confidential inquiries are welcomed.

For further information regarding the County of San Luis Obispo, visit our website at http://www.slocounty.ca.gov.

Supplemental Information:
San Luis Obispo County Information Technology Department (ITD) supports the countywide technology infrastructure and approximately 2,500 users. ITD has a centralized project management team as well as software and network engineer specialists. We are looking for creative and innovative software engineers who can contribute to the County by applying their skills in business systems and software engineering. The County of San Luis Obispo offers competitive salaries, a generous pension benefit and an outstanding community for work and play.

item.title: Lead Software Developer at ThoughtWorks (Sydney, Australia)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is hunting for a passionate Lead Software Developer who cares about software excellence.

We work in a dynamic, collaborative, non-hierarchical environment where talent is valued over job title or years of experience.  We want you to develop your career outside the confines of a traditional career path.

Being a consultancy, our teams work on a huge variety of projects. You could be helping shape the digital strategy of a retail giant, building a new mobile platform for a bank, creating an app to support an awareness campaign for Indigenous Australians or helping the science community locate meteorites that have fallen to earth.  All of this whilst building quadcopters or robotic arms in your spare time.

As a Lead Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do:


  • Lead teams of software engineers

  • Be a mentor and role model to less experienced developers

  • Employ Agile development including task estimation, test automation, deployment automation and Continuous Integration to improve overall execution speed and product quality

  • Learn new technologies and help shape new offerings for our business

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you're passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan



Here's what you'll bring:


  • Development and delivery experience with Java, .NET, Ruby, Scala, Clojure or Mobile 

  • Passion for software engineering and craftsman-like coding prowess

  • Have helped lead development on large, custom-built object-oriented applications

  • Great OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge

  • Experience working with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches and best practices, such as Extreme Programming (XP)

  • Ability to work in a variety of client settings and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

  • Knowledge of software best practices, like TDD, BDD and continuous integration




We're a big believer in diversity.  We build software for a wide variety of people so we think that a wide variety of people should build our software.  We abhor and reject discrimination and inequality, and promote diversity in all its forms. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve.  As long as you're an opinionated, disruptive thinker, we'd like to hear from you.

To hear what our developers think about working at ThoughtWorks, take a look here.

In addition to all this, we have some great extra benefits including a generous training budget and one of the best parental leave packages in Australia.

If you want to get more information or apply, use the links and we will be in touch soon.

item.title: AWS Engineer at STYLIGHT (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for a talented AWS certified Engineer who understands the importance of continuous integration and deployment. Our DevOps culture means you are embedded with product teams and directly work with developers to release amazing features everyday.


Your Responsibilities



  • You streamline our deployment process to spot build problems early and allow us to ship with confidence.

  • Design and operate our AWS infrastructure.

  • You monitor our builds and coach our developers to improve automated test coverage.

  • Ensure high availability and low response times for our users.

Why join STYLIGHT?


We asked your future colleagues, here are their top responses:



  • Hands-on work after quick ramp up & openness to new solutions and improvements.

  • You are provided with moral and financial support to learn, go to conferences, do other things than your tasks.

  • International and highly motivated environment with open business culture over all departments and flat hierarchy.

  • Munich's landscape, architecture, nature, museums, and restaurants are all top notch. In terms of life quality, it has been reported to be in the top 10 of the world.

  • For more information check out: engineering.stylight.com/why/ and http://engineering.stylight.com/.


Your Team



  • We build software to improve the user experience and monetization of our website.

Up for the challenge?


Does that sound like the perfect job for you? Then don’t hesitate and apply here! We're looking forward to receiving your complete application! Your contact person: Sandra Jasarevic

We do culture differently, too. You will quickly see how we approach our business, as we believe our team should work smart, and play harder.
