item.title: Software Engineer (Pivotal Labs - Palo Alto, CA) at Pivotal Labs (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Pivotal Labs: We Transform Ideas into Software.


As a recognized leader in highly disciplined agile software development practices, Pivotal Labs has been building high reliability software for over 20 years. We build consumer and enterprise web and mobile applications for global clients, and have a growing practice building applications for the iOS and Android platforms. We also developed Pivotal Tracker, the project management and collaboration tool used by thousands of software developers worldwide.


We Can Go Fast Forever. 


We pair program, all day, every day because we know it delivers remarkable results. We practice and teach an approach to software engineering that applies across industries and organizations, so you’ll experience all types of teams, products, and technologies. And we believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge and refocus.


We Court Perfection.


Working at Pivotal means you get better at what you already do well. We set up regular retrospectives to figure out what we’re doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we’re doing right so we can improve on it. We consistently practice Test Driven Development, which results in high-quality, reliable and more maintainable code. And we believe that methodical, steady, relentless forward momentum drives consistent results.


Get Breakfast Everyday. And Get Paid to Master The Latest Technologies.


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks are available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded Pivots who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers on beer night.

item.title: Android Software Development Engineer in Test at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Job Summary: 


We are looking for an Android SDET who is passionate about testing and writing tests for our native Android application. The ideal candidate will be someone who is detail oriented, passionate about learning and using new technologies and has the capacity to quickly grasp the inner workings of the software that they are testing. We are looking for QA people who have the experience and passion to release a high quality product that will positively impact the lives of our members around the globe.


Testing culture at eHarmony:



  • Here at eHarmony, testers are developers who are perfectionists and have an ingrained drive to ensure that every piece of code meets the highest standards of quality.

  • We have adopted Scrum as our agile development methodology. Software engineers in Test are expected to be active participants of the sprint planning process.

  • Developers and testers are expected to work together and even pair program. Testers are expected to work with developers to identify performance problems early in the QA cycle to ensure that the software that is shipped is not just defect free but also performs under load.

  • Lastly, we strongly believe that good testing practices will ensure that we are agile, not just in terms of processes but also in terms of delivering features.



Key Responsibilities:



  • Take ownership of manual and automated testing efforts for Android native app

  • Collaborate with SDET’s in the design, development and maintenance of the android automation testing frameworks

  • Proactive in identifying and providing solutions for deficiencies and gaps in manual and automation test coverage.

  • Improve app quality by pairing with developers to understand code changes and the impact to existing regression areas.

  • Participate in the Scrum planning sessions. Analyze the requirements and help with defining the acceptance criteria for the features that are being developed.

  • Work closely with the Product team to understand their expectations of how a feature would function.

  • Work with management to create and provide metrics and KPI’s around performance and automation testing.

  • Maintain and deploy builds to the QA environment.

  • Work with the Operations team to debug acceptance-testing failures that are related to the testing environment.

  • Actively participate in code reviews conducted by the developers.

  • Analyze post-release metrics to identify any escape defects and provide quick resolution by writing tests that expose the release defect before any code fix is release.

  • Evaluate existing testing methodologies and suggest new techniques that will help us deliver high-quality features faster.

  • Improve and maintain test plan for automated, functional, regression, acceptance and performance testing.

  • Maintain a solid understanding of QA workflows, automation best practices, and agile methodologies.

  • Maintain proficiency with eHarmony technology stack including use of systems, tools, and processes within the Technology department.

  • Mentor junior members of the team and provide training, support and best practices.

  • Manage test device platform, including upgrades and device purchasing.

item.title: C++ Developer voor het high Potential start-up project REPRO/MultiDAM. at CWI (Amsterdam, Nederland)
item.description:
Over MultiDAM


REPRO/MultiDAM heeft de ambitie dat alle ambulances altijd op het juiste moment op de juiste locatie aanwezig zijn. De reden is simpel. In levensbedreigende noodsituaties waar iedere seconde telt, is het een enorme uitdaging voor ambulancedienstverleners om binnen enkele minuten op de plaats van bestemming te arriveren en direct te beginnen met het verlenen van de eerste hulp. In Nederland wordt gewerkt met een richtlijn dat 95% van alle levensbedreigende noodsituaties binnen 15 minuten worden bereikt door een ambulance. In de praktijk blijkt dat deze doelstelling structureel niet wordt gehaald door het merendeel van de ambulance dienstverleners. In 7% van de ruim 500.000 levensbedreigende noodritten wordt de aanrijtijd overschreden, wat als gevolg heeft dat in 35.000 gevallen de ambulance te laat arriveert.


Ons concept is een software-oplossing die ervoor zorgt dat de reactietijd van ambulances verkort kan worden door middel van verschillende Dynamisch Ambulance Management (DAM) algoritmen die ontwikkeld worden door CWI. De gemeenschappelijke deler van deze algoritmen is dat we proactief ambulances binnen hun regio gaan verplaatsen zodat we altijd de optimale dekking van het gebied realiseren.


Wat kunnen meldkamers en de ambulancedienstverleners bereiken met REPRO/MultiDAM:



  • vermindering van de tijd die besteed wordt aan logistieke besluitvorming door de centralist;

  • verhoging van de beschikbare tijd voor medische ondersteuning door de centralist;

  • elimineren van irrationele menselijke besluitvorming op de inzet van ambulances;

  • reductie van de rijtijdoverschrijding;

  • gerichte lokale verbetering van de prestaties van bijvoorbeeld 80% naar 85% voor een specifiek postcode gebied;

  • een reductie van de kosten door efficiëntere distributie van ambulances;

  • optimaliseren van standplaatslocaties om kosten te reduceren.



Voor de juiste persoon is dit de ideale kans om ervaring op te doen bij een startend bedrijf en onderdeel uitmaken van een ondernemend team. Wij bieden je een uitdagende functie aan in een dynamisch start-up met een no-nonsense mentaliteit, waar flexibiliteit, teamwork en een informele sfeer belangrijke uitgangspunten zijn.


Je werkt zowel op CWI in Amsterdam als op locatie in de gemeenschappelijke meldkamer van Politie, Brandweer en Ambulance in Lelystad. Je werkt op het snijvlak van techniek, wiskunde en klantcontact. Je zorgt ervoor dat onze oplossing naar een hoger plan wordt getild en helpt hierbij meer ambulances tijdig bij de patiënt te laten zijn. In levensbedreigende noodsituaties telt namelijk iedere seconde.


In dit project zul je intensief samenwerken met onderzoekers van CWI, de ambulancemeldkamer van de Flevoland, onze toekomstige klanten en onze partner NLC (www.nlc.nl).


Als programmeur ben je grotendeels bezig met het verbeteren en ontwikkelen van onze realtime DAM-software. Je bent een belangrijke brug tussen onze gebruikers op locatie en onze software ontwikkeling. Je luistert naar de problemen die de gebruikers ondervinden en vertaalt deze naar de technische vraag of een software-probleem. Je gebruikt je creatief probleemoplossend vermogen en technische expertise om onze organisatie te ondersteunen daar waar diepgaande technische kennis nodig is. Je bedenkt nieuwe mogelijkheden om problemen te verhelpen, waardoor REPRO/MultiDAM zich ook op het gebied van dienstverlening zal gaan onderscheiden in deze internationale nichemarkt. Je denkt actief mee over de invulling van projecten en doet suggesties voor bestaande en nieuwe functionaliteiten. Je bent in staat om de problemen die je tegenkomt in de software te verwerken.

item.title: We Need C#, iOS, Android and Windows Phone Developers! at Milestone Systems (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
- To our new Custom Development team in Bulgaria


We need Software Developers to staff a new team and help us with the numerous projects in our pipeline. Working in Custom Development will bring you closer to the customer. You are the best among your breed


We need a raft of skills, and the combinations of how to build this team are endless. Our primary demand is you being the best within your field with 4+ years of work experience with one of the following platforms: 



  • C#

  • iOS

  • Android

  • Windows Phone


However, we very much like to see you having knowledge of - and interest in working with one or more of the other platforms. Your understanding of the principles of OOD is clear and you have solid experience with multithreading. You have an educational background in Computer Science or Software Engineering and are fluent in spoken and written English.


We look for bright people that are always eager to expand their horizon and desire to share their knowledge. You take ownership and drive assignment all way. You are adaptable to changes and like new challenges including changing assignments in short iterations. Finally, you have a kick-ass attitude and will to confront any challenges standing between you and building great solutions.


Career and perks


Milestone Systems is a great place for you to continue your career. We have a career model that supports your development, and the perks are numerous:



  • Individual career path – technical and leadership growth, enhanced by learning and development program (Milestone Leadership Academy for people managers), regular 1:1 follow-ups with your manager and one visit to the headquarters in Denmark as part of your onboarding program

  • Multicultural environment with IT professionals from a wide range of countries in a high-tech organization

The future is up to you


Take your technical skills to the next level and become part of a fast growing high-tech company. Apply now by submitting your CV in English.


As it is important to us to maintain our high quality software and our position as #1 in the VMS market, we only want the best-in-class engineers. Our interview process consists of several interviews with different colleagues that will take you through various technical assignments. This will give us an impression of how you work in practice. In addition, it will allow you to discover the chemistry with future colleagues and extensive insight of our company through multiple angles.


Interviews will be held in the week of September 7 – 11.


For more information, you can contact Paolo Blem, Director of Custom Development at +45 28 350 353, or visit our website: www.milestonesys.com.


The future is up to you!

item.title: Cloud Developer at Cloudreach Europe Limited (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Cloudreach’s Cloud Developers work with challenging, but very cool and leading edge, technical solutions for industry leading clients including well known global brands.  We love all things cloud related and believe passionately in the innovation it can drive.


We’re Europe’s only top-tier partner for both Amazon Web Services and Google - two giants of the cloud computing industry.  We are looking for a Cloud Developer who is capable of delivering awesomeness to our incredible client base.


Don’t worry about prior “cloud” experience, what we want are smart, friendly developers.


Not if. When will you join the best Cloud team in the industry?


What we are looking for?


Cloudreach is looking for a capable developer who has a passion for DevOps relevant experience and is keen to grow, and share, their technical skills in a fast growing company.  If you are curious about the Cloud and have possibly dabbled with AWS and Google Apps we want to speak to you.  We subscribe to the concept of "DevOps", where we use development skills in the operational environment in order to increase service quality.


We have been fortunate enough to work with a wide variety of technologies to facilitate the delivery of operational services to our customer.  Now we need to pick things up a gear by developing a bespoke platform unique to our team, integrating disparate sources of information into a unified platform that can be used as a foundation for further automation of operations tasks.  This will allow our core operations team to focus on solving the unique and interesting problems that crop up, as well as working with you to define and implement new features as they are required.


You will be working with the following cool technologies (and more):




  • Amazon Web Services cloud, Google Apps and Salesforce




  • Linux / Open Source including Apache, MySQL, Varnish, Nginx plus others




  • Splunk, Chef and Ruby




How will you spend your time here at Cloudreach?  As a Cloud Developer you will be a key member of our Platform Engineering team and will help drive the development of our bespoke and unique cloud management platform:




  • Establish and maintain our Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery platform




  • Work with key stakeholders from other areas of the business to design and document core functionality such as an API layer, a variety of backend task processing application, a frontend UI to allow our Operations engineers to leverage the new features as they are added




  • Actively mentor and develop software development skill across the team in a DevOps environment.




  • Providing 3nd level support to resolve incidents and problems related to our cloud management platform

For more information, please contact Engineering Manager, Brian Salling at +45 25 606 730, or visit our website: www.milestonesys.com.


The future is up to you!

item.title: UI/UX Team Lead with Razor-sharp eye with clean design at Axxess (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Are you experienced in designing and building web and mobile solutions with a simple, clean and clever design?  Are you a compelling visual communicator with razor-sharp eye for superb aesthetics?  Are you seeking an opportunity to lead a team of engineers, while building products that make a difference?  If so, this might be the role for you.


Axxess is looking for an exceptional UI/UX Team Lead to be focused on building amazing user experiences for our customers through creative solutions in mobile (iOS, Android and all other platforms), responsive web development, and new emerging technologies. This role will collaborate with a dynamic multi-disciplinary team of designers and developers relentlessly working to create outstanding user experiences.  You will be part of a team truly seeking to set apart the Axxess brand, creating amazing experiences to engage our customers across all our properties.


Axxess is a technology company that provides software for health organizations to efficiently run their business. Axxess empowers health care companies with easy to use, cloud based software that integrates all aspects of their operations so they improve patient outcomes while growing their business. 


Why Axxess?


It’s simple.  We do business differently, by empowering you to build the technology to create mind-blowing, first-to-market, superior products - leading healthcare into the future. We build the best because we only hire the best.


We do culture differently, too. You will quickly see how we approach our business, as we believe our team should work smart, and play harder.  


We are an open, agile environment, where transparent conversation ignites collaboration with a team of great thinkers.  Everyone freely contributes, ideas override egos, and the best idea always wins.  We embrace new technologies and pride ourselves on sustainable and quality code.  In our world, opportunity paired with imagination is limitless and we build what others can only hope to dream.  We’ve created an atmosphere allowing you to produce your best work, by catering to the creative.  Collaborate in a space designed to inspire the sharing of ideas on whiteboards; chill by yourself in the lounge or play a game of Madden or pool.


We are deliberate about our environment; we’ve built it to inspire creativity, where we are excited to come every day to pour our passion into our products.    We Dream. We Build. We Empower.

item.title: Sr Software Developer at SPIRIT Global Energy Solutions (Frederick, CO)
item.description:
Position Summary:


Accountable for Real Time software design and develop of innovative automation technology used for artificial lift of oil production.  Responsible for new product software engineering throughout the product development life (idea-to launch) and sustaining engineering.  Researches, designs, and develops computer software systems, in conjunction with hardware product development.  The position reports to the Automation Engineering Director who is based in Frederick (Denver), CO. This is a senior level role where the candidate will define and continuously improve software engineering processes, practices and architectures used by the company.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following.  Other duties may be assigned. 



  • Reviews and validates system software requirements to determine feasibility of design constraints.

  • Architects, designs, develops, and updates functionality for embedded automation software, systems, and sub-systems.

  • Evaluates hardware and software interfaces and system requirements working in a multidisciplinary team.

  • Develops and directs software system testing procedures to verify software functional requirements.

  • Coordinates installation of software system.

  • Consults with customers concerning maintenance of software systems.

  • Identifies, evaluates, and develops tools and processes necessary to meet engineering, project and business goals.

  • Provides timely communications on significant issues or developments.

  • Maintaining a focus on safety, quality and reliability.

  • Conducts problem root cause investigations and determines proper resolution.

  • Leads and participates actively in software design and code reviews.

  • Develops software verification strategies and test procedures to verify software functional requirements.

  • Practices and promotes modern software development methodologies.

  • Reviews and continuously improves processes used in software engineering.

  • Guides and mentors team-members on design, debugging, coding and testing standards.

item.title: SENIOR PHP DEVELOPER (m/f) join at early stage at Seven Senders GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Are you bored of developing the backend of the next random e-commerce startup?
Are you tired of taking on another developer’s work?
Instead, you want to work on something fresh and new? Come and work with us.


THE DEAL



  • Build a highly scalable product that will be used by millions of customers on a daily basis

  • Work together with one of the best software IT-team in Berlin and improve your skills

  • Gain a competitive salary plus stock options at an early stage

  • Work in an exciting full-time position in an experienced and passionate team


WHO WE ARE
We are Seven Senders GmbH. Our product revolutionizes cross-border e-commerce in Europe. We enable online shops to ship to customers abroad 30% cheaper and twice as fast. Our ‘rock star’ backend framework and various APIs serve as technical enablers, a beautiful frontend is our face to the customer. The development started 6 months ago and there is plenty of stuff that needs to be done.
Have fun, earn money, join us now!


WHY WE NEED YOU
We know what our customers want: cheap, fast and flexible deliveries and highly responsive and smooth interfaces. Our core tech stack includes PHP (Symfony2, Phalcon frameworks), MySQL, Memcached, Chef, AWS. Does our IT stack sound familiar to you? Then come on board and exploit your complementary skillset to design and develop the information flow that is necessary to create and track hundred thousands of shipments across Europe. You implement quick and robust solutions (MVP) at first and you will later transfer them into highly scalable and efficient solutions.

item.title: C++ Developer (Market Links) at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Do you love programming in C++? Are you up to the challenge of writing software that not only guarantees reliability, safety and compliance to legal and functional requirements but also performs better than all of your competitors? Do you want to work in a fast paced environment among highly skilled colleagues where technology and creativity combine to deliver innovative solutions? If you can complement this with at least 5 years of experience working with C++, you might be the C++ Developer (Market Links) we are looking for.

IT at Optiver
Since trading on the floor changed to screen-based trading, we constantly need the most advanced technology, trading software and connections to the market. In short, we need the best IT-professionals to develop, optimise and support our systems and tools. The atmosphere we are working in is fast, but exciting. This makes IT at Optiver a great challenge whereby expertise, innovation and fun go hand in hand every day.

What you'll do
As a C++ Developer (Market Links) you will be responsible for developing low-latency connectivity software to many different trading platforms. The software connecting with exchanges needs to be fast, reliable and must meet all requirements. You will work together with other development teams, traders and external parties to design and implement robust server-side solutions in C++ to be deployed on a Linux platform. You will be surrounded by talented, committed developers and you will be provided with the opportunity to explore your ideas and create your own projects. Handling continuous change and diverse challenges with creativity and vision is key.

item.title: Lead Mobile App Developer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Lead Mobile App Developer at Coolblue you make sure our first (and to be built) mobile app enters the most downloaded charts in the app stores.


What you tell your friends you do
'I make sure Coolblue is under your thumb and in your pocket.' 


What you will really be doing



  • You will be responsible for the App category for Coolblue. Sweeeeet. 

  • Evangelise and spread your Apps mentality to your colleagues.

  • The popular apps you and your team develop will change the shopping experience of our customers. 

  • Within iOS and/or Android you will first focus on the what and second on the how. 


How will you be doing this?



  • Manage and build the Mobile team for Coolblue, currently existing of two people and growing.

  • You also code. 

  • The team is multidisciplinary and Scrum is part of our soul. You prioritize work together with your team and product owner. 

  • You will receive immediate feedback from end-users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment. There is always a budget for good ideas. 

  • You use the right tool for the job, if it's Android Studio, Gradle, Github, Xcode, Instruments, it does not matter what you use, as long as it gets the job done. Boom. 


What we have worked on last quarter



  • The first mobile app for Coolblue. It is still a secret, you will find it out soon. Both iOS and Android will be released. 

  • Write reusable classes in Swift. Still work in progress though. 

  • Testing. 


What a day in the office might look like
Today is the big day. The final sprint before launch of the first Coolblue app ever is finalized and the app is now ready for demo. Hard work, but fun too. The weeks leading up to the launch have been hectic. The app is practically done. You and your team have worked hard to get it done. A lot of details and footwork to sort out. But now it's finally out there. You take a deep breath, knowing you've produced a good basis for this project. Time to show it to the company. Let the demo begin!

item.title: VP of Software Engineering, Centro Direct at Centro (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
ABOUT THE PRODUCT AND ENGINEERING TEAM


At Centro, we’ve always been about making people’s lives better—from our employees to our clients. Today, we’re building a unified platform to execute every digital media advertising transaction, thus providing a new level of automation and intelligence in ad tech. This is an enormous task that will disrupt an industry and improve the lives of those who work within it.

To do this, we’re aggressively growing our team of engineers, product developers and designers. We are imaginative, passionate, determined and relentless in our efforts. Of course, we are fascinated by the complexity of engineering problems at this scale—it’s what brings bright minds together. But what keeps us coming back (and why we love coming to work everyday) is the chance to improve how work gets done: freeing up people’s time so that they can dream bigger and make life better.

Come build something amazing with us.


ABOUT THE ROLE


We are looking for a software engineering leader to head our Chicago development group and take responsibility for a group of directors, managers and engineers to build our flagship product, Centro Direct. This is a senior leadership role focused on scaling the organization and practices and delivering best-in-class functionality and usability, with high quality, at a competitive velocity, managing through engineering manager direct reports and driving agile product delivery across multiple teams. The group includes teams that are responsible for both front-end and backend components for our 24x7 SaaS service and partners closely with product management This role is responsible for guiding architecture and driving to high availability across all services.

item.title: Software Architect at Itility (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
item.description:
Ben je geïnteresseerd in de nieuwste software technologieën? Is het met jouw team gestructureerd ontwikkelen van technische software oplossingen binnen internationale en landelijk opererende enterprises jouw ding, dan biedt Itility je die mogelijkheid in de functie van


Software Architect


Wat ga je doen?
Je stelt software architecturen op voor het aansturen van complexe IT infrastructuren of andere “things”, je werkt deze uit in een eerste set user stories. Je begeleidt je scrumteams in het implementeren van de oplossingen voor diverse enterprises. Je werkt mee aan de binnen Itility ontwikkelde architectuur, breidt deze verder uit en geeft richting aan de binnen Itility ontwikkelde software artefacten. Je ontwikkelt nieuwe concepten in de door jezelf georganiseerde deepdives waarin de Itility software ontwikkelaars deelnemen. Je bent een echte teamplayer, je team bestaat uit gedreven en creatieve specialisten, die resultaatgerichte Itility projecten uitvoeren bij klanten of op locatie bij Itility. 


Wil je onderdeel zijn van een internationale community van IT specialisten en jouw carrière naar een hoger plan tillen? Als SW Architect zijn dit jouw activiteiten:



  • opstellen van roadmaps van de te creëren applicaties bij de Itility klanten;

  • opstellen software architecturen, deze uitwerken in software artefacten;

  • begeleiden van implementatie teams;

  • meewerken aan Itility SW portfolio;

  • onderzoek doen naar nieuwe software technologieën, deze vertalen naar toepassingen voor Itility.


Dit is ons aanbod
Je krijgt de kans om je in een inspirerende omgeving optimaal te ontwikkelen, onder de persoonlijke begeleiding van een Senior Architect of Programmamanager. 


Bij Itility investeren we in elkaar. Behalve een prima salaris krijg je bij Itility veel extra's, zoals: 



  • opleiding aan de 2-jarige Itility Academy en externe trainingen op maat;

  • aanvullende variabele beloning op basis van geleverde prestaties;

  • 26 verlofdagen;

  • onkostenvergoeding;

  • auto, laptop en smartphone.


Locatie
Eindhoven tot Randstad

item.title: Technical Project Manager at American Express (New York, NY)
item.description:
American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

Technical Project Managers that join our Technologies team can be assigned to one of several exciting teams that are developing new virtual, Internet-based payment solutions, customer service portals, online merchant services support and integration, credit management tools, and suites of web-based applications for cardmember targeted offers that will span over 20 international markets.

You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world class cardmember experiences across multiple channels, including native iOS, Android, web, social integration, Java services, and APIs. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Drives integrated teams to deliver technology solutions in support of key product initiatives by working closely with product owners, architects, engineers, and quality assurance

  • Works within and across business units to prioritize, plan, and execute the development schedule for major product releases

  • Manages and tracks team velocity, financials, and other KPIs in relation to the plan and published progress reports

  • Assigns development resources to activities, and monitors performance across resource channels

  • Maintains dependency plan between planned sprints across engineering, infrastructure, and third parties

  • Manages, and appropriately escalates, delivery impediments, risks, issues, and changes tied to the product development initiatives

  • May perform hands-on reviews of product backlog, designs, code, test scripts, and results in addressing delivery impediments or product quality issues

  • Ensures deliverables across engineering teams are high quality and clearly documented

  • Conducts daily stand-ups and retrospectives at the end of each sprint, and ensures that the team is continuously learning from the past

  • Identifies opportunities to adopt innovative technologies

  • This rebel with a cause looks beyond the obvious for continuous improvement opportunities

Qualifications

This high energy Technical Project Manager must have:



6+ years of technical project management experience


Deep understanding of all aspects of software design with a demonstrated track record of increasing responsibility


Coding experience and ability to review code with team members and help drive solutions


Experience managing Agile, Scrum, or other rapid application development teams to deliver technology solutions that meet customer expectations for timeliness and quality


Experience managing project budgets and reporting


Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to effectively communicate across third parties and technical and business product managers


Ability to get industry leading solutions to market efficiently and effectively


Experience in clarifying objectives, dealing with ambiguity/under-defined problems, advocating for simplification, and influencing teams


Ability to enable business capabilities through innovation


Demonstrated willingness to learn new technologies and takes pride in how fast they develop working software


Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline, or equivalent work experience, is preferred


PMI certification is a plus


Scrum Master certification is a plus


Experience using Rally agile delivery management platform is a plus


Experience with object-oriented design and coding skills across a variety of platforms (JAVA, HTML5, BLAZE, DB2, XML, and Mainframe) is a plus


Experience with web services and open API development, as well as SOA concepts, is a plus


Experience with payments technology and industry is a plus


MG2A



American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law. Click here to view the EEO is the Law poster. If the link does not work, please copy and paste the following URL in a new browser window: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm
