item.title: Chief Engineer ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) Connected Safety (m/f) at Harman Becker Automotive Systems GmbH (Karlsbad, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Responsibilities:



We are developing several industry-first ADAS products. Our ADAS products combine powerful in-vehicle processing, V2X connectivity, and cloud analytics, taking advantage of Harman's strength in highly complex systems. Now we need an experienced chief engineer who can help us design our next generation products and deliver those that we have already been awarded. As the ADAS chief engineer you will directly supervise a team of systems / software engineers, and provide technical guidance to a larger cross-functional team. Your tasks at Harman will include:




  • Work with systems and software engineers to develop and document connected safety implementation requirements, from the physical to the application layer, including key vehicle interfaces.

  • Lead the technical architecture development for Connected Safety, defining the interaction between external environmental sensing, map data, V2X communications, and cloud connectivity.

  • Define / invent features that support our Connected Safety roadmap: What will it take to make cars drive themselves? We are looking for your creativity to refine our plans.

  • Lead the activity to develop a demonstrator for Connected Safety features: Proof that your ideas will work.

  • Participate in industry forums and stay current on state of the art to ensure a competitive position for Harman. We want you to be a thought leader in the industry.



Our Offer


Continue your career at Harman, one of the worldwide leaders in infotainment and car audio. We have been successfully doing business for decades and are proud to have all premium car manufacturers as clients. As a Harman employee, you will have the opportunity to actively shape the future and be an important part of Harman's success story. Our dynamic and international business offers you numerous opportunities to further develop and make an impact. Your knowledge and commitment will be rewarded with an attractive compensation package. HARMAN is an employer who values equal employment opportunities for both, women and men. Applications from qualified women are particularly welcome.

item.title: Web Developer at Electronic Access Solutions (Pittsford, NY)
item.description:
UTC Building & Industrial Systems is the world's largest provider of building technologies. Its elevator, escalator, fire safety, security, building automation, heating, ventilation, air conditioning and refrigeration systems and services promote integrated, high performance buildings that are safer, smarter and sustainable. UTC Building & Industrial Systems is a unit of United Technologies Corp., a leading provider to the aerospace and building systems industries worldwide.



The Security & Access Solutions group at UTC Building & Industrial Systems develops a comprehensive product portfolio to protect buildings, people and assets; providing innovative security products that include advanced software and hardware, IP solutions, wireless communications, electronic locking systems, and mobile applications. Among its leading brands are Lenel, Interlogix, Supra and Onity offering robust security and life safety systems, and affordable, flexible lock and key management solutions.



Each day, the engineering team is working to meet some of the most unique and exciting global challenges. In order to maintain our role as a global leader, we continue to seek talented, ambitious individuals to join our engineering team. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and are looking for an opportunity to apply your technical expertise, then we have a great opportunity for you. We are seeking an innovative, data driven, results-oriented Web Developer/Front-End Engineer to contribute to our continued legacy of innovation.


The Web Developer/Front-End Engineer will develop software that meets the needs of customers by reviewing requirements, architecting and designing a front-end software solution, planning and estimating development work, implementing the front-end software solution, assisting with or writing test plans and documentation, and maintaining the solution. This position produces contributes to their team or department by applying their solid knowledge of the web development discipline while continuing to develop specialized knowledge.


Under moderate supervision, the Web Developer/Front-End Engineer can be responsible for small projects or multiple tasks within a project/program area. This position contributes to their team or department by applying their strong knowledge of web development, front-end architecture and user interface development.


United Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer Python - Join us at dubizzle, Dubai! at Dubizzle Middle East FZ LLC (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
Are you a thought leader and expert in your technology stack? Can you solve any task thrown at you, irrespective of complexity or scale? Do you mentor those in your team and push the boundaries of perfection? Do you know which corners can and can't be cut? Delivering A-class products that scale to millions of users,  applying new industry trends and challenging your peers are all part of the daily gig.


Our Senior Software Engineers conceive, design and deliver the most complex products within their stream. They have an intimate knowledge of the business domain and always put our user's experience first.


Your Responsibilities?



  • Hit the ground running - Gather up-to-date and in-depth understanding of the dubizzle code base and technologies stack within weeks;

  • Lead planning sessions around new product features, deliver detailed roll-out/roll-back strategies for releases.

  • Research and apply industry trends as part of your daily work;

  • Create unit tests in accordance with our established standards to cover assigned work;

  • Write and maintain exemplary code following dubizzle’s programming practices;

  • Actively contribute in post-release maintenance issues;

  • Develop elegant solutions for complex problems;

  • Pioneer reliability and efficiency of our current code base, platforms and/or core systems;

  • Impact on the direction and scope of dubizzle’s technical vision within your stream;

  • Define the architecture of your product steam;

  • Gain a detailed understanding of the complete architecture of our product and the position of your product stream in it;

  • Work in a mentoring capacity within a peer-programming environment and provide guidance on tasks, irrespective of complexity or scale;

  • Code review all major pull requests, defining programming standards and providing constructive feedback.

  • Provide and share a broad knowledge of technologies and architectures and function as a mentor within the scope of your product stream (and outside of it when required);

  • Capacity to push back requirements when incomplete;

  • Handle the entire software development life cycle, end to end

item.title: iOS Developer at When I Work (Saint Paul, MN) (allows remote)
item.description:
The workforce management industry is broken. Nearly every tool on the market is a nightmare to use, impossible to learn, and expensive to implement — and worst of all, they all fail to focus on the end-user. At When I Work, we’re doing something different. We’re building products for the end-user, not the decision maker. We’re creating transformative, simple scheduling and attendance products that help hourly employees and managers work better together. We spend every day doting over how technology can empower the hourly workforce like nothing the world has ever seen. Our ultimate mission is to help people spend less time working and more time living. We need your help.


We are:



  • A well-funded ($5M Series A in July) 70 person company growing at a fast rate.

  • A 2X Best Place to Work

  • Led by a CEO named in the Inc.com 2014 list of 35 Under 35 Coolest Entrepreneurs

  • The 2013 Minnesota Cup High Tech Division Winner


Location


Our home office in Minneapolis/St Paul, MN but you can work remotely anywhere within the US.  All applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer.


Who We’re Looking For


Does taking an existing iOS app and pushing what can be done on the iOS platform sound like a fun challenge? Does striving to find the best and simplest solution, not the most obvious, drive you? Does working with a team that values elegance of design, both in the UI and in the code, resonate with you?  If so, we’d love to talk with you.


When I Work is hiring an iOS mobile app developer. Mobile is a huge part of what we do, and you’ll help take our iOS development efforts to new heights! It will be a fun ride.


What You’ll Be Doing


You will be implementing exciting new mobile capabilities and collaborating with, mentoring, and learning from your peer iOS developers. You’ll also work with our Android development team to trade ideas and push each other to new levels of mobile awesomeness.


What’s In It For You



  • Medical and dental benefits

  • Paid vacation and holidays

  • Remote work environment … work where you work best

  • Dynamic and dedicated team

  • Data/Cell (internet) stipend

  • Casual dress code

  • Most of all smart and driven team members that love to collaborate, seek feedback, and improve

  • Best Place To Work 2015 | 2014 | 2013

  • Inc.com 2014 list of 35 Under 35 Coolest Entrepreneurs

  • 2013 Minnesota Cup High Tech Division Winner


Sound Like a Good Fit?


Check out our core values. If they excite you, We’d love to talk!  Please submit the following to apply:



  • Resume (including months/years of employment for each position)

  • Cover letter explaining why you’d like to work at When I Work, and not somewhere else.This can be very informal with bullet points or a short summary. A poem is OK too. We like personality. 


Not looking right now for a new job?


That’s OK… we are going to be hiring through this year and into 2016. Let’s talk about what you may be looking for down the road.

item.title: Perl Developer at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) is looking for Perl Developer who is passionate about their craft, who thrives on challenge and who believes in success through collaboration. Whether it is hardening Perl's hash function or developing efficient serialization libraries, we solve serious problems using Perl.


We offer an international, result-driven, fun, and dynamic environment. If scale and complexity excite you, Booking is the place to B!


B.responsible


Our technical culture derives strongly from our strong ties to the Perl community. We appreciate what open source means both for our business and also for internal projects. Some of our most useful hacks inside the company have come from someone scratching the proverbial itch. We are actively engaged and enjoy the benefits our culture produces such as increased communication between each other and also to our business counterparts.


As a Software Developer, you are responsible for the development, performance, and scaling of our public website as well as internal systems, which includes using: Perl (5.14), DBI, Mason, Moose, Sereal, Plack, nginx, Javascript, MySQL, Memcached, Redis, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, git, and CentOS Linux. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team. Our development strategy is agile and we work in small Scrum teams of 5-7. We do several rollouts every day. We are data-driven and do extensive A/B testing.


Even without Perl experience, your colleagues will help you get up to speed in order to be able to start solving real problems from day one.


Important aspects of the job include:



  • Rapidly develop next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance systems.

  • Solve issues with the site and internal systems, prioritizing based on customer impact

  • Act as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences

  • Collaborate with the team, Team Leaders and Product Owners to prioritize projects

item.title: AWS Technical Architect at Rackspace (Hayes, UK)
item.description:
Rackspace are seeking passionate technical architects/engineers


Managers to deliver Fanatical Support on Amazon Web Services. Fanatical Support for AWS includes a wide range of services and features to help customers make the most out of their chosen hosting platform, accelerate adoption of Cloud in their business and improve upon traditional hosting strategies.



With a strong background in Enterprise support environments, you will help customers manage change, minimise risk, optimise operations and support business growth through pro-active and personable interactions. You will build long-term customer relations, understanding their business goals and operational capability in order to best align and manage Rackspace resources and services, and drive outstanding customer outcomes.



The right candidate for the role will be adept at managing senior stakeholders, complex service delivery systems, co-ordinating Rackspace and customer teams around complex business and technical situations, always delivering within established timescales and exceeding customer’s expectations. To facilitate strong, personable customer relationships, some travel will be required to customer sites, with occasional international travel.




TECHNICAL CAPABILITIES:



Strong demonstrable experience and skills in the following areas are either mandatory or beneficial.



Required



  • Strong customer focus, with an ability to continually anticipate and meet their needs

  • Amazon Web Services, licensing, billing, credit and escalation processes

  • Excellent working knowledge of Amazon Web Services, Compute, Relational and NoSQL Databases, Caching, Object and Block Storage, Scaling, Load Balancing, CDNs, Networking etc.

  • Certifications in AWS Business Professional, AWS Technical Professional and AWS TCO and Cloud Economics

  • VLANs, layer2/3 routing, access lists & load balancing

  • Infrastructure Automation, Config Management and Orchestration toolsets such as Chef, Puppet or Ansible

  • Design of native Cloud applications, Cloud application design patterns and practices

  • Working knowledge of one or more Programing languages (.Net, C++, Java, Ruby on Rails, Perl, PHP, Python)

  • Web Development (SDKs and IDE tool kits)

  • Service Oriented Architectures (SOA)

  • Application Lifecycle Management (ALM)

  • Monitoring tools such as AWS CloudWatch and Rackspace Cloud Monitoring

  • Leadership of account planning activities, service improvement or business development activity

  • Ability to collaborate with and manage diverse cross functional teams for successful customer outcomes



Desirable



  • AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate, AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional

  • Project management qualifications (Prince2)

  • Certification in AWS (Architecting on AWS, Developing on AWS, Systems Operations on AWS etc.)

  • Application and platform analytics tools (AppDynamics or NewRelic)

  • Operating System Knowledge (Microsoft Windows and Linux Distributions)

  • OpenStack, Vmware, Hyper-V and Azure

  • ITIL Foundation or above

item.title: Lead DevOps Engineer at Simply Business (London, UK)
item.description:
• You will have the ability and willingness to drive us to the next level of DevOps rather than just doing DevOps. We’re looking for someone who has the ability to drive major cultural change (test driven infrastructure, automate everything) and the dedication to lead and portray the vision and direction to ensure things are done in a way that brings us closer to our DevOps nirvana




  • We subscribe to DevOps being the intersection of dev, operations and QA and this is the collaborative nature of the role we're looking to fill; the constant dialogue with various stakeholders not just within the operations team but across the entire tech team and even the entire company.




  • You will be hands on in creating tools to build and automate environments for production use. You understand the need to build scalable, reproducible and usable infrastructure. Along this journey you will be required to minimize scope for user error and provide clarity in de-risking security implications, through detection and sufficient layers of protection. 



Current projects



  • We are in the midst of migrating our applications to an infrastructure as code framework that is auditable, testable, peer reviewed and automated. In order to achieve a clear path for the provisioning and deployment of our development lifecycle environments we are making use of tools such as AWS Cloud Formation, Ruby, Capistrano, Github, Puppet Master, Hiera and Blackbox. The intention is to avoid previous disparate ways of working and get things to a consistent state in order to refactor more easily.




  • Writing a Ruby application to make provisioning to Vagrant and EC2 more straightforward; provide the right keys for deploying onto and have all the monitoring/backup packages pre-installed/configured and hooked into Puppet Master for security updates.




  • Implementing centralised logging using Logstash/Elasticsearch/Kibana.




  • Writing a Ruby application, to provide a library and CLI to manage Cloud Formation stacks, which accepts templates written as javascript objects.




  • Enhance Nagios and provision/deploy it using our infrastructure as code framework. Enhancements include more intuitive alerts, consistent checks, easier self-service for adding checks and integration to see the status of our security and traffic routing features.




  • Implementing an Intrusion Detection System



Future projects




  • Upgrading to Mongo version 3. Using the MongoDB Management Service to manage automated deploys and upgrades of Mongo. This will facilitate Mongo migrations more easily using the MongoDB Management Service.  




  • DSL-based approach for creating and managing our subdomains with regards to DNS, SSL certificates, traffic manager routing and monitoring.




  • Extending our current infrastructure as code framework e.g. areas where Cloud Formation is not yet supported, integration with other Amazon services outside of EC2.




  • Investigating Docker and other container technologies to see if we should add them to our tech stack.

item.title: Full stack developer / Software engineer at Law of the Jungle (Eveleigh, Australia)
item.description:
FullStack means engineering everything that’s needed to complete a project, from interaction on the web, to the back-end that records it, to the jobs that process the data recorded. We have a hybrid software stack of Java, JSP, JQuery, JavaScript, AJAX, much of which is going to change, so being a programming polyglot in the beginning will help you get to grips with what our old stack does before you change it.


You're our ideal candidate if you have:



  • Several successful projects that you can describe where you were the Team Lead

  • Extensive experience developing for the web with at least 2 years' experience coding PHP, SQL, HTML, CSS and JavaScript and jQuery

  • Additional, demonstrated experience (at least 3 delivered projects) coding enterprise level JAVA, Apache Cocoon, JSP, XML, JSON, XSL, HTML, UML, SOAP and RESTful Web APIs

  • Attention to detail and a feeling of pride and ownership over quality

  • Have a keen understanding of and appreciation for UX and responsive design

  • Lots of references

  • A fun, friendly, motivated, ambitious, confident approach to tasks, and ready to hit the ground running


You will be happy to:



  • Write clean code that is easily read, understood, expanded on and maintained by others

  • Prototyping solutions quickly and effectively

  • Be analytically minded and be able to give accurate time estimates


Highly regarded:



  • Understanding and experience with the Amazon AWS platform – specifically EC2 and S3

  • Experience with or interest in modern development tools

  • Demonstrated capabilities coding functionality in HTML5

  • Angular, Objective C, SWIFT, Native Android platform programming skills

  • Formal training (CS degree and certifications)


We currently have a mix of JAVA Enterprise and opensource tech on MySQL, use Atlassian tools, and are looking to move to AWS.  Our team is small, smart, ambitious, supportive and, above all, we're excited by what we do.  We're not changing the world, but have a vision which could give us a chance (or two)!  Our work environment is relaxed, open and fun.  We are part of a deeply motivated, technical community and our office is centrally located near Sydney's CBD- easy to get to by train. 

We will give you an exciting and varied set of requirements to work with, include you in strategy planning, and have a lot of blue sky to work towards.  You will have the scope to push yourself in ways that larger teams do not allow.  That said you will be part of a growing, specialised business and a cohesive team effort that needs you to provide an example as its principal programmer.  Like us, you will need to be comfortable presenting your ideas, justifying the direction you want your work to take, listening to others and following the approaches the team ultimately decides to take.  Trust is something you'll need to earn, even if you're one of our Rock-stars. Taking your team on each journey you take is part of the example you will need to set. 

You will also need to be:



  • Able to speak perfect English and have excellent communication skills 

  • Expert at sharing your work

  • An open, inclusive technologist who can share your insights, train others and learn

  • Prepared to write release plans for the code you want to release

  • Carry out effective testing process

  • Able to work in Australia legally (and here now)

  • Good at NOT breaking existing/others' logic (unless you help fix it when you do)


This is a foundational role and one in which you can help build the kind of open, exciting culture in which you can thrive.  Your first task will be to get up to speed with the existing sourcecode and present how it works to the team.  Over time you will become an SME who shares with others, gets the release and deployment process working.  Then you will move onto planning and building out the new features, overseeing support, helping to improve old code and planning the next product.  You will be expected to set an example and ensure we stay focused on quick, quality completion of projects.

If the above describes you and your passions, reach out and make a time to see us! Just be prepared to tell us where you want to go after that.



  • Interview 1: Meet and greet

  • Technical Test

  • Interview 2: Finalise employment details


Our apologies, but only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Resumes only, no need for a cover letter (they're all the same and add no value). Applicants only please – no recruiters. Thank you.

item.title: iOS Mobile Apps Chief Architect - $150K at Crossover (Tân Bình, Vietnam) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you ready to make $100,000 USD while working for a fortune 500 company all from the comfort of your home? If you are eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world, then this role is for you. Work for Crossover and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. If you think it sounds too good to be true then take a closer look…


What to Expect as a iOS Mobile Apps Chief Architect at Crossover


Crossover is looking for iOS Mobile Architects that are ready to architect and build both completely new mobile applications and overhaul legacy mobile applications on both iOS. With your deep experience with the native APIs, you know how to build those showcase apps that have features or visuals (maybe even a little 3d rendering!) that can only be done as an app.  You will partner closely with back-end engineers, designers, and product management to ensure features are developed holistically.  You should have an unrelenting drive for quality, with a passion for responsive UIs and tight clean animations.  Importantly, you will be expected to apply your already deep understanding of the unique characteristics of mobile platforms, both from a frontend and backend perspective, to not only define and implement the key architecture components of the mobile app, but also give recommendations for backend services that can support the user experience desires of product management.


Compensation


At Crossover, you’ll earn extremely competitive wages while enjoying the flexibility of working from virtually anywhere on the face of the earth:




  • Salary: 75 USD/hr




  • Position type: Full time (40 hours per week)




  • Location: Global




Next Steps


Ready to join? Start the process now by applying through our application link. If you meet the qualifications, we will proceed with a series of tests and interviews. Crossover is eager to see what you have to offer our cutting edge global workforce.

item.title: System Administrator in training to play in Geek paradise at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Sounds like Geek paradise? Let me introduce trivago to you. We’ve grown from a small start-up in 2005 to the world’s largest online hotel search. 45 million users visit our website per month to compare prices of over 700.000 hotels on 200 booking sites. Based in Düsseldorf, Germany, our System Administrators successfully maintain this multi-datacentre network infrastructure. Working when, how and with whatever PC, Mac and equipment they choose, they develop our soft- and hardware further and further - at trivago speed.



Your tasks:



  • Learn to monitor and maintain our multi-datacentre network infrastructure.

  • Once you have gained an understanding of our current systems, question and develop them further. We’re growing, and growing fast, so we want you to make sure our infrastructure stays at the cutting-edge of computer technology.

  • Introduce the hipster stuff you get excited about. Test and qualify their success, and see them brought to product maturity and implemented in 5 datacentres on 3 continents!

  • Use your know-how and logical thinking to troubleshoot reasons for critical malfunctions in our complex technical environment.

  • Document our rapidly changing infrastructure and work on your own projects to apply the theory you learnt at uni in real-life.

  • Continuously research trends, share your ideas and work on exciting projects to implement them.

item.title: Senior PHP Symfony Developer at DreamCheaper (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
TechCrunch dubbed us "the most hated startup in the hotel booking market". Help us give the power back to the people and join our experienced CTO in building & leading our local and remote development teams.
We're well-funded by major European VCs and industry veterans so you can get to know the exciting world of fast growth and work with experts in their fields.
We're friends that value learning and growth and we work hard to enable anyone to do their best work!


What you'll do



  • Lead our local and remote development teams together with our CTO

  • Work on our internal and public applications and services

  • Continuously extend and optimize our development ecosystem

  • Discuss and translate feature requests from our executes to user stories

  • Implement new features like the integration of external data providers

item.title: Product Manager, Stack Overflow Careers at Stack Exchange (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Come help us build the future of Stack Overflow Careers!  We’re obsessed with serving two customers: employers and developers. This Product Manager will focus on the employer experience.


We want you to teach employers the best way to recruit developers, and give them the tools to solve what is a very hard problem for employers: hiring developers. We have a variety of products that give you a head start. You’ll do a lot, but here are some of the things you should be excited about:



  • Fixing a broken recruiting model: Help companies succeed by teaching them how developers want to be recruited.

  • Creating public artifacts: Write blog posts announcing new features and why they matter.

  • Testing and iterating: Nobody gets it right on the first try, which is why we prefer to prototype, test, and rapidly iterate based on data and user feedback.

  • Convincing passionate people: Our marketing and sales team care a lot about our clients.  You should be excited about convincing them why your ideas will make the employer experience better, and work through issues with them when they disagree.


We’re looking to hire the right person wherever you are in the world. We work remotely (see http://blog.stackoverflow.com/2013/02/why-we-still-believe-in-working-remotely) so you’ll likely work from home and interact with the team over Google Hangouts and chat, usually during US and European working hours. We have offices in New York, London and Denver, so if you’re in one of those cities you’ll have the option of working out of an office.

item.title: Manager of Professional Services at Puppet Labs (Portland, OR) (allows remote)
item.description:
Department: Customer Success

Location: Anywhere, West Coast

Reports to: Director of Solutions Engineering and Services

Summary of Role

Enjoy leading technical, client-facing teams?  Do you love automation and Open Source software?  Excited about what Puppet is doing and want to be a part of it?

Puppet Labs is hiring a Manager of Professional Services for our Western Region to help drive strategic direction for the department and set the daily operations for the Professional Services (PS) Team.  The PS Manager will coach our growing team of consultants and ensure we continue our tradition of delivering outstanding services to our clients.  In this role, you will manage PS engagements with customers as well as manage team members, milestones, and activities.  You will coordinate with peers and other departments, such as User Experience, Engineering, and Sales to collaborate on special initiatives and to formalize feedback and communication loops.  You will work with the Directors of Solutions Engineering & Services and other PS Managers to help develop the roadmap for PS offerings.  

As Manager, your goal is to facilitate excellent Professional Services performance by coaching Professional Services Engineers, making proactive change and removing barriers to enhance productivity and satisfaction.  In order to do so, the Professional Service Manager will occasionally participate in consulting engagements (10-15% of the time) in a project QA or oversight role in order to maintain Puppet Labs domain expertise to help evaluate the quality and relative significance of technical output and achievements from PS team members.

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of recent experience in configuration management, data center management, and systems management domains

  • 2+ years experience managing and growing a Professional Services team

  • Excellent leadership skills, with proven success in leading, engaging and motivating staff, as well as working effectively across departments.

  • Excellent time and project management skills

  • Experience generating and interpreting service delivery key metrics

  • Experience supervising staff, including hiring, performance management, team building, etc.

  • Professional Services experience in an enterprise software and/or open source company

  • Strong customer relations & presentation skills

  • Experience with Puppet or other configuration management tools

  • Excitement about working with Puppet

  • Joy from growing and developing staff

  • Passion for problem solving

  • Ability to travel up to 30% regionally and nationally

Application Instructions

Please include a cover letter with your application addressing the following questions:

1. Why are you interested in working for Puppet Labs?

2. Please summarize how you feel your background meets the aforementioned qualifications.

3. Describe your philosophy and approach for motivating, coaching and developing a Professional Services team.

4. Describe your most difficult expectations setting experience with a customer and what you learned from it.

5. Describe a recent or significant learning moment in a professional environment.  What did you learn?  How will you use this knowledge?

Working for Puppet Labs


Our mission at Puppet Labs is to drive the cost of technology change to zero.  We make IT automation software for systems administrators, freeing them from repetitive work and fire-fighting so they can do more interesting and higher-value work for their organizations.  Our most important measure of success is their love for our products.

We're growing fast, but we're determined for everyone here to have a real impact on the company and our customers every day.  We're driven and restless.  We encourage creativity and collaboration.  By challenging each other, we foster continuous improvement.  We hire carefully for passion, self-motivation, intelligence, curiosity, and adaptability.

We offer excellent health benefits for employees and family, a flexible time-off policy (that we do insist you use), and a variety of methods to grow your skills and further your career.  We have employees all around the US, the UK, Sweden, Canada, the Czech Republic and Australia.  Our headquarters in downtown Portland, Oregon, is one block off Tom McCall Waterfront Park with views of Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens and the Willamette River.

Puppet powers thousands of companies, including Twitter, Yelp, Disney, Google, Citrix, eBay, NYSE, Cisco WebEx, Salesforce, Bank of America and PayPal.  Our investors include Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, VMware, Google Ventures, Cisco, True Ventures, Radar Partners, and Emerson Street Partners.

Puppet Labs is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact 877-575-9775 for assistance.

item.title: Lead Systems Engineer at Atlassian (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Job summary


Be a part of an energetic and fast moving team that delivers incredible, innovative improvements to our infrastructure and site operations. More than 330,000 teams and 2.5 million developers love Bitbucket and use it every day to manage their Git and Mercurial repositories. We're in the process of building our infrastructure and refining our operational processes for the next several years, to make our platform even more scalable, reliable and speedy to accommodate the next level of our explosive growth. This role will lead our systems engineering team to evolve our infrastructure and processes to help take the team to the next level. This is a rare opportunity to get in early and help drive our systems and operations strategy. You'll collaborate often with the development team and product managers and will assist with the design, build-out, monitoring, scaling, optimization and support of Bitbucket's customer-facing and mission critical infrastructure systems. We're serious about security, performance, reliability, observability and quality, so you'll be refining our operational processes to ensure our team is prepared for anything.


More about you


The Team Lead we’re seeking will have experience leading a team and be effective at mentoring and motivating people and leading projects. You should have past experience in leading a world-class systems engineering or operations team for a high traffic service. A good understanding of SaaS infrastructure and operational best practices is also key to this role. You should be one of those naturally curious types, always looking to improve things, love dabbling in your own side-projects and learning new skills that are not a necessarily part of your normal day job. You’re probably someone who enjoys sharing knowledge with your team, asking for help when you need it, and at the end of the day, thrive on leading people to help them grow.

item.title: Senior IT Ops engineer Global Commercial Banking Portal at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ING is looking for a (mid-senior level) IT Ops/System Engineer within Global Digital Channels domain of Commercial Banking.


If you want to work at a place where you are in charge of the correct operation of systems impacting tens of thousands of our commercial banking customers, where investing in the automation of provisioning and monitoring never stops, and where we are building a team of top-notch Ops engineers that can take on the challenges of running one of the most important internet-facing applications of one of the largest European Banks, please read on.



Work description


As a Mid-Senior Ops Engineer you look after the availability, reliability of our main Internet-facing commercial banking system—Global Commercial Banking (CB) Portal. The Global CB Portal covers the whole range of ING’s Commercial Banking products and offers the whole spectrum of Commercial Banking products: payments & cash management, FM, Lending, etc. The portal is accessible via web as well as mobile and tablet devices (with native apps for iOS and Android). The impact of what you are responsible for is huge. The field evolves fast and staying up-to-date and exercising technical leadership to help the organization stay at the forefront is of paramount importance. You will focus on strengthening the monitoring and automated delivery of our software to meet the challenges posed by the growth in the number of users of CB Portal. Some of the main responsibilities are listed below, we expect you to be able to cover more than half of them.



  • Monitoring and supporting the production environment and several other environments of CB Portal

  • Automating the installation and integration of different components making up CB Portal

  • Capacity management of file systems and databases used

  • Owning backup/restore and disaster recovery processes

  • Ability to analyze DB performance and make necessary performance tuning suggestions

  • Streamlining our development process from code check-ins all the way to deployment into production in collaboration with Dev colleagues

  • Evolve our approach for monitoring and alerting towards preventive monitoring


You will participate in DevOps teams and software release cycles in collaboration with the Commercial Banking business and its support functions, all within a DevOps way of working.



Your work environment


You will work in the dynamic and challenging environment of the IT organization of ING Global Digital Channels.


We operate according to a Scrum Agile development process and strongly believe in the DevOps approach to delivering IT solutions. The focus is on high-quality mission-critical software delivered in time using iterative development with regular milestone demos to the business, so that at the end there are no surprises about what we build.



Desired skills & experience



  • IT (Master/Bachelor) technical degree

  • Proven track record in this role, preferably in an international environment

  • Good knowledge (or at least keen interest to gain it) of some of the following areas: payments, cash management and financial markets is vital for this position

  • You have sound knowledge of relational databases and ideally have looked after the operation of a critical production installation of Oracle including its performance tuning as well as backup/restore scripts and processes.

  • Excellent knowledge of at least one modern scripting language (Python, Ruby, Groovy). Knowledge of Python is big nice-to-have.

  • Good knowledge of modern application servers such as Nginx, Tomcat, JBoss, WebSphere

  • Good knowledge of enterprise level networking (TCP/IP, VPNs, SFTP, Proxy, Firewalls)

  • Excellent knowledge of OS fundamentals with the ability to apply it in the context of modern operating systems, e.g. RHEL, CentOS etc.

  • Good knowledge and real-world experience in provisioning environments with tools such as Puppet, Chef, Docker

  • Knowledge of NoSQL data stores such as Cassandra, while not mandatory, is a strong nice-to-have.

  • Experience in the inner workings of the JVM, while not mandatory, is an important nice-to-have

  • Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery using modern OSS tools such as Jenkins, Maven/Gradle, Sonar

  • Performance/Capacity/Availability Monitoring, knowledge of well-known OSS tools in this area (such as Ganglia, Nagios, Graphite, and JMeter) is a big nice-to-have

  • Basic knowledge of Scrum

  • Able to work under pressure, no 9-5 mentality, willing to be on stand-by outside of office hours

  • Great English communication skills, verbal as well as written.

  • CISSP certificate is a very important nice-to-have.


Important competences:



  • problem solving

  • creativity

  • cooperation

  • disciplined and result oriented

item.title: Sr. Development Engineer & Architect at Stage 3 Systems Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a very talented programmer who has experience leading teams and is interested in a software opportunity that is not the run of the mill consumer web site development. We're solving big industrial problems using the very latest methods and technologies. We are taking the most modern web technologies into one of the largest industries in the world. You will make a difference in how people do their jobs globally.


We rely on your ability as a self-starter to tackle issues of immense complexity, bringing your experience to bear on solving problems, driving technical direction, while working with, leading and learning from teams of equally talented and experienced colleagues. We believe in small, empowered, focused teams who thrive in an environment that gets out of their way and allows them to do excellent work. We want you to continue to experiment with the latest technologies, development  and operations methods and to help us to constantly raise the bar of our offering.


We expect you to be extremely qualified in one or more of the technologies listed and we would especially like to see someone with DevOps experience, having deployed to scale to Amazon or one of the other large public clouds. We know that deployment and operations are as big a part of the solution as the applications themselves and expect you to embrace the challenge that comes with taking responsibility for that part of the job as well.


After we've had a chat with you from seeing your Resume/CV we would want to see code examples, working systems and other things you've built. We will want to learn what you liked about those efforts and  what you'd do differently and why.


This is a full time position which allows us to offer you benefits and stability but we are open to trying things out on contract at first if you wish.

item.title: Microsoft Azure Technical Architect at Rackspace (Hayes, UK)
item.description:
Rackspace are on the hunt for Technical Architects/Service Delivery Managers to deliver Fanatical Support with AZURE. Fanatical Support for AZURE includes a wide range of services and features to help customers make the most out of their chosen hosting platform, accelerate adoption in their business and improve upon traditional hosting options.


The right candidate for the role will be adept at managing senior stakeholders, complex service delivery systems, co-ordinating Rackspace and customer teams around complex business and technical situations, always delivering within established timescales and exceeding customer’s expectations. To facilitate strong, personable customer relationships, some travel will be required to customer sites, with occasional international travel.


With a strong background in Enterprise support environments, you will help customers manage change, minimise risk, optimise operations and support business growth through pro-active and personable interactions. You will build long-term customer relations, understanding their business goals and operational capability in order to best align and manage Rackspace resources and services, and drive outstanding customer outcomes.

item.title: Senior UX Designer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Senior UX’er at Coolblue you put your design magic to use to turn every visitor into a happy customer.


What you tell your friends you do
"I never outgrew the 'Why?'-phase of my childhood.'


What you will really be doing



  • You come up with new functionalities and bring those all the way to 'live' so they can be tested.

  • You improve the usability of our webshops, catering to more than 150.000 visitors a day.

  • Designing creative and ingenious things without losing sight of the visual identity of Coolblue.

  • You don't just do great UX Design-work in your own team, but you also coach fellow designers so that they will too.


How will you be doing this?



  • You're not in the business of delivering pretty pictures, you work together with a development team to build a great product.

  • You define your own priorities with your development team and Product Owner. You receive direct feedback of end-users and are given free rein to experiment.

  • You decide on your own tools. Balsamiq, Axure, Photoshop, Sketch. It doesn't matter, as long as your design is well-considered and polished.

  • To measure is to know. You're directed by big data and experience, not just gut-feeling.

  • You're able to find the correct balance between thinking big picture and making small steps with an Agile mindset.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Mobile. We used existing code to make sure all of our 300+ web shops became available on mobile devices. Every two weeks, new functionalities were introduced in phases.

  • Responsive design. One codebase, lots of devices, but always the optimal user experience.


What a day in the office might look like
You sit down behind your MacBook and have a quick look at Google Analytics to see the first results of the checkout after they went live yesterday. People seem to be able to find their way through the process much easier now, great! After the daily stand-up you walk down to the demo lab and put on your labcoat. The usability research, set up by our UX Researcher is about to kick off. Drat, there's still a usability bug in the checkout. You decide to organise a brainstorm with your fellow UX Designers to come to quick and great solutions. Before you end your day you walk over to a UX design colleague to give him some feedback on the work he did for displaying bundles on our product page. 


Team
You work in a multidisciplinary team of three to five developers, each with their own specialisation ranging from PHP to JavaScript. The team is accompanied with a Scrum Master and a Product Owner.

item.title: Principal Java Software Engineer at First Utility (Warwick, UK)
item.description:
SUMMARY


Due to an internal promotion, The UK’s fastest growing and largest independent energy supplier is seeking a passionate, innovative and experienced Principal Software Engineer who is committed to delivering best of breed software solutions.


First Utility is committed to helping customers reduce their energy bills through the use of innovative technology, by offering cheaper tariffs and campaigning for industry change.  This opening comes at an exciting stage and offers a fantastic opportunity for you to be part of a team hungry to make a difference.


We are the ‘Growing Business Awards’ Growing Business of the Year 2014 and the only energy company to have been listed in the fast track 100 for four consecutive years.


ROLE OVERVIEW


This is a key role within the development team building advanced software solutions for our on-line energy business.  Projects you will work on cut across a wide set of solution domains including: on-line registrations, customer self-serve, single customer view, mediation, rating and billing.  Successful candidates will have a strong subject matter expertise and a desire to grow in a rapidly expanding company that seeks to differentiate itself through technology. 


A key part of this role is to help raise the level of experience in the team, as such Principal’s will be accountable for highlighting areas of development with the teams they work within and propose training, coaching and education plans. In addition to having expert technology skills we are looking for people who have a demonstrable background in carrying out a coaching role while still maintaining hands on involvement.


We are looking for a graduate with a strong degree in a relevant technical discipline (ideally software engineering, Information Technology, Mathematics etc.) with commercial experience of developing software solutions as a Java Developer within an Agile environment.  We currently use Scrum but this should not limit candidates who have experience of XP, DSDM or other recognised agile frameworks.

item.title: Senior Front-end Developer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Senior Front-end Developer you maintain the balance between creativity and functionality for our web shops, and you coach your fellow developers. 


What you tell your friends you do
"I am the chosen one who brings balance to the force."


What you will really be doing



  • Improving the usability and performance of our web shops.

  • Delivering a working functionality for our web shops, once every two weeks.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. Besides your own specialization you will learn to perform all other tasks within the team.

  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.

  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.

  • Big data and experience are your gurus, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Responsive design. One codebase, lots of devices, but always the optimal user experience.

  • Reviews. A completely new infrastructure for better performance and scalability. Improved usability for both customers and moderators. More reviews, more interaction, less spam, better conversion rates.


What a day in the office might look like
You and the interaction designer from your Scrum team finalize the first step of the new checkout.  Proudly you examine the result: a well-considered combination of semantically correct HTML(5) and Javascript/Jquery and CSS(3) for added value. All in order to create an optimal user experience.Now, you are both dying to start working on the next sprint regarding the payment page. You and the other developers have made very sure, over the last few weeks, to keep things as simple as (humanly) possible. So, creating this page should be a piece of cake.


Team
You will be working in a team with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Scrum Master and a Product Owner.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Full Web Stack C#, WPF, Xamarin) at Trainer Road LLC (Reno, NV) (allows remote)
item.description:
TrainerRoad is looking to expand our engineering group. We're looking for smart software engineers who "get things done". Candidates can be located anywhere on Earth (sorry, Watney).


We're a small group with a lot of potential. Areas of work include Xamarin iOS/OSX, WPF, ASP.net MVC, Web API, HTML/Javascript, Azure, ANT sport devices, Bluetooth Smart sport devices, Build/Test integration, and SQL among others.


Engineers will have the opportunity to work in all of the above technologies, but would be able to focus on particular areas if that's where their passion lies.


We create the world's most effective cycling training software, you can learn more about us at www.trainerroad.com.


Who We're Looking For


We want smart engineers! You should have an intermediate to advanced understanding of the Gang of Four design patterns and how to apply them to software development. The ideal candidate is a "developer's developer" and enjoys reading about programming in their free time, tinkering on the weekends with side projects and staying abreast of the latest frameworks/technologies in their area of expertise.


We basically want someone with a passion for development.


Required Technology Experience



  • C# Experience - Intermediate to Advanced proficiency


Optional Technology Experience



  • ASP.net MVC

  • LINQ

  • Web API

  • Azure

  • Xamarin

  • SQL

  • ReactiveUI

  • WPF

  • Javascript Frameworks (Angular, React, ect)

  • HTML

  • Build/Test CI 


Work Remote or in Reno, Nevada


We're looking for the best candidate worldwide. Don't let a little thing like geography get in the way. One third of our team currently works remotely. It works very well with the help of Slack, Screen Hero, Basecamp, and Github.


We do require you to be able to make our 1pm pacific time standup and have at least a four hour overlap with our 8-5pm mon-fri Reno office hours at least four days a week. 


For example, we have an Australian employee who works from noon to 9pm pacific time Sunday through Thursday (that's his mon-fri). That works just fine for us.


Job Salary


Let us know what you want to get paid when you submit your resume. We want experienced and proficient engineers. The higher salary you request, the better we expect you to be.


Job Perks



  • Competitive Pay

  • Unlimited Vacation

  • 401k with 4% company matching 

  • 100% of employees individual health care paid

  • Flexible schedule

  • Access to the latest fitness devices (power meters, trainers, sensors, etc.)


Your Resume Should have...



  • Examples of C# projects you have worked on

  • Links to any open source projects you've contributed to

  • Github/StackOverflow username if you'd like

  • Examples of experience in the "Optional Technology Experience" area

  • Links to any sample C# code that you're proud of

  • Your required annual salary


We also Require...


The best engineers only want to work with other great engineers. We've found that the best way to find great engineers is to actually have them code, not just answer trivia questions during an interview.


That's why we require applications to do a refactoring exercise as part of their job submission. The right candidate won't find this a pain in the ass; it should be enjoyable.


This also weeds out the vast majority of candidates who just fire off resumes everywhere. In our previous job posting, 90% of candidates did NOT do this step.


The refactoring exercise is attached to this job posting. It has a readme.txt in it with instructions.


Excited about our Company?


In your application let us know why you want to work with us and why you think you'd be a good fit for our company.


FAQs


Do I have to be a cyclist to apply?


Nope! We'll encourage you to ride, and will even buy you an entry level bike if you want, but it's not required. Not everyone in the company is a cyclist.


What's unlimited vacation mean?


We don't keep track of vacation hours. The CEO of TrainerRoad used to be an engineer at a Fortune 500 company where life was a grind. We believe employees put out their best work when they are happy and not burnt out.


If you're brain just isn't working at 3pm, we encourage employees to go home and rest up. It does no one any good to sit and stare at the computer screen for another two hours. We don't track that time.


Employees generally shoot for around four weeks of REAL vacation time (no e-mail checking) but some take more and some take less.  The thing we care about is how productive you can be and how much value you can add to the company. Bottom line, we want people who are passionate and get things done. If you meet those requirements everything else works itself out.


That being said, if you end up taking massive amounts of vacation, come in late, leave early and aren't producing outstanding work we're going to have a problem.


How do you work?


We try to work as pragmaticly as we can.  We have excellent designers on staff who go from mockups to responsive HTML with light javascript work.


Development uses Github with a strict pull request process. We test, comment, refactor and improve each other's pull requests.


We have partial test coverage and we can definitely improve in that area (maybe you can help?).


We often pair program via Screen Hero.


Our developers float between mobile, desktop and web development. Our future engineers can specialize in one area if that's where their passion is.


You didn't ask about education, what's required?


Please put your education on your resume, but we're not going to reject someone because they don't have a degree in Computer Science. We understand that some of the best and most passionate engineers are self taught.


This is the longest job posting ever, when does it end?


Right now! Congrats if you made it this far! We look forward to looking at your resume and refactoring exercise.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Cake Solutions Inc (NY, NY)
item.description:
About Cake Solutions Inc


Using the very latest technologies, Cake Solutions helps organisations take innovative and disruptive ideas and develop them into reactive software solutions. Cake’s success is underpinned by our unique One Team® approach that allows for standalone projects or close collaboration with the clients’ technology teams. Cake provides mentors to guide the entire organisation through modern software engineering, continually transferring skills and knowledge to client teams in the process. This enables Cake to deliver not just software but to transform the way organisations think about and execute software delivery.


As an early adopter of change in the IT industry, Cake embraces the use of the latest bleeding edge programming languages and tools to implement system components including big data, machine learning and the Internet of Things. Cake delivers the appropriate technical solution to a business problem and can transform the way organisations think about and deliver production-ready high quality systems safely and predictably.


Our experienced, cross-functional agile teams enable the delivery of entire solutions not just lines of code. They appreciate the importance of continuous integration, continuous delivery, DevOps and rigorous testing.


Cake team members are published authors, prolific bloggers and experienced speakers. They have extensive experience in designing, building and implementing scalable Reactive Applications and are encouraged to continually research and innovate and to publish thought leading insights.


We make the most of messaging infrastructures, modern DBMSs, and all other services that make up today's enterprise systems. Automated provisioning, testing, integration and delivery allow us to release high quality systems safely and predictably.


Cake are looking for a passionate and skilled Operations Developer with a real passion for on-going learning and continual skills development.  The role will involve maintaining and creating Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery pipelines, to ensure the development process is automated and repeatable.  You will be helping to build and deploy system infrastructure in a cloud focused environment while providing operational advice to developers when appropriate.Another responsibility will be monitoring existing clusters of deployed instances in the Cloud maintaining backups and performance (manually scaling where appropriate), identifying errors, troubleshooting, improving alerting on failure and also deploying new code releases to those environments. 


If you are interested in an exciting and challenging DevOps role please send us your CV; if your qualifications match our requirements, we will schedule a telephone interview. We would also be delighted to see & discuss your published works (blogs, articles, books, contributions to open source projects).

item.title: Applications Developer (French Services) - MON04037 / Développeur d'applications at CBC/Radio-Canada (Montreal, QC, Canada)
item.description:
Applications Developer (French Services) - MON04037



What it’s like working at CBC/Radio-Canada


Whether on-air or behind the scenes, here you join a team that thrives on making the connections and telling the stories that are important to Canadians. So, if you’ve got the ability to keep up with the pace of our ever-changing industry, the passion to make the next great idea even better and the drive to make things happen, this is the place for you.



Please note this is a temporary position for one year.



CBC/Radio-Canada's Media Infrastructures and Media Presentation team is currently seeking a talented and Application Developer to join the media expert group. Based in Montreal, this position focuses primarily on the analysis, programming and integration of applications in accordance with best practices and established standards.



You are also responsible for handling support and maintenance requests, as well as for troubleshooting and debugging computer systems.



As Application Developer, you have the following duties:



  • Identify the appropriate programming language for each target platform

  • Develop applications in the various programming languages, then test, debug and document your code to ensure highly reliable system integration

  • Document architecture and technical solutions according to the internal standards

  • Support and maintain applications, in addition to answer questions and fix troubleshooting

  • Ensure effective implementation and integration of applications, as well as the availability of appropriate documentation

  • Provide leadership in handling high-level technical issues

  • Produce implementation plans for approved changes, ensure that the various stages of the system construction, integration, testing and implementation are carefully planned and carried out

  • Research, analyze and document technical requirements of complex systems based on the functionality required by the client

  • Analyze complex business requirements and recommend appropriate, efficient and cost-effective solutions

  • Conduct feasibility studies for new technologies and draft detailed technical specifications

  • Participate in the delivery of new applications and the maintenance/enhancement of existing ones, with lead responsibility for technical issues

  • Coordinate application systems problem resolution with software vendors, hardware vendors, and internal staff



You possess:



  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or the equivalent

  • Minimum of three (3) years of experience in a Multi applications  Developer role with one of the major development framework, such as .Net, Java or Python

  • Knowledge of relational databases, NOSQL and at least one ORM

  • Understanding of the SOA architecture and its various possible implementations. Strong interest in various techniques of integration

  • Solid knowledge of development and deployment tools  in a large company (Source Management, Project Management, EDI)

  • Knowledge of several of the following programming languages: Python, Perl, PHP, Ruby on Rails, Java, Javascript, C, C +, C #, Shell scripting is an asset

  • A strong interest in agile methodologies, Python, Linux and Open Source is an important asset

  • Excellent communication skills (spoken and written)

  • Client service skills

  • Excellent interpersonal skills

  • Experience working in a collaborative, teamwork-driven environment

  • Up to date on the latest development technologies, trends and approaches, while staying committed to projects and support requests

  • Ability to act as a technical mentor

  • Ability to learn other programming languages

  • Knowledge of English


Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.



CBC/Radio-Canada is committed to reflecting our country’s diversity.



In becoming the leader in expressing Canadian culture and enriching democratic life, we need to be as diverse in every way as the country we serve, both within our workforce and on air. As an employer, we value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada's public broadcaster.



For more information, visit the Talent and Diversity section of our corporate website.



If this sounds interesting, please apply online! We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.



Please apply online at: https://rita.illicohodes.com/go/55c8957312497d478d547a1c/52cc274258b7007a6ef89fd6/en



-----------------------------------



Développeur d'applications (Services français) - MON04037



Travailler à CBC/Radio-Canada


Que ce soit pour travailler en ondes ou en coulisse, vous pourriez faire partie d’un groupe dynamique, qui réussit à créer des liens et à présenter des sujets qui passionnent les Canadiens. Alors si vous avez la capacité d’évoluer dans une industrie en pleine transformation, la passion nécessaire pour que la prochaine grande idée soit encore meilleure et la volonté de réaliser de grandes choses, ce poste est pour vous!



Veuillez noter qu'il s'agit d'un poste temporaire d'une durée d'un an.



L'équipe de services d'Infrastructure médias et centre de diffusion de Radio-Canada est activement à la recherche d'un Développeur d'applications talentueux pour rejoindre le groupe d'expert-médias. Le poste qui est basé à Montréal, se concentrera  principalement sur l’analyse, la programmation et l'intégration des applications selon les meilleures pratiques et standards établis.



De plus, vous seriez responsable de demandes de soutien et de maintenance en plus de répondre aux problèmes de systèmes informatiques et d’effectuer les corrections des bogues.



En tant que Développeur d'applications vous aurez à:



  • Identifier les langages de programmation appropriés pour chaque plateforme visée;

  • Faire le développement en différents langages de programmation,  procéder aux tests, débogage et à la documentation afin d'obtenir une intégration des systèmes hautement fiable;

  • Documenter l'architecture et les solutions techniques en conformité avec les standards internes;

  • Mettre en œuvre le support et l'entretien des applications en plus de répondre aux questions et résoudre les problèmes;

  • Assurer l'implantation et l'intégration efficaces des applications et documentations appropriées;

  • Faire preuve de leadership dans la gestion des problèmes techniques de haut niveau ;

  • Produire les plans de mise-en-œuvre pour les changements approuvés en s’assurant que les différentes étapes de la construction, de l'intégration, des tests et de l'implantation du système soient attentivement planifiés et effectués;

  • Rechercher, analyser et documenter les exigences techniques des systèmes complexes en fonction des fonctionnalités exigées par le client;

  • Analyser les besoins d'affaire complexes et recommander des solutions appropriées, rentables et efficaces;

  • Procéder aux études de faisabilité pour la nouvelle technologie et rédiger les spécifications techniques détaillées;

  • Contribuer à la livraison des nouvelles applications ainsi qu'à l'entretien des applications existantes en exerçant un leadership technique;

  • Coordonner la résolution des problèmes de système d'application avec les fournisseurs de logiciels, de matériel et le personnel interne.



Vous possédez :



  • Baccalauréat en informatique (ou l'équivalent);

  • Minimum de trois (3) années d'expérience dans un rôle de développeur d'applications multi-tiers avec l’un des « Framework » de développement majeur tel que .Net, Java ou Python;

  • Connaissance des bases de données relationnelle, NOSQL et d'au moins un ORM;

  • Comprendre l’architecture SOA et ses diverses implémentations possibles. Intérêt marqué pour les diverses techniques d'intégration;

  • Connaissance approfondie des outils de développement et de déploiement dans une grande entreprise (Gestion de source, gestion de projet, IDE);

  • Connaissance de plusieurs des langages de programmations suivants: Python, Perl, PHP, Ruby on rails, Java, Javascript, C, C+, C#, Shell script est un atout;

  • Un intérêt marqué pour les méthodologies agiles, Python, Linux et l’Open Source est un atout important.

  • Excellentes habiletés de communication (à l'oral et à l'écrit);

  • Aptitude avec le service client;

  • Excellentes habiletés interpersonnelles;

  • Expérience de travail dans un environnement axé sur le travail d'équipe et la collaboration;

  • Être à l'affût des plus récentes technologies, tendances et approches en matière de développement tout en restant engagé aux projets et aux demandes de support;

  • Aptitude à agir comme mentor technique;

  • Capacité d'apprendre d'autres langages de programmation.


Les candidats peuvent être soumis à des tests de compétences et de connaissances.



CBC/Radio-Canada est engagé à refléter la diversité canadienne.



À titre de chef de file de l’expression de la culture canadienne et de l’enrichissement de la vie démocratique du pays, nous devons afficher par tous les moyens la même diversité que le pays que nous servons, tant au sein de notre effectif qu’à l’antenne. En tant qu’employeur, nous valorisons l’égalité des chances et favorisons un milieu de travail inclusif, où nos différences individuelles sont non seulement reconnues et mises en valeur, mais se retrouvent également dans tous les services que nous offrons comme radiodiffuseur public du Canada. 



Pour plus d’information, visitez la section Talent et Diversité de notre site web institutionnel.



Si ce poste vous intéresse, postulez en ligne! Nous remercions les candidats de leur intérêt, toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes retenues pour une entrevue.



SVP Postulez en ligne au: https://rita.illicohodes.com/go/55c8957312497d478d547a1c/52cc274258b7007a6ef89fd6/fr
